Oh, enter, enter now!
verses.yoruba:
O nkun! O nkun! Ile ayọ na nkun
Yara! Mase pẹ ko kun ju fun ọ!
Wọle, wọle, wọle nisisiyi.

verses.english:
Pass in! pass in! That banquet is for thee,
That cup of everlasting love is free
Room, room, still room!
Oh, enter, enter now!
verses.yoruba:
'Aye si mbẹ' ilẹkun si silẹ,
Ilẹkun ifẹ, iwọ ko pẹ ju,
Wọle, wọle, wọle nisisiyi.

verses.english:
All heav'n is there! All joy! Go in go in!
The angels beckon thee the prize to win
Room, room, still room!
Oh, enter, enter now!
verses.yoruba:
Wọle, wọle! Tirẹ ni ase na,
Wa gb'ẹbun 'fẹ ayeraye lọfẹ!
Wọle, wọle, wọle nisisiyi.

verses.english:
Louder and sweeter sounds the loving call;
Come, ling'rer, come! enter that festal hall,
Room, room, still room!
Oh, enter, enter now!
verses.yoruba:
Kiki ayọ lo wa nibẹ, wọle!
Awọn angẹli npe ọ fun ade,
Wọle, wọle, wọle nisisiyi.

verses.english:
It fills, that hall of jubilee!
Make haste, make haste! 'tis not too full for thee!
Room, room, still room!
Oh, enter, enter now!
verses.yoruba:
L'ohun rara n'ipe ifẹ na ndun!
Wa ma jafara, wọle, ase na!
Wọle, wọle, wọle nisisiyi.

verses.english:
Ere night that gate may close, and seal thy doom,
Then the last, low, long cry,
'No room, no room!'
No room, no room! Oh, woeful cry! 'No room!'
verses.yoruba:
K'ilẹ to su, ilẹkun na le ti,
'Gba na o k'abamọ! O se! O se!?
O se, o se, ko s'aye mọ; o se!

title.english: Softly And Tenderly Jesus
title.yoruba: Gbọ b'Olugbala Ti Npe Lohun Jẹjẹ

verses.english:
Softly and tenderly Jesus is calling
Calling for you and for me,
Patiently, Jesus is waiting and watching,
Watching for you and for me.
verses.yoruba:
Gbọ b'Olugbala ti npe lohun jẹjẹ,
O npe iwọ at'emi,
Wo! O nfi suru duro lẹnu ọna,
Nduro de'rẹ at'emi.

verses.english:
Why should we tarry when Jesus is pleading,
Pleading for you and for me,
Why should we linger and heed not His mercies,
Mercies for you and for me.
verses.yoruba:
Ese ta fi nlora gba Jesu nsipẹ,
Nsipẹ fun temi tirẹ,
Ese ta fi nkẹgan ọpọ anu Rẹ?
Anu fun temi tirẹ.

verses.english:
Time is now fleeting, the moment are passing,
Passing from you and from me,
Shadows are gathering, death-beds are coming,
Coming for you and for me.
verses.yoruba:
Wo b'akoko! Ti sure to nkọja lọ,
Nkọja lọ f'emi at'iwọ,
Ọjọ ogbo de tan, ikun sumọle,
Iku nbọ fun ọ f'emi.

verses.english:
O for the wonderful, love He has promised,
Promise for you and for me,
Though we have sinned, He has mercy and pardon,
Pardon for you and for me.
verses.yoruba:
A! Ifẹ iyanu to ti seleri,
'Leri fun temi tirẹ,
Bi a tilẹ dẹsẹ, idariji nbẹ,
O nbẹ fun ọ at'emi.

chorus.english:
Come home, come home!
Ye who are weary come home!
Earnestly, tenderly, Jesus is calling,
Calling o! Sinner come home!
chorus.yoruba:
Wale....., wa'le,
Ẹyin tarẹ mu, wa'le ee.
Tifẹtifẹ ni Olugbala npe ọ,
O npe ẹlẹsẹ wa'le.

title.english: Blow Ye The Trumphet Blow

verses.english:
Blow ye the trumpet blow,
The gladly solemn sound;
Let all the nations know,
To earth's remotest bound,
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ fun'pe na kikan,
Ipe ihinrere
K' o dun jake jado
L' eti gbogbo ẹda.

verses.english:
Extol the Lamb of God,
The all-atoning Lamb;
Redemption by His blood,
Throughout the world proclaim.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu Alufa wa
Ti ṣ'etu Ladele;
Alarẹ, ẹ simi,
Aṣọfọ ẹjẹ Rẹ

verses.english:
Ye, who have sold for nought,
Your heritage above,
Receive it back unbought,
The gift of Jesus' love.
verses.yoruba:
Fun 'pe t' Odagutan
T' a ti pa ṣ' etutu;
Je ki agbaiye mọ
Agbara ẹjẹ Re.

verses.english:
Jesus our great High Priest,
Has full atonement made;
Ye weary spirits, rest,
Ye mournful souls, be glad.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹyin ẹru ẹsẹ
Ẹ sọ 'ra yin d' ọmọ
Lọwọ Kristi Jesu
Ẹ gba ominira yin.

verses.english:
Hearts that are weary, come,
Rest on the Saviour's breast;
Disconsolate heart, come,
Be cheerful and rejoice.
verses.yoruba:
Gbọ 'pe ìhìnrere
Ìhìn ore-ọfẹ
Agba yin lọw'oye,
Ẹ wa 'waju Jesu.

chorus.english:
The year of jubilee is come!
Return, ye ransomed sinners, home.
chorus.yoruba:
Odun idasile ti de,
Pada elese, e pada.

title.english: Come With Thy Sins To The Fountain

verses.english:
Come with thy sins to the fountain,
Come with thy burden of grief,
Bury them deep in its waters
There thou wilt find a relief.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹlẹsẹ wa s'orisun na
Wa pẹlu 'banujẹ rẹ,
Ri wọn sinu omi jinjin,
Wọ yo ri 'rọrun nibẹ.

verses.english:
Come as thou art to the fountain,
Jesus is waiting for thee,
What though thy sins be like crimson?
White as snow they shall be!
verses.yoruba:
Wa t'iwọ t'ẹru ẹsẹ rẹ,
Jesu ti nduro de ọ,
B'ẹsẹ rẹ pon bi alari,
Nwọn yio funfun bi sno.

verses.english:
These are the words of the Saviour
They who repent and believe,
They who are willing to trust Him,
Life at His hands shall receive.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu Olugbala wipe,
Awọn ti o ba gbagbo
Ti wọn si ronupiwada,
Y'o riye gba lọdọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
Come and be healed at the fountain,
List to the peace-speaking voice;
Over a sinner returning,
Now let the angels rejoice!
verses.yoruba:
Wa, we ninu orisun na,
F'eti si ohun ifẹ,
Jẹ ki awọn angẹli yọ,
F'ẹlẹsẹ to yi pada.

chorus.english:
Haste thou away! Why wilt thou stay?
Risk not thy soul on a moment's delay,
Jesus is waiting to save thee,
Mercy is pleading today.
chorus.yoruba:
Yara kalo, mase duro!
Isẹju kan le sọ ẹmi rẹ nu,
Jesu nduro lati gba ọ,
Aanu nbẹ fun ọ l'oni.

title.english: Since Christ My Soul
title.yoruba: Bi Krist' Ti Da ọkan Mi Nde

verses.english:
Since Christ my soul from sin set free,
This world has been a heav'n to me
And mild earth's sorrows and its woe
'Tis heav'n my Jesus here to know.
verses.yoruba:
Bi Krist' ti da ọkan mi nde,
Aye mi ti dabi ọrun,
Larin 'banujẹ at'aro
Ayọ ni lati mọ Jesu.

verses.english:
Once heaven seemed a far-off place,
Till Jesus showed His smiling face,
Now it's begun within my soul,
'Twill last while endless ages roll.
verses.yoruba:
Mo tiro pe ọrun jina
Sugbọn nigbati Jesu de
L'ọrun ti de 'nu ọkan mi,
Nibẹ ni y'o si wa titi.

verses.english:
What matters where on earth we dwell?
On mountain top, or in the dell?
In cottage, or in mansion fair
Where Jesus is, 'tis heaven there.
verses.yoruba:
Nibo l'a ko le gbe l'aye
L'o r'oke tabi pẹtẹlẹ,
L'ahere tabi agbala,
Ko s'ewu, Jesu wa nibẹ.

chorus.yoruba:
Aleluya! Ayọ l'o je
Pe, mo ti ri 'dariji gba,
Ibikibi ti mo ba wa,
Ko s'ewu, Jesu wa nibẹ.

title.english: Thy Kingdom Come, O God

verses.english:
Thy kingdom come, O God,
Thy rule, O Christ, begin:
Break with Thine iron rod
The tyrannies of sin.
verses.yoruba:
Krist' ki 'jọba Rẹ de,
Ki asẹ Rẹ, bẹrẹ;
F'ọpa irin Rẹ fọ,
Gbogbo ipa ẹsẹ.

verses.english:
Where is Thy reign of peace,
And purity, and love?
When shall all hatred cease,
As in the realms above?
verses.yoruba:
Ijọba ìfẹ́ da?
Ati t'alafia;
'Gba wo ni irira
Yio tan bi t'ọrun?

verses.english:
When comes the promised time,
That war shall be no more
Oppression, lust, and crime
Shall flee Thy face before?
verses.yoruba:
Akoko na ha da
T'ọtẹ yio pari,
Ika ati 'rẹjẹ,
Pelu ifẹkufẹ?

verses.english:
We pray Thee, Lord, arise,
And come in Thy great might;
Revive our longing eyes,
Which languish for Thy sight.
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa, jọ dide,
Wa n'nu agbara Rẹ;
Fi ayọ fun awa
Ti o nṣ'afẹri Rẹ.

verses.english:
Men scorn Thy sacred name
And wolves devour Thy fold;
By many deeds of shame
We learn that love grows cold.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹda ngan ookọ Rẹ,
Koko njẹ agbo Rẹ,
Iwa 'tiju púpọ
Nfihan pe 'fẹ tutu.

verses.english:
O'er heathenlands afar
Thick darkness broodeth yet;
Arise, O morning Star,
Arise, and never set.
verses.yoruba:
Okun bole sibẹ,
Ni ilẹ keferi,
Dide 'Rawo orọ,
Dide, máṣe wọ mọ.

title.english: Go And Tell Of The Glad Tidings

verses.english:
Go and tell of the glad tidings,
Make all the world to hear the news,
Who hears and believes shall be saved,
Those who refuse shall be condemned.
verses.yoruba:
Lọ wasu ihinrere Mi
Mu gbogbo aye gb'ore Mi;
Ẹni t'o gb'ọrọ Mi y'o la,
Ẹni t'o kọ ọ yio segbe.

verses.english:
I'll reveal to you great myst'ries,
Ye shall show forth my word of truth,
In all the works that I have done,
And the miracles ye shall do.
verses.yoruba:
Emi o f'oye nla han yin,
Ẹ o f'ọrọ otọ Mi han;
Ni gbogbo isẹ ti Mo se,
Ni gbogbo isẹ ti ẹ o se.

verses.english:
Go and heal the sick and raise the dead
In my great name cast out demons
Let not my prophet ever fear,
Though Jews and Gentiles should deride.
verses.yoruba:
Lọ wo arun, lọ j'oku nde,
F'orukọ Mi l'esu jade;
Ki woli Mi mase bẹru,
Bi Griki ati Ju kẹgan.

verses.english:
Teach all the world my commandments,
And lo, I am with you always;
To me belong all pow'r and might,
I can kill and can make alive.
verses.yoruba:
Kọ gbogbo aye l'asẹ Mi,
Mo wa lẹhin yin de opin;
Lọwọ Mi ni gbogbo ipa,
Mo le pa, mo si le gbala.

verses.english:
A light encircled Him around;
He ascend in great glory,
The news was proclaim'd far and near,
The ascension of our Saviour.
verses.yoruba:
Imọlẹ si ran yi I ka,
Ogo la l'o fi lo s'ọrun;
Wọn si mu de ilẹ jijin,
Ihin igoke Ọlọrun.

title.english: Go, Labour On, Spend, And Be Spent

verses.english:
Go, labour on; spend, and be spent,
Thy joy to do the Father's will:
It is the way the Master went;
Should not the servant tread it still?
verses.yoruba:
Ma sisẹ lọ, mase sarẹ,
Fi ayọ sisẹ Baba rẹ,
Bayi ni Jesu se l'aye:
Ko ha yẹ k'awa ko se bẹ?

verses.english:
Go, labour on; 'tis not for nought,
Thy earthly loss is heavenly gain:
Men heed Thee, love Thee, praise Thee not;
The master praises; what are men?
verses.yoruba:
Ma sisẹ lọ ki se lasan,
Ofo aye l'ere ọrun:
Bi araye ko fẹ yin ọ,
Iyin Jesu ju t'ẹda lọ.

Ma sisẹ, l'ojojumọ,
Okunkun aye fere de;
Mura si 'sẹ, mase s'ole,
Ko ba le gba ọkan re la.

verses.english:
Men die in darkness at your side,
Without a hope to cheer the tomb;
Take up the torch, and wave it wide,
The torch that lights time's thickest gloom.
verses.yoruba:
Pupọ, pupọ l'awọn to ku,
Ti wọn ko n'ireti ọrun,
Gbe ina 'gbagbọ rẹ, ma fi;
Ma fi si okunkun aye.

Ma sisẹ lọ, ma gbadura:
F'ogbon wa awọn to sina;
Jade lo s'opopo ọna,
Rọ asako lati wọlẹ.

verses.english:
Toil on, and in thy toil rejoice;
For toil comes rest, for exile home
Soon shalt thou hear the Bridegroom's voice,
The midnight peal, Behold, I come!

title.english: Seeking The Lost, Yes, Kindly
title.yoruba: Tọ Asako Lọ, Lọ F'ifẹ Rọ Wọn

verses.english:
Seeking the lost, yes, kindly entreating
Wanderers on the  mountain astray,
Come unto 'me' His message repeating,
Words of the Master speaking today.
verses.yoruba:
Tọ asako lọ, lọ f'ifẹ rọ wọn,
Awọn t'o sina s'ori oke,
Wa sọdọ mi! Ni hun Jesu wi,
Gbọ b'Oluwa ti mbẹbẹ lọni.

verses.english:
Seeking the lost and pointing of Jesus,
Soul that are weak, and hearts that are sore,
Leading them forth in way of Salvation,
Showing the path to life evermore.
verses.yoruba:
Tọ asako lọ fi Jesu han wọn,
Ọkan arẹ t'o si ti gbogbẹ,
Ma sin wọn lọ si ọna igbala,
Fi ọna iye pipe han wọn.

verses.english:
Thus would we go on mission of mercy,
Following Christ from day to day,
Cheering the faint and raising the fallen,
Pointing the lost to Jesus the way.
verses.yoruba:
K'a ma tẹ siwaju n'isẹ rere,
K'a ma tẹle Kristi lojojo,
K'a ma se 'anu gb'ẹni subu ro,
K'a ma fi Jesu han asako.

chorus.english:
Going afar... upon the mountain,
Bringing the wand'rer back again, back again,
Into the fold... of our Redeemer,
Jesus the Lamb for sinners
(for sinners slain).
chorus.yoruba:
A nrin ajo lọ s'ori oke,
Lati pe asako pada
(pe pada),
Sinu agbo Olugbala wa,
Jesu t'a pa fun ẹlẹsẹ
(pa f'ẹlẹsẹ).

title.english: For My Sake And The Gospel's Go

verses.english:
For my sake and the Gospel's
Go and tell Redemption's story
His heralds answer, 'Be it So,
And Thine, Lord, all the glory!'
They preach His Birth, His Life, His Cross,
The love of His atonement
For whom they count the world but loss,
His Easter, His Enthronement.
verses.yoruba:
Tori Mi at'Ihinrere,
Ẹ lọ sọ t'Irapada,
Awọn onse Rẹ nke, 'Amin'
Tirẹ ni gbogbo ogo;
Nwọn nsọ t'ibi, t'iya, t'iku,
Ifẹ etutu nla Rẹ;
Wọn nka hun aye s'ofo
T'ajinde on 'jọba Rẹ.

verses.english:
Hark, hark the trump of jubilee
Proclaims to every nation,
From pole to pole, by land and sea
Glad tidings of salvation:
As nearer draws the day of doom,
While still the battle rages,
The Heavenly Dayspring through the gloom,
Breaks on the night of ages.
verses.yoruba:
Gbọ, gbọ, ipe ti Jubeli,
O ndun yi gbogb' aye ka,
N'ile ati l'oju okun
A ntan ihin igbala;
Bi ọjọ na ti sun mọlẹ,
T'ogun si ngbona janjan,
Imọlẹ ila-orun na
Yo mọ larin okunkun.

verses.english:
Still on and on the anthems spread
Of Hallelujah voices,
In concert with the holy Dead
The warrior Church rejoices;
Their snow-white robes are washed in Blood,
Their golden harps are ringing;
Earth and the paradise of God,
One triumph-song are singing.
verses.yoruba:
Siwaju ati siwaju
Lao ma gbọ, 'Aleluya'
Ijọ Ajagun yo ma yọ
Pẹl' awọn oku mimọ,
A fo aso won n'nu ẹjẹ,
Duru wura won si ndun,
Aye at'ọrun d'ohun pọ,
Wọn nkọ orin isẹgun.

verses.english:
He comes, Whose Advent Trumpet drowns
The last of Time's evangels,
Emmanuel crown'd with many crowns,
The Lord of Saints and Angels:
O Life, Light, Love, the great I am,
Triune, Who changest never,
The Throne of God and of the Lamb,
Is Thine, and Thine for ever.
verses.yoruba:
O de Ẹni t'a nwọna Rẹ,
Ẹni ikehin na de,
Imanuẹli t'O d'ade,
Oluwa awọn mimọ,
Iye, Imọlẹ at'ifẹ,
Mẹtalọkan titi lae;
Tirẹ ni itẹ Ọlọrun
Ati t'ọdọ Aguntan.

title.english: Hark! The Song Of Jubilee

verses.english:
Hark! The song of jubilee,
Loud as mighty thunders roar,
Or the fullness of the sea
When it breaks upon the shore,
'Hallelujah! For the Lord God omnipotent shall reign,
Hallelujah!' let the word
Echo round the earth and main.

'Hallelujah!' hark the sound
From the depths unto the skies,
Wakes above, beneath, around,
All creation's harmonies;
See Jehovah's banner furled
Sheath'd His sword; He speaks 'tis done,
And the kingdoms of this world
Are the kingdom of His Son.
verses.yoruba:
Aleluya! Gbọ iro
Lati aye de orun,
Ni orin gbogbo ẹda,
L'oke, n'isalẹ, yika,
Wo Jehofa ti sẹtẹ,
Ida w'akọ; O pasẹ,
Awọn ijọba aye
Di ijọba Ọmọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
He shall reign from pole to pole
With illimitable sway;
He shall reign when like a scroll
Yonder heav'ns have passed away
Then the end; beneath His rod
Man's last enemy shall fall;
Hallelujah! Christ is in God,
God in Christ is All in all!

title.english: Jesus Shall Reign Where'er The Sun

verses.english:
Jesus shall reign where'er the sun,
Doth his successive journeys run;
His kingdom stretch from shore to shore,
Till moons shall wax and wane no more.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu yo jọba ni gbogbo
Ibi t'aba le ri orun;
'Jọba Rẹ yo tan kakiri,
'Jọba Rẹ ki o nipẹkun.

verses.english:
For Him shall endless prayer be made,
And praises throng to crown His head;
His name like sweet perfume shall rise,
With every morning sacrifice.
verses.yoruba:
On li ao ma gbadura si,
Awọn ọba yo pe l'Ọba;
Orukọ Rẹ b'orun didun
Y'o ba ebọ orọ g'oke.

verses.english:
People and realms of every tongue,
Dwell on His love with sweetest song;
And infant voices shall
Their young hosannas to His name.
verses.yoruba:
Gbogbo oniruru ede,
Yo fi 'fẹ Rẹ korin didun;
Awọn ọmọde yo jẹwo,
Pe 'bukun won t'odo Rẹ wa.

'Bukun pọ nibi t'On jọba,
A tu awọn onde sile,
Awọn alarẹ ri 'simi,
Alaini si ri 'bukun gba.

verses.english:
Let every creature rise, and bring,
Its grateful honours to our king;
Angels descend with songs again,
And earth prolong.
verses.yoruba:
Ki gbogbo ẹda ko dide,
Ki wọn f'ọla fun Ọba wa;
K'angẹl' tun wa t'awọn t'orin
Ki gbogb' aye jumọ gberin.

title.english: Awake, And In His Strength

verses.english:
Awake, and in His strength renewed,
The battle cry take up again;
All enemies shall be subdued,
And Christ the Lord shall reign.
verses.yoruba:
Ji, sọ agbara Rẹ d'ọtun,
Gbe 'hamọra gun rẹ wọ;
A o sẹgun gbogbo ọta,
Kristi yo si jọba.

verses.english:
Too long His followers idly stood,
By selfish creed and doctrine rent;
Nor knew that for one Brotherhood
His own short life was spent.
verses.yoruba:
O ti pe t'awọn ọmọ Rẹ
Tinse 'yapa lori ekọ;
Wọn gbagbe pe l'ori 'sokan,
Ni On lo aye Re.

verses.english:
Unite and in His strength go on,
Nor count a life as lost, but gain;
And soon the vict'ry shall be won,
For Jesus Christ must reign.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ papọ li agbara Rẹ,
Aye yin yoo si je ere;
Laipẹ ẹ o ni isegun,
'Tori Krist' y'o jọba.

verses.english:
To dare and do for Him is meet
The struggle shall not be in vain,
The Trumpet shall not call 'Retreat,'
For Jesus Christ must reign.
verses.yoruba:
O yẹ ka sisẹ f'Oluwa,
Isẹ wa ko ni jẹ asan;
A ko gbọdọ pada s'ẹhin,
'Tori Krist' y'o jọba.

chorus.english:
For Christ must reign,
For Christ must reign,
Our hope in Him is not in vain;
For Christ must reign,
For Christ must reign,
For Christ must reign,
Our hope in Him is not in vain;
For Christ must reign.
chorus.yoruba:
Krist' y'o jọba,
Krist' y'o jọba,
Ireti wa n'nu Rẹ ko yẹ;
Krist' y'o jọba,
Krist' y'o jọba,
Krist' y'o jọba,
Ireti wa n'nu Rẹ ko yẹ,
Krist' y'o jọba.

title.english: Lift The Banner Of The Cross

verses.english:
Lift the banner of the cross,
Bear it onward day by day,
Till the mighty pow'rs of wrong are downward hurled,
Let it grandly, proudly wave
With the message, Christ can save
Lift it higher till it circles all the world.
verses.yoruba:
Gbe asia na soke!
Si ma gbe lojojumọ,
Titi gbogb' agbara ibi yo wolẹ!
Jẹki o ma fẹ lẹlẹ
Pẹlu 'hin Krist' le gbala;
Gbe soke titi yo fi yi aye ka

verses.english:
Lift the banner of the cross,
Till it shines o'er ev'ry land,
Let its fold of beauty never more be furl'd,
Till the darken'd isles shall sing
Of Immanuel their king
Lift it higher till it circles all the world.
verses.yoruba:
Gbe asia, na soke,
Ni gbogb' orilẹ ede,
Ki a ma se ka asia na kuro;
Titi aye yo kọrin
T'Imanuẹli, Ọba won,
Gbe soke titi yo fi yi aye ka.

verses.english:
Lift the banner of the cross,
Till it shines o'er ev'ry land,
Speed the day when all see its folds unfurled,
Let it float from sea to sea
Till all lands in Christ are free,
Lift it higher till it circles all the world.
verses.yoruba:
Gbe asia na soke,
Ko ma dan ni gbogbo 'le,
M'ọjọ na yara de t'yo ma fẹ lẹlẹ,
Mu fo lat'okun d'okun,
Tit' aye yo gba Kristi;
Gbe soke titi yo fi yi aye ka.

chorus.english:
Lift it higher till it Circles all the world,
Till the mighty pow'rs of wrong are downward hurl'd,
Let it grandly proudly wave
With the message, 'Christ can save'!
Lift it higher till it circles all the world.
chorus.yoruba:
Gbe soke titi yo fi yi aye ka,
Titi agbara la ibi yio fi wo;
Jẹki o ma fẹ lẹlẹ,
Pẹlu 'hin: Krist' le gbala,
Gbe soke titi yo fi yi aye ka.

title.english: Lord How Long Will Thou Tarry

verses.english:
Lord how long will thou tarry
Till thou will come again?
We all are almost fainting;
As we watch thy coming;
Lord how long will thou tarry?
To keep us waiting Thee,
Many do not have belief,
That thou will come again.
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa y'o ti pẹ to,
Ti 'Wọ o tun pada?
Arẹ fẹrẹ mu wa tan,
Bi a ti nw'ọna Rẹ;
Oluwa y'o ti pẹ to
Ta o ma reti Rẹ?
Ọpọ ni ko gbagbo mo
Pe 'Wọ o tun pada.

verses.english:
Lord, how long will thou tarry
Till thou shall hail on us?
Until we who expect Thee
Shall see Thee rejoicing
Awake thou sleeping virgin
Go proclaim His coming
That they who've slept already
May wake to welcome Him.
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa y'o ti pẹ to
Ti 'Wọ o kesi wa?
Ti awa ti nreti Rẹ
Yi o ri Ọ l'ayọ
Ji, wundia ti o sun
Lọ kede bibọ Rẹ
Ki gbogbo awọn t'o sun
Le mọ pe O mbọ wa.

Dide, tan fitila re
Gbe ewu mimọ wọ,
Mura lati pade Rẹ
'Tori On fẹrẹ de,
Oluwa y'o ti pẹ to
Ti 'Wọ o tun pada?
Ma jẹ ki arẹ mu wa
Tit' ao fi ri Ọ.

title.english: Dear Saviour, We Our Love Should

verses.english:
Dear Saviour, we our love would show,
That all the world might see,
The joy the peace and rest the know
Who love and worship Thee.
verses.yoruba:
Olugbala a o f'ayọ han,
Ki gbogb' aye le ri,
Ayọ 'simi, alafia
T'awọn to fẹ Ọ ni.

verses.english:
Help us the gospel news to tell
Till not our hearts alone,
But all who come with us to dwell
Thy sovereign right shall own.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹ ki le sọrọ 'hinrere
Titi gbogb' ọkan wa,
Pẹlu gbogb' ẹni yi wa ka
Y'o fi gba Ọ l'Ọba.

verses.english:
O send us forth as flaming brands,
Whose sacred beams shall shine,
Till those in darkness Island lands
Behold the light divine.
verses.yoruba:
Ran wa b'ina at'orun wa,
Ti 'mọlẹ rẹ yo tan,
Tit' awọn to wa n' okunkun
Yo ri imọlẹ na.

verses.english:
Thy wondrous race on us bestow
And till each heart and mind,
That we with zeal may forward go
To help and bless mankind.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹ ki 'yanu or'ọfẹ Rẹ
Kun inu ọkan wa;
K'awa le fi itara lọ
Lati se 'ranlọwọ.

chorus.english:
The world for Christ, the world for Christ,
Throughout from sea to sea,
We want the whole wide world for Christ,
To set the nations free.
chorus.yoruba:
Gbogbo aye, gbogbo aye,
Gbogbo, tilẹ, t'okun (toke),
A fe gbogbo aye fun Krist'
K'orilẹ d'ominira

title.english: Rejoice, For Jesus Reigns

verses.yoruba:
Ẹ yọ Jesu jọba,
'Nu ọmọ eniyan,
O da ara tubu,
O sọ wọn d'om'nira:
K'esu kọju s'Om' Ọlọrun,
Lai f'ọta pe, isẹ Rẹ nlọ.

Ise ti ododo
Otọ, Alafia,
Fun rọrun aye wa,
Yi o tan ka kiri,
Keferi, Ju, wọn o wolẹ
Wọn o jẹjẹ isin yiyẹ.

Agbara l'ọwọ Rẹ
Fun abo eni Rẹ,
Si asẹ giga Rẹ;
L'ọpọ o kiyesi
Ọrun ayo ri 'sẹ Rẹ
Ekusu rere gb'ofin Rẹ.

title.english: We Give Thee But Thine Own

verses.english:
We give Thee but Thine own,
Whate'er the gift may be;
All that we have is, Thine alone,
A trust, O Lord, from Thee.

May we Thy bounties thus
As stewards true receive,
And gladly, as Thou blesses us,
To Thee our first-fruits give.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹ k'a gba ẹbun Rẹ
Bi iriju rere;
Bi o si ti nbukun wa to,
Bẹ l'a o fi fun Ọ.

verses.english:
To comfort and to bless
To find a balm for woe,
To tend the lone and fatherless
Is angels' work below.
verses.yoruba:
K'a ma tu ni ninu,
K'a ma rẹ ni 'lẹkun,
K'a ma bọ alainibaba
N'ise t'a ba ma se.

verses.english:
The captive to release,
To God the lost to bring,
To teach the way of life and peace,
It is a Christ-like thing.
verses.yoruba:
K'a tu onde silẹ,
K'a mu asako bọ,
K'a kọni l'ọna Olorun,
B'iwa Kristi l'o ri.

verses.english:
And we believe Thy word,
Though dim our faith may be;
Whate'er for Thine we do,
O Lord, We do it unto Thee.
verses.yoruba:
A gba oro Rẹ gbọ,
Busi igbagbọ wa,
Ohun t'a se fun ẹni Rẹ,
Jesu, a se fun Ọ.

title.english: Tell It Out Among The Heathen

verses.yoruba:
Wi jade larin keferi p'Oluwa l'Ọba,
Wi jade! Wi jade!
Wi jade f'orilẹ-ede mu ki wọn kọrin,
Wi jade! Wi jade!
Wi jade tiyintiyin pe, On o ma po si,
Pe, Ọba nla Ologo l'Ọba alafia,
Wi jade tayọtayọ bi iji tilẹ nja,
Pe O joko lor' isan omi, Ọba wa titi lae.

Wi jade larin keferi pe, Jesu njoba,
Wi jade! Wi jade!
Wi jade f'orile-ede mu k'ide won ja,
Wi jade! Wi jade!
Wi jade fun awon ti nsokun pe,
Jesu ye,
Wi jade f'alarẹ pe,
O nfun ni n'isimi
Wi jade f'ẹlẹsẹ pe O wa lati gbala;
Wi jade fun awọn ti nku pe, O ti sẹgun iku.

Wi jade larin keferi Krist' njọba loke,
Wi jade! Wi jade!
Wi jade fun keferi ife n'ijoba Re,
Wi jade! Wi jade!
Wi jade l'ọna opopo l'abuja ọna
Je ko dun jakejado ni gbogbo agbaye,
B'iro omi pupọ ni k'iho ayọ wa je,
Titi gbohun-gbohun yo fi gbe iro na de'kangun aye.

title.english: Oh, Spread The Tidings

verses.english:
Oh, spread the tidings round, wherever man is found,
Wherever human hearts and human woes abound;
Let every Christian tongue proclaim the joyful sound,
The Comforter has come.
verses.yoruba:
Tan ihin na kalẹ, jakejado aye,
K'awọn ti ẹru npa, mọ pe igbala de,
K'awọn ti se ti Krist' sọ ihin ayọ na,
Olutunu ti de.

Ọba awon ọba, wa f'iwosan fun wa,
O wa ja ide wa, O mu igbala wa,
K'olukuluku wa, kọrin isẹgun pe,
Olutunu ti de.

Ifẹ ianu nla, a! mba le royin na,
Fun gbogbo eniyan, ẹbun or'ọfẹ Rẹ;
Emi ọmọ egbe, di ọmọ igbala,
Olutunu ti de.

Gbe orin 'yin soke, s'Olurapada wa,
K'awọn mimọ loke, jumọ ba wa gberin
Yin ifẹ Rẹ titi, ifẹ ti ko le ku,
Olutunu ti de.

chorus.yoruba:
Olutunu ti de,
Olutunu ti de,
Ẹmi lat' oke wa, ileri Baba wa;
Tan ihin na kalẹ, jakejado aye,
Olutunu ti de.

title.english: Thou Whose Almighty Word

verses.english:
Thou whose Almighty word
Chaos and darkness heard,
And took their flight,
Hear us, we humbly pray,
And where the gospel day
Sheds not its glorious ray,
Let there be light!
verses.yoruba:
Iwọ ti okunkun
Gb'ọrọ agbara Rẹ,
To si fo lọ,
Gbọ ti wa, a nbe Ọ
Nibit' ihinrere
Ko ti tan 'molẹ rẹ,
K'imọlẹ wa.

verses.english:
Thou who didst come to bring
On Thy redeeming wing
Healing and sight,
Health to the sick in mind,
Sight to the inly blind,
O now to all mankind
Let there be light!
verses.yoruba:
'Wọ t'iye apa Rẹ
Mu iriran w'aye,
At'ilera:
Ilera ti inu;
Iriran ti okan;
Fun gbogbo eniyan,
K'imọlẹ wa.

verses.english:
Spirit of truth and love,
Life-giving, holy Dove,
Speed forth Thy flight:
Move on the water's face,
Spreading the beams of grace,
And in earth's darkest place
Let there be light!
verses.yoruba:
Iwọ Ẹmi oto,
Ti o n f'iye fun wa,
Fo kakiri,
Gbe fitila anu
Fo ka oju omi
Ni 'bi okunkun nla,
K'imọlẹ wa.

verses.english:
Blessed and holy Three,
Glorious Trinity,
Grace, love, and might,
Boundless as ocean's tide
Rolling in fullest pride,
Through the world far and wide
Let there be light!
verses.yoruba:
Mẹtalọkan Mimọ,
Ọgbọn, ifẹ, Ipa,
Alabukun!
B'igbi omi okun
Ti nyi ni ipa re,
Bẹ ka bogbo aye,
K'imọlẹ wa.

title.english: There's A Call Comes Ringing

verses.english:
There's a call comes ringing o'er the restless wave,
'Send the light.…send the light'
There are souls to rescue, there are souls to save,
'Send the light.…send the light'
verses.yoruba:
Ipe na ndun l'ọtun ati l'osi pe,
Tan 'mọlẹ, tan 'mọlẹ,
Ọpọ l'o nku laini ireti ọrun,
Tan 'mọlẹ, tan 'mọlẹ.

verses.english:
We have heard the Macedonian call today,
'Send the light.…send the light'
'And our grateful off' rings at the cross we lay,
'Send the light…send the light'
verses.yoruba:
Awọn t'o wa l'okunkun nke tantan pe,
Tan 'mọlẹ, tan 'mọlẹ,
Mu wọn wa jẹjẹ s'ibi agbelebu,
Tan 'mọlẹ, tan 'mọlẹ.

verses.english:
May the grace of Jesus unto all abound,
'Send the light.…send the light'
And a Christ-like spirit ev'rywhere be found,
'Send the light.…send the light'
verses.yoruba:
Jẹ k'a gbadura k'or'ọfẹ le jọba,
Tan 'mọlẹ, tan 'mọlẹ,
Ki Ẹmi Krist' jọba ni ibi gbogbo,
Tan 'mọlẹ, tan 'mọlẹ.

verses.english:
Let us not grow weary in the work of love,
'Send the light.…send the light'
While we gather jewels for our crown above,
'Send the light.…send the light'
verses.yoruba:
Jẹ k'a tẹramo isẹ t'o lere yi,
Tan 'mọlẹ, tan 'mọlẹ,
Ao gbade nikẹhin bi a foriti,
Tan 'mọlẹ, tan 'mọlẹ.

chorus.english:
Send the light, the blessed gospel light,
Let it shine from shore to shore,
Send the light the blessed gospel light,
Let it shine for ever more.
chorus.yoruba:
Tan 'mọlẹ ihinrere na,
Jẹ k'o tan yi aye ka,
Tan imọlẹ ihinrere na,
Jẹ k'o tan yi aye ka.

title.english: In Pity, Look On Me My God

verses.english:
In pity, look on me my God,
Show Thy wonderful love to me,
Forbid that I should plan my life,
Thou art the One who plans form me.
verses.yoruba:
Ọlọrun mi b'ojuwo mi
F'iyanu 'fe la Re han mi,
Ma je ki ngbero fun ra mi,
'Tori 'Wọ ni ngbero fun mi.

verses.english:
Oh do not let me choose for Thee,
For Thou, my portion ever art,
Oh do that which Thou has ordained,
For me, in Thy great heart of love.
verses.yoruba:
Maje ki mbu le Ọ lọwọ,
'Tori Wọ li onipin mi,
S'eyi ti 'Wọ ti pinnu rẹ,
Iba jẹ pọnju tab' ogo.

verses.english:
Lord, who can know Thy beginning
Thou Lord of glory, good and kind,
Thou hast with Thee a thousand ways,
When I have not yet thought out one.
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa tal'o ridi Rẹ,
Iwọ Ọlọrun ologo,
Iwọ l'ẹgbẹgbẹrun ọna,
Nibi ti nko ni 'kansoso.

verses.english:
As far and high as is the heav'n,
So are Thy thoughts higher than mine,
Lead me, that I may follow Thee,
In the way of Thy righteousness.
verses.yoruba:
B'ọrun ti ga ju aye lọ,
Beni 'ro Rẹ ga ju t'emi;
Ma dari mi k'emi le lọ,
S'ipa ọna ododo Rẹ.

chorus.english:
My Father, lead me here on earth,
Let me, Thy great salvation find.
chorus.yoruba:
Baba mi, to mi l'aye yi,
Je ki 'gbala Re to fun mi.

title.english: Jesus Wants Me For A Sunbeam

verses.english:
Jesus wants me for a sunbeam,
To shine for Him each day,
In every way try to please Him,
At home, at School, at place.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu fẹ k'emi jẹ 'mọlẹ,
Ki nta lojojumọ,
Nibikibi kin le wu Ọ,
Nile ati lode.

verses.english:
Jesus wants me to be loving,
And kind to all I see,
Showing how pleasant and happy,
His little ones can be.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu fẹ kifẹ kun n'nu mi,
Ki nfẹ gbogb'eniyan,
Ki nfi han pe ifẹ Jesu,
Ngbe n'nu mi lọjọjọ.

verses.english:
I will ask Jesus to help me,
To keep my heart from sin,
Ever reflecting His goodness,
And always shine for Him.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu jọwọ ran mi lọwọ,
Gba mi lọwọ ẹsẹ,
Ki ore Olugbala mi,
Ma tan n'nu aye mi.

verses.english:
I'll be a sunbeam for Jesus,
I can if but I try,
Serving Him moment by moment,
Then live with Him on high.
verses.yoruba:
Uno jẹ imọlẹ fun Jesu,
Jesu ran mi lọwọ,
Uno sin Jesu nigba gbogbo,
Kin le bagbe loke.

chorus.english:
A sunbeam, a sunbeam,
Jesus wants me for a sunbeam,
A sunbeam, a sunbeam,
I'll be a sunbeam for Him.
chorus.yoruba:
Imọlẹ, Imọlẹ,
Jesu fẹ kemi jẹ 'mọlẹ,
Imọlẹ, Imọlẹ,
Lemi o je fun Jesu.

title.english: Rock Of Ages

verses.english:
Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in Thee;
Let the water and the blood,
From Thy riven side which flowed,
Be of sin the double cure,
Cleanse me from its guilt and power.
verses.yoruba:
Àpáta ayérayé,
Ṣe ibí isadi mi;
Jẹ kí omi on ẹjẹ,
T'ọsan lati iha Rẹ,
Ṣe ìwòsàn f'ẹsẹ mi,
K'o si sọ mi di mímọ.

verses.english:
Not the labor of my hands
Can fulfill Thy law's demands;
Could my zeal no respite know
Could my tears for ever flow,
All for sin could not atone,
Thou must save, and Thou alone.
verses.yoruba:
K'ise iṣẹ ọwọ mi
L'o le mu ofin Rẹ ṣe,
B'itara mi ko l'arẹ
T'omije mi nṣàn titi,
Wọn kò tó fún ètùtù,
'Wo nikan l'o le gbàla.

verses.english:
While I draw this fleeting breath.
When mine eyes shall close in death,
When I soar to worlds unknown,
See Thee on Thy judgment throne;
Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in Thee.
verses.yoruba:
'Gbati ẹmi mi ba pin,
T'iku ba p'oju mi de,
Ti mbá lọ s'aye aimọ,
Ki nri Ọ n'itẹ 'dajọ́;
Àpáta ayérayé,
Se ibí isadi mi.

title.english: Love Him Who's Thy Neighbour

verses.english:
'Love him who's thy neighbour'
It is the Lord's command,
He made Himself an example,
By the way He loved us.
verses.yoruba:
'Fẹ ẹnikeji rẹ',
Ase Oluwa ni;
O sa fara Rẹ sapẹrẹ,
Ni fifẹ t'O fe wa.

verses.english:
'Love him who's thy neighbour'
Whether in peace or war,
He taught us to love all our foes,
Repay evil with good.
verses.yoruba:
'Fẹ ẹnikeji rẹ',
N'ire tabi n'ija;
O kọ wa pe k'a f'ọ ta wa,
K'a fore san ibi.

verses.english:
'Love him who's thy neighbour'
The Lord's voice trumpets still,
So, all of us ought to prepare,
To love all our neighbours.
verses.yoruba:
'Fẹ ẹnikeji rẹ',
Oluwa nke tantan;
O yẹ ki gbogbo wa mura,
K'a f'ẹnikeji wa.

verses.english:
'Love him who's thy neighbour'
And those living next door,
Those that are in your neighbourhood,
And all your enemies.
verses.yoruba:
'Fẹ ẹnikeji rẹ',
At'aladugbore,
Pẹlu gbogb'ẹni yi ọ ka,
At'ọta rẹ pẹlu.

verses.english:
To love our neighbours as,
Jesus Himself loved us,
Jesus loved all His enemies,
And blessed and prayed for them.
verses.yoruba:
K'a f'ẹnikeji wa,
Bi Jesu ti fẹ wa
Jesu sa fẹ awọn ọta Rẹ,
O si sure fun wọn.

title.english: Guide Me, O Thou Great Jehovah

verses.yoruba:
Ma tọju mi, Jehofah nla,
Ero l'aye osi yi,
Emi ko l'okun, Iwọ ni
F'ọwọ agbara di mi mu,
Onjẹ ọrun, onjẹ ọrun,
Ma bọ mi titi laelae.

verses.english:
Open Thou the crystal fountain,
Whence the healing stream shall flow,
Let the fiery, cloudy pillar
Lead me all my journey through:
Strong Deliverer! Strong Deliverer!
Be Thou still my help and shield

When I tread the verge of Jordan,
Bid my anxious fears subside;
Death of deaths, and hell's destruction,
Land me safe on Canaan's side:
Song of praises! Song of praises
I will ever give to Thee.
verses.yoruba:
'Gba mo ba de ẹba Jordan,
Fọkan ẹru mi balẹ,
Iwọ t'o ti sẹgun iku,
Mu mi gunlẹ Kenan jẹ;
Orin yin, Orin iyin,
L'emi o fun Ọ titi.

title.english: I Have A Friend Who Is Ever Nigh
title.yoruba: Mo Lọrẹ Kan To Wa Nitosi

verses.english:
I have a friend who is ever nigh
Whether I sleep or wake;
Ever He guards with a watchful eye,
He knoweth the way that I take.
verses.yoruba:
Mo lọrẹ kan to wa nitosi,
L'ọsan ati l'oru,
O nfi oju Rẹ sọ mi titi,
O mọ ọna ti emi ngba.

verses.english:
I have a friend who is always near
One who will ne'er forsake;
What though my pathway be dark and drear,
He knoweth the way that I take.
verses.yoruba:
Mo ni ọrẹ kan t'o sunmọ mi,
Ko jẹ kọ mi silẹ;
Bi ọna mi tilẹ s'okunkun,
O mọ ọna ti emi ngba.

verses.english:
I have a friend who will guide me on
Until the shadows break,
Leading me on, till my crown is won,
He knoweth the way that I take.
verses.yoruba:
Mo l'ọrẹ kan ti y'o ma tọ mi,
Tit' opin y'o fi de,
O ntọ mi titi un o fi d'ade,
O mọ ọna ti emi ngba.

chorus.english:
He knoweth the way that I take
And keeps me when asleep or awake;
And lead me for His own name's sake,
He knoweth the way that I take
chorus.yoruba:
O mọ ọna ti emi ngba,
O si pa mi mo l'ọsan, loru,
O nto mi li orukọ Rẹ,
O mọ ọna ti emi ngba.

title.english: Hark, My Soul! It Is The Lord

verses.yoruba:
Ọkan mi, Oluwa ni
Jesu rẹ ni, gb'ọrọ Rẹ,
Jesu nsọ, O mba ọ sọ,
Pe, ẹlẹsẹ, 'wọ fẹ mi?

Gba t'a de ọ, mo gba ọ,
O gb'ọgbẹ, Mo wo ọ san,
Gb' o sako, Mo mu ọ bo;
Mo s'okun rẹ d'imọlẹ.

verses.english:
Can a woman's tender care
Cease toward the child she bare?
Yes, she may forgetful be;
Yet, will I remember thee.
verses.yoruba:
Kikẹ iya ha le pin
Si omo rẹ ti o bi?
L'otitọ, o le gbagbe,
Sugbọn Em'o ranti rẹ.

verses.english:
Mine is an unchanging love,
Higher than the heights above,
Deeper that the depths beneath,
Free and faithful, strong as death.
verses.yoruba:
Ifẹ t'Emi ki yẹ lae,
O ga rekọja ọrun;
O si jin ju okun lọ,
Ifẹ alailẹgbẹ ni.

'Wọ fẹrẹ r'ogo Mi na,
'Gb'ise ore-ọfẹ tan;
'Wọ ọba mi gunwa pọ
Wi, ẹlẹsẹ 'wọ fẹ mi?

Olori aroye 
Ni pe ifẹ mi tutu;
Sugbọn mo fe Ọ Jesu,
A! Mba fẹ Ọ ju yi!

title.english: Lead Us Heav'nly Father, Lead Us
title.yoruba: Ma Tọ Wa Baba Wa Ọrun

verses.english:
Lead us, heav'nly Father, lead us,
O'er the world's tempestuous sea;
Guard us, guide us, keep us, feed us,
For we have no help but Thee,
Yet possessing every blessing
If our God our Father be.
verses.yoruba:
Ma tọ wa Baba wa ọrun
Larin 'danwo aye yi,
Pa wa mo k'o si ma bọ wa,
A ko n'iranwọ miran,
Sugbọn gbogbo 'bukun l'ani,
B'Ọlọrun jẹ Baba wa.

Olugbala, dariji wa,
Iwọ sa m'ailera wa,
'Wọ ti rin aye saju wa,'
Wọ mọ egbe inu rẹ,
Bi alarẹ, Ẹni-kanu,
N'Iwọ l'aginju yi ja.

verses.english:
Spirit of our God, descending,
Fill our hearts with heavenly joy,
Love with every passion blending,
Pleasure that can never cloy;
Thus provided, pardon'd, guided,
Nothing can our peace destroy.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹmi Ọlọrun, sọkalẹ,
F'ayọ run k'ọkan wa,
K'ifẹ dapọ mọ iya wa
At'adua ti ki su ni
B'a ba pese fun wa bayi,
Ki l'o le da wa lamu?

title.english: He Gave To Me A Seal

verses.english:
He gave to me a seal,
Of the great debt I owe,
And as He gave, He smiled and said,
'Always, remember Me.'
verses.yoruba:
O fun mi l'edidi,
Gbese nla ti mo jẹ,
B'o ti fún mi, O sí rẹrin,
Pe; Máṣe gbagbe mi.

verses.english:
He gave to me a seal,
All of my debts He paid,
And as He gave, He smiled and said,
'Always, remember Me.'
verses.yoruba:
O fun mi l'edidi,
O san igbese na,
B'o ti fún mi, O sí rẹrin,
Wipe; ma rántí Mi!

verses.english:
I shall treasure the seal,
Though, the debt is all paid,
The seal told of the love of One,
Who paid the debt for me.
verses.yoruba:
Un o p'edidi na mọ,
B'gbese tilẹ tan;
O nsọ ìfẹ Ẹni t'o san,
Igbese na fún mi.

verses.english:
I looked at it and smiled,
Again, I looked and wept,
The earnest of His love for me,
I'll ever treasure it.
verses.yoruba:
Mo wo mo si rẹrin,
Mo tun wo mo sọkún,
Ẹri ìfẹ Rẹ sí mi ni,
Ùn o tọju rẹ titi.

verses.english:
It is more than a seal
It is in remembrance,
That all the debt of sin was 
By Lord, Emmanuel.
verses.yoruba:
Ki tun s'edidi mọ,
Ṣugbọn ìrántí ni!
Pe gbogbo igbese mi ni,
Immanueli san.

title.english: I Need Thee Every Hour

verses.english:
I need Thee every hour,
Most gracious Lord;
No tender voice like 
Can peace afford.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fẹ Ọ n'gbagbogbo,
Iwọ Olore;
K'o s'ohun bi Tire,
T'o m'alafia wa.

Mo fẹ Ọ n'gbagbogbo,
Duro ti mi,
Idanwo ko n'ipa
B'o wa n'tosi.

verses.english:
I need Thee every hour,
In joy or pain;
Come quickly and abide,
Or life is vain.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fẹ Ọ n'gbagbogbo,
L'ayọ, n'isẹ;
Yara wa ba mi gbe,
Asan l'aye.

verses.english:
I need Thee every hour;
Teach me Thy will,
And Thy rich promises
In me fulfil.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fẹ Ọ n'gbagbogbo,
Ko mi n'ifẹ Rẹ;
Mu ileri Rẹ sẹ,
Si mi l'ara.

verses.english:
I need Thee every hour,
Most Holy One;
O make me Thine indeed
Thou blessed Son.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fẹ Ọ n'gbagbogbo,
Ẹni Mimọ,
Se mi n'Tirẹ totọ,
Ọmọ 'bukun.

chorus.yoruba:
Mo fẹ Ọ, a! mo fẹ Ọ,
Ni wakati gbogbo;
Bukun mi Olugbala,
Mo wa s'ọdọ Rẹ.

title.english: I Gave My Life For Thee

verses.english:
I gave my life for Thee,
My precious blood I shed,
That thou might'st ransomed be,
And quicken'd from the dead,
I gave My life for thee;
What hast thou giv'n for Me?
verses.yoruba:
Mo f'ara mi fun Ọ,
Mo ku nitori rẹ,
Ki nle ra ọ pada,
K'o le jinde n'n'oku,
Mo f'ara mi fun ọ;
Kini 'wọ se fun Mi?

verses.english:
I spent long years for thee
In weariness and woe,
That an eternity
Of joy thou mightest know,
I spent long years for thee;
Hast thou spent one for Me?

My Father's home of light,
My rainbow-circled throne
I left, for earthly night,
For wand'rings sad and lone,
I left it all for thee;
Hast Thou left aught for Me?

I suffer'd much for thee,
More than thy tongue can tell
Of bit'rest agony,
To rescue thee from hell,
I suffered much or thee;
What canst thou bear for Me?

And I have brought to thee,
Down from My home above,
Salvation full and free,
My pardon and My love,
Great gifts I brought to Thee;
What hast thou brought to Me?
verses.yoruba:
Mo mu igbala nla
Lat' ile Baba mi
Wa lati fi fun ọ
Ati idariji
Mo m'ẹbun wa fun ọ;
Ki lo mu wa fun mi?

verses.english:
Oh, let thy life be given,
Thy years for Me be spent,
World-fetters all be riven,
And joy with suffering blent,
I gave Myself for thee;
Give thou thyself to Me.

title.english: My Happy Heart Is Singing

verses.english:
My happy heart is singing,
My heav'nly Father's love;
He send so many blessings,
Like sunbeams from above.
verses.yoruba:
Ọkan ayọ mi nkọ'rin,
Ifẹ Baba ọrun,
O ran ọpọ ibukun,
B'orun lat'oke wa.

verses.english:
Tho' other joy may fail me,
And sorrows may befall,
Saviour will be with me,
And He is best of all.
verses.yoruba:
B'ayọ miran gbogbo pin,
Ti banujẹ si de,
Jesu yio pẹlu mi,
On si dara julọ.

verses.english:
O, let me tell to others,
The story of His grace,
Rejoicing in His service,
Until I see His face.
verses.yoruba:
Uno sọ fun elomiran,
Itan or'ọfẹ Rẹ,
Uno ma yo n'nu isin Rẹ,
Titi uno r'oju Rẹ.

verses.english:
And when I view the glories
Within the jasper wall,
I'll sing with all the ransomed
My Saviour's best of all.
verses.yoruba:
'Gba mo ba si ri ogo,
Ninu odi Jasper;
Uno kọ'rin irapada,
P'Olugbala san ju.

chorus.english:
But Jesus is the best of all,
Yes Jesus is the best of all,
Of all the joys that may surround me,
The best of all is Jesus.
chorus.yoruba:
Sugbọn Jesu l'O san julọ,
Bẹni Jesu l'O san julọ,
N'nu gbogbo ti o yi mi ka,
Jesu nikan l'O julọ.

title.english: I Heard The Voice Of Jesus Say

verses.english:
I heard the voice of Jesus say,
Come unto Me and rest;
Lay down, thou weary one, lay down,
Thy head upon My breast!
I came to Jesus as I was,
Weary, and worn, and sad;
I found in Him a resting-place,
And He has made me glad.
verses.yoruba:
Mo gb'ohun Jesu t'o wipe
Wa simi lọdọ Mi;
'Wọ alarẹ, gbe ori rẹ
Le okan-aya Mi!
N'nu are on ibinujẹ
Ni mo to Jesu wa;
Lọdọ Rẹ, mo r'ibi-simi,
On si mu 'nu mi dun.

verses.english:
I heard the voice of Jesus say,
Behold, I freely give
The living water; thirsty one,
Stoop down and drink, and live!
I came to Jesus, and I drank
Of that life-giving stream;
My thirst was quenched, my soul revived,
And now I live in Him.
verses.yoruba:
Mo gb'ohun Jesu t'o wipe,
Iwọ ti ongbe ngbe,
Un o f'omi 'ye fun o l'ofe
Bẹrẹ, mu, ko si ye!
Mo tọ Jesu wa, mo si mu
N'nu omi iye na;
Ọkan mi tutu, o sọji,
Mo d'alaye n'nu Rẹ.

verses.english:
I heard the voice of Jesus say,
I am this dark world's Light;
Look unto Me, thy morn shall rise,
And all thy day be bright!
I looked to Jesus, and I found
In Him my Star, my Sun;
And in that light of life I'll walk
Till trav'lling days are done.
verses.yoruba:
Mo gb'ohun Jesu t'o wipe,
'Mọlẹ aye l'Emi;
Wo mi, ọrun rẹ yo si la,
Ọjọ rẹ yo dara
Mo wa Jesu n'nu Rẹ mo ri
'Rawo at'orun mi;
N'nu 'mọlẹ rẹ l'emi yo rin
Tit' ajo mi yo pin.

title.english: I've Found A Friend, Oh Such A
title.yoruba: Mo l'Ọrẹ Kan Ifẹ Rẹ Pọ!

verses.english:
I've found a Friend, oh, such a Friend!
He loved me ere I knew Him;
He drew me with the cords of love
And thus He bound me to Him,
And round my heart still closely twine,
Those ties which naught can ever,
For I am His, and He is mine,
For ever and for ever.

I've found a Friend, oh, such a Friend!
He bled, He died to save me;
And not alone the gift of life,
But His own self He gave me.
Naught that I have my own I call,
I hold it for the Giver:
My heart, my strength, my life, my all,
Are His, and His for ever.
verses.yoruba:
Mo l'Ọrẹ kan ifẹ Rẹ pọ!
O ku lati gba mi la;
Iye nikan kọ l'O fun mi
O fi ara Rẹ ji mi,
Nko ni p'ohun kan ni temi
Un o pamọ f'Olufunmi;
Ọkan, agbara, ẹmi mi
Tirẹ, ni titi laelae.

verses.english:
I've found a Friend, oh, such a Friend!
All power to Him is giv'n,
To guard me on my onward course
And bring me safe to heaven
Th'eternal glories gleam afar,
To nerve my faint endeavour;
So now to watch, to work, to war,
And then to rest for ever.
verses.yoruba:
Mo l'Ọrẹ kan ifẹ Rẹ pọ!
Gbogb' agbara l'a fi fun
K' O le sọ mi li ajo mi,
K' O si mu mi de ọrun
Ogo ailopin tan 'mọlẹ,
Lati fun mi li okun;
Uno sọra, uno sisẹ, uno ja,
Lẹhin na, uno simi lae.

verses.english:
I've found a Friend, oh, such a Friend!
So kind, and true, and tender,
So wise a Counsellor and Guide,
So mighty a Defender!
From Him who loves me now so well,
What pow'r my soul can ever?
Shall life or death, or earth or hell?
No, I amHis for ever.
verses.yoruba:
Mo l'Ọrẹ kan ifẹ Rẹ pọ!
Oniyọnu, Olotọ!
Olugbimọ at'Amọna,
Alabo t'o lagbara!
Kini 'ba le ya mi lọdọ
Iye, iku, Aye, egbe?
Bẹkọ! Mo jẹ Tirẹ lae.

title.english: Jesus, Too Late I Thee Have Sought

verses.english:
Jesus, too late I Thee have sought
Hear me, blest Saviour, when I call;
Hear me, and from Thy dwelling place,
Pour down the riches of Thy grace.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu Oluwa, Ọba mi,
Gb'ohun mi nigbati mo npe;
Gb'ohun mi lati 'bugbe Rẹ
Rọ 'jo ore-ọfẹ silẹ.

verses.english:
Jesus, too late I Thee have sought,
How can I love Thee as I ought?
And how extol Thy matchless fame,
The glorious beauty of Thy name?
verses.yoruba:
Jesu mo ti jafara ju,
Uno se le fẹ Ọ, b'o ti yẹ?
Em'o se le gb' ogo Rẹ ga,
Ati ẹwa orukọ Rẹ?

verses.english:
Jesus, what didst Thou find me,
That Thou hast dealt so lovingly?
How great the joy that Thou hast brought,
So far exceeding hope or thought!
verses.yoruba:
Jesu ki l'o ri ninu mi,
Ti 'fẹ na fi pọ to bayi?
Ore Rẹ si mi ti pọ to,
O ta gbogbo ero mi yo!

verses.english:
Jesus, of Thee shall be my song,
To Thee my heart and soul belong;
All that I have or am is Thine,
And Thou, blest Saviour, Thou art mine.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu 'Wo o jẹ orin mi,
Tirẹ laya at'ọkan mi
Tirẹ ni gbogbo ini mi,
Olugbala, 'Wọ ni temi.

chorus.english:
Jesus, my Lord, I Thee adore,
Oh make me love Thee more and more.
chorus.yoruba:
Oluwa mi, mo fẹran Rẹ,
Jẹ ki nle ma fẹran Rẹ si.

title.english: Jesus, Still Lead On

verses.english:
Jesus, still lead on,
While life's course is run,
And we'll follow at Thy bidding,
Meekly in Thy footsteps treading;
Guide us by Thy hand,
To our fatherland.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu, ma tọ wa,
Tit' ao fi simi;
Bi ọna wa ko tilẹ dan
A o tẹle Ọ l'aifo ya.
F'ọwọ rẹ tọ wa,
S'ilu Baba wa.

verses.english:
Should the way be drear,
Let us never fear,
And in days of greatest sorrow,
Trust Thee for a bright tomorrow;
For, through weal and woe,
To our home we go.
verses.yoruba:
B'ọna ba l'ewu,
B'ọta sunmọ wa,
Majẹ k'aigbagbọ m'ẹru wa,
Ki gbagbọ on 'reti ma yẹ,
'Tor' arin ọta
L'a nlọ sile wa.

verses.english:
If we feel the smart,
Of a wounded heart,
Or if others' griefs oppress us,
Still may patience,
Lord, possess us;
Let us, ever true,
Keep the end in view.
verses.yoruba:
'Gbat' afẹ 'tunu,
Ninu 'banujẹ,
'Gbat' idanwo titun ba de,
Oluwa fun wa ni suru;
Fi'lu ni han wa,
Ni b'ẹkun ko si.

verses.english:
Order Thou our way
All our earthly stay;
Should our path be rough and thorny,
Give us grace meet for the journey
Then, when life is o'er,
Open wide Thy door.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu, ma tọ wa;
Tit' ao fi simi
Amọna ọrun, tọju wa
Dabobo wa, tu wa ninu,
Titi ao fi de
Ilu Baba wa.

title.english: More Love To Thee O Christ

verses.english:
More love to Thee, O Christ,
More love to Thee
Hear Thou the pray'r I make
On bended knee
This is my earnest plea
More love, O Christ To Thee
More love to Thee!
More love to Thee!
verses.yoruba:
Ki nfẹ Ọ si Kristi,
Ki nfẹ Ọ si!
Gb'adura ti mo ngba
L'or'ẹkun mi;
Eyi ni ẹbẹ mi;

Ki nfẹ Ọ si Kristi,
Ki nfẹ Ọ si,
Ki nfẹ Ọ si.

verses.english:
Once earthly joy I crave,
Sought peace and rest
Now Thee alone I seek,
Give what is best
This all my pray'r shall be
More love, O Christ To Thee
More love to Thee!
More love to Thee!
verses.yoruba:
L'ẹkan ohun aye
Ni mo ntoro;
Nisiyi, 'Wọ nikan
Ni emi nwa;
Eyi l'aura mi:
Ki nfẹ Ọ si Kristi,
Ki nfẹ Ọ si,
Ki nfẹ Ọ si.

verses.english:
Let sorrow do its work,
Send grief and pain;
Sweet are Thy messengers,
Sweet their refrain,
When they can sing with me
More love, O Christ To Thee
More love to Thee!
More love to Thee!
verses.yoruba:
Je ki 'banujẹ de
At' irora:
Didun l'o jisẹ Rẹ
At' ise wọn;
'Gba wọn mba mi kọrin,
Ki nfẹ Ọ si Kristi,
Ki nfẹ Ọ si,
Ki nfẹ Ọ si.

verses.english:
Then shall my latest breath
Whisper Thy praise;
This be my parting cry
My heart shall raise
This still its pray'r shall be
More love, O Christ To Thee
More love to Thee!
More love to Thee!
verses.yoruba:
Njẹ, opin emi mi
Y'o jiyin Rẹ,
Eyi y'o jẹ ọrọ
Ikẹhin mi;
Adura mi y'o jẹ,
Ki nfẹ Ọ si Kristi,
Ki nfẹ Ọ si,
Ki nfẹ Ọ si.

title.english: Thine Forever! God Of Love

verses.english:
Thine for ever! God of love,
Hear us from Thy throne above;
Thine for ever may we be,
Here and in eternity.
verses.yoruba:
Tirẹ titi lae l'awa se
Baba, Ọlọrun ifẹ;
Jẹ k'ajẹ Tirẹ titi,
L'aye yi, ati laelae.

verses.english:
Thine for ever! Lord of life,
Shield us through our earthly strife;
Thou the Life, the Truth, the Way,
Guide us to the realms of day.
verses.yoruba:
Tirẹ laelae, l'awa se
Ma toju wa laye yi;
'Wọ Iye, Ọna, Otọ,
Tọ wa si ilu orun.

verses.english:
Thine for ever! O how blest
They who find in Thee their rest!
Saviour, Guardian, Heav'nly Friend,
O defend us to the end!
verses.yoruba:
Tirẹ laelae! Abukun
L'awon t'ose simi wọn!
Olugbala, Ọrẹ wa,
Gba'ja wa ja de opin.

verses.english:
Thine for ever! Shepherd, keep
These Thy frail and trembling sheep;
Safe alone beneath Thy care,
Let us all Thy goodness share.
verses.yoruba:
Tirẹ laelae! Jesu pa
Awọn agutan Rẹ mọ,
L'abẹ isọ rere Rẹ,
Ni k'o pa gbogbo wa mọ.

verses.english:
Thine for ever! Thou our guide,
All our wants by Thee supplied,
All our sins by Thee forgiven,
Lead us, Lord, from earth to heav'n.
verses.yoruba:
Tirẹ laelae! Aini wa
Ni o jẹ aniyan Rẹ;
O ti f'ẹsẹ wa ji wa,
Tọ wa si ibugbe Rẹ.

title.english: There Is A Name I Love To Hear
title.yoruba: Orukọ Kan Mbẹ Ti Mo Fẹ

verses.english:
There is a name I love to hear,
I love to sing its worth;
It sounds like music in mine ear,
The sweetest name on earth.
verses.yoruba:
Orukọ kan mbẹ ti mo fẹ,
Mo fẹ ma kọrin Rẹ;
Iro didun ni l'eti mi,
Orukọ didun ni.

verses.english:
It tells me of the Lamb of God
Who died to set me free;
It tells me of His precious blood,
The sinner's perfect plea.
verses.yoruba:
O sọ ifẹ Olugbala
T'O ku lati ra mi,
O sọ ẹjẹ Rẹ 'yebiye
Etutu ẹlẹsẹ.

verses.english:
It tells me of a Father's smile,
Beaming upon His child;
It cheers me through this little while,
Through, desert, waste, and wild.
verses.yoruba:
O sọ ti iyọnu Baba,
Ti O ni s'Ọmọ Rẹ,
O m'ara mi ya, lati la
Aginju aye ja.

verses.english:
Jesus, the name I love so well,
The name I love to hear,
No saint on earth its worth can tell
No heart conceive how dear.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu, orukọ ti mo fẹ,
T'o si dun l'eti mi;
Ko s'ẹni mimọ kan l'aye
T'o mọ b'o ti pọ to.

verses.english:
This name shall shed its fragrance still
Along this thorny road
Shall sweetly smooth the rugged hill,
That leads me up to God.
verses.yoruba:
Orukọ yi j'orun didun
L'ọna ẹgun t'a nrin;
Yio tun ọna yangi se
T'o lọ s'ọd' Ọlọrun.

verses.english:
And there with all the blood-bought throng
From sin and sorrow free,
I'll  sing the new eternal song
Of Jesus' love to me.
verses.yoruba:
Nibẹ pẹlu awọn mimọ
Ti wọn bo nin'ẹsẹ,
Emi o kọrin titun ni
T'ifẹ Jesu si mi.

title.english: We Love Thee Lord, Yet Not Alone

verses.english:
We love Thee, Lord; yet not alone,
Because Thy bounteous hand
Showers down its rich and ceaseless gifts
On ocean and on land;
We praise Thee, gracious Lord, for these,
Yet not for these alone
The incense of Thy children's love
Arises to Thy throne.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu Oluwa a fẹ Ọ,
'Tori gbogbo ẹbun
Nt'ọwọ Rẹ da lat' oke wa
B'iri si gbogb' aye;
A yin Ọ n'tori 'wọnyi,
K'ise fun won nikan,
Ni awọn ọmọ-ọdọ Rẹ
Se ngb'adura si Ọ.

verses.english:
We love Thee, Lord, because when we had err'd and gone astray,
Thou didst recall our wandering souls
Into the heavenward way,
When helpless, hopeless, we were lot
In sin and sorrow's night,
A guiding way was granted us
From Thy pure fount of light.
verses.yoruba:
Awa fe Ọ, Olugbala,
'Tori 'gbat' asako,
Iwọ pe ọkan wa pada
Lati t'ọna iye;
'Gba t'a wa ninu okunkun,
Taa ri ninu ẹsẹ,
'Wọ ran imọlẹ Rẹ si wa
Lati f'ọna han wa.

verses.english:
Because, O Lord, Thou lovedst us
With everlasting love,
And sentest forth Thy son to die
That we might live above;
Because, when we were heirs of wrath,
Thou gavest hopes of heav'n;
We love because we much have sinn'd,
And much have been forgive.
verses.yoruba:
Baba orun awa fẹ Ọ,
Nitori 'Wọ fẹ wa
'Wọ ran Ọmọ Re lati ku,
Ki awa le n'iye;
'Gbat'a wa l'abẹ 'binu Rẹ
'Wọ fun wa n'ireti;
Bi ẹsẹ t'a da ti pọ to
Bẹ l'o ndariji wa.

title.english: When This Passing World Is Done

verses.english:
When this passing world is done,
When has sunk on glaring sun,
When we stand with Christ on high
Looking o'er life's history,
Then, Lord, shall I fully know,
Not till then, how much I owe.
verses.yoruba:
'Gbat'aye yi ba kọja,
Ti orun rẹ ba si wọ
Ti a ba wọ 'nu ogo,
T'a boju wo ẹhin wa,
Gbana, Oluwa, un o mọ
Bi 'gbese mi ti pọ to.

verses.english:
When I stand before the throne,
Dress'd in beauty not my own,
When I see Thee as Thou art,
Love Thee with unsinning heart;
Then, Lord, shall I fully know,
Not till then, how much I owe.
verses.yoruba:
'Gba mo ba de 'b'itẹ Rẹ,
L'ẹwa tiki se t'emi,
'Gba mo ri Ọ b'O ti ri,
Ti mo fẹ Ọ l'a fẹ tan;
'Gbana Oluwa un o mọ
Bi 'gbese mi ti pọ to.

verses.english:
When the praise of heav'n I hear,
Loud as thunders to the ear,
Loud as many water's noise,
Sweet as harp's melodious voice;
Then, Lord, shall I fully know,
Not till then, how much I owe.
verses.yoruba:
'Gba mba gbọ orin ọrun,
T'o ndun bi ohun ara,
Bi iro omi pupọ;
T'o si dun b'ohun duru,
'Gbana Oluwa, un o mọ
Bi'gbese mi ti pọ to.

Oluwa jọ, jẹ k'a ri
Ojiji Rẹ l'aye yi,
K'a mọ adun 'dariji
Pẹlu iranwọ Ẹmi,
Ki ntilẹ mọ l'aye yi,
Die ninu 'gbese mi.

verses.english:
Chosen not for good in me,
Waken'd up from wrath to flee,
Hidden in the Saviour's side,
By the Spirit sanctified.
Teach me, Lord, on earth to show,
By my love, how much I owe.
verses.yoruba:
Ore-ọfẹ l'o yan mi,
L'o yọ mi ninu ewu,
Jesu l'Olugbala mi,
Ẹmi sọ mi di mimọ;
Kọ mi ki nfi han l'aye,
Bi'gbese mi ti pọ to.

title.english: O Come, All Ye Faithful

verses.english:
O come, all ye faithful,
Joyful and triumphant,
O Come ye, O come ye to Bethlehem;
Come and behold Him
Born the King of angels.
verses.yoruba:
Wa Ẹyin olootọ!
L'ayọ at'isẹgun,
Wa ka lọ, wa ka lọ si Bẹtlẹhẹm,
Wa kalọ wo o
Ọba awọn Angẹl'.

verses.english:
True God of true God,
Light of Light eternal,
Lo! He abhors not the Virgin's womb,
Son of the Father,
Begotten, not created.
verses.yoruba:
Olodumare ni
Imọlẹ ododo,
Ko si korira inu wundia
Ọlọrun papa
Ti a bi, t'a ko da!

verses.english:
Sing choirs of angels,
Sing in exultation,
Sing, all ye citizen of heav'n above
Glory to God,
In the highest.
verses.yoruba:
Angẹli, ẹ kọrin
Kọrin itoye Rẹ!
Ki gbogbo eda ọrun si gberin,
Ogo f'Ọlọrun
L'oke ọrun lohun!

verses.english:
Yea, Lord, we greet Thee,
Born this happy morning,
Jesus, to Thee be glory given,
Word of the Father,
Now in flesh appearing.
verses.yoruba:
Nitotọ a wọlẹ
F'Ọba t'a bi loni,
Jesu Iwọ li awa nf'ogo fun!
'Wọ Ọmọ Baba,
T'o gbe ara wa wọ!

chorus.english:
O come let us adore Him,
O come let us adore Him,
O come let us adore Him,
He is Christ the Lord.
chorus.yoruba:
Ẹ wa kalọ juba Rẹ,
Ẹ wa kalọ juba Rẹ,
Ẹ wa kalọ juba Kristi Oluwa.

title.english: See Amid The Winter Snow

verses.english:
See amid the winter snow,
Born for us on earth below,
See the tender Lamb appear,
Promised from eternal years.
verses.yoruba:
Nigbati otutu mu,
Li aye abi Jesu,
Ọdọ aguntan tabi,
Ileri ayebaye.

verses.english:
Low within a manger lies
He who built the starry skies
He who throned in height sublime
Sits among the cherubim.
verses.yoruba:
Ninu ibujẹ ẹran,
L'atẹ ẹlẹda aye,
Ẹni t'ogunwa l'ọrun,
To joko l'arin kerub.

verses.english:
Say yee holy shepherds say
What your joyful news today
Wherefore have yee left your sheep
On the lonely mountain steep?
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ sọ t'ibi Oluwa,
Ẹyin Olus'aguntan,
Ẹse t'ẹ d'agbo yin nu,
Silẹ li ẹba oke?

verses.english:
As we washed at dead of night
We saw a wondrous light
Angel singing 'peace on earth'
Told us of the saviour's birth.
verses.yoruba:
Ni ọganjọ oru ni,
Irawọ 'yanu la tan,
Alafia l'aye yi,
L'awọn Angẹli nkede.

verses.english:
Sacred infants all divine
What a tender love was thine
Thus to come from highest bliss
Down to such a world as this.
verses.yoruba:
A bi Ọmọ iyanu,
Iru ifẹ wo leyi,
P'Olugbala wa saye,
Lati gba gbogbo wa la.

verses.english:
Teach, oh teach us holy child
By thy face so meek and mild
Teach us to resemble thee
In thy sweet humility.
verses.yoruba:
Ọmọ to s'ọwọn kọ wa,
Nipa ifẹ Rẹ rere,
Ki aba le dabi Rẹ,
Ni inu iwa pẹlẹ.

chorus.english:
Hail thou ever blessed morn
Hail redemption's happy dawn,
Sing thru all Jerusalem,
Christ is born in Bethlehem.
chorus.yoruba:
Ayin ẹni ibukun,
To mu irapada de,
Kọrin ka Jerusalem,
A bi Kris'ni Bẹtlẹhẹm.

title.english: Hark! The Herald-Angels Sing

verses.english:
Hark! The herald-angels sing,
Glory to the new-born King,
Peace on earth, and mercy mild,
God and sinners reconciled,
Joyful, all ye nations, rise,
Join the triumph of the skies,
With the angelic host proclaim,
Christ is born in Bethlehem.
verses.yoruba:
Gbọ ẹda ọrun nkọrin,
“Ogo fun Ọba t'a bi”,
“Alafia l'aye yi”,
Ọlọrun ba wa laja,
Gbogbo ẹda, nde l'ayọ,
Ẹ gberin, at'oke wa,
Kede pẹl' angẹli pe,
A bi Kristi ni Bẹtlẹhẹm'.

verses.english:
Christ, by highest heav'n ador'd,
Christ, the everlasting Lord,
Late in time behold Him come,
Offspring of a virgin's womb!
Veiled in flesh the Godhead see;
Hail the incarnate Deity!
Pleas'd as Man with man to dwell,
Jesus, our Immanuel.
verses.yoruba:
Kristi t'a nyìn l'ogo l'ọrùn,
Kristi Oluwa tití láé,
Ni igbẹyin wo, o dé,
Ọmọ inú wundia!
W'Ọlọrun di eniyan!
Ọlọrun di eniyan
O dun mi k'ó b'eeyan gbe
Jesu, Imanuẹl' wa.

verses.english:
Hail the heav'n-born Prince of Peace!
Hail the Sun of Righteousness!
Light and life to all He brings,
Risen with healing in His wings,
Mild He lays His glory by,
Born that man no more may die,
Born to raise the sons of earth,
Born to give them second birth.
verses.yoruba:
Wo, Alade Alafia!
Wo o, orun ododo!
O mu 'mọlẹ iye wa,
'Lera mbẹ li apa rẹ,
O bọ 'go rẹ s'apa kan,
A bi k'eniyan ma ku;
A bi k'o gb'eniyan ro,
A bi k'o le tun wa bi.

verses.english:
Come, Desire of nations, come,
Fix in us Thy humble home,
Rise, the woman's conquering Seed,
Bruise in us the serpent's head.
Adam's likeness now efface,
Stamp Thine image in its place,
Second Adam from above,
Reinstate us in thy love.
verses.yoruba:
Wa, 'reti oril'ede,
F'ọkan wa ṣe 'bugbe Rẹ,
Ndé, irú ọmọ 'birin,
Ṣẹgun èṣù ninu wa,
Pa àwòrán Adam rẹ,
F'aworan Rẹ dipo rẹ,
Adam' 'keji lat'oke,
Gba wa pada s'ifẹ Rẹ.

chorus.english:
Hark! The herald-angels sing,
Glory to the new-born King.
chorus.yoruba:
Gbọ eda ọrun nkọrin,
Ogo fun Ọba t'a bi.

title.english: Angels From The Realms Of Glory

verses.english:
Angels from the realms of glory
Wing your flight o'er all the earth;
Ye, who sang creation's story,
Now proclaim Messiah's birth.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹyin angẹl' l'orun ogo,
To yi gbogbo aye ka;
Ẹ ti kọrin dida aye,
Ẹ sọ t'ibi mesaiah.

verses.english:
Shepherds in the field abiding,
Watching o'er your flocks by night,
God with man is now residing,
Yonder shines the infant light.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹyin Oluṣọ-agutan,
Ti nṣọ́ ẹran yin l'oru,
Imanueli wa ti de,
Irawo Ọmọ na ntan.

verses.english:
Sages, leave your contemplations;
Brighter visions beam afar,
Seek the great desire of nations,
Ye have seen His natal star.
verses.yoruba:
Amoye, f'ero yin silẹ,
Wo 'ran didan lokere!
Wa 'reti nla orilẹ 'de,
Ẹ ti ri irawọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
Saints, before the altar bending
Watching long with hope and fear,
Suddenly the Lord, descending,
In His temple shall appear.
verses.yoruba:
Onigbagbo ti ntẹriba,
Ni 'bẹru at'ireti,
L'ojiji l'Oluwa o de
Ti yio mu nyin re 'le.

verses.english:
All creation, join in praising,
God the Father, Spirit, Son,
Evermore your voices raising,
To th' Eternal Three in One.
verses.yoruba:
A nwo b'ọm'ọwọ nisi'yi,
Y'o gba itẹ Baba Rẹ,
Ao ko gbogb' aye s'ọdọ Rẹ,
Gbogb' ekun yo wolẹ fún.

chorus.english:
Come and worship,
Worship Christ the new-born King.
chorus.yoruba:
Ẹ wa jọsin,
Fún Kristi Ọba titun.

title.english: As With Gladness Men Of Old

verses.english:
As with gladness men of old
Did the guiding star behold,
As with joy they hailed its light
Leading onward, onward, beaming bright;
So, most gracious Lord, may we
Evermore be led to Thee.
verses.yoruba:
B'awọn ara igbani
Ti f'ayọ ri 'rawọ na,
Bi wọn ti f'inu didun
Tẹle 'mọlẹ didan rẹ,
Bẹ, Oluwa Olore
Ni k'a mu wa d'ọdọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
As with joyful steps they sped,
Saviour, to Thy lowly bed,
There to bend the knee before
Thee, whom heav'n and earth adore;
So may we with willing feet
Ever seek the mercy seat.
verses.yoruba:
Bi wọn ti fi ayọ lọ
Si ibujẹ ẹran na,
Ti won si wolẹ nibẹ,
F'Ẹni t'ọrun t'aye mbọ,
Gẹgẹ bẹ ni k'a ma yọ
Lati wa sitẹ anu.

verses.english:
As they offered gifts most rare,
At Thy cradle rake and bare,
So may we with holy joy,
Pure, and free from sin's alloy,
All our costliest treasures bring,
Christ, to Thee, our heav'nly King.
verses.yoruba:
Bi wọn ti mu ọrẹ wa
Si ibujẹ ẹran na,
Bẹ ni k'a fayo mu wa
Ọrẹ tẹsẹ ko bajẹ,
Mu isura gbogbo wa
Sọdọ Rẹ, Jesu Ọba.

verses.english:
Holy Jesus, every day keep us in the narrow way;
And, when earthly things are past,
Bring our ransomed souls at last
Where they need no star to guide,
Where no clouds Thy glory hide.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu mimọ, pa wa mọ
L'ọna toro l'ọjọjọ,
Gbat'ohun aye ba pin
M'ọkan wa de ilu, ti
'Rawọ ko nsamọna mọ,
'Biti wọn nwo ogo Rẹ.

verses.english:
In the heavenly country bright,
Need they no created light,
Thou its light, its joy, its crown,
Thou its sun which goes not down,
There for ever may we sing
Hallelujah to our King.
verses.yoruba:
Ni 'lu ọrun mimọ na,
Wọn ko wa imọlẹ mọ,
'Wọ l'ọrun rẹ ti ki wọ,
'Wọ l'ayọ at'ade rẹ,
Nibẹ titi l'ao ma kọ
Aleluya s'Ọba wa.

title.english: All Thanks To Thee Almighty God

verses.english:
All thanks to Thee Almighty God,
For sending Thy son to us,
Let the whole world be filled with joy,
For the child born on this day.
verses.yoruba:
A f'ọpẹ fun Ọlọrun wa,
To ran Ọmọ Rẹ w'aye,
K'ayọ gba gbogbo aye kan,
F'ọmọ na t'abi loni.

verses.english:
All thanks to Thee, Almighty God,
For thy great love upon us,
Thou hast sent the Saviour to us,
On this day as we rejoice.
verses.yoruba:
A f'ọpẹ fun Ọlọrun wa
Fun 'fẹ nla to ni si wa;
O ran Olugbala w'aye,
Lojo oni awa nyo.

verses.english:
Let all the seeds of the forest,
Cocoa, Palm tree and Rubber,
All the hidden treasures of ground,
Give praises unto our King.
verses.yoruba:
Ki gbogb' eso inu igbo,
Koko, ọpẹ on rọba,
Gbogbo isura 'nu ilẹ,
Ba wa fiyin f'Ọba wa.

verses.english:
Let all fishes in the Ocean
And all the birds of the air,
Let all the beasts of the forest,
Now give praises to our Lord.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹ ki ẹja inu ibu
At'ẹyẹ oju ọrun,
Ki gbogbo ẹranko igbẹ,
Wa fiyin f'Oluwa wa.

verses.english:
As we are rejoicing today,
We beseech Thee Trinity,
Give us, that we may adore Thee
And the coming year to praise.
verses.yoruba:
Bi a ti nse ti ọdun yi,
A mbẹ Ọ, Mẹtalọkan,
Jẹk'a le wa fiyin fun Ọ,
Niwoyi ọdun to mbọ.

chorus.english:
Shout and rejoice, all ye people
Let us praise our mighty God,
Shout and rejoice, ye believers,
Let our souls be fill'd with joy.
chorus.yoruba:
Ẹ ho, ẹ yọ, gbogb'eniyan,
Ẹ fiyin f'Ọlọrun wa,
Ẹ ho, ẹ yọ, onigbagbo,
K'iyin gba ọkan wa kan.

title.english: Awake, Awake, All Nations

verses.english:
Awake, awake, all nations
No longer slumber on,
Our light of lights supernal
Now makes its rays appear,
The sun gives natural light
Christ illumines the hearts,
Must the hope of our Fathers
Dawn upon us in vain?
verses.yoruba:
Ẹji, Ẹyin eniyan
Ẹ ma se sun titi;
A! Imọlẹ wa nlanla
On li o yo de yi,
Orun n'imọlẹ ara,
Jesu ni ti ọkan?
Ireti awọn baba
Yio ha de lasan?

verses.english:
He comes from sin to set free
And darkness to dispel,
Rejoice Christ's kingdom bring us
A great era of peace,
To Him let's bring our offerings
Of worship, love and praise,
Wise men brought gifts from afar
Shall we not give our hearts.
verses.yoruba:
O de k'ẹwọn ẹsẹ tu,
O de k'okunkun lọ;
Ẹ yo ijọba Jesu
O ni rọrun pupọ,
Ẹ jẹ k'a mu ọrẹ wa
K'a juba Ọba wa,
Awọn amoye mu wa
A ki o mu wa bi?

verses.english:
Let us give our hearts to Him
Let Him be enthroned there,
Surrender all to Jesus
Be subject to His will,
Rejoice! Again rejoice, ye
For Christ the Lord is come,
For the riches and the poor,
Our Lord Jesus is come.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹ k'a fi ọkan wa fun,
K'o tẹ 'tẹ Rẹ sibẹ;
K'a fi ohun gbogbo fun
K'a si se ifẹ Rẹ.
Ẹ yọ! ẹ yọ! ẹ tun yọ!
Jesu Oluwa de
F'otosi at'ọlọrọ,
Kristi Oluwa de.

title.english: CHristians, Awake

verses.english:
Then to the watchful shepherds it was told,
Who heard the angelic herald's voice,
Behold, I bring good tidings of a Saviour's birth
To you and all the nations upon earth;
This day hath God fulfilled His promised word,
This day is born a Saviour, Christ the Lord.
verses.yoruba:
'Gba na l'a ran akede angẹli;
T'a so f'awọn olus'agutan pe,
'Mo mu 'hinrere Olugbala wa
T'a bi fun yin ati gbogbo aye,
Ọlọrun mu l'eri Rẹ se loni,
A bi Olugbala, Krist' Oluwa.

verses.english:
He spake; and straightway the celestial choir,
In hymns of joy, unknown before, conspire,
The praises of redeeming love they sang,
And heav'ns whole orb with hallelujahs rang;
God's highest glory was their anthem still,
Peace upon earth, and unto men goodwill.
verses.yoruba:
Bi akede angẹl' na ti so tan,
Ọpọlọpọ ogun ọrun si de;
Wọn nkọrin ayọ t'eti ko gbo ri,
Orin Aleluya gba ọrun kan,
Ogo ni f'Ọlọrun l'oke ọrun,
Alafia at'ifẹ s'eniyan.

A ba le ma ranti nigbagbogbo
Pe, 'fẹ Ọlọrun l'o gba 'raye la,
K'a to 'sẹ Jesu t'o ra wa pada,
Lat' ibuj'ẹran de or' agbelebu;
K'a tọrọ or'-ọfẹ k'a le tẹ le,
Titi ao tun r'oju Rẹ Ọlọrun.

verses.english:
Then may we hope, the angelic hosts among
To sing, redeem'd, a glad triumphal song,
He that was born upon this joyful day
Around us all His glory shall display;
Saved by His love, incessant we shall sing
Eternal praise to heav'n's Almighty King.

title.english: Christians Lift Your Voice In Praises

verses.english:
Christians lift your voice in praises,
On this memorable day,
Hear the voices of the angels
Singing praises to our God,
Singing praises, singing praises,
Peace on earth goodwill to men.
verses.yoruba:
Onigbagbọ, ẹbu s'ayọ,
Ọjọ nla l'eyi fun wa,
Ẹ gbọ bi awọn Angẹli
Ti nf'ogo fun Ọlọrun,
Alafia, Alafia,
Ni fun gbogbo eniyan.

verses.english:
Let the whole earth now sing praises,
To the glorious Lord and King,
The begotten Son of Father
Who is born of virgin's birth
Wonderful Lord, wonderful Lord,
Is the Saviour born today.
verses.yoruba:
Ki gbogbo aiye ho fayọ,
K'a f'ogo fun Ọlọrun,
Ọmọ bibi Rẹ l'o fun wa
T'a bi ninu Wundia:
Ẹn' Iyanu, Ẹn' Iyanu
Ni Ọmọ t'a bi loni.

verses.english:
In the midst of chaos and danger,
And the evils of the world,
In the distraction of our sins
The Son of God comes to save,
The Counselor, the Counselor,
Jesus Christ the Prince of Peace.
verses.yoruba:
Ninu gbogbo rudurudu,
On ibi t'o kun aiye,
Ninu idamu nla ẹsẹ
L'Ọm' Ọlọrun wa gba wa,
Olugbimọ, Olugbimọ,
Alade, Alafia.

verses.english:
Almighty and most gracious Lord,
Born today as newly babe,
Father, who is everlasting
Now our Controller to be,
O be joyful, o be joyful,
The Son of David now reigns.
verses.yoruba:
Ọlọrun Olodumare,
L'abi, bi ọmọ titun,
Baba! Eni ayeraye
L'o di alakoso wa:
Ẹ bu s'ayọ, Ẹ bu s'ayọ,
Ọmọ Dafidi jọba.

verses.english:
He has come to save us from sin,
Our Advocator to be,
Satan's chain the Lord hath broken
He is made the glorious being,
Therefore rejoice, therefore rejoice
We are now sav'd from the death.
verses.yoruba:
O wa gba wa l'ọwọ ẹsẹ,
O wa d'onigbọwọ wa
Lati fọ itẹgun esu,
A ṣe ni Ọba Ogo,
Ẹ ku ayọ, Ẹ ku ayọ,
A gba wa l'ọwọ iku.

title.english: Peace On Earth Goodwill Unto Men

verses.english:
Peace on earth goodwill unto men,
Was the song of the angels,
Shepherd abiding in the field,
Heard, and herald Jesus birth.
verses.yoruba:
Alafia f'aye at'eeyan
L'orin t'awọn angẹl' kọ,
Awọn Olus'agutan gbọ
T'ikede ibi Kristi.

verses.english:
'Twas upon the mount of Judea,
There was great light of stars seen
To guide the wise men on their way
To look for this precious gift.
verses.yoruba:
Ni on oke Judea
N'imọlẹ 'rawọ la tan,
Lati s'amọna fun awọn
Ti nwa bun 'yanu yi.

verses.english:
And the three wise men saw the light,
As it was shown unto them,
To the child they brought precious gifts,
Gold, silver, and Frankincense.
verses.yoruba:
Awọn amoye mẹta ni
Ri imọlẹ nlanla na;
Wọn mu ẹbun wa f'Ọmọ na,
Wura, turari, ojia.

verses.english:
By the manger where Jesus laid,
They fell and worshipp'd their King
In humble they offer'd their gifts,
To Him that brought salvation.
verses.yoruba:
Lẹba ibujẹ ran na
Wọn juba fun Ọba wọn,
N'irẹlẹ wọn f'ẹbun lelẹ
F'ẹni to mu 'gbala wa.

title.english: O Beautiful Star Of Bethlehem

verses.english:
O beautiful star the hope of life,
Guiding the pilgrims through the night;
Over the mountains 'til the break of dawn,
Into the land of perfect day;It will give out a lovely ray,
O beautiful star of Bethlehem, shine on

chorus.english:
O beautiful star of Bethlehem,
Shining upon us through the dawns;
Give us a lamp to light the way,
Unto the land of perfect day,
O beautiful star of Bethlehem, shine on
chorus.yoruba:
Irawọ didan ti Bẹtlẹhẹm,
Tan sori wa titi ọjọ ogo,
Jọwọ fun wa ni imọlẹ,
Titi de ilu didan ni,
Irawọ didan ti Betlehem, maa tan.

title.english: Joy To The World! The Lord Is Come

verses.english:
Joy to the world! The Lord is come
Let earth receive her King;
Let every heart prepare Him room,
And heaven and nature sing.
verses.yoruba:
Ayọ b'aiye! Oluwa de,
K'aye gba Ọba rẹ?
Ki gbogbo ọkan mura de,
K'aye kọrin s'oke,

Ayọ b'aiye! Jesu jọba,
Ẹ jẹ k'a ho fayọ;
Gbogbo igbe, omi, oke,
Wọn ngberin ayọ na.

verses.english:
No more let sins and sorrows grow,
Nor thorns infest the ground;
He comes to make His blessings flow,
Far as the curse is found.
verses.yoruba:
K'ẹsẹ on 'yọnu pin l'aye,
K'ẹgun ye hu n'ilẹ,
O de lati mu 'bukun san,
De 'bi t'ẹgun gbe wa.

verses.english:
He rules the world with truth and grace,
And makes the nations prove
The glories of His righteousness
And wonders of His love.
verses.yoruba:
O fotọ at'ìfẹ jọba,
O jẹk'orilẹ 'de
Mọ, ododo ijọba Rẹ,
At'ìfẹ 'yanu Rẹ.

title.english: Child In The Manger Infant Of Mary

verses.english:
Child in the manger infant of Mary
Out cast and stranger Lord of all
Child who inherits all our transgressions,
All our demerits on Him fall.
verses.yoruba:
Ọmọ n'bujẹran l'ọmọ Maria,
Alejo, Oluwa aye,
Ọmọ to ru gbogbo asisẹ wa
Ati awọn abuku wa.

verses.english:
Once the most holy Child of salvation,
Gently and lowly lived below
Now, as our glorious mighty Redeemer,
See him victorious o'er each foe.
verses.yoruba:
Nigbakan l'ọmọ Mimọ julọ yi
F'irẹlẹ gbe'nu aye yi;
Nisiyi gẹgẹ b'Olurapada
O ni 'sẹgun lori ọta.

verses.english:
Prophets foretold Him Infant of wonder,
Angels behold Him on His throne
Worthy our Saviour of all their praises,
Happy for ever Are His own.
verses.yoruba:
Awọn wọli sọ asọtẹlẹ Rẹ;
Awọn angẹl ri lor'ite
Olugbala, 'wọ ni iyin yẹ fun,
Layọ l'awọn Tirẹ y'o wa.

title.english: Joy Fills Our Inmost Heart To-Day

verses.english:
Joy fills our inmost heart to-day,
The royal Child is born,
And angel hosts in glad array,
His Advent keep this morn.
verses.yoruba:
Ayọ kun ọkan wa loni,
A bi Ọmọ Ọba,
Ọpọ àwọn ogun ọrun,
Nsọ ibi Rẹ loni!

verses.english:
Low at the cradle throne we bend,
We wonder and adore;
And feel no bliss can ours transcend,
No joy was sweet before.
verses.yoruba:
A wolẹ n'ibujẹ ẹran,
N'iyanu l'a jọsin:
Ibukun kan ko ta yi yọ,
Ko s'ayọ bi eyi.

verses.english:
For us the world must lose its charms,
Before the manger shrine,
When, folded in Thy mother's arms
We see Thee, Babe divine.
verses.yoruba:
Aiye ko n'adun fun wa mọ,
'Gbati a ba nwo Ọ
L'ọwọ wundia iya Rẹ,
'Wọ Ọmọ Iyanu.

verses.english:
Thou light of uncreated Light,
Shine on us, Holy Christ,
That we may keep Thy birthday bright,
With service undefiled.
verses.yoruba:
Imọlẹ lat' inu 'mọlẹ,
Tan 'mọlǝ s'okun wa!
K'a le ma fi isin mimọ
Ṣe 'ranti ọjọ Rẹ.

chorus.yoruba:
Ẹ yọ, Ọlọrun d'eniyan!
O wa joko l'aye;
Orúkọ wo l'o dun to yi
Immanuẹl'.

title.english: Once In Royal David's City

verses.english:
Once in royal David's city,
Stood a lowly cattle-shed,
Where a mother laid her baby
In a manger for His bed.
Mary was that mother mild,
Jesus Christ her little child.
verses.yoruba:
Nigba kan ni Bẹthlehẹmu,
Ile kekere kan wa,
Nib'iya kan tẹ 'mọ rẹ si,
Lori ibujẹ ẹran;
Maria n'iya ọmọ na,
Jesu Krist si l'ọmọ na.

verses.english:
He came down to earth from heaven,
Who is God and Lord of all,
And His shelter was a stable,
And His cradle was a stall,
With the poor, and mean, and lowly
Lived on earth our Saviour holy.

And through all His wondrous childhood,
He would honour and obey
Love, and watch the lowly maiden
In whose gently arms He lay
Christian children all must be
Mild, obedient, good as He.
verses.yoruba:
Ni gbogbo igba ewe Rẹ,
O ngbọran, O si mb'ọla;
O fẹran, O si ntẹriba,
Fun iya ti ntọju Rẹ!
O ye ki gbogb' ọmọde
K'o se olugbọran bẹ.

verses.english:
Not in that poor lowly stable,
With the oxen standing by,
We shall see Him; but in Heaven,
Set at God's right hand on high;
When like stars His children crown'd,
All in white shall wait around.
verses.yoruba:
Ki se ni ibujẹ ẹran
Nibiti malu njẹun
L'awa o ri, sugbọn l'ọrun
Lọwọ tun Ọlọrun;
'Gba wọn 'mọ Rẹ b' irawọ
Ba wa n'nu asọ ala.

title.english: While Shepherds Watch'd Their Flocks

verses.english:
While shepherds watch'd their flocks by night,
All seated on the ground,
The angel of the Lord came down,
And glory shone around.
verses.yoruba:
Bi awọn Olus'agutan
Ti ns'agbo wọn l'oru;
Angẹl' Oluwa sọkalẹ,
Ogo ran yi wọn ka.

verses.english:
'Fear not,' said he; for mighty dread
Had seized their troubled mind;
'Glad tidings of great joy I bring
To you and all mankind.'
verses.yoruba:
Ẹru ba wọn pupọ, sugbọn
O ni 'Ẹ ma bẹru'
Ihin ayọ ni mo mu wa
Fun yin at'araye.

verses.english:
'To you, in David's town, this day
Is born of David's line
The Saviour, who is Christ the Lord
And this shall be the sign.'
verses.yoruba:
Fun yin n'ilu Dafid', loni
N'idile Dafidi,
Abi Olugbala ti se
Kristi, Oluwa wa.

verses.english:
'The heav'nly Babe you there shall find,
To human view display'd
All meanly wrapp'd in swathing bands,
And in a manger laid.'
verses.yoruba:
Eyi ni y'o j'ami-ẹyin
O ri ọm-ọwọ na,
A fi ọja we, a si tẹ
Si ibujẹ ẹran.

verses.english:
Thus spake the seraph; and forthwith,
Appear'd a shinning throng
Of angels, praising God, and thus,
Address'd their joyful song.
verses.yoruba:
Bi angẹl' na ti sọrọ tan
Ọpọ awọn angẹl'
Fo de, wọn si nyin Ọlọrun
Wọn nkọrin ayọ pe.

verses.english:
All glory be to God on high,
And to the earth be peace;
Goodwill henceforth from heav'n to men,
Begin, and never cease.
verses.yoruba:
Ogo ni f'Ọlọrun loke
Alafia l'aye
K'ifẹ 'nu rere s'eniyan
Bẹrẹ laini opin.

title.english: The First Noel, The Angel Did Say

verses.english:
The first Noel, the angel did say,
Was to certain poor shepherds in fields as they lay;
In fields where they, lay, keeping their sheep,
On a cold winter's night that was so deep.
verses.yoruba:
Ibi Kristi, lawọn angẹli sọ,
Fun awọn olusọ agutan 'nu papa,
Nibi ti wọn ti sọ agbo agutan wọn,
Ni-ale ti otutu mu-pupọ.

verses.english:
They looked up and saw a star,
Shining in the east, beyond them far;
And to the earth it gave great light
And so it continued both day and night.
verses.yoruba:
Wọn woke wọn ri 'rawọ didan,
Ni ila orun lọna jinjin rere,
O tan imọlẹ to lagbara saye,
Imọlẹ na si ntan lọsan ati loru.

verses.english:
And by the light of the same star,
Three wise men came from country far,
To seek for a king was their intent
And to follow the star, wherever it went.
verses.yoruba:
Imọlẹ 'rawọ ni amoye mẹta ri,
Ti wọn se tọna jinjin rere wa,
Lati wa Ọba kan ni ero wọn,
Ki wọn tẹle 'rawọ sibi ti o ba nlọ.

verses.english:
This star drew night to the north-west;
O'er Bethlehem it took it rest,
And their it did both stop and stay,
Right over the place, where Jesus lay.
verses.yoruba:
Irawọ yi sun-mọ-tosi,
Gba ti o de Bẹthlẹhẹm ni o duro,
Nibẹ ni o-de ti o duro,
Nibi ti Jesu wa ti-o-sun si.

verses.english:
Then entered in those wise men three,
Fall reverently, upon the knee,
And offered there, in His presence,
Their gold, and myrrh and frankincense.
verses.yoruba:
Nigba na awọn amoye mẹta,
Wolẹ lẹsẹ Jesu lati fiyin fun,
Wọn mu ẹbun wa fun Olugbala,
Wura, ojia ati turari.

chorus.english:
No-el, No-el, No-el, No-el,
Born is the King of Israel.
chorus.yoruba:
I-bi- Kristi, I-bi-Kristi;
Ọba ti a bi, Ọba Israẹli.

title.english: We Three Kings Of Orient Are

verses.english:
We three kings of orient are,
Bearing gifts we traverse a-far;
Field and fountain, moor and mountain,
Following yonder star.
verses.yoruba:
Amoye mẹta nwo orun,
Mu ẹbun lọna jinjin wa,
Gba arin papa, oke, lati to 'pasẹ
'Rawo naa lọ.

verses.english:
Born a King on Bethlehem plain,
Gold I bring to crown Him again,
King for-ev-er, cea-sing nev-er,
O-ver us all to reign.
verses.yoruba:
Ọba ta bi ni Bẹthlẹhẹm,
Mo mu wura wa lati fun,
Titi ayeraye ni yo ma,
J'Ọba fun gbogbo wa.

verses.english:
Frank-in-cense to offer have I,
In-cense owns a Deity nigh,
Prayer-and praising, all men raising,
Worship Him God on high.
verses.yoruba:
Turari ni mo wa fun Ọ,
Orun turari f'Ọba nla,
Gbogbo eniyan ngba'dura
Fiyin, f'Ọba to ga ju lọ.

verses.english:
Myrrh is mine, its bitter perfume,
Breathes a life of gathering gloom,
Sorrowing, sighing bleeding, dying
Sealed in the stone-cold tomb.
verses.yoruba:
Ojia to 'run rẹ koro,
Sọ nipa 'banujẹ to nbọ,
Lọjọ 'waju at'ẹjẹ tutu,
Pẹl' edidi sare.

verses.english:
Glo-rious now behold Him
arise,King and God and sacrifice,
Al-le-lu-ia!A-le-lu-ia!
Peals through the earth and skies.
verses.yoruba:
O dide pẹlu ogo nla,
Ọba ọrun eletutu,
A-le-lu-a! A-le-lu-u-ya,
Rohin Re ka gbaye.

chorus.english:
O, star of wonder, Star of night
Star With loyal beauty bright,
West-ward leading, still proceed-ing,
Guide us to Thy perfect light.
chorus.yoruba:
I-rawọ ologo didan,
To fẹ wa otitọ han,
Tọna iwọ orun wa, tọ wa
Simọlẹ Rẹ pipe.

title.english: Away In A Manger, No Crib For
title.yoruba: Ni Ibujẹ Ẹran, To Ko Sibu-Sun

verses.english:
Away in a manger, no crib for a bed,
The little Lord Jesus laid down His sweet head,
The stars in the sky looked down where He lay,
The little Lord Jesus asleep on the hay.
verses.yoruba:
Ni ibujẹ ẹran, to ko sibu-sun,
Jesu wa lọmọde, gb'ori rẹ lelẹ,
Awon irawọ nwo 'bi ti Jesu wa,
Oluwa sun lori koriko to gbẹ.

verses.english:
The cattle are lowing, the baby awakes,
But little Lord Jesus, no crying He makes;
I love Thee Lord Jesus! Look down from the sky,
And stay by my cradle till morning is nigh.
verses.yoruba:
Igbe agbo ẹran, ji ọmọ tuntun,
Sugbon Jesu Oluwa wa ko kigbe,
Jesu mo fẹ Ọ, wo mi lat'oke wa,
Duro lẹgbẹ 'busun mi dowurọ.

verses.english:
Be near me, Lord Jesus, I as Thee to stay,
Close by me forever, and love me I pray,
Bless all the dear children in Thy tender care,
And take us to heaven to live with Thee there.
verses.yoruba:
Sun mọ mi Oluwa, mo bẹ Ọ duro,
Timi titi laelae, fẹran mi Jesu,
Bukun awọn ọmọde, mu wa sodo Rẹ,
Ka le ma ba Ọ gbe titi laelae.

title.english: Silent Night, Holy Night

verses.english:
Silent night, Holy Night,
All is calm, all is bright,
Round you virgin mother and child
Holy infant so tender and mild,
Sleep in heavenly peace,
Sleep in heavenly peace.
verses.yoruba:
A! Ajinjin oru mimọ,
Ookun sa, 'mọlẹ tan,
Yika wundia ati ọmọ rẹ,
Ọmọ mimọ to wa loju orun,
Simi n'nu alaafia,
Simi n'nu alaafia.

verses.english:
Silent night, Holy Night,
Silent night, holy night
Darkness flies, all is light,
Shepherds hear the angels sing,
Hallelujah! Hail the king!
Christ the Saviour is born,
Christ the Saviour is born.
verses.yoruba:
A! Ajinjin oru mimọ,
'Mọlẹ de, ookun sa,
Olusọ agutan gborin Angẹl,
Kabiyesi aleluya Ọba,
Jesu Olugbala de,
Jesu Olugbala de.

verses.english:
Silent night, Holy Night,
Guiding star, lend thy light,
See the eastern wise men bring,
Gifts and homage to our King!
Christ the Saviour is born,
Christ the Saviour is born.
verses.yoruba:
A! Ajinjin oru mimọ,
Rawọ ọrun tan 'mole,
Wo awọn amoye ila orun,
Mu ọrẹ wọn wa fun Ọba wa,
Jesu Olugbala de,
Jesu Olugbala de.

verses.english:
Silent night, Holy Night,
Wondrous star, lend thy light,
With the angels let us sing,
Hallelujah to our King!
Christ the Saviour is born,
Christ the Saviour is born.
verses.yoruba:
A! Ajinjin oru mimọ,
'Rawọ ọrun tan 'mọlẹ,
Ka pẹlu awọn Angẹli kọrin,
Kabiyesi aleluya Ọba,
Jesu Olugbala de,
Jesu Olugbala de.

title.english: I'm Pressing On The Upward Way

verses.english:
I'm pressing on the upward way,
New height I'm gaining everyday,
Still praying as I onward bound,
Lord, plant my feet on higher ground.
verses.yoruba:
Mo ntesiwaju l'ọna na,
Mo ngoke si lojojumọ,
Mo ngbadura bi mo nti lọ,
Oluwa jọ, gbe mi soke.

verses.english:
My heart has no desire to stay,
Where doubts arise and fears dismay,
Tho' some may dwell where these abound,
My pray'r my aim is higher ground.
verses.yoruba:
Ifẹ ọkan mi ko duro,
Larin 'yemeji at'ẹru,
Awọn miran le ma gbe'bẹ,
Ibi giga l'ọkan mi nfẹ.

verses.english:
I want to live above the world,
Tho' satan's darts at me are hurl'd,
For faith has caught the joyful sound,
The song of saints on higher ground,
verses.yoruba:
Mo fẹ ki nga ju aye lọ
B'eṣu tile ngbogun ti mi,
Mo nfi gbagbọ gbọ órin na,
Ti awọn mimọ nkọ loke.

verses.english:
I want to scale the utmost height,
And catch a gleam of glory bright,
But still I'll pray till hea'n I've found,
Lord, lead me on to higher ground.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fẹ de 'bi giga julo,
Ninu ogo didan julọ,
Mo n gbadura ki nle de bẹ,
Oluwa mu mi de 'le na.

verses.english:
Lord lift me to the upward way,
