Come in, Come in.
verses.yoruba:
Mo da Ọ duro s'ode pọ ju,
Wọle, Wọle,
Dari eyi ji mi Oluwa,
Wọle, Wọle.

verses.english:
I hear Thee knocking at my heart's door,
Come in, Come in,
I'Il keep Thee waiting outside no more,
Come in, Come in.
verses.yoruba:
Mo gbọ, O nkan'lẹkun, Oluwa,
Wọle, Wọle,
Nko ni da Ọ duro s'ode mọ,
Wọle, Wọle.

chorus.english:
Come not to tarry, but stay, dear Lord,
All shall be Thine love can afford
Here in my heart ever make
Thine abode,
Come in, Come in.
chorus.yoruba:
Ma ba mi gbe titi Oluwa,
Ohun ti O fe ni uno fẹ,
Fi ọkan mi se 'bugbe Rẹ laelae,
Wọle, Wọle.

title.english: Come, Holy Spirit, Heavenly Dove

verses.english:
Come, Holy Spirit, heavenly dove,
With all Thy quickening pow'rs;
Kindle a flame of sacred love,
In these cold hearts of ours.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹmi Mimọ 'daba ọrun,
Wa ni agbara Rẹ;
Ko da ina ifẹ mimọ,
Si ọkan tutu wa.

verses.english:
In vain we tune our formal songs,
In vain we strive to rise;
Hosannas languish on our tongues,
And our devotion dies.
verses.yoruba:
Wo ba ti nra pala nihin
Ta fẹ hun asan;
Ọkan wa ko le fo ko lọ
Ko de b'ayo titi.

verses.english:
And shall we then for ever live,
At this poor dying rate?
Our love so faint, so cold to Thee,
And Thine to us so great?
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa ao ha wa titi
Ni kiku osi yi?
Ifẹ wa tutu bẹ si Ọ,
Tirẹ tobi si wa.

verses.english:
Come, Holy Spirit, heavenly Dove,
With all Thy quick'ning powers;
Come, shed abroad the saviour's love,
And that shall kindle ours.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹmi Mimọ 'Daba ọrun
Wa ni agbara Rẹ;
Wa da 'na 'fẹ Olugbala
Ti'wa o si gbina.

title.english: Lord, We Believe To Us And Ours

verses.english:
Lord, we believe to us and ours
The apostolic promise given;
We wait the Pentecostal pow'rs,
The Holy Ghost sent down from heaven.
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa, awa gbagbọ pe,
Tiwa ni 'leri igbani;
A nret' agbara Pẹntikọst,
Ẹmi Mimọ lat'oke wa.

Fun gbogb' ẹni ti Kristi pe,
Ni 'leri to daju mbẹ fun:
O pe gbogbo ẹyin Tirẹ,
Ẹ gba ọrọ ti Jesu sọ.

verses.english:
The Holy Ghost, if I depart,
The Comforter, shall surely come,
Shall make the contrite sinner's heart,
His lov'd, His everlasting home.
verses.yoruba:
B'Emi ba lọ, Ẹmi mimọ,
Olutunu ni yio wa,
S'ọkan ibanuj' elese
Di ile Re ayeraye.

verses.english:
Assembled here with one accord,
Calmly we wait the promised grace;
The purchase of our dying Lord,
Come, Holy Ghost, and fill the place.
verses.yoruba:
A f'ọkan kan pẹjọ nihin,
A nret' ileri or'-ọfẹ,
T'iku Oluwa wa ti ra,
Ẹmi Mimọ wa kun ihin.

verses.english:
If every one that asks may find,
If still Thou dost on sinners fall,
Come as a mighty rushing wind;
Great grace be now upon us all.
verses.yoruba:
B'ẹni bere ba le ri gba,
Bo ba mba l'ẹlẹsẹ sibẹ,
Wa b'iro ẹfufu lile;
Fun gbogbo wa l'or'ọfẹ Rẹ.

verses.english:
Behold, to Thee our souls aspire,
And languish Thy descent to meet:
Kindle in each thy living fire,
And fix in every heart Thy seat.
verses.yoruba:
Sa wo, Iwọ l'ọkan wa nwa,
A si npongbẹ isokan Rẹ;
Da ina iye sinu wa,
Fi ọkan wa se 'bugbe Rẹ.

title.english: Lord God The Holy Ghost

verses.english:
Lord God the Holy Ghost,
In this accepted hour,
As on the day of Pentecost,
Descend in all Thy pow'r
We meet with one accord
In our appointed place,
And wait the promise of our Lord,
The Spirit of all grace.
verses.yoruba:
'Wọ Ọlọrun Ẹmi
L'ọjọ 'tẹwọgba yi
Gẹgẹbi ọjọ Pẹntikọst'
Sọkalẹ l'agbara,
L'ọkan kan la pade
Ninu ile Rẹ yi;
A duro de ileri Rẹ,
Ẹmi ore ọfẹ.

verses.english:
Like mighty rushing wind
Upon the waves beneath,
Move with one impulse every mind,
One soul, one feeling, breathe:
The young, the old, inspire
With wisdom from above;
And give us hearts and tongues of fire,
To pray, and praise, and love.

Spirit of light, explore
And chase our gloom away,
With lustre shining more and more
Unto the perfect day;
Spirit of truth, be Thou
In life and death our Guide,
O spirit of adoption, now
May we be sanctified.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹmi imọlẹ, wa
Le okunkun jade,
Siwaju ni ki 'mọlẹ tan
Titi d'ọsan gangan,
Ẹmi otitọ, wa
Samọna wa titi;
Ẹmi isọdọmọ, si wa
S'ọkan wadi mimọ.

title.english: Lord, In Thy Presence We Are Met

verses.english:
Lord, in Thy presence we are met,
A full salvation to proclaim,
To testify of grace received,
Or offered now in Jesus' Name;
Dear Lord, to Thee our spirit cry,
Our ever longing satisfy.

We ask Thee, Lord-for Thou art here,
Make this a Pentecostal hour,
When hung'ring souls from Thee
Pardon, or purity, or pow'r
Unstop deaf ears, let blind eyes see,
Bring souls into Thy liberty.
verses.yoruba:
Awa mbẹ Ọ, lakoko yi
F'agbara Pẹntikọsti han;
'Gbati awọn ti ongbẹ ngbẹ
Ri 'dariji on 'wẹnumọ,
La oju awọn afọju
Si eti awọn to di 'ti.

verses.english:
Thou knowest sin-sick souls are here
Sick with depravity within,
Restless, discouraged, wearied, ones
And Thou art here to cleanse from sin;
Oh! Speak the word 'I will, whole'
And save and sanctify each soul.
verses.yoruba:
Awọn ti ẹru ẹsẹ npa
Mbẹ nihin lati gba 'wosan;
Gbogbo awọn ta npọn loju
Lo wa fun idasilẹ wọn,
Sọrọ 'wosan ki gbogbo wọn
Le gba iwẹnumọ ọkan.

verses.english:
Grant to Thy servants boldness now
That faithfully they speak thy word,
By stretching forth Thy hand to heal
Let signs and wonders from the Lord,
Here in our midst to-day be done,
So, Father, glorify Thy Son.
verses.yoruba:
F'igboya f'awọn 'ranse Rẹ
Ki wọn wasu tọkantọkan;
Na ọwọ Rẹ lati wosan
K'isẹ 'yanu se l'okọ Rẹ,
Kari agbara Rẹ loni,
Kale gbe oruko Rẹ ga.

Awa nduro bi O ti wi,
Jẹ ko ri fun wa b'ọrọ Rẹ,
K'aigbagbọ tab' igberaga
Mase dena agbara Rẹ,
Jọba ninu ọkan gbogbo,
Awa mbẹ Ọ, Ẹmi Mimọ.

title.english: There's A Stranger At The Door

verses.english:
There's a stranger at the door,
Let Him in;
He has been there oft before,
Let Him in;
Let Him in, ere He is gone,
Let Him in, the Holy One,
Jesus Christ the Father's son
Let Him in.

verses.yoruba:
Si ọkan rẹ paya fun,
Pe wọle,
B'o ba pe y'o pada lọ,
Pe wọle,
Pe wọle, ọrẹ rẹ ni;
Yo dabobo ọkan rẹ,
Yo pa ọmọ de opin;
Pe wọle.

verses.english:
Hear you now His loving voice?
Let Him in;
Now, oh, now make Him your choice
Let Him in;
He is standing at your door,
Joy to you He will restore,
And His name you will adore,
Let Him in.
verses.yoruba:
O ko ha gbọ hun Rẹ,
Pe wọle,
Se l'ayanfẹ rẹ loni,
Pe wọle,
O duro l'ẹhin 'lẹkun
Yio fun ọ ni ayọ,
'Wo o yin orukọ Rẹ,
Pe wọle.

verses.english:
Now admit the heavenly Guest,
Let Him in;
He will make for you a feast,
Let Him in;
He will speak your sins forgiven,
And when earth ties all are riven,
He will take you home to heaven,
Let Him in.
verses.yoruba:
Pe alejo na wọle,
Pe wọle,
Yio se ase fun ọ,
Pe wọle,
Y'o dari ẹsẹ ji ọ,
'Gbati ipinya ba de,
Y'o mu o dele ọrun,
Pe wọle.

title.english: When The Power Of God Descended

verses.english:
When the pow'r of God descended
On the day of Pentecost,
All the days of waiting ended,
They received the Holy Ghost.
verses.yoruba:
Gbat'agbara Ọlọrun dé,
Li ọjọ pentikosti,
Sa if'oju s'ọna pari,
'Tori wọn rí Ẹmi gba.

verses.english:
Tongues of flame came down upon them
And they preached the word in pow'r,
List'ning multitudes awaken'd,
Turned to God that very hour.
verses.yoruba:
Ela 'han ina ba le wọn
Wọn sì wasu ọrọ na,
Ọpọlọpọ èèyàn gbagbọ,
Wọn yipada s'Ọlọrun.

verses.english:
We are waiting Holy Spirit,
We are all of one accord,
Lord fulfil just now the promise,
That is given in Thy Word.
verses.yoruba:
Anw'ọna fun Ẹni Mimọ
Gbogbo wa f'ohun sọkan,
Mu 'leri na ṣẹ, Olúwa,
Ti a ṣe nin' ọrọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
Fill and thrill us with thy presence,
Grant the blessing that we need
Flood our souls with wondrous glory
While the pray'r of faith we plead.
verses.yoruba:
Jọ, fi agbára Rẹ kun wa,
Fún wa ni' bukun ta nfẹ;
Fi ogo rẹ kun ọkan wa,
Ba ti nfi gbagbọ bẹbẹ.

chorus.english:
O Lord, send the pow'r just now,
O Lord, send the pow'r just now,
O Lord, send the pow'r just now,
And baptize, every one.
chorus.yoruba:
Ran agbára, Oluwa,
Ran agbára, Oluwa,
Ran agbára, Oluwa,
Ki O sí baptis' wa.

title.english: Spirit Divine, Attend Our Prayers

verses.english:
Spirit divine, attend our prayers,
And make this house Thy home;
Descend with all Thy gracious pow'rs
O come, great Spirit come!
verses.yoruba:
Ẹmi ọrun, gb'adura wa,
Wa gbe 'nu ile yi;
Sọkalẹ pelu agbara Rẹ,
Wa, Ẹmi Mimọ, wa.

verses.english:
Come as the light: to us reveal
Our emptiness and woe;
And lead us in those paths of life
Where all the righteous go.
verses.yoruba:
Wa bi 'mọlẹ si fihan wa
B'aini wa ti pọ to;
Wa tọ wa si ọna iye
Ti olododo nrin.

verses.english:
Come as the fire, and purge our hearts,
Like sacrificial flame;
Let our whole soul an offering be
To our Redeemer's name.
verses.yoruba:
Wa, bi ina ẹbọ mimọ,
S'ọkan wadi mimọ,
Jẹ ki ọkan wa je ọrẹ
F'orukọ Oluwa.

verses.english:
Come as the dew, and sweetly bless
This consecrated hour;
May barrenness rejoice to own
Thy fertilizing pow'r.
verses.yoruba:
Wa, bi iri, si wa bukun
Akoko mimọ yi,
Ki ọkan alaileso wa
Le yọ l'agbara Rẹ.

verses.english:
Come as the dove, and spread Thy wings,
The wings of peaceful love;
And let Thy Church on earth become
Blest as the Church above.
verses.yoruba:
Wa, bi adaba, n'apa Rẹ,
Apa ifẹ mimọ,
Wa, jẹ ki Ijọ Rẹ l'aye
Dabi Ijọ t'ọrun.

Ẹmi ọrun, gb'adura wa,
S'aye yi d'ile Rẹ;
Sokalẹ pẹl' agbara Rẹ,
Wa, Ẹmi Mimọ wa.

title.english: Come, Holy Ghost, Our Hearts Inspire

verses.english:
Come, Holy Ghost, our hearts inspire
Let us Thine influence prove,
Source of the old prophetic fire,
Fountain of light and love.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹmi Mimọ, mi s'ọkan wa,
Ka mọ agbara Rẹ;
Orisun Ẹmi 'sọtẹle,
T'imọlẹ at'ifẹ.

verses.english:
Come, Holy Ghost, for moved by Thee,
The prophets wrote and spoke
Unlock the truth, Thyself the key,
Unseal the sacred Book.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹmi Mimọ l'agbara Rẹ
L'awọn Woli sisẹ;
Iwọ lo nfi otọ han wa,
Ninu iwe mimọ.

verses.english:
Expand Thy wings, celestial Dove,
Brood o'er our nature's night;
On our disordered spirits move,
And let there now be light.
verses.yoruba:
Adaba ọrun, na 'yẹ Rẹ,
Bo okun ẹda wa:
Jẹki 'mọlẹ Rẹ tan sori,
Ẹmi aisotọ wa.

verses.english:
God, through Himself, we then shall know,
If Thou within us shine,
And sound, with all Thy saints below
The depths of love divine.
verses.yoruba:
A o mọ, Ọlọrun daju,
B'Iwọ ba mbẹ n'nu wa,
Ao mọ 'jinlẹ ifẹ mimọ
Pẹlu awọn Tirẹ.

title.english: Come Holy Ghost Descend From High

verses.english:
Come holy ghost descend from high
Baptizer of our spirits Thou,
The sacramental seal apply,
And witness with the water now.
verses.yoruba:
Wa Ẹmi Mimọ sọkalẹ,
Oni baptisi ọkan wa;
M'edidi majẹmu Rẹ wa,
K'o si se ẹri omi yi.

verses.english:
Pour faith thy energy divine,
And sprinkle the atoning blood,
May Father, Son and Spirit join,
To seal this child, a child of God.
verses.yoruba:
Tu agbara nla Rẹ jade,
K'O si wọn ẹjẹ etutu;
Ki Baba, Ọmọ at' Ẹmi,
S'awọn yi d'ọmọ Ọlọrun.

title.english: Hear The Voice From Heaven Saying

verses.english:
Hear the voice from heaven saying,
To Jesus, in River Jordan,
A witness is to all the world,
This is my own beloved Son.
verses.yoruba:
Gbo hun t'o dun lat'oke
Si Jesu l'odo Jọrdani,
Ẹri fun gbogbo araye,
'Eyi l'ayanfẹ Ọmọ Mi'.

verses.english:
Without sin is He and perfect,
But to fulfil all righteousness,
Of baptism in the water,
He made Himself an example.
verses.yoruba:
Alailẹsẹ, Ẹni pipe,
Sugbọn nitori a pasẹ
Iwẹnumọ ninu odo,
O f'ara Rẹ se apẹrẹ.

verses.english:
Son of the Father's own bosom,
Is Salvation for all mankind,
The source of life for the sinner,
Jordan, brought near to Calvary.
verses.yoruba:
Ọmọ ọkan aya Baba,
Igbala fun gbogbo ẹda,
Orisun iye ẹlẹsẹ,
Jọrdani t'oke Kalfari.

verses.english:
Come, thou, follow now thy Saviour,
Obey the command, be baptized,
Example of death with Jesus,
And the resurrection with Him.
verses.yoruba:
Wa, tẹle Olugbala rẹ,
Ninu asẹ ilọ s'odo,
Apẹre iba Jesu ku,
Ati ajinde pẹlu Rẹ.

verses.english:
Come, do not be curious to know,
A secret which the Lord would keep,
Put obedience first and at last,
The result will then be revealed.
verses.yoruba:
Wa, ma tan idi asiri
To wu Oluwa lati bo,
F'igbọran saju; nikẹhin
Ere rẹ y'o fi ara han.

title.english: I Am So Glad That Our Father In
title.yoruba: Mo Yọ Pupọ Pe Baba Wa ọrun

verses.yoruba:
Mo yọ pupọ pe Baba wa ọrun
Sọ t'ifẹ Rẹ ninu 'we t'O fun mi,
Mo r'ohun 'yanu ninu Bibeli,
Eyi s'ọwọn ju pe, Jesu fẹ mi.

verses.english:
Though I forget Him, and wander away,
Still He doth love me wherever I stray;
Back to His dear loving arms do I flee,
When I remember that Jesus loves me.
verses.yoruba:
'Gba mo gbagbe Rẹ, ti emi sa lọ,
O fẹ mi sibẹ, O wa mi kiri;
Mo yara pada s'apa anu Rẹ,
'Gbati mo ranti pe Jesu fẹ mi.

verses.english:
Oh, if there's only one song I can sing,
When in His beauty I see the great king,
This shall my song in eternity be,
Oh, what a wonder that Jesus loves me!
verses.yoruba:
Bi o se orin kan l'emi le kọ,
'Gba mo r'Ọba la ninu ẹwa Rẹ;
Eyi ni yo ma j'orin mi titi,
A! iyanu ni pe, Jesu fẹ mi.

Jesu fe mi, mo si mọ pe mo f'Ẹ,
Ifẹ lo mu wa r'ọkan mi pada,
Ifẹ lo m'U k'o ku l'ori igi,
O da mi loju pe, Jesu fẹ mi.

verses.english:
If one should ask of me, how can I tell?
Glory to Jesus, I know very well!
God's Holy Spirit with mine doth agree.
Constantly witnessing-Jesus loves me.
verses.yoruba:
Emi o ti se dahun b'a bi mi
Ohun ti ogo Oluwa mi jẹ?
Ẹmi mimọ njẹri nin' ọkan mi,
Ni igba gbogbo pe, Jesu fẹ mi.

verses.english:
In this assurance I find sweetest rest,
Trusting in Jesus, I know I am blest,
Satan, dismayed, from my soul now doth flee,
When I just tell him that Jesus loves me.
verses.yoruba:
Ni 'gbẹkẹle yi ni mo r'isimi,
Ni 'gbẹkẹle Krist' mo d'alabukun,
Satan damu sa kuro l'ọkan mi,
Nigba mo sọ fun pe, Jesu fẹ mi.

chorus.english:
I am so glad that Jesus loves me,
Jesus loves me, Jesus loves me,
I am so glad that Jesus loves me,
Jesus loves even me.
chorus.yoruba:
Mo yọ pupọ pe Jesu fẹ mi,
Jesu fẹ mi, Jesu fẹ mi,
Mo yọ pupọ pe Jesu fẹ mi,
Jesu fẹ an'emi.

title.english: Jesus, We Lift Our Souls To Thee

verses.yoruba:
Jesu, Iwo l'a gb'ohun si,
Mi Ẹmi Mimo Rẹ,
Si awọn eniyan wọnyi,
Baptis' wọn s'iku Rẹ.

K'O fi agbara Rẹ fun wọn,
Fun wọn l'ọkan titun;
Kọ 'rukọ Rẹ si aya wọn,
Fi Ẹmi Rẹ kun wọn.

verses.english:
Thy faithful servants let them prove,
Girded with truth divine;
Be sharers in Thy dying love,
And followers of Thine.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹki wọn ja bi ajagun,
L'abẹ opagun Rẹ;
Mu wọn f'otitọ d'amure,
Ki wọn rin l'ọna Rẹ.

verses.english:
Lord, plant us all into Thy death,
That we Thy life may prove;
Partakers of Thy cross beneath,
And of Thy crown above.
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa, gbin wa s'iku Rẹ,
K'a jogun iye Rẹ;
L'aye, ka ru agbelebu,
K'a ni ade ọrun.

title.english: See These Ones In White Apparel

verses.english:
See these ones in white apparel,
Standing by the river's brink,
Their backs turned to the world and sin,
And waiting to be baptized,
And expecting,
To fulfil the Lord's command.
verses.yoruba:
Wo, awọn t'o wọ 'sọ ala,
Wọn duro leti odo,
Wọn k'ẹyin s'aye at'ẹsẹ,
Wọn ntele Atẹbọmi;
Wọn si nreti,
Lati se asẹ Jesu.

verses.english:
Behold, how they stand there in fear
But they not of hope bereft,
They know that their blessed Saviour
Commanded their immersion,
Jordan is cold,
But their faith is waxing hot.
verses.yoruba:
Wo bi wọn ti duro l'ẹru,
Sugbọn pẹlu ireti,
Wọn mọ pe Olugbala wọn
L'O pase odo lilo,
Jọrdan' tutu,
Sugbọn igbagbọ gbona.

verses.english:
Behold and see, other brethren,
Their elders in Jesus Christ,
Stretch out hands of love to help them,
They have been like them before,
At this moment,
They rejoice in pard'ning grace.
verses.yoruba:
Si wo awọn arakunrin,
Egbọn wọn ninu Jesu,
Wo bi wọn ti na 'wọ ifẹ,
Wọn sa ti dabi wọn ri,
Nisisiyi,
Wọn ny'ayọ idariji.

verses.english:
Go, follow your Saviour and Lord,
Behold with the eye of faith,
The heavens open: God's spirit
Loudly saying from heaven
'These disciples,
Are my beloved children'.

title.english: Stand, Soldier Of The Cross

verses.english:
Stand, soldier of the cross,
Thy high allegiance claim,
And vow to hold the world but loss
For Thy Redeemer's name.
verses.yoruba:
Duro, ọm'ogun Krist'
F'ẹnu rẹ so f'aye,
Si jẹjẹ pe, ofo l'aye
Nitori Jesu rẹ.

verses.english:
Arise, and be baptized,
And wash thy sins away;
Thy league with God be solemnized,
Thy faith avouch'd today.
verses.yoruba:
Dide, ka baptis' rẹ,
Ko wẹ ẹsẹ rẹ nu,
Wa b'Ọlọrun da majẹmu,
Jẹwọ igbagbọ rẹ.

verses.english:
No more thine own, but Christ's
With all the saints of old,
Apostles, Seers, Evangelists,
And martyr throngs enthralled.
verses.yoruba:
'Wo ki se t'ara rẹ,
Bikose ti Kristi;
A ko orukọ rẹ pọ mọ
T'awọn mimọ 'gbani.

verses.english:
In God's whole armour strong,
Front hell's embattled pow'rs,
The warfare may be sharp and long
The vict'ry must be ours.
verses.yoruba:
Ni 'hamọra Jesu
Kọjuja si esu;
Bo ti wu k'ogun na le to
Awa ni yo sẹgun.

verses.english:
Oh, bright the conqu'ror's crown,
The song of triumph sweet,
When faith casts every trophy down,
At our great Captain's feet.
verses.yoruba:
Ade didara ni,
Orin na, didun ni;
'Gba ta ba ko ikogun jọ
S'ẹsẹ Olugbala.

title.english: The Voice That Sound In Desert

verses.english:
The voice that sound in desert
Its the voice of watchman
Hark as the voice now calling
Calling for repentance
The voice as it was Sounding
Art thou not now concern'd
And why, O brothers, sisters
Do you feel unconcern'd.
verses.yoruba:
Ohun ti dun l'aginju,
Ohun alore ni,
Gbọ b'o ti ndun rara pe,
'Ẹ ronupiwada'
Ohun na ko ha dun to?
Ipe na ko ha kan ọ?,
Kilo se, arakunrin,
Ti o ko fi mira?

verses.english:
The Kingdom is now at hand
The Kingdom of our Lord
And those that wash their garments
Shall sit on royal throne
Why do you feel unconcern'd?
To the voice of watchman?
Which sound new to thee clearly
Seeking for repentance.
verses.yoruba:
'Ijọba ku si dẹdẹ'
Ijọba Ọlọrun,
Awọn t'o ti fọ'sọ wọn
Nikan ni yio gunwa
Ese t'o ko fi nani
Ohun lore yi,
Ti dun l'eti rẹ tantan Pe,
'Ronupiwada?'

verses.english:
The Abner and pharpar stream
They may be clean water
But the command of cleanses is in river Jordan,
Throw all thy thoughts to one side,
And do the will of God
Now descend into this stream
And wash and be thou clean.
verses.yoruba:
Abana pẹlu Farpar;
Le jẹ odo mimọ,
Sugbọn asẹ 'wẹnumọ,
Jọrdan' nikan l'o ni;
Ju ero rẹ s'apakan,
Se asẹ Oluwa,
Wa sinu adagun yi,
We, k'o si di mimọ.

verses.english:
What's now keeping you waiting?
What can be your excuse?
Behold the stream and Thy John
All things are now ready
You have argued for long time
Will you die with spirit?
Sinners hear the watchman's voice
And come to repentance.
verses.yoruba:
Ki niba da o duro?
Awawi kan ko si;
Wo 'do, wo Johannu rẹ,
Ohun gbogbo setan;
O pẹ ti o ti njiyan,
O ha ba Ẹmi ku?
Ẹlẹsẹ, gbọ alore,
Si ronupiwada.

title.english: We are baptized unto His death

verses.english:
We are baptized unto His death
By water baptism
And we go down into the grave
Buried with Jesus Christ.
verses.yoruba:
A baptis' wa sinu iku,
Nipa itẹbọ 'mi;
A sin wa 'nu 'boji Jesu,
A sin wa pẹlu Rẹ.

verses.english:
Buried with Christ to sin no more
That we may rise with Him
That we may partake of new grace
That fits us for the skies.
verses.yoruba:
A ba Krist' ku k'a ba ye sẹ
K'a le ji pẹlu Rẹ,
K'a le jere ẹbun titun
T'y'o mu wa yẹ f'oke.

verses.english:
O Holy Ghost, come unto us
That all our words may be
The hope of His soon appearing
And Christ's revelation.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹmi, fi ara Rẹ fun wa;
K'ọrọ wa ko le jẹ
Ireti Oluwa l'oke
At' ifarahan Krist'.

verses.english:
Lord, let our faith be glorified,
Our joy and crown fulfil
To live a life of heav'n on earth.
On high, to reign with Thee.
verses.yoruba:
Fun igbagbọ wa li ogo,
Ayọ ati ade,
Lat' aye k'a le wa l'oke
K'a joko pelu Krist'.

title.english: While Passing Through This World
title.yoruba: To Ba Kọja L'aye Ẹsẹ Yi

verses.english:
While passing through this world of sin,
And others your life shall view;
Be clean and pure without within,
Let others see Jesus in you.
verses.yoruba:
To ba kọja laye ẹsẹ yi,
Ti wọn wo 'gbe aye rẹ,
Jẹ mimọ ninu at'ode,
Jẹ kari Jesu lara rẹ.

verses.english:
Your life a book before their eyes,
They're reading it thro' and thro'
Say, does it point them to the skies,
Do others see Jesus in you.
verses.yoruba:
B'iwe ni gbe aye rẹ jẹ,
Ti wọn nka ni gbogbo igba;
Se o ntọ wọn sọna iye,
Se wọn ri Jesu lara rẹ

verses.english:
What joy it will be at set of sun,
In mansions beyond the blue,
To find some souls that you have won,
Let others see Jesus in you.
verses.yoruba:
Ayọ ni nigba oorun wọ,
Ninu ile la loke,
Lati ri awọn to gbala,
Jẹ kari Jesu lara rẹ.

verses.english:
Then live for Christ both day and night,
Be faithful, be brave and true,
And lead the lost to life and light,
Let others see Jesus in you.
verses.yoruba:
Ma sin Jesu lọsan loru,
Jolotitọ si nigboya,
Ma sako wa sinu mọlẹ,
Jẹ kari Jesu lara rẹ.

chorus.english:
Let others see Jesus in you,
Let others see Jesus in you,
Keep telling the story be faithful and true,
Let others see Jesus in you.
chorus.yoruba:
Jẹ kari Jesu lara rẹ,
Jẹ kari Jesu lara rẹ;
Rohin, jolododo at'olotitọ,
Jẹ kari Jesu lara rẹ.

title.english: Standing On The Promises Of God

verses.english:
Standing on the promises of God my King,
Thro' eternal ages let His praises
Standing on the promises of God.
verses.yoruba:
Duro lori ileri Jesu Ọba,
Eni ti a o ma yin titi laelae,
Emi yo ma kọrin ogo Ọlọrun,
Duro lori 'leri Ọlọrun.

verses.english:
Standing on the promises that cannot fall,
When the howling storms of doubt and fears assail,
By the living word of God I shall prevail.
Standing on the promises of God.
verses.yoruba:
Duro lori ileri ti ko ni yẹ,
Nigba ti iji aye ba mi lẹru,
Ọrọ Ọlọrun ye, yo mu mi bori,
Duro lori 'leri Ọlọrun.

verses.english:
Standing on the promises of Christ the Lord,
Bound to Him eternally by love's strong cord,
Overcoming daily with the Spirit's sword,
Standing on the promises of God.
verses.yoruba:
Duro lori ileri Jesu Ọba,
Titi ayeraye lo fifẹ Rẹ han,
Ida ẹmi mu ka bori lojojumọ,
Duro lori 'leri Ọlọrun.

verses.english:
Standing on the promises I cannot fall
Listening every moment to the Spirit's call,
Resting in my Saviour as my all in all
Standing on the promises of God.
verses.yoruba:
Mo duro lori 'leri nko ni subu,
Tẹti si hun ipe Ẹmi Mimọ,
Gbẹkẹl' Olugbala to le sohun gbogbo,
Duro lori 'leri Ọlọrun.

chorus.english:
Stan-dig, stan-ding,
Standing on the promises of God my Saviour,
Stan-ding, stan-ding,
I'm standing on the promises of God.
chorus.yoruba:
Duro lori ileri, duro lori ileri
Duro lori ileri, Jesu Olugbala,
Duro lori ileri, duro lori ileri
Mo duro lori 'leri Ọlọrun.

title.english: Give Your Best To The Master

verses.english:
Give of your best to the Master,
Give of the strength of your youth,
Throw your soul's fresh, glowing adore,
Into the battle for truth,
Jesus has set the example,
Dauntless was He, young and brave
Give Him your loyal devotion,
Give him the best that you have.
verses.yoruba:
Sa ipa rẹ f'Olugbala,
Nigba to wa lomọde,
Nigbona ọkan ni tara,
Ja ija otitọ naa,
Jesu ti se ipinlẹsẹ,
Ni kekere lo gboya,
Safi gbogbo ọkan rẹ fun,
Fun lohun to dara ju.

verses.english:
Give of your best to the Master,
Give Him first place in your heart,
Give Him first place in your service,
Con-se crate ev-'ry part,
Give and to you shall be given,
God His beloved son gave,
Gratefully seeking to serve Him,
Give Him the best that you have.
verses.yoruba:
Sa ipa rẹ f'Olugbala,
Ko jakọkọ lọkan rẹ,
Ko ja kọkọ ni sinsin rẹ,
Ya gbogbo rẹ si mimọ,
Fun, a o si fi fun ọ naa,
O fayanfe rẹ fun ọ,
Wa, ko sin in pẹlu ọpẹ,
Fun lohun to dara ju.

verses.english:
Give of your best to the Master,
Naught else is worthy His love,
He gave himself for your ransom
Gave up His glory above,
Laid down His life without murmur,
You from sin's ruin to save,
Give Him your heart's adoration
Give Him the best that you have.
verses.yoruba:
Sa ipa rẹ f'Olugbala,
Ko safiwe ifẹ Rẹ,
Oun ni o ra ọ pada,
To file ogo silẹ,
O fẹmi rẹ le 'lẹ laikun
Lati gba 'wo ẹlẹsẹ,
Ni tara fun nin' ọkan rẹ,
Fun lohun to dara ju.

chorus.english:
Give of your best to the Master,
Give of the strength of your youth,
Clad in salvation full armour,
Join in the battle for truth.
chorus.yoruba:
Sa ipa rẹ f'Olugbala,
Nigba to wa lọmọde,
Gbe hamọra iye naa wọ,
Ja ija otitọ naa.

title.english: When You Start For The Land

verses.english:
When you start for the land of heavenly rest,
Keep close to Jesus all the way;
For He is the Guide, and He knows the way best,
Keep close to Jesus all the way.
verses.yoruba:
'Gbati o ba nlọ s'ilẹ 'simi ọrun,
Sunmọ Jesu titi d'opin;
'Tori Oun ni Olutọ t'O m'ọna ju,
Sunmọ Jesu titi d'opin.

verses.english:
Never mind the storms or trials as you go,
Keep close to Jesus all the way;
Tis a comfort and joy His favour to know,
Keep close to Jesus all the way.
verses.yoruba:
Mase ronu wahala at'ipọnju,
Sunmọ Jesu titi d'opin,
O dara lati ri ojurere Rẹ,
Sunmọ Jesu titi d'opin.

verses.english:
To be safe from the darts of the evil one,
Keep close to Jesus all the way;
Take the shield of faith till the victory is own,
Keep close to Jesus all the way.
verses.yoruba:
Ki o ba le bọ lọwọ ofa esu,
Sunmọ Jesu titi d'opin;
Gbe apata igbagbọ fun iṣẹgun,
Sumo Jesu titi d'opin.

Awa y'o dele wa orun nigbose,
Sunmọ Jesu titi d'opin;
Nibiti a ki wipe 'odigbose'
Sunmọ Jesu titi d'opin.

chorus.english:
Keep close to Jesus, keep close to Jesus,
Keep close to Jesus all the way,
By day or by night never turn from the right,
Keep close to Jesus all the way.
chorus.yoruba:
Fara mọ Jesu, Fara mọ Jesu,
Sunmọ Jesu titi d'opin;
Lọsan tabi l'oru mase ya kuro,
Sunmọ Jesu titi d'opin.

title.english: Stand Up, Stand Up For Jesus

verses.english:
Stand up, stand up for Jesus!
Ye soldiers of the Cross;
Lift high His royal banner,
It must not suffer loss,
From vict'ry unto vict'ry
His army shall He lead.
Till every foe is vanquished
And Christ is Lord indeed.
verses.yoruba:
Duro, duro fun Jesu,
Ẹyin Ọm'ogun Krist'
Gbe asia Rẹ s'oke
A ko gbọdọ fẹ ku
Lat' iṣẹgun de 'sẹgun
Ni y'o tọ ogun Rẹ;
Tit' ao ṣẹgun gbogb' ọta
Ti Krist' y'o j'Oluwa.

verses.english:
Stand up, stand up for Jesus!
The trumpet-call obey;
Forth to the mighty conflict
In this His glorious day!
Ye that are men, now serve Him
Against unnumbered foes;
Let courage rise with danger,
And strength to strength oppose.
verses.yoruba:
Duro, duro fun Jesu,
F'eti s'ohun ipe
Jade lọ s'oju ija
Loni ọjọ nla Rẹ;
Ẹyin akin ti nja fun
Larin ainiye ọta,
N'nu ewu ẹni 'gboya,
Ẹ kọju 'ja s'ọta.

verses.english:
Stand up, stand up for Jesus!
Stand in His strength alone,
The arm of flesh will fail you;
Ye dare not trust your own;
Put on the Christian's armour,
And watching unto prayer,
Where duty calls, or danger,
Be never wanting there.
verses.yoruba:
Duro, duro fun Jesu,
Duro l'agbara Rẹ;
Ipa eniyan ko to,
Ma gbẹkẹle tirẹ,
Di 'hamora 'hinrere,
Ma s'ọna, ma gbadura,
B'ise tab' ewu ba pe,
Mase alaide 'bẹ.

verses.english:
Stand up, stand up for Jesus!
The strife will not be long;
This day the noise of battle,
The next the victor's song
To him that overcometh
A crown of life shall be;
He with the King of Glory
Shall reign eternally.
verses.yoruba:
Duro, duro fun Jesu,
Ija na ki y'o pẹ;
Oni, ariwo  ogun,
Ọla orin 'ṣẹgun!
Ọni t'o ba si ṣẹgun!
Y'o gba ade iye,
Y'o ma ba Ọba ogo
J'ọba titi laelae.

title.english: Oft In Sorrow, Oft In Woe

verses.english:
Oft in sorrow, oft in woe,
Onward Christians, onward go!
Fight the fight, maintain the strife
Strengthened with the Bread of life.
verses.yoruba:
Laarin ewu atosi,
Kristian maa tẹ siwaju,
Rọju duro ja 'ja naa.
K'ounjẹ 'ye fu ọ lokun.

verses.english:
Onward, Christians, onward go!
Join the war and face the foe,
Will ye flee in danger hour!
Know ye not your captain's power?
verses.yoruba:
Kristian maa tẹ siwaju,
Ẹ o ha sa fun ọta?
Ẹ o ha bẹru ibi?
Se o mọyi Balogun yin?

verses.english:
Let you dropping hearts be glad,
March in heavenly armour clad,
Fight, nor think the battle long,
Soon shall victory tune your song.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹ ki ọkan yin ko yọ,
Mu 'hamọra ọrun wọ,
Ja, ma ro pe ogun npẹ
Iṣẹgun yin fẹrẹ de.

verses.english:
Let not sorrow dim your eyes,
Soon shall every tear be dried?
Let not tears your course impede,
Great your strength, if great your need.
verses.yoruba:
Ma jẹ kinu yin bajẹ,
Oun fẹ n'omije yin nu,
Mase jẹ kẹru ba yin,
B'aini yin, lagbara yin.

verses.english:
Onward then to glory move,
More than conquerors ye shall prove
Through opposed by many a foe,
Christian soldiers, onward go!
verses.yoruba:
Njẹ ẹ maa tẹ siwaju,
Ẹ o ju aṣẹgun lọ,
B'ọpọta doju kọ yin,
Kristian, ẹ tẹsiwaju.

title.english: I Have Decided To Follow Jesus
title.yoruba: Mo Ti Ṣe 'Leri, N'o Tẹle Jesu

verses.english:
I have decided to follow Jesus
I have decided to follow Jesus
I have decided to follow Jesus
No turning back, no turning back.
verses.yoruba:
Mo ti ṣe 'leri, n'o tẹle Jesu,
Mo ti ṣe 'leri, n'o tẹle Jesu,
Mo ti ṣe 'leri, n'o tẹle Jesu,
Nko ni pada, nko ni pada.

verses.english:
If no one joins me, still I will follow,
If no one joins me, still I will follow
If no one joins me, still I will follow
No turning back, no turning back.
verses.yoruba:
Mo ti ṣe 'leri, n'o tẹle Jesu,
Mo ti ṣe 'leri, n'o tẹle Jesu,
Mo ti ṣe 'leri, n'o tẹle Jesu,
Nko ni pada, nko ni pada.

verses.english:
The world behind me, the cross before me,
The world behind me, the cross before me,
The world behind me, the cross before me,
No turning back, no turning back.
verses.yoruba:
N'o kaye silẹ, n'o tẹle Jesu,
N'o kaye silẹ, n'o tẹle Jesu,
N'o kaye silẹ, n'o tẹle Jesu,
Nko ni pada, nko ni pada.

title.english: Ho, Reapers In The Whitened Harvest

verses.english:
Ho, reapers in the whitened harvest
Oft, feeble, faint, and few,
Come, wait upon the blessed Master
Our strength He will renew.
verses.yoruba:
Eyin olukore nin' oko,
T'arẹ fẹrẹ mu tan,
Ẹ roju duro de Oluwa,
Y'o s'agbara d'ọtun.

verses.english:
Two oft a weary and discouraged,
We pour a sad complaint;
Believing in a living Saviour,
Why should we ever faint?
verses.yoruba:
Nigba arẹ ati 'rẹwẹsi,
A ngb'ọkan wa si Ọ;
Lẹyin t'a gba Olugbala gbọ,
Ki l'a o tun beru.

verses.english:
Rejoice! for He is with us always,
Lo, even to the end!
Look up! take courage and go forward,
All needed grace He'll send!
verses.yoruba:
Ẹyọ! O mba wa gbe l'ọjọjọ,
Ani titi d'opin;
Woke! Ẹ si ma tẹsiwaju,
Y'o fun nyin l'agbara.

chorus.yoruba:
Awọn t'o duro d'Oluwa,
Y'o s'agbara wọn d'ọtun,
Wọn o fi iye fọ,
Wọn o fi iye fọ bi idi,
Wọn o sa, wọn ki y'o karẹ,
Wọn o rin, ki y'o rẹ wọn,
Wọn o sa, wọn ki y'o karẹ,
Wọn o rin, ki y'o rẹ wọn,
Wọn o sa, wọn ki y'o karẹ,
Y'o rin, k'y'o rẹ wọn.

title.english: Jesus, I Will Trust Thee
title.yoruba: Jesu, Emi O Fi Kan Mi Fun Ọ

verses.yoruba:
Jesu, emi o fi kan mi fun Ọ,
Mo jẹbi mo gbe, sugbọn 'Wọ le gba mi
L'aye ati l'ọrun ko s'ẹni bi Rẹ,
Iwọ ku f'ẹlẹsẹ, f'emi na pẹlu.

verses.english:
Jesus, I may trust Thee, name of match-less worth,
Spoken by the angel at Thy wondrous birth:
Written, and forever, on Thy cross of shame,
Sinners read and worship, trusting in that name.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu, mo le simi le orukọ Rẹ,
Ti angẹli wa sọ, lọjọ Ibi Rẹ,
Eyi t'a kọ t'o han lor' agbelebu,
Ti ẹlẹsẹ si ka, wọn si tẹriba.

verses.english:
Jesus, I must trust Thee, pondering Thy ways,
Full of love and mercy all Thine earthly days;
Sinners gather'd round Thee, lepers sought Thy face,
None too vile or loathsome for a Saviour's grace.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu, emi ko le sai gbẹkẹle Ọ,
Iṣẹ Rẹ l'aye kun f'anu at'ifẹ,
Ẹlẹsẹ yi Ọ ka, adete ri Ọ,
Ko s'ẹni buruju, ti 'Wọ kole gba.

verses.english:
Jesus, I can trust Thee, trust Thy written word,
Though Thy voice of pity I have never heard,
When Thy Spirit teacheth, to my taste how sweet,
Only may I hearken, sitting at Thy feet.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu, mo le gbẹkẹ mi le ọrọ Rẹ,
Bi nko tilẹ gbo ohun anu Rẹ ri,
'Gbat' Ẹmi Rẹ nko ni, o ti dun pọ tọ,
Ki nsa f'ara balẹ k'ẹkọ lẹsẹ Rẹ.

Jesu totọ-totọ mo gbẹkẹ le Ọ,
Ẹnikẹni t'o wa, 'Wọ ki o ta nu,
Otọ ni 'leri Rẹ, ọwọn l'ẹjẹ Rẹ,
Wọnyi ni gbala mi, 'Wọ l'Ọlọrun mi.

title.english: Who Is On The Lord Side

verses.english:
Who is on the Lord side?
Who will serve the King?
Who will be His helpers?
Other lives to bring?
Who will leave the world's side?
Who will face the foe?
Who is on the Lord's side?
Who for Him will go?
By the call of mercy.
verses.yoruba:
Ta ni jẹ t'Oluwa
To fe ṣiṣẹ fun?
Ta ni yo se ranwọ
Lati lo kede?
Ta ni yo wa sako,
Ti yo b'ọta ja?
Ta ni jẹ t'Oluwa
To fẹ ṣiṣẹ fun
Pẹlu ipe anu?

verses.english:
Not for weight of glory,
Not for crown and palm,
Enter we the army,
Raise the warrior-psalm,
But for love that claimeth
Lives for whom He died;
He whom Jesus nameth,
Must be on His side,
By thy love constraining.
verses.yoruba:
Ki se ogo aye
Tabi fadaka,
Awa ọmọ ogun
Ta nkọrin 'ṣẹgun,
Ifẹ lo wa wa ri,
Eyi lo nrọ wa,
Ẹni Jesu pe ko
Le sai wa 'dọ Rẹ,
Nipa ifẹ Rẹ nla.

verses.english:
Jesus, Thou hast bought us,
Not with gold or gem,
But with thine own life blood,
For Thy diadem;
With thy blessing filling,
Each who comes to Thee,
Thou hast made us willing,
Thou has made us free,
By thy grand redemption.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu 'wọ ti ra wa
Pẹlu ẹjẹ Rẹ
Kiṣe pẹlu wura
Ogo ni fun Ọ,
O nfi bukun Rẹ fa,
Wọn to tẹle Ọ,
Iwọ lo amu wa fẹ
Lati se 'fẹ Rẹ,
Nipa rapada nla.

verses.english:
Fierce may be the conflict,
Strong may be the foe,
But the king's own army-
None can overthrow,
Round His standard ranging
Victory is secure,
For His truth unchanging,
Makes the triumph sure,
Joyfully enlisting.
verses.yoruba:
B'ija tilẹ gbona,
Ti ọta nhalẹ,
Ko le bori ọmọ
Ogun ti Ọba,
Yika ọmọ ogun,
Iṣẹgun ti wa,
Otitọ lọna Rẹ,
Iṣẹgun daju,
Ninu ayọ nla naa.

chorus.english:
By thy grace divine,
We are on the Lord's side
Savior we are thine.
chorus.yoruba:
Nipa ore-ọfẹ,
Awa niha Oluwa,
Tirẹ lawa nṣe

title.english: It Is Glory Just To Walk With Him
title.yoruba: O Ti Dun To Lati Mọ Jesu

verses.english:
It is glory just to walk with Him whose blood has ran-somed me
 It is rapture for my soul each day,
It is joy divine to feel him near where'er my path may be,
Bless the Lord, it's glory all the way!
verses.yoruba:
O ti dun to lati mọ Jesu Ẹni t'O gba mi la,
'Jojumọ ọkan mi kun f'ayọ,
Ayọ ni lati ripe O mba mi lọ sibikibi,
'Jojumọ ogo ni f'Oluwa.

O ti dun to ki O wa nitosi nigba idanwo,
Ka sa gbagbọ ka si gbadura;
O ti dun to ki a ma gbe n'nu
Kristi nigbakugba,
Y'O ma fi ogo ọrun kun wa.

verses.english:
'Twill be glory when I walk with Him on heaven's golden shore,
Never from his side again to stray,
'Twill be glory, wondrous glory with the Saviour evermore,
Everlasting glory all the way!
verses.yoruba:
Y'o ti dun to lati pade Rẹ
l'ebute ogo na,
Awa yo pade l'aipinya mo;
Orin ogo, ogo, ogo la o ma kọ titi lae,
Ni ilu ologo ti Baba.

chorus.english:
It is glory just to walk with Him
It is glory just to walk with Him
He will guide my steps aright,
Through the vale and o'er the height,
It is glory just to walk with Him.
chorus.yoruba:
O ti dun to lati ma ba rin,
O ti dun to lati ma ba rin,
Y'O ma se amọna mi,
N'nu 'mọlẹ at'okunkun;
O ti dun to lati ma ba rin.

title.english: I Can Hear My Saviour Calling

verses.english:
I can hear my Saviour calling,
I can hear my Saviour calling,
I can hear my Saviour calling,
Take thy cross, and follow, follow me.
verses.yoruba:
Mo gbọ Olugbala mi npe,
Mo gbọ Olugbala mi npe;
Mo gbọ Olugbala mi npe,
'Gb'agbelebu rẹ si tẹ le mi'.

verses.english:
I'll go with Him thro' the garden,
I'll go with Him thro' the garden,
I'll go with Him thro' the garden,
I'll go with Him, with Him, all the way.
verses.yoruba:
Em'o ba kọja ọgba ni,
Em'o ba kọja ọgba ni,
Em'o ba kọja ọgba ni,
Em'o tẹle, tẹle titi lae.

verses.english:
I'll go with Him thro' the judgment,
I'll go with Him thro' the judgment,
I'll go with Him thro' the judgment,
I'll go with Him, with Him, all the way.
verses.yoruba:
Em'o ba kọja idajọ,
Em'o ba kọja idajọ,
Em'o ba kọja idajọ,
Emi o tẹle, tẹle titi lae.

verses.english:
He will give me grace and glory,
He will give me grace and glory,
He will give me grace and glory,
All go with me, with me, all the way.
verses.yoruba:
Y'o fun mi l'ore at'ogo,
Y'o fun mi l'ore at'ogo,
Y'o fun mi l'ore at'ogo,
Y'o jẹ t'emi, t'emi titi lae.

chorus.english:
Where He leads me I will follow,
Where He leads me I will follow,
Where He leads me I will follow,
I'll go with Him with Him, all the way.
chorus.yoruba:
Ọna t'O la l'emi o rin,
Ọna t'O la l'emi o rin,
Ọna t'O la l'emi o rin,
Em'o tẹle, tẹle titi lae.

title.english: O Weary Heart, There Is A Home

verses.english:
O weary heart, there is a home,
Beyond the reach of toil and care,
A home where changes never come,
Who would not fain be resting there?
verses.yoruba:
Ọkan arẹ ile kan mbẹ,
L'ọna jinjin s'aye ẹsẹ;
Ile t'ayida ko le de,
Tani ko fẹ simi nibẹ.

verses.english:
Yet when bowed down beneath the load,
By heaven allowed, thine earthly lot
Look up! Thou' it reach that blest abode,
Wait, meekly wait, and murmur not!
verses.yoruba:
Bi wahala bo o mọlẹ,
B'ipin rẹ l'aye ba buru,
W'oke s'ile ibukun na;
Sa rọju duro mase kun.

verses.english:
If in thy path some thorns are found
Oh, think who bore them on His brow,
If grief thy sorrowing heart has found,
It reached a holier than thou.
verses.yoruba:
Bi ẹgun ba wa l'ọna rẹ,
Ranti ori t'a f'ẹgun de;
B'ibanujẹ bo ọkan rẹ,
O ti ri bẹ f'Olugbala.

verses.english:
Toil on! Nor deem, though sore it be
One sigh unheard, one pray'r forgot;
The day of rest will dawn for thee,
Wait, meekly wait, and murmur not!

chorus.english:
Oh wait, meekly wait, and murmur not!
Oh wait, meekly wait, and murmur not,
Oh wait, oh wait, oh wait, and murmur not!
chorus.yoruba:
Duro, rọju duro, mase kun,
Duro, rọju duro, mase kun,
Duro, duro, sa rọju duro mase kun.

title.english: O God, My God, My All Thou Art

verses.english:
O God, my God, my all Thou art,
Ere shines the dawn of rising day,
Thy sovereign light within my heart,
Thy all-enlivening pow'r display.
verses.yoruba:
Ọlọrun mi 'wọ l'ẹmi mi!
Ki imọlẹ ọrọ t'o la;
F'agbara Rẹ han l'ọkan mi,
Ki O si mu mi l'ara ya.

verses.english:
For Thee my thirsty soul doth pant,
While in this desert land I live;
And hungry as I am, and faint,
Thy love alone can comfort give.
verses.yoruba:
Ongbe Rẹ l'o ngbẹ ọkan mi
N'ilẹ aginju gbigbẹ yi,
Ebi pa mi mo si daku,
'Fẹ Rẹ nikan lo le yo mi.

verses.english:
In a dry land, behold, I place
My whole desire on Thee, O Lord;
And more I joy to gain Thy grace,
Than all earth's treasures can afford.
verses.yoruba:
Iwọ nikan l'ọkan mi nfẹ,
N'ilẹ gbigbe yi, Ọlọrun;
Mo fẹ ni ore-ọfẹ Rẹ
Ju gbogbo ọrọ aye lọ.

verses.english:
More dear than life itself, Thy love
My heart and tongue shall still employ;
And to declare Thy praise will prove,
My peace, my glory, and my joy.
verses.yoruba:
Ifẹ Rẹ t'o sọwọn julọ,
Y' kun ọkan at'ahọn mi,
Ogo, ayọ alafia mi
Y'o je lati so yin Rẹ.

verses.english:
In blessing Thee, with grateful songs
My happy life shall glide away;
The praise that to Thy name belongs
Hourly with lifted hands I'll pay.
verses.yoruba:
Gbogbo aye mi ni un o ma
F'orin ọpẹ 'bukun fun Ọ;
Iyin t'o ye orukọ Rẹ
Ni uno ma gbe s'oke si Ọ.

verses.english:
Thy name, O God, upon my bed
Dwells on my lips, and fires my thought;
With trembling awe, in midnight Shade,
I muse on all Thy hand have wrought.
verses.yoruba:
Orukọ Rẹ wa l'ẹnu mi,
At' ero mi, lor'eni mi;
Mo nse asaro Iṣẹ Rẹ
Pẹlu 'wariri l'oganjọ.

verses.english:
In all I do I feel Thine aid;
Therefore Thy greatness will I sing,
O God, who bidd'st my heart be glad,
Beneath the shadow of Thy wing.
verses.yoruba:
Mo nri ọwọ Rẹ n'nu 'ṣẹ mi;
Njẹ uno kọrin titobi Rẹ,
Ọlọrun, 'wo t'O mu mi yọ
Labẹ ojiji iyẹ Rẹ.

Mo sun mo Ọ timọtimọ;
Agbara Rẹ y'o si gba mi
Lọw'aye at'ọrun egbe,
Igbala Rẹ ki tase lae.

title.english: Whither, Pilgrims Are You Going

verses.english:
Whither, pilgrims, are you going,
Going each with staff in hand?
We are going on a journey,
Going at our king's command,
Over hills and plains and valleys,
We are going to His palace,
We are going to His palace,
Going to the better land;
We are going to His palace,
Going to the better land.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹyin ero, nibo lẹ nlọ,
T'ẹyin t'ọpa l'ọwọ yin?
A nrin ajo mimọ kan lọ,
Nipa aṣẹ Ọba wa,
Lori oke on pẹtẹlẹ,
A nlọ s'afin Ọba rere,
A nlọ s'afin Ọba rere,
A nlọ s'ilẹ to dara,
A nlọ s'afin Ọba rere,
A nlọ s'ilẹ to dara.

verses.english:
Tell us, pilgrims, what you hope for
In that far-off, better land?
Spotless robes, and crowns of glory
From a Saviour's loving hand,
We shall drink of life's clear river,
We shall dwell with God for ever,
We shall dwell with God for ever,
In that bright, that better land
We shall dwell with God for ever,
In that bright, that better land.

Pilgrims, may we travel with you
To that bright and better land?
Come and welcome, come and welcome
Welcome to our pilgrim land
Come, oh, come! And do not leave us,
Christ is waiting to receive us,
Christ is waiting to receive us,
In that bright, that better land,
Christ is waiting to receive us,
In that bright, that better land.
verses.yoruba:
Ero, a le ba yin kẹgbẹ
L'ọna ajo s'ilẹ na?
 Wa, ma kalọ, wa ma kalọ,
Wa, si ẹgbẹ ero wa,
Wa, ẹ maṣe fi wa silẹ,
Jesu nduro, O nreti wa,
Jesu nduro, O nreti wa
N'ilẹ mimọ to dara;
Jesu nduro, O nreti wa
N'ilẹ mimọ to dara.

title.english: Ho, My Comrades! See The Signal

verses.english:
Ho, my comrades! See the signal
Waving in the sky!
Reinforcements now appearing,
Victory is nigh!
verses.yoruba:
Ha! Ẹgbẹ mi, ẹ w'asia
Bi ti nfẹ lẹlẹ!
Ogun Jesu fẹrẹ dè na,
A fẹrẹ ṣẹgun!

verses.english:
See the mighty host advancing,
Satan leading on:
Mighty men around us falling,
Courage almost gone!

See the glorious banner waving!
Hear the trumpet blow!
In our Leader's name we'll triumph
Over every foe!
verses.yoruba:
Wo asia Jesu ti nfẹ,
Gbo ohun ipe;
A o ṣẹgun gbogbo ọta
Ni orukọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
Fierce and long the battle rages,
But our help is near:
'Onward comes our great Commander,
Cheer, my comrades, cheer!'
verses.yoruba:
Ogun ngbona girigiri,
Iranwọ wa mbọ;
Balogun wa mbọ wa tete,
Ẹgbẹ, tujuka!

chorus.english:
'Hold the fort, for I am coming!'
Jesus signals still;
Wave the answer back to heaven,
'By Thy grace we will!'
chorus.yoruba:
'D'odi mu, Emi fẹrẹ de'
Bẹni Jesu nwi,
Ran 'dahun pada s'ọrun pe,
'Awa o di mu!'

title.english: Rise, Ye Children Of Salvation

verses.english:
Rise, ye children of salvation,
All who cleave to Christ the Head,
Wake, arise! O mighty nation,
Ere the foe on Zion tread.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ dide ọmọ igbala
Ẹyin t'ẹ fẹ Oluwa,
Dide, ilu alagbara
Ki ọta to de Sion.

verses.english:
Saints and heroes long before us,
Firmly on this ground have stood;
See their banners waving o'er us,
Conquerors through Jesus' blood.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹgbẹ mimọ ti igbani
Ti wọn ti nrin ọna yi
W'asia wọn t'o nfẹ lele
Aṣẹgun nipa Kristi.

verses.english:
Deathless, we are all unfearing,
Life laid up with Christ in God;
In the morn of His appearing
Floweth forth a glory flood.
verses.yoruba:
A ti gbe 'ku mi ni 'ṣẹgun
Iye wa mbẹ n'nu Kristi;
L'ọjọ farahan Oluwa
A o ho iho ayọ.

verses.english:
Soon we all shall stand before Him,
See and know our glorious Lord;
Soon in joy and light adore Him,
Each receiving his reward.
verses.yoruba:
Laipẹ ao de 'bi itẹ Rẹ
Ao si mọ Ọba ogo;
Nibẹ ao ke, 'Kabiyesi'
Gbogbo wa y'o gba ere.

chorus.english:
Pour it forth a mighty anthem,
Like the thunders of the sea
Through the blood of Christ our ransom,
More than conquerors are we,
More than conquerors are we,
More than conquerors are we,
Through the blood of Christ our ransom,
More than conquerors are we.
chorus.yoruba:
Fagbara rẹ kọrin kikan
Bi iro omi okun,
Nipa ẹjẹ Kristi Jesu
Awa ju aṣẹgun lọ
Awa ju aṣẹgun lọ
Awa ju aṣẹgun lọ
Nipa ẹjẹ Kristi Jesu
Awa ju aṣẹgun lọ.

title.english: Thine-Thine Forever

verses.english:
'Thine - Thine forever' blessed bond
That knits, us, Lord, to Thee;
May voice, and heart, and soul respond,
Amen, so let it be.
verses.yoruba:
Tirẹ titi lae l'awa se
Oluwa wa ọrun!
K'ohun at'ọkan wa wipe;
Amin, bẹni k'o ri.

verses.english:
When this world strikes its dulcet harp,
And earth our heav'n appears,
Be 'Thine forever', clean and sharp,
God's trumpet in our ears.
verses.yoruba:
'Gbati aye ba ndun mọ ni,
T'o si nfa ọkan wa;
K'iro yi pe, 'Tirẹ l'awa'
Le ma dun l'eti wa.

verses.english:
When sin in pleasure's soft disguise
Would work us deadliest harm,
May 'Thine forever' from the skies
Steal down, and break the charm.
verses.yoruba:
'Gba t'ẹsẹ pẹlu ẹtan rẹ
Ba fẹsẹ wa n'ibi;
K'iro yi pe, 'Tirẹ l'awa'
Tu ẹtan ẹsẹ ka.

verses.english:
When Satan flings his fiery darts
Against our weary shield,
May 'Thine forever' in our hearts
Forbid us faint or yield.
verses.yoruba:
Gbati esu ba ntafa rẹ
S'ori ailera wa;
K'iro yi pe, 'Tirẹ l'awa'
Ma jẹ ki o rẹ wa.

verses.english:
Thine all along the flow'ry spring,
Along the summer prime,
Till autumn fades in welcoming
The silver frost of time.
verses.yoruba:
Tirẹ, n'igb'a wa l'ọmọde,
Tirẹ, n'igb'a ndagba,
Tirẹ, n'igb'a ba ndarugbo
Ti aye wa mbuse.

verses.english:
'Thine, Thine forever', body, soul,
Henceforth devote to Thee,
While everlasting ages roll;
Amen, so let it be.

title.english: Jesus, I My Cross Have Taken

verses.english:
Jesus, I my cross have taken,
All to leave, and follow Thee;
Destitute, despis'd, forsaken,
Thou from hence my All shalt be;
Perish every fond ambition,
All I've sought, or hop'd, or known,
Yet how rich is my condition!
God and Heav'n are still my own!
verses.yoruba:
Jesu, mo gb'agbelebu mi
Ki nle ma tọ Ọ lẹyin;
Otosi at'ẹni ẹgan,
'Wọ l'ohun gbogbo fun mi,
Bi ini mi gbogbo segbe,
Ti ero mi gbogbo pin,
Sibẹ, ọlọrọ ni mo jẹ!
T'emi ni Krist' at'ọrun.

verses.english:
Man may trouble and distress me,
Twill but drive me to Thy breast;
Life with trials, hard may press me,
Heav'n's will bring me sweeter rest!
Oh! 'tis not in grief to harm me,
While Thy love is left to me!
Oh! 'twere not in joy to charm me,
Were that joy unmixed with Thee!
verses.yoruba:
Ẹda le ma wahala mi,
Y'o mu mi sunmọ Ọ ni;
Idanwo aye le ba mi,
Ọrun o mu 'simi wa,
Ibanujẹ ko le se nkan
Bi 'fẹ Rẹ ba wa fun mi;
Ayọ ko si le dun mo mi,
B'iwọ ko si ninu rẹ.

verses.english:
Take, my soul, thy full Salvation,
Rise o'er sin and fear and care;
Joy to find in every station,
Something still to do or bear,
Think what Spirit dwells within thee!
What a Father's smile is thine!
What a Saviour died to win thee!
Child of Heav'n, shouldst thou repine?
verses.yoruba:
Ọkan mi, gba igbala rẹ
Bori ẹsẹ at'ẹru;
F'ayọ wa ni ipokipo,
Ma ṣiṣẹ lo, ma wẹyin,
Ro t'emi to wa ninu Rẹ,
At'ifẹ Baba si ọ!
W'Olugbala tO ku fun ọ,
Ọmọ ọrun mase kun.

verses.english:
Haste then on from grace to glory,
Arm'd by faith, and wing'd by pray'r,
Heav'n eternal day's before thee,
God's own Hand shall guide thee; there!
Soon shall close thy earthly mission,
Swift shall pass thy pilgrim days,
Hope soon change to glad fruition
Faith to sight and pray'r to praise.
verses.yoruba:
Njẹ kọja lat'ore s'ogo
N'nu adura on 'gbagbọ;
Ọjọ ailopin wa fun ọ,
Baba y'o mu o de 'bẹ,
Isẹ rẹ l'aye fẹrẹ pin,
Ọjọ ajo rẹ nbuse,
Ireti y'o pada 'sayọ,
Adura s'orin iyin.

title.english: Have Thine Own Way, Lord
title.yoruba: Se Mi Bi O Ti Fẹ Oluwa

verses.english:
Have Thine own way, Lord! Have Thine own way,
Thou art the porter I am the clay,
Mould me and make me after Thy will.
While I am waiting, yielded and still.
verses.yoruba:
Se mi bi o ti fẹ Oluwa,
Iwọ ni Ọmọ, emi l'amo,
Mọ mi, si se mi b'O ba ti fẹ,
Ọkan mi setan, mo wa fun Ọ.

verses.english:
Have Thine own Way Lord! Have Thine own way,
Search me and try me, Master, today,
Whiter than snow, Lord, wash me,just now,
As in thy presence humbly I bow.
verses.yoruba:
Se mi bi o ti fẹ Oluwa,
Ye ọkan mi wo l'oni Jesu,
Wẹ mi nisiyi kin fun ju sno,
Mo fi rẹlẹ wo lẹ l'ẹsẹ Rẹ.

verses.english:
Have Thine own way Lord! Have Thine own way,
Wounded and weary, help me I pray
Power all power surely is Thine,
Touch me and heal me, Saviour divine.
verses.yoruba:
Se mi bi o ti fẹ Oluwa,
O rẹ ọkan mi, jọwọ gba mi,
Lọwọ Rẹ ni qbogbo ipa wa,
Wo mi san Olugbala ọwọn.

verses.english:
Have Thine own way Lord! Have Thine own way,
Hold o'er my being absolute sway,
Fill with Thy Spirit till all shall see,
Christ only always, living in me.
verses.yoruba:
Se mi bi o ti fẹ Oluwa,
Se akoso gbogbo aye mi,
F'ẹmi Rẹ kun mi, tit' ao ri
Krist' nikan n'nu mi nigbagbogbo.

title.english: Gladly, Gladly, Toiling For The Master

verses.english:
Gladly, gladly, toiling for the master,
Go we forth with willing hands to do
Whatsoe'er to us He hath appointed,
Faithfully our mission we'll pursue.
verses.yoruba:
Pẹlu ayọ l'ao ṣiṣẹ f'Oluwa,
Pẹlu ifẹ l'ao f'ọwọ wa se
Iṣẹkiṣẹ ti o ba yan fun wa!
L'ododo l'ao ṣiṣẹ 'ranṣẹ wa.

verses.english:
Sweetly, sweetly, we will tell the story
Of His love to mortals here below;
Christ, the brightness of the father's glory,
Freely here His blessings will bestow.
verses.yoruba:
Pẹlu adun l'a o sọ itan na;
T'ifẹ nla rẹ s'awa eniyan,
Kristi itansan ogo ti Baba,
L'ọfẹ l'On o fi 'bukun fun wa.

verses.english:
Meekly, meekly, toiling for the Master,
Walking, faithfully the path He trod;
Leading wand'rers to the dear Redeemer,
Pointing sinners to the Lamb of God.
verses.yoruba:
Pẹlu 'rẹlẹ l'ao ṣiṣẹ f'Oluwa,
Ao fi otitọ rin l'ọna Rẹ;
Ao tọ asako s'ọd'Olugbala,
A f'Ọdagutan han ẹlẹsẹ.

chorus.english:
Toiling for Jesus,
Joyfully we go, yes,
Joyfully we go,
Toiling for Jesus,
In His vineyard here below.
chorus.yoruba:
Ṣiṣẹ fun Jesu,
L'ayọ l'a o lọ,
L'ayọ l'a o lọ;
Ṣiṣẹ fun Jesu,
Ninu ogba Rẹ laye.

title.english: Take My Life And Let It Be

verses.english:
Take my life, and let it be,
Consecrated, Lord, to Thee,
Take my moments and my days;
Let them flow in ceaseless praise.
verses.yoruba:
Gba aye mi, Oluwa,
Mo ya si mimọ fun Ọ,
Gba gbogbo akoko mi,
Ki wọn kun fun iyin Rẹ.

verses.english:
Take my hands, and let them move,
At the impulse of Thy love,
Take my feet, and let them be
Swift and beautiful for Thee.
verses.yoruba:
Gba ọwọ mi, k'O si jẹ
Ki nma lo fun ìfẹ Rẹ,
Gba ẹsẹ mi, k'O si jẹ
Ki wọn ma sare fun Ọ.

verses.english:
Take my voice, and let me sing,
Always, only for my King,
Take my lips, and let them be
Filled with messages from Thee.
verses.yoruba:
Gba ohun mi, je ki nma
Kọrin f'Ọba mi titi;
Gba ete mi, jẹ ti wọn
Ma jisẹ fun Ọ titi.

verses.english:
Take my silver and my gold;
Not a mite would I withhold,
Take my intellect, and use
Every pow'r as Thou shalt choose.
verses.yoruba:
Gba wura, fadaka mi,
Okan nki o da duro;
Gba ọgbọn mi, ko sil lo,
Gẹgẹ bi O ba ti fẹ.

verses.english:
Take my will, and make it Thine,
It shall be no longer mine,
Take my heart-it is Thine own;
It shall be Thy royal throne.

Take my love; my Lord, I pour
At Thy feet its treasure-store
Take myself, and I will be
Ever, only, all for Thee!
verses.yoruba:
Gba 'fẹran mi, Oluwa,
Mo fi gbogbo rẹ fun Ọ;
Gb'emi papa; lat' oni
Ki njẹ Tirẹ titi lae.

title.english: Work For The Night Is Coming
To The Work, To The Work
title.yoruba: Ao Ṣiṣẹ! Ao Ṣiṣẹ! Ọm'Ọlọrun Ni Wa

verses.yoruba:
Ao ṣiṣẹ! Ao ṣiṣẹ! Ọm'Ọlọrun ni wa,
Jẹ k'a tẹle ipa ti Oluwa wa tọ;
K'a fi 'mọran Rẹ so agbara wa dọtun
K'a fi gbogbo okun wa ṣiṣẹ t'ao se.

A o ṣiṣẹ! Ao ṣiṣẹ! Bọ awọn T'ebi npa,
Ko awọn alarẹ lọ s'orisun iye;
Ninu agbelebu l'awa o ma sogo,
'Gbati a ba nkede pe: 'Ọfẹ n'igbala'.

verses.english:
To the work, to the work! there is labour for all,
For the kingdom of darkness and error shall fall;
And the name of Jehovah exalted shall be,
In the loud-swelling chorus,
'Salvation is free'.

To the work, to the work in the strength of the Lord,
And a robe and a crown shall our labour reward;
When the home of the faithful our dwelling shall be,
And we shout with the ransomed,
'Salvation is free'.
verses.yoruba:
A o ṣiṣẹ! Ao ṣiṣẹ! Laqbara Oluwa.
Agbada at' ade y'o si jẹ ere wa;
'Gbat' ile awọn olotọ badi tiwa,
Ghogbo wa o jọ ho pe: 'Ọfẹ n'igbala'.

chorus.english:
Toiling on, toiling on,
Toiling on, toiling on,
Let us hope, let us watch,
And labour till the Master comes.
chorus.yoruba:
Foriti! Foriti!
Foriti! Foriti!
Ma reti, ma sọna,
Titi Oluwa o fi de.

title.english: O Saviour, May We Never Rest

verses.english:
O Saviour, may we never rest
Till thou art formed within,
Till Thou hast calmed our troubl'd breast,
And crush d the pow'r of sin.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu mase jẹ k'a simi
Tit' O fi d'okan wa;
TO fun wa ni 'bale aya,
TO wo itẹ ẹsẹ.

verses.english:
O may we gaze upon thy Cross,
Until the wondrous sight
Makes earthly treasures seems but dross,
And earthly sorrows light.
verses.yoruba:
A ba le wo agbelebu,
Titi iran la na
Y'o sọ ohun aye d'ofo,
T' y'o mu 'banujẹ tan.

verses.english:
Until releas'd from carnal ties,
Our spirit upward springs,
And gees true peace above the skies
True joy in heav'nly things.
verses.yoruba:
Titi ọkan wa yo goke,
T'ao bọ lọwọ ara;
T'ao fi r'alafia pipe,
Ati ayọ ọrun.

verses.english:
There as we gaze, may we become
United, Lord, to Thee,
And in a fairer, happier home,
Thy perfect beauty see.
verses.yoruba:
Bi a si ti ntẹjumọ Ọ,
K'a d'ọkan pẹlu Rẹ;
K'a si ri pipe ẹwa Rẹ,
N'ile ayọ l'oke.

title.english: Onward Christian Soldiers

verses.english:
Onward Christian soldiers, marching as to war,
With the cross of Jesus, going on before.
Christ, the royal Master, leads against the foe;
Forward into battle, see! His banners go.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ ma tẹ síwájú, Kristian Ologun,
Ma tẹjumọ Jesu t'O mbẹ níwájú,
Kristi Olúwa wa ni Balógun wa,
Wo! Àsìá Rẹ wà níwájú Ogun.

Ni orukọ Jesu, ogun eṣu sa,
Njẹ Kristian ologun ma nṣo sí iṣẹgun
Ọrun apadi mi ni hiho iyin,
Ara, gb'ohun yin ga, gb'orin yin soke.

verses.english:
Like a mighty army moves the Church of God:
Brothers, we are treading where the saints have trod,
We are not divided, All one Body we,
One in hope, in doctrine, One in charity.
verses.yoruba:
Bí ẹgbẹ ogun nla n'ijọ Ọlọrun,
Ara, a n rin l'ọna t'awọn mimọ nrin;
A ko ya wa ni 'pa, ẹgbẹ kan ni wa,
Ọkan ni 'reti, ni ẹkọ, ni ifẹ.

Itẹ ati 'jọba wọnyi le parun,
Ṣugbọn ìjọ Jésù y'o wa titi lae,
Ọrùn-apadi ko le bori' ijọ yi,
A n'ileri Kristi, eyi kò le yẹ.

verses.english:
Onward, then, ye people! Join our happy throng;
Blend with ours your voices in the triumph song,
Glory, laud, and honor unto Christ, the King!
This through countless ages, men and angels sing.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ ma ba mi kalọ, ẹyin eniyan,
D'ohun yin pọ mọ wa, l'orin ìṣẹgun;
Ogo, ìyìn, ọla fún Kristi Ọba!
Eyi ni y'o ma jẹ orin wa titi.

chorus.english:
Onward, Christian soldiers, marching as to war,
With the cross of Jesus, going on before.
chorus.yoruba:
Ẹ ma tẹsiwaju, Kristian Ologun,
Ṣa tẹjumọ Jesu t'O mbẹ níwájú.

title.english: Jesus Calls Us! O'er The Tumult

verses.english:
Jesus calls us! O'er the tumult,
Of our life's wild restless sea,
Day by day His sweet voice soundeth,
Saying: Christian, follow me.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu npe wa l'ọsan, l'oru,
Larin irumi aye;
Lojojumọ la ngb'ohun Rẹ,
Wipe, 'Kristian, tẹle mi'.

verses.english:
As, of old, apostles heard it,
By the Galilean lake,
Turned from home and toil and kindred,
Leaving all for his dear sake.
verses.yoruba:
Awọn Apostel igbani
Ni odo Galili ni;
Wọn kọ ile, ọna silẹ,
Gbogbo wọn si ntọ lẹyin.

verses.english:
Jesus calls us from the worship,
Of the vain world's golden store,
From each idol that would keep us,
Saying: Christian, love me more!

In our joys and in our sorrows,
Days of toil and hours of ease,
Still He calls, in cares and pleasures
That we love Him more than these.
verses.yoruba:
L'arin ayọ at' ẹkun wa,
L'arin lala on 'rọrun,
Tantan l'O npe l'ohun rara,
Pe: 'Kristian, ẹ fẹran Mi'.

verses.english:
Jesus calls us! By Thy mercies,
Saviour, make us hear Thy call,
Give our hearts to Thine obedience,
Serve and love Thee best of all.
verses.yoruba:
Olugbala, nip'anu Rẹ,
Jẹ ki a gbọ ipe Rẹ;
F'eti 'gbọran fun gbogbo wa,
K'a fẹ Ọ ju aye lọ.

title.english: What Shall We Offer Our Good God

verses.english:
What shall we offer our good Lord,
Poor nothings, for His boundless grace?
Fain would we His great name record,
And worthily set forth His praise.
verses.yoruba:
Ki l'awa y'o fun Ọlọrun
Fun gbogbo ore Rẹ si wa?
Ao f'ayo ranti Okọ Rẹ,
A o si fi iyin Rẹ han.

verses.english:
Great object of our growing love,
To whom our more than all we owe
Open the fountain from above,
And let it our full souls o'er flow.
verses.yoruba:
Iwo ni olu ifẹ wa,
L'odo Rẹ l'a nr'ohun gbogbo
Si orisun lat'oke wa,
Jẹ k'o san si okan gbogbo.

verses.english:
So shall our lives Thy pow' proclaim,
Thy grace for every sinner free;
Till all mankind shall learn Thy name
Shall all stretch out their hands to Thee.
verses.yoruba:
Bẹ l'ao kede agbara Rẹ,
At' or'-ọfẹ Rẹ f'ẹlẹsẹ;
Titi gbogb'ẹda y'o mọ Ọ,
Ti wọn o si tẹwọ si Ọ.

verses.english:
Open a door which earth and hell
May strive to shut, but strive in vain
Let Thy word richly in us dwell,
And let our gracious fruit remain.
verses.yoruba:
Silẹkun silẹ fun 'se Rẹ,
T'aye at' esu ki o le si,
Je k'ọrọ Rẹ ma gbe 'nu wa
Ki eso na k'o wa titi.

verses.english:
O multiply the sower's seed!
And fruit we every hour shall bear
Throughout the world Thy gospel
Spread,Thy everlasting truth declare.
verses.yoruba:
'Bukun eso afunrugbin,
K'a le ma so eso titi;
K'a tan 'hinrere Rẹ k'aye
Ati otitọ Rẹ titi.

verses.english:
We all, in perfect love renewed,
Shall know the greatness of Thy pow'r,
Stand in the temple of our God
As pillars, and go out no more.
verses.yoruba:
Ao mọ titobi ipa Rẹ,
'Gba t'a ba se wa pe n'ifẹ;
Bi ọwọn n'ile Ọlọrun
L'ao duro, t'ao ni jade mọ.

title.english: Dismiss Me Not Thy Service, Lord
title.yoruba: Jesu Ma Yọ Mi N'nu Sẹ Rẹ

title.english: We Are Building On The Rock
title.yoruba: A Nkọle L'or'apata T'ijikiji Ko Le Mi

verses.english:
We are building on the Rock which no tempest e'er can shock,
Tho' the adverse winds may round us roar,
Our foundation's sure and strong, we are here to conquer wrong,
Trusting him whose aid we now Implore.
verses.yoruba:
A nkọle l'or'apata t'ijikiji ko le mi,
'Pilẹ wa daju, o lagbara;
Iṣẹ wa nihin ni lati ṣẹgun gbogbo ibi,
K'a si gbẹkẹl' Orisun 'ranwọ.

verses.english:
No foundation could we lay in our own imperfect way,
Which would stand the Storms that may assail,
But on Christ the solid Rock we shall be a sheltered flock,
For His bring care will e'er prevail.
verses.yoruba:
Ko si 'pilẹ ta le fi sọlẹ lori aimọkan wa,
To le duro b'igbi 'ponju de;
Sugbọn lori Krist' Apata l'abo to daraju,
Nitori ikẹ Rẹ l'o daju.

verses.english:
Let us labour then and sing in this temple of the king,
In His service true we shall be blest,
In harmonious, happy bands loyal hearts united hands,
Our reward, eternal peace and rest.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹ ka ṣiṣẹ, ka kọ'rin ninu tẹmpil' mimọ yi,
Ninu 'sin Rẹ ao ri 'bukun gba;
Ta ba f'ayọ ati 'sowọpọ ṣiṣẹ f'Oluwa
Ere wa ni ayọ ailopin.

chorus.english:
On the Rock on the Rock,
(We are building on the Rock)
(On the sure and solid Rock)
It has stood for ages and it stands secure,
On the Rock blessed Rock,
Stand secure we are building on the Rock
(building on the Rock)
We are building on the Rock Christ Jesus.
chorus.yoruba:
Apata (A nkọle l'or'Apata,)
Apata, (L'or'Apata to daju,)
Apata ayeraye to duro lae (duro lae)
Apata (A nkọle l'or' Apata,)
Apata (Apata to ni 'bukun)
A nkọle l'or'Apata, Kristi Jesu.

title.english: My Jesus I Love Thee

verses.english:
My Jesus I love Thee, I know Thou art mine,
For Thee all the pleasures of sin I resign;
My gracious Redeemer, my Saviour art Thou,
If ever I love Thee, my Jesus 'tis now!

I love Thee because Thou hast first love me,
And purchased my pardon, when nailed to the tree,
I love Thee for wearing the thorns on Thy brow,
If ever I love Thee, my Jesus 'tis now!
verses.yoruba:
Mo fẹ Ọ n'tori 'Wọ lo kọkọ fẹ mi,
O ra 'dariji fun mi ni Kalfari,
Mo fẹ Ọ 'Wọ lo d'ade ẹgun fun mi,
Bi nko fe Ọ tẹlẹ, n'siyi mo fẹ Ọ.

verses.english:
I'll love Thee in life, I will love Thee in death,
And praise Thee as long as Thou lendest me breath,
And say should the death-dew lie cold on my brow,
If ever I loved Thee my Jesus 'tis now!

In mansion of glory and endless delight,
I'll ever adore Thee in heaven so bright;
I'll sing with the glittering crown on my brow,
If ever I love Thee, my Jesus 'tis now!
verses.yoruba:
Ninu ogo didan ti ainipekun,
Iwọ lemi o ma f'iyin fun titi;
Un o korin pẹl' ade ogo l'ori mi,
Bi nko fẹ Ọ tele, n'siyi mo fẹ Ọ.

title.english: All To Jesus I Surrender
title.yoruba: Mo Fi Gbogbo Rẹ Fun Jesu

verses.english:
All to Jesus I surrender,
All to Him I freely give,
I will ever love and trust Him,
In His presence daily live.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fi gbogbo rẹ fun Jesu,
Patapata l'aiku kan;
Ùn ó ma fẹ, ùn ó si gbẹkẹle,
Ùn ó wa lọdọ Rẹ titi.

verses.english:
All to Jesus I surrender,
Humbly at His feet I bow,
Worldly pleasures all forsaken,
Take me, Jesus, take me now.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fi gbogbo rẹ fun Jesu,
Mo fi 'rẹlǝ wole fun;
Mo fi 'gbadun ayé silẹ,
Gba mi, Jesu, si gba mi.

verses.english:
All to Jesus I surrender,
Make me, Saviour, wholly Thine,
Let me feel the Holy Spirit,
Truly know that Thou art mine.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fi gbogbo rẹ fun Jesu,
Ṣe mi ni Tirẹ nikan;
Jẹ kin kun fun Ẹmi Mimọ
Ki nmọ pe, 'Wọ jẹ t'emi.

verses.english:
All to Jesus I surrender, Lord,
I give myself to Thee;
Fill me with Thy love and power,
Let Thy blessings fall on me.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fi gbogbo rẹ fun Jesu
Mo fi ara mi fun Ọ;
F'ifẹ at'agbara kun mi,
Ki 'bukun Rẹ ba le mi.

verses.english:
All to Jesus I surrender,
Now I feel the sacred flame,
Oh, the joy of full salvation;
Glory, glory to His name!

chorus.english:
I surrender all,
I surrender all;
All to Thee, my blessed Saviour,
I surrender all.
chorus.yoruba:
Mo fi gbogbo Rẹ,
Mo fi gbogbo Rẹ,
Fun Ọ, Olugbala mi, ni
Mo fi wọn silẹ.

title.english: Are You Trusting Jesus

verses.english:
Are you trusting Jesus all along the way,
Does he grow more precious to your heart each day?
Are you His disciple? Test His word and see,
He will give the spirit more abundantly.
verses.yoruba:
O ha ngbẹkẹle Jesu n'gbogb'ọna rẹ?
O ha nd'ọtun lọkan rẹ lojojumọ?
O ha j'ọm' ẹyin Rẹ? Yẹ ọrọ Rẹ wo,
Y'o fun ọ l'Ẹmi Mimọ lọpọlọpọ.

verses.english:
For His matchless favour magnify the name,
Of our gracious Saviour who from glory came,
Let the saints adore Him for this wondrous word,
Sealing our redemption through the crimson flood.
verses.yoruba:
Fun oju rere Rẹ, gbe okọ Rẹ ga,
Olugbala wa to t'ọrun sọkalẹ,
K'awọn ayanfẹ Rẹ juba ọrọ Rẹ,
Ẹni ra wa pada nipa ẹjẹ Rẹ.

verses.english:
Come to him believing hearken to His call,
From His receiving yield to Him your all,
Jesus will accept you when to Him you flee,
He will grant His blessing more abundantly.
verses.yoruba:
Wa pẹlu igbagbọ, wa jẹ ipe Rẹ,
Ẹyin t'a mbukun, jọwọ ara yin fun;
Jesu, y'o gb'ẹni t'o sa wa sọdọ Rẹ,
Y'O da 'bukun Rẹ lu o lọpọlọpọ.

chorus.english:
More abundantly, more abundantly
They that might have life
And more abundantly.
chorus.yoruba:
Lọpọlọpọ si, lọpọlọpọ si,
Ki wọn le ni iye si lọpọlọpọ
Lọpọlọpọ si, lopolopo si,
Ki wọn le ni iye si lọpọlọpọ.

title.english: Sing The Wondrous Love Of Jesus

verses.english:
Sing the wondrous love of Jesus,
Sing His mercy and His grace,
In the mansions bright and blessed,
He'll prepare for us a place.
verses.yoruba:
Kọrin t'ifẹ 'yanu Jesu,
Anu at' or'-ọfẹ Rẹ;
Yio pese ayọ fun wa
N'ile Baba Rẹ loke.

verses.english:
While we walk the pilgrim pathway,
Clouds will overspread the sky;
But when travelling days are over,
Not a shadow, not a sigh.
verses.yoruba:
B'a ti nrin lọ l'ọna ajo wa,
Okun yo su l'ọna wa,
Laipẹ oru ẹkun yo di
Owurọ orin ayọ.

verses.english:
Let us then be true and faithful,
Trusting, serving every day;
Just one glimpse of Him in glory,
Will the toils of life repay.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ jẹ ka ma foriti lọ,
Kama sin tọkantọkan;
Ta ba ri ninu ogo Rẹ,
Ao gbagbe iponju wa.

verses.english:
Onward to the prize before us!
Soon His beauty we'll behold,
Soon the pearly gates will open,
We shall tread the street of gold.

chorus.english:
When we all get to heaven,
What a day of rejoicing that will be?
When we all see Jesus,
We'll sing and shout the victory.
chorus.yoruba:
'Gba ta ba d'ọrun rere,
Bawo li ayọ wa yo ti pọ to!
Gba ta ba ri Jesu,
Ao yọ, ao kọrin iṣẹgun.

title.english: Christian! Seek Ye Not Repose

verses.english:
Christian! Seek not yet repose,
Hear thy guardian angel say,
Thou art in the midst of foes:
Watch and pray.

Principalities and powers,
Must'ring their unseen array,
Wait for thy unguarded hour:
Watch and pray.
verses.yoruba:
Ogun ọrun apadi,
T'a ko ri nko 'ra wọn jọ;
Wọn so ijafara re,
Ma sọra.

verses.english:
Hear the victors who o'er came;
Still they mark each warrior's way
All with one consent exclaim,
Watch and pray.
verses.yoruba:
Awọn to ṣẹgun saju,
Wọn nwo wa b'awa ti nja;
Wọn nfi ohun kan wipe:
Ma sọra.

verses.english:
Hear, above all, hear thy Lord,
Him thou lovest to obey;
Hide within thy heart His word:
Watch and pray.

verses.yoruba:
Ma sọra bi enipe
Nibe ni 'ṣẹgun rẹ wa,
Gbadura fun 'ranlọwọ,
Ma sọra.

title.english: It Is Not Meet For Saints To Fear

verses.english:
It is not meet for Saints to fear
Nor for them to despair,
For when they least expect His help
The Saviour will appear.
verses.yoruba:
Ko tọ k'awọn mimọ bẹru,
Ki wọn sọ 'reti nu,
'Gba wọn ko reti ranwọ Rẹ,
Olugbala yo de.

verses.english:
When Abraham took up his knife
God's voice said to him, 'stop'
The yonder ram caught by the horn
Shall substitute thy son.
verses.yoruba:
Nigbati Abram mu ọbẹ,
Ọlọrun ni, 'Duro';
Agbo ti o wa lọhun ni,
Y'o dipo ọmọ na.

verses.english:
When Jonah sank beneath the waves,
No hope of escape near
God sent a fish that swallowed him
And brought him to the shore.
verses.yoruba:
'Gba Jona ri sinu omi,
Ko ro lati yọ mọ;
Sugbọn Ọlọrun ran ẹja,
To gbe lọ s'ebute.

verses.english:
With such great might and love as this,
Abounding in His word;
I pray to bring my anxious cares
And leave them all to Him.
verses.yoruba:
B'iru ipa at'ifẹ yi
Ti pọ l'ọrọ Rẹ to!
Emi ba ma k'aniyan mi,
Le Oluwa lọwọ!

verses.english:
Lift up your eyes and wait His help
It may be long but wait;
Though the promise may tarry long,
It soon shall come to pass.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ duro de iranwọ Rẹ,
B'o tilẹ pẹ, duro,
B'ileri na tilẹ falẹ,
Sugbọn ko le pẹ de.

title.english: Have Faith In God
title.yoruba: Gb'Ọlọrun Gbọ 'Gba To Jẹ Iwọ Nikan

verses.english:
Have faith in God when your pathway is lonely,
He sees and knows all the way you have trod;
Never alone are the least of His Children,
Have faith in God, have faith in God.
verses.yoruba:
Gb'Ọlọrun gbọ 'gba to jẹ iwo nikan
O ri ọ, O mọ gbogbo ọna Rẹ;
Ko le fọkan silẹ 'nu awọn ọmọ Rẹ
Gb'Ọlọrun gbọ! Gb'Ọlọrun gbọ!

verses.english:
Have faith in God when your prayers are unanswered,
Your earnest plea He will never forget
Wait on the Lord trust His word and be patient,
Have faith in God, have faith in God.

Have faith in God in your pain and sorrow,
His heart touched with your grief and despair;
Cast all your cares and your burdens upon Him,
Have faith in God, have faith in God.

Have faith in God though all else fail about you,
Have faith in God, He provides for His own;
He cannot fail though all kingdoms shall perish,
He rules, He reigns upon His throne.

title.english: Begone, Unbelief

verses.english:
Begone, unbelief, my Saviour is near,
And for my relief will surely appear
By pray'r let me wrestle, and He will perform;
With Christ in the vessels, I smile at the storm.
verses.yoruba:
Aigbagbọ bila! Temi l'Oluwa,
Oun O si dide fun igbala mi;
Ki nsa ma gbadura, Oun O se ranwọ,
'Gba Krist' wa lọdọ mi ifoya ko si.

verses.english:
Though dark be my way, since he is my Guide,
'Tis mine to obey, 'Tis His to provide
Though cisterns be broken, and creatures all fail,
The word He hath spoken, shall surely prevail.
verses.yoruba:
B'ọna mi ba su, Oun l'O sa ntọ mi
Ki nsa gbọran sa, Oun o si pese;
Bi iranlọwọ ẹda gbogbo saki,
Ọrọ t'ẹnu Rẹ sọ, yo bori dandan.

verses.english:
His love, in time past forbids me to think,
He'll leave me at last in trouble to sink;
Each sweet Ebenezer I have in review,
Confirms His good pleasure to help me quit through.
verses.yoruba:
Ifẹ t'O fi han ko jẹ ki nro pe,
Y'O fi mi silẹ ninu wahala;
Iranwọ ti mo si nri lojojumọ,
O nki mi l'aya pe, emi o la ja.

verses.english:
Why should I complain of want or distress,
Temptation or pain?He told me no less;
The heirs of salvation, I know from His Word,
Through much tribulation must follow their Lord.
verses.yoruba:
Emi o se kun 'tori ipọnju,
Tabi irora, O ti sọ tẹlẹ,
Mo m'ọrọ Rẹ p'awọn ajogun 'gbala
Wọn ko le sai kọja larin wahala.

verses.english:
How bitter that cup no heart can conceive,
Which He drank quit up, that sinners might live!
His way was much rougher and darker than mine;
Did Christ, my Lord, suffer, and shall I repine?

Since all that I meet shall work for my good,
The bitter is sweet, The medicine, food,
Though painful at long, present 'Twill cease before long,
And then-oh, how pleasant, The conqueror's song!
verses.yoruba:
Njẹ b'ohun gbogbo ti nṣiṣẹ ire,
Fun awọn to duro de Oluwa,
B'oni tilẹ koro, sa ko ni pẹ mọ,
'Gba na orin'ṣẹgun yi o ti dun to?

title.english: He Will Answer Every Pray'r

verses.english:
He will answer every pray'r,
This, His promise and His will
He has never chang'd nor fail'd,
Glory to His name.
verses.yoruba:
Y'o dahun gbogb' adura,
Ileri ati 'fẹ Rẹ,
Ko sa ti yi pada ri;
Ogo f'okọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
He will answer every pray'r,
To His promise I will cling,
I know He'll ne'er deceive me,
Glory to His name.
verses.yoruba:
Y'o dahun gbogb' adura,
Uno rọ mọ ileri Rẹ,
Mo mọ On ko jẹ da mi,
Ogo f'okọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
He will answer every pray'r,
Let us ask from Him in faith,
With his Holy Spirit's help,
Glory to His name.
verses.yoruba:
Y'o dahun gbogb' adura,
Jẹ ka bere ni 'gbagbo,
Ẹmi Rẹ ran ni lowo,
Ogo fokọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
He will answer every pray'r,
Come thou to the mercy seat,
Blest assurance you'll receive,
Glory to His name.
verses.yoruba:
Y'o dahun gbogb' adura,
Wa sibi itẹ anu,
O ri idaniloju,
Ogo fokọ Rẹ.

title.english: Through The Love Of God Our Saviour

verses.yoruba:
Bi a wa ninu ipọnju,
Ki y'o sí nkan;
Igbala kikun ni tiwa,
Ki y'o sí nkan,
Igbẹkẹle Ọlọrun dun;
Gbigbe inu Kristi l'ere,
Ẹmi sí nsọ wa di mimọ,
Ko le sí nkan.

Ọjọ ọla yíò dara,
Ki y'o sí nkan,
'Gbagbọ le kọrin n'nu 'pọnju
Ki y'o sí nkan,
Agbẹkẹle 'fẹ baba wa;
Jesu nfun wa l'ohun gbogbo,
Ni yiye tabi ni kiku;
Ko le sí nkan.

title.english: Give Me The Faith Which Can Remove
title.yoruba: Fun Mi n'Igbagbọ To Le Sọ

verses.english:
Give me the faith which can remove
And sink the mountain to a plain;
Give me the child-like praying love,
Which longs to build thy house again
Thy love let it my heart o'er pow'r,
And all my simple soul devour.

I want an even strong desire,
I want a calmly fervent zeal
To have poor souls out of the fire,
To snatch them from the verge of hell
And turn them to a pardoning God,
And quench the brands in Jesus' blood.
verses.yoruba:
Mo nfẹ ifẹ to lagbara,
Mo nfẹ itara to gbona,
Ki nyọ ẹlẹsẹ n'nu ina,
Ki nja wọn lọwọ iparun,
Ki ndari wọn sod' Ọlọrun
Ki nfẹjẹ Jesu pa 'na wọn.

verses.english:
I would the precious time redeem,
And longer live for this alone,
To spend, and to be spent, for them
Who have not yet my Saviour known;
Fully on these my mission prove,
And only breathe, to breathe Thy love.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fẹra 'gba to lọ pada,
Ki npe laye nitorina,
Ki no ara mi fun awọn
Ti ko ti mọ Olugbala;
Ki nf'ipe mi han lara wọn,
Ki nsi ma mi kik'ifẹ Rẹ.

verses.english:
My talents, gifts, and graces, Lord,
Into Thy blessed hands
And let me live to preach Thy word,
And let me to Thy glory live;
My every sacred moment spend
In publishing the sinner's friend.
verses.yoruba:
Gba ẹbun ati ise mi
S'ọwọ rere Rẹ, Oluwa;
Jẹki nma wasu ọrọ Rẹ,
Ki nwa laye fun ogo Rẹ,
Ki nlo gbogbo akoko mi
N'ikede Ọre ẹlẹsẹ.

verses.english:
Enlarge, inflame, and fill my heart,
With boundless charity divine!
So shall I ali my strength exert,
And love them with a zeal like Thine
And lead them to Thy open side
The sheep for whom their Shepherd died.
verses.yoruba:
Bu s'ọkan mi, mu ko gbona,
K'O si f'ifẹ mimọ kun un!
Bẹni uno lo gbogbo 'pa mi,
Uno f'itara Tirẹ fẹ wọn;
Uno si to wọn si iha Rẹ,
Awọn agutan t'O ku fun.

title.english: They That Trust The Lord Are Secured

verses.english:
They that trust in the Lord are secure,
Tho' the storm rages dark o'er the sea:
For this anchor of promise is sure
'My grace is sufficient for thee'.
verses.yoruba:
Awọn to gbẹkẹle Oluwa
Yio bori igbi idanwo;
Nitori ileri yi daju,
'Ore-ọfẹ mi to fun ọ'.

verses.english:
What a boon to the pilgrim oppress
What a balm such a promise must be,
To the laden ones seeking for rest,
'My grace is sufficient for thee'.
verses.yoruba:
Manna lat'ọrun li eyi jẹ,
Fun awọn ero mimọ l'ọna,
T'ẹru pa, to si nwa isimi,
'Ore-ọfẹ Mi to fun ọ'.

verses.english:
In the race for the prize, fainting soul,
Though a weary you bow down the knee,
Rise again, and press on to the goal
'My grace is sufficient for thee'.
verses.yoruba:
Larin ire ije ti iye,
Bi arẹ tilẹ mu ọ subu
Tun dide, ko si tẹ siwaju;
'Ore-ọfẹ Mi to fun ọ'.

verses.english:
Neither trial nor doubt brings dismay
Nor from danger that comes will I flee,
For I stand on this promise today,
'My grace is sufficient for thee'.

chorus.english:
My grace is sufficient for thee,
My grace is sufficient for thee,
Oh, matchless, boundless grace
My grace is sufficient for thee.
chorus.yoruba:
Ore-ọfẹ mi to fun ọ,
Ore-ọfẹ mi to fun ọ,
Ore-ọfẹ ti ko l'ẹgbẹ;
Ore-ọfẹ mi to fun ọ.

title.english: My Faith Looks Up To Thee

verses.english:
My faith looks up to Thee,
Thou Lamb of Calvary,
Saviour divine,
Now hear me while I pray;
Take all my guilt away;
O let me from this day
Be wholly Thine.
verses.yoruba:
Ìgbàgbọ mi wo Ọ,
Iwo Ọd'aguntan,
Olugbala,
Jọ gbọ adura mi,
M'ẹsẹ mi gbogbo lọ;
K'emi lat'oni lọ
Si jẹ Tirẹ.

verses.english:
May Thy rich grace impact
Strength to my fainting heart,
My zeal inspire,
As Thou hast died for me,
O may my love to Thee
Pure warm, and changeless be,
A living fire.
verses.yoruba:
Ki ore- ọfẹ Rẹ
F'ilera f'ọkan mi;
Mu mi tara;
B'Iwọ ti ku fun mi,
A! k'ìfẹ mi si Ọ
K'o ma gbona titi
B'ina iye.

verses.english:
While life's dark maze I tread,
And griefs around me spread,
Be Thou my Guide;
Bid darkness turn to day,
Wipe sorrow's tears away,
Nor let me ever stray
From Thee aside.
verses.yoruba:
'Gba mo nrin l'okunkun
Ninu ọbinuje,
S'amọna mi;
Sọ okun di 'mọlẹ;
Pa 'banujẹ mi rẹ,
Ki nma ṣako kuro
Li ọdọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
When ends life's transient dream,
When death's cold sullen stream
Shall o'er me roll,
Blest Savior, then in love,
Fear and distrust remove;
O bear me safe above,
A ransom'd soul.
verses.yoruba:
Gbati aye ba pin,
T'odo tutu iku
Nṣàn l'ori mi,
Jesu, ninu ifẹ,
Mu k'ifoiya mi lọ,
Gbe mi d'oke ọrun,
B'ọkan t'ara.

title.english: My Hope Is Built On Nothing Less

verses.english:
My hope is built on nothing less
Than Jesus' blood and righteousness;
I dare not trust the sweetest frame,
But wholly lean on Jesus' name.
verses.yoruba:
Ìgbàgbọ mi duro l'ori,
Ẹjẹ at'ododo Jesu,
Nko jẹ gbẹkẹle ohun kan,
Lẹyìn orúkọ nla Jesu.

verses.english:
When long appears my toil some race,
I rest on His unchanging grace;
In every high and stormy gale,
My anchor holds within the veil.
verses.yoruba:
B'ire-ije mi tilẹ gun,
Or'-ọfẹ Rẹ ko yipada;
B'o ti wù kí iji na le to,
Idakoro mi ko ni yẹ.

verses.english:
His oath, His covenant, and blood,
Support me in the whelming flood;
When every earthly prop gives way,
He then is all my hope and stay.
verses.yoruba:
Majẹmu, ati ẹjẹ Rẹ,
L'em'o rọ mọ, bi 'kunmi dé;
'Gbati ko s'atilẹyin mọ,
On jẹ ireti nla fún mi.

verses.english:
When the last trumpet's voice shall sound,
Oh may I then in Him be found,
Robbed in His righteousness alone,
Faultless to stand before the throne men.
verses.yoruba:
'Gbat'ipe 'kẹyin bá sì dùn,
A! Mba le wa ninu Jesu;
Ki nwo ododo Rẹ nikan,
Ki nduro níwájú itẹ.

chorus.english:
On Christ, the solid rock, I stand;
All other ground is sinking sand.
chorus.yoruba:
Mo duro le Kristi Apata,
Ilẹ miran, iyanrin ni.

title.english: Oh For A Faith That Will Not Shrink

verses.english:
Oh, for a faith that will not shrink,
Though pressed by many foes,
That will not tremble on the brink,
Of poverty or woe.
verses.yoruba:
A ba le n'igbagbọ aaye,
B'o ti wu k'ọta pọ,
Igbagbọ ti ko jẹ mi ra,
Fun aini at'osi.

verses.english:
That will not murmur nor complain,
Beneath the chast'ning rod,
But, in the hour of grief or pain,
Can lean upon its God.
verses.yoruba:
Ìgbàgbọ ti ko jẹ rahun,
L'abe ibawi Rẹ,
Sugbọn ti nsimi l'Ọlọrun,
Nigba ibanujẹ.

verses.english:
A faith that shines more bright and clear,
When tempests rage without,
That when in danger knows no fear
In darkness feels no doubt.
verses.yoruba:
Igbagbọ ti ntan siwaju,
'Gbat' iji 'pọnju de;
Ti ko si jẹ siyemeji,
N'nu wahala gbogbo.

verses.english:
A faith that keeps the narrow way,
Till life's last spark is fled,
And with a pure and heav'nly ray,
Lights up a dying bed.
verses.yoruba:
Igbagbọ ti ngb' ọna toro,
Titi ẹmi o pin,
Ti yo si f'imọlẹ ọrun
Tan akete iku.

verses.english:
Lord, give me such a faith as this,
And then, whatever may come,
I taste e'en now the hallow'd bliss
Of an Eternal Home.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu figbagbọ yi fun mi,
Njẹ b'o ti wu k'ori,
Lat' aye yi lo, uno l'ayọ
Ilu ọrun rere.

title.english: Must I Go And Empty Handed
title.yoruba: Uno Ha Lọ Ni Ọwọ Ofo?

verses.english:
Must I go and empty handed?
Thus my dear Redeemer meet?
Not one day of service give Him?
Lay no Trophy at His feet?
verses.yoruba:
Uno ha lọ ni ọwọ ofo?
Ki no pade Jesu bẹ?
Nko iti ṣiṣẹ ọjọ kan fun
Nko iti mu ẹnikan wa.

verses.english:
Not at death I shrink or falter,
For my Saviour saves me now,
But to meet him empty handed
Thought of that now clouds my brow.
verses.yoruba:
Iku kọ lo ndẹruba mi,
Tori Jesu ti gba mi
Pe mo nlọ ni ọwọ ofo
Iro yi mb'ọkan mi jẹ.

verses.english:
Oh, the years of sinning wasted!
Could I but recall them now,
I would give them to my Saviour,
To His will I'd gladly bow.
verses.yoruba:
A! Akoko ti mo sọnu,
Mba le pe wọn pada bọ,
Mba fi wọn fun Oluwa mi
Ifẹ Rẹ ni mo fẹ se.

verses.english:
Up, ye saints, arouse, be earnest!
Up and work while yet 'tis day,
Ere the night of death o'er take you
Strive for souls while yet you may.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹnyin mimọ, tara ṣiṣẹ,
Ṣiṣẹ, 'gbati se ọsan,
Ki igbe aye yin to pin,
So eso fun Oluwa.

chorus.english:
Must I go and empty handed?
Must I meet my Saviour so?
Not one soul with which to greet Him?
Must I empty handed go?
chorus.yoruba:
Uno ha lọ ni ọwọ ofo?
Uno ha pade Jesu bẹ?
Ko si eso kan lọwọ mi
Ti mo le mu pade Rẹ?

title.english: Sometimes The Shadows Gather

verses.english:
Sometimes the shadow gather and mist obscure the way,
Sometimes the cloud grows heavy, and darken all the way,
How precious to remember our Father's loving care,
That God still loves His children, and He answers prayer.
verses.yoruba:
Bi sudẹdẹ yi ọ ka, ti kuku bo ọna
T'oju ọrun su dudu, t'ọna rẹ si sokun
O dun lati ma ranti, itọju Baba wa,
Pe o fẹ awọn 'mọ Rẹ, O si ngb'adura.

verses.english:
Sometimes the way is dreary, we seem to walk alone,
Forgetting that the father keeps watch above His own,
How many needless sorrows, the faithless have to bear
For God still loves His children, and He answers prayers.
verses.yoruba:
O ma ndabi ẹnipe, o ku awa nikan,
Sugbọn Baba wa ọrun, nse 'tọju wa sibẹ,
Ọpọlọpọ banujẹ, ni aigbagbọ nmu Wa,
Ọlọrun f'awọn ti Rẹ,
O si ngb' adura.

verses.english:
O soul, weighed down with sorrow beneath a heavy load,
Remember God will help you, however rough the road,
His grace is still sufficient, for every load of care,
God ever loves His children and He answers prayers.
verses.yoruba:
Iwọ ọkan t'arẹ mu, labẹ ẹru wuwo,
Ranti pe iranwo nbọ, bi 'soro tilẹ pọ,
Or'ọfẹ Rẹ to fun ọ, yo mẹru rẹ fuyẹ,
Ọlọrun f'awọn ti Rẹ,
O si nab'adura.

chorus.english:
Keep on believing, God will answer prayer,
Keep on believing, never despair
Tho you be heavy laden, and burdened down with care,
Remember God still loves you, and He answers prayer.
chorus.yoruba:
Sani igbagbọ, O ngbọ adura,
Sani igbagbọ, ma sọ reti nu,
Bi wahala rẹ po to si soro fun ọ,
Ranti pe O fẹran rẹ,
O si ngb'adura.

title.english: In Some Ways Or Other The Lord

verses.english:
