Upwards I fly,
Still all my song shall be,
Nearer, my God to Thee!
Nearer to Thee!
verses.yoruba:
Gba mba fi ayọ lọ
S'oke ọrùn
To ga ju ọrùn lọ
S'oke gíga;
Orin mi yio jẹ!
Un o sunm'Ọ, Ọlọrun
Uno sunmọ Ọ.

title.english: When Shadows Darkens My Earthly
title.yoruba: Nigba Ti Ọna Mi Ba Sokun

verses.english:
When shadows darken my earthly way,
And long dreary seems the day,
This promise sweet comes my soul to greet,
He never forgets His own.

When cherished plans all here seem to fail,
And doubt and fear my soul as sail,
'Tis then I rest on His loving breast
Who never forgets His own.
verses.yoruba:
Nigbati 'reti gbogbo ba pin,
T'iyemeji at'ẹru de,
Un o wa 'simi l'aya Ẹni ti,
Ko le jẹ gbagbe Tirẹ.

verses.english:
O no, He never forgets his own,
And dearer He has daily grown
Since that glad day when He came to stay,
He never forgets His own.
verses.yoruba:
Oun ko jẹ gbagbe Tirẹ laelae;
O se wọn fun mi pupọ,
Lati 'gbati O ti sọkalẹ.
Ti O ngbe 'nu ọkan mi.

chorus.english:
He never forgets His own,
Though friends deny there is one so nigh,
Who never forget His own.
chorus.yoruba:
On ko jẹ gbagbe Tirẹ,
On ko jẹ gbagbe Tirẹ,
Bi ọrẹ sa, On wa nitosi,
On ko jẹ gbagbe Tirẹ.

title.english: Master! The Tempest Is Raging

verses.english:
Master, the tempest is raging!
The billows are tossing high!
The sky is o'ershadowed with blackness,
No shelter or help is nigh,
'Carest Thou not that we perish?
How canst thou lie asleep,
When each moment so madly is threatening
A grave in the angry deep?'
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa, iji nja kikan,
Igbi omi ru s'oke;
Oju ọrun pẹlu su dudu,
'Ranlọwọ ko si n'tosi:
'Wọ ko bere, bi a segbe?
'Wọ y'o ha se le sun
'Gbati 'sẹju kọkan d'ẹru ba wa,
Pe omi n'iboji wa?

Oluwa, pẹl ẹdun ẹmi,
Mo tẹriba n'ironu,
Inu ọkan mi ko ni 'simi,
A! ji k'O gba mi, mo bẹ;
Igbi ẹsẹ on binujẹ
Bo ọkan mi mọlẹ;
Mo segbe, Oluwa mi mo segbe,
A! Yara k'O si gba mi.

Oluwa, ẹru ti kọja
Idakẹjẹ si ti de,
Orun f'oju han nin' ndagun,
Ọrun si wa l'aya mi;
Duro Olurapada mi,
Ma fi mi silẹ mọ;
Pẹ l'ayọ, uno d'ebute Ibukun,
Uno simi l'ebute na.

chorus.english:
'The winds and the waves shall obey My will,
Peace... Be still!
Whether the wrath of the storm tossed sea,
Or demons, or men, or whatever it be,
No waters can swallow the ship where lies,
The Master of ocean, and earth,and skies,
They all shall sweetly obey my will,
Peace, peace, be still!
They all shall sweetly obey my will,
Peace, peace, be still!'
chorus.yoruba:
Afẹfẹ at'igbi, y'o se fẹ mi;
Dakẹ jẹ,
Ibase 'binu riru okun,
Ibase esu tabi ohunkohun,
Ko si omi t'o le ri ọkọ na,
Ti Oluwa ọrun at'aye wa;
Wọn y'o f'inu didun se fẹ mi,
Dakẹ jẹ, dakẹ Jẹ,
Wọn y'o f'inu didun se 'fẹ mi
Dakẹ jẹ.

title.english: Be Glad In The Lord
title.yoruba: Ẹ Yọ N'nu Oluwa, Ẹ Yọ

verses.english:
Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice,
All ye that are upright in heart,
And ye that have made him your choice,
Bid sadness and sorrow depart.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ yọ n'nu Oluwa, ẹ yọ,
Ẹyin t'ọkan rẹ se dede;
Ẹyin t'o ti yan Oluwa,
Le 'banujẹ at'aro lọ.

Ẹ yọ 'tori On l'Oluwa,
L'aye ati l'ọrun pẹlu;
Ọrọ Rẹ bori ohun gbogbo,
O l'agbara lati gbala.

verses.english:
What though in the conflict for right
Your enemies almost prevail!
God's armies, just hid from your sight,
Are more than the foes which assail.
verses.yoruba:
'Gba t'ẹba nja ija rere,
Ti ọta fẹrẹ bori yin;
Ogun Ọlọrun t'ẹ ko ri,
Pọ ju awọn ọta yin lọ.

verses.english:
Though darkness surround you by day,
Your sky by the night be o'er cast,
Let nothing your spirit dismay,
But trust till the danger is past.
verses.yoruba:
B'okunkun tilẹ yi ọ ka,
Pẹlu isudẹdẹ gbogbo,
Mase jẹ k'ọkan rẹ damu,
Sa gbẹkẹl' Oluwa d'opin.

verses.english:
Be glad in the lord and rejoice,
His praise proclaiming in song;
With harp, and with organ, and voice,
The loud hallelujahs prolong!
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ yọ n'nu Oluwa, ẹ yọ,
Ẹ kọrin iyin Rẹ kikan;
Fi duru ati ohun kọ,
Aleluya l'ohun goro.

chorus.english:
Rejoice! Rejoice!
Rejoice in the Lord and rejoice,
Rejoice! Rejoice!
Rejoice in the Lord rejoice.
chorus.yoruba:
Ẹ yọ! Ẹ yọ!
Ẹ yọ n'nu Oluwa, ẹ yọ!
Ẹ yọ! Ẹ yọ!
Ẹ yọ n'nu Oluwa, ẹ yọ!

title.english: Simply Trusting Christ My Saviour

verses.english:
Simply trusting Christ my Saviour,
In His presence I'm so blest,
That the storms which beat around me,
Drive me closer to His breast.
verses.yoruba:
Ki ngbẹkẹle Olugbala,
L'ọdọ Rẹ mo ni 'bukun,
Ki wahala to yi mi ka,
Mu mi sunmọ ọdọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
Humbly trusting in the shadow,
When the sun is hid from view;
Not a cloud so dense and low' ring,
But His love can still shine through.
verses.yoruba:
Ni 'gbẹkẹle ojiji Rẹ,
Nigbati orun ko si,
Bo ti wu k'oju ọrun su,
Ifẹ Rẹ yo tan 'mọlẹ.

verses.english:
Ever trusting in the sunshine,
With all fear and doubting gone;
On the mountain top with Jesus,
Still 'tis better farther on.
verses.yoruba:
Gbẹkẹle imọlẹ Rẹ lae
Kọ 'yemeji at'ẹru;
Lori oke pẹlu Jesu,
Gbe ọkan rẹ s'oke si.

chorus.yoruba:
Gbẹkẹle lojojumo,
Gbẹkẹle Jesu titi,
Ohunkohun to le de,
Gbẹkẹle Jesu nikan.

title.english: Simply Trusting Everyday

verses.english:
Simply trusting every day,
Trusting through a stormy way,
Even when my faith is small,
Trusting Jesus, that is all.
verses.yoruba:
Sa gbẹkẹle l'ọjọjọ,
Gbẹkẹle l'arin 'danwo,
Bi 'gbagbọ tilẹ kere,
Gbẹkẹle Jesu nikan.

verses.english:
Brightly doth His spirit shine,
Into this poor heart of mine,
While He leads I cannot fall,
Trusting Jesus, that is all.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹmi Rẹ ntan Imọlẹ,
Si ọna okunkun mi;
L'ọwọ Rẹ, nko le subu,
Gbẹkẹle Jesu nikan.

B'ọna ba mo uno kọ'rin,
B'o ba di, uno gbadura;
Larin ewu, uno ke pe,
Gbẹkẹle Jesu nikan.

verses.english:
Trusting Him while life shall last,
Trusting Him till earth be past,
Till within the jasper wall,
Trusting Jesus, that is all.
verses.yoruba:
Gbẹkẹle titi d'opin,
Tit'aye yo fi kọja;
Ti ao si de 'nu ogo,
Gbẹkẹle Jesu nikan.

chorus.english:
Trusting as the moment fly,
Trusting as the days go by,
Trusting Him whate'er be fall,
Trusting Jesus, that is all.
chorus.yoruba:
Gbẹkẹle ni 'gbagbogbo,
Gbẹkẹle lojojumọ;
Gbẹkẹle lọnakọna,
Gbẹkẹle Jesu nikan.

title.english: Oh, The Best Friend To Have Is Jesus

verses.english:
Oh, the best friend to have is Jesus
When the cares of life upon you roll,
He will heal the wounded heart,
He will strength and grace impart,
Oh, the best friend to have is Jesus!

What a friend I have found in Jesus
Peace and comfort to my soul He brings,
Leaning on His mighty arm,
I will fear no ill nor harm,
Oh, the best friend to have is Jesus!
verses.yoruba:
Ọrẹ pataki ni Jesu jẹ,
O f'alafia kun ọkan mi,
Ni 'gbẹkẹle apa Rẹ,
Nko jẹ bẹru ibikan;
Jesu l'ọrẹ to dara julọ.

verses.english:
Though I pass through the night of sorrow,
And the chilly waves of Jordan roll,
Never need I shrink nor fear,
For my Saviour is so near,
Oh, the best friend to have is Jesus!
verses.yoruba:
Bi 'banujẹ tilẹ de ba mi,
Ti igbi Jọrdan si nyi lu mi,
Emi ko gbọdọ bẹru,
Oluwa mbẹ nitosi;
Jesu l'ọrẹ to dara julọ.

verses.english:
When at least to our home we gather,
With the loved ones who have gone before,
We will sing upon the shore,
Praising Him for evermore;
Oh, the best friend to have is Jesus!
verses.yoruba:
'Gbati a ba dele wa ọrun,
Pẹlu awọn to ti lo saju,
 Ao kọrin l'ebute Rẹ,
Ao si ma yin titi;
Jesu l'ọrẹ to dara julọ.

chorus.english:
The best friend to have is Jesus!
The best friend to have is Jesus!
He will help you when you fall,
He will hear you when you call,
Oh, the best friend to have is Jesus.
chorus.yoruba:
Jesu l'ọrẹ to dara ju,
Jesu l'ọrẹ to dara ju,
On ki yo jẹ ko subu,
Y'O gbọ 'gbati o ba pe;
Jesu l'ọrẹ to dara julọ.

title.english: When We Walk With The Lord

verses.english:
When we walk with the Lord,
In the light of his word,
What a glory He sheds on our way!
While we do His good will,
He abides with us still,
And with all who will trust and obey.
verses.yoruba:
'Gbat'a b'Oluwa rin
N'nu 'mọlẹ ọrọ Rẹ;
Ọnà wa yíò ti mọlẹ to!
'Gba t'a ba nṣe 'fẹ Re,
On y'o ma ba wa gbe,
Ati awọn t'o gbẹkẹ wọn le.

verses.english:
Not a shadow can rise,
Not a cloud in the skies,
But His smile quickly drives it away;
Not a doubt nor a fear
Not a sigh nor a tear,
Can abide while we trust and obey.
verses.yoruba:
Ko s'ohun to le dé,
L'oke tabi n'ilẹ,
To le ko agbára Rẹ l'oju;
Iyemeji, ẹrú,
Ìbànújẹ, ẹkun,
Ko le dúró, bi a gbẹkẹle.

verses.english:
Not a burden we bear,
Not a sorrow we share,
But our toil he doth richly repay;
Not a grief nor a loss,
Not a frown nor a cross,
But is blest if we trust and obey.
verses.yoruba:
Kò sí wàhálà mọ
Tabi ìbànújẹ,
O ti san gbogbo 'gbese wọnyi
Ko si aro kan mọ,
Tabi ifajuro,
Ṣugbọn 'bukun b'a ba gbẹkẹle.

verses.english:
But we never can prove,
The delights of His love,
Until all on the altar we lay;
For the favour He shows,
And the joy he bestows,
Are for them who will trust and obey.
verses.yoruba:
A kò le f'ẹnu sọ,
Bi 'fẹ Rẹ ti pọ to,
Titi ao fi f'ara wa rubọ;
Anu ti On fihan,
At'ayọ t'O nfun ni,
Jẹ ti awọn ti o gbẹkẹle.

verses.english:
Then in fellowship sweet
We will sit at His feet,
Or we'll walk by His side in the way
What He says we will do,
Where He sends we will go,
Never fear, only trust and obey.
verses.yoruba:
Ni 'dapọ pẹlu Rẹ,
Ào joko l'ẹsẹ Rẹ,
Tabi ki a ma rin pẹlu Rẹ.
Awa yo gbọ Tirẹ,
Ào jiṣẹ t'O ran wa,
Ma bẹrù, sa gbẹkẹle nikan.

chorus.english:
Trust and obey,
For there's no other way,
To be happy in Jesus,
But to trust and obey.
chorus.yoruba:
Sa gbẹkẹle,
Ọna miran ko sí
Lati l'ayọ n'nu Jesu,
Ju pe, ka gbẹkẹle.

title.english: Trembling Souls, Beset By Fears

verses.english:
Trembling soul, beset by fears,
'Thy God reigneth'
Lord above and dry Thy tears,
'Thy God reigneth'
Tho thy foes with pow'r assail,
Naught against thee shall prevail,
Trust in Him, He'll never fail,
'Thy God reigneth'
'Thy God reigneth'.
verses.yoruba:
Iwọ ọkan t'ẹru npa,
'Jesu njọba';
Woke, n'omije rẹ nu,
'Jesu njọba'
B'ogun ọta tilẹ po,
Wọn ki yio le bori;
Gbẹkẹle Jesu ki y'o kọ ọ silẹ,
'Jesu njọba',
'Jesu njọba'.

verses.english:
Join ye saints the truth proclaim,
'Thy God reigneth',
Shout it forth with glad acclaim
'Thy God reigneth'
Zion, wake! The morn is nigh,
See it break from younger sky,
Loud and clear the watchmen cry,
'Thy God reigneth'
'Thy God reigneth'.
verses.yoruba:
K'okiki otitọ na,
'Jesu njọba'
Ẹyin mimọ, gberin na,
'Jesu njọba'
Sion, ji! ojumọ mọ,
Wo bo ti la lohun ni;
Goro l'olusọ nke pe:
'Jesu njọba',
'Jesu njọba'.

verses.english:
Church of Christ, awake, awake,
'Thy God reigneth'
Forward, then, fresh courage take,
'Thy God reigneth'
Soon descending from His throne,
He shall claim thee for His own,
Sin shall then be overthrown,
'Thy God reigneth',
'Thy God reigneth'.
verses.yoruba:
Ji, Ijọ Kristi l'aye,
'Jesu njọba';
Gbe 'hamọra gboya wọ,
'Jesu njọba'
Laipe on y'o sọkalẹ,
Lati gba ọ ni Tirẹ;
A o si gbe ẹsẹ mi,
'Jesu njọba',
'Jesu njọba'.

title.english: There Is Victory Within My Soul

verses.english:
There is victory within my soul
For the spirit with me abides,
Let the waves of temptation roll,
Jesus keeps me whate'er betides.
verses.yoruba:
Iṣẹgun wa li ọkan mi,
Nitori ẹmi ngbe 'nu mi;
Jẹki igbi idanwo de,
Jesu mura lati gba mi.

verses.english:
Though the conflict be fierce and long,
Though the conflict my heart assail,
In my weakness yet I am strong,
For with Jesus I'll e'er prevail.
verses.yoruba:
Bi 'ja tile lẹ to si pe,
B'esu tilẹ b'ọkan mi ja;
Sibẹ, mo jẹ alagbara,
L'agbara Jesu, ngo ṣẹgun.

verses.english:
I have victory over sin,
I have victory o'er the grave;
Even death now has lost its sting,
Hallelujah! I know I'm saved.
verses.yoruba:
Mo ni 'ṣẹgun lori ẹsẹ,
Mo ni 'ṣẹgun lori 'boji,
Ani iku ko ni 'pa mọ,
Aleluya! Emi ti la.

chorus.english:
Victory, Victory, 'vict'ry in my soul;
I have glorious victory since
Jesus took control,
Victory, victory, sweeping like a flood,
I have glorious victory through
Jesus' blood.
chorus.yoruba:
Isẹgun! Isẹgun! 'sẹgun l'ọkan mi,
Mo ni iṣẹgun nla 'tori Jesu gb'ọkan mi,
Iṣẹgun! Iṣẹgun! Bi odo sisan,
Mo ni 'ṣẹgun la ninu ẹjẹ Jesu.

title.english: When Upon Life's Billows
title.yoruba: Nigba Ti'gbi Aye Yi Ba Yi Lu Ọ

verses.english:
When upon life's billows you are tempest tossed,
When you are discouraged, thinking all is lost,
Count your many blessings, name them one by one,
And it will surprise you what the Lord hath done.
verses.yoruba:
Nigba ti'gbi aye yi ba yi lu ọ,
To si dàbí ẹnipe gbogbo rẹ pin,
Ka ibukun rẹ, ṣírò wọn l'ọkọkan,
Iṣẹ Oluwa yo jẹ 'yanu fún ọ.

verses.english:
Are you ever burdened with a load of care?
Does the cross seem heavy you are called to bear?
Count your many blessings, every doubt will fly,
And you will be singing as the days go by.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹrú aniyan ha nwọ ọkan rẹ l'orun!
Iṣẹ t'a pe ọ sí ha sọrọ fún ọ
Ka 'bukun re, 'yemeji yo sí fo lọ,
Orin ìyìn ni yo si gbẹ'nu rẹ kan.

verses.english:
When you look at others with their lands and gold,
Think that Christ has promised you His wealth untold;
Count your many blessings, money can not buy,
Your reward in Heaven, nor your home on high.
verses.yoruba:
'Gbat' o ba nwo awọn ọlọrọ ayé,
Ronu ọrọ ti Jesu ti ṣe leri;
Ka ibukun rẹ, owo ko le ra wọn,
Ere rẹ lọrun, ati'le rẹ l'oke

verses.english:
So, amid the conflict, whether great or small,
Do not be discouraged, God is over all;
Count your many blessings, angels will attend,
Help and comfort give you to your journey's end.
verses.yoruba:
Ninu gbogbo ayidayida aye
Maṣe fòyà, Ọlọrun tobi julọ
Ka ibukun rẹ, awọn Angeli y'o tọ ọ,
Wọn yo sí ran ọ lọwọ titi d'opin.

chorus.english:
Count your blessing, name them one by one,
Count your blessing, see what God hath done;
Count your blessing, name them one by one,
Count your many blessing, see what God hath done.
chorus.yoruba:
Ka 'bukun rẹ, ka won l'ọkọkan,
Ka 'bukun rẹ, wo isẹ Ọlọrun
Ka 'bukun rẹ, ka won l'ọkọkan,
Ka 'bukun rẹ, wa ri 'sẹ t'Ọlọrun ṣe.

title.english: The Foundation Of Truth Laid
title.yoruba: Ipinlẹ Ti Jesu Fi Lelẹ l'Eyi

verses.english:
The foundation of truth, laid by our Christ,
Which the praying father grace,
Let it ever be known that on the righteous rock,
He will ever remain with us.
verses.yoruba:
Ipinlẹ ti Jesu fi lelẹ l'eyi,
Ti Baba Aladua ntọ,
K'ẹda mase rope o yẹ kuro nibẹ,
O duro le krist' apata.

verses.english:
Though the Thunder may flash, with a great roaring sound,
We the God-Sons will not fear,
When the people of world, slight the Ark of Noah,
Many perished and many destroyed.
verses.yoruba:
Bi ara nsan ẹgbagbeje ohun,
Ọmọ Jesu yio duro ti,
K'enia ma kegan ọkọ Noa,
Ọkọ refo ọmọ Jesu la.

verses.english:
Stephen was prosecuted, Peter the same,
All have drunk the cup of Christ,
So is our Father, Moses,
Let us ever be watchful and pray.
verses.yoruba:
A rojọ mọ Stephen,
A rojọ mọ peter,
A rojọ mọ Jesu Oluwa,
A rojọ mọ Mose,
K'ẹda lọ kiyes'ara.

verses.english:
Praying father prepare, to meet Cherubim,
And the Seraphim below,
God has glorified thee, in heaven,
Above by thy seat around His throne.
verses.yoruba:
Baba aladura dide d'amure,
Lati pade awọn Kerubu,
Ọlọrun ti yin isẹ Rẹ lat'oke wa,
Ade iye yio jẹ Tirẹ.

verses.english:
God of Abraham, praises all thy works
Though the worldly children slight
All the Ghost of Heaven ever rejoice
For our grace of Trinity.
verses.yoruba:
B'aiye mbu Mose, awọn Angẹli nfẹ,
Ọlọrun Abraham nfẹ,
Awọn ogun ọrun si ngbadura rẹ,
Ọlọrun Mẹtalọkan.

chorus.english:
Believers rejoice,
All Angels rejoice,
Our foundation is on the Rock of Ages,
Our foundation is on the Rock of Ages.
chorus.yoruba:
Onigbagbọ ẹ yọ,
Ẹ yin Angẹli ẹ yọ,
A fi 'pinlẹ lelẹ lori otitọ,
A fi 'pinlẹ lelẹ lori otitọ.

title.english: Come Unto Me, Ye Weary

verses.english:
'Come unto Me, ye weary,
And I will give you rest'.
Oh, blessed voice of Jesus,
Which comes to hearts oppress'd!
It tells of benediction,
Of pardon, grace, and peace,
Of joy that hath no ending,
Of love which cannot cease.
verses.yoruba:
'Wa sọdọ Mi, alaarẹ,
Un o fun yin n'isimi',
A! Ohun didun Jesu,
Ti o p'ẹlẹsẹ wa,
O nsọ, ti Ore-ọfẹ
Ati t'alafia,
Ti ayọ ti ko l'opin,
T'ife ti ko le tan.

verses.english:
'Come unto Me, dear children,
And I will give you light',
Oh, loving voice of Jesus
Which comes to cheer the night!
Our hearts were fill'd with sadness,
And we had lost our way,
But morning brings us gladness
And songs the break of day.
verses.yoruba:
'Ẹ wa ẹyin ọmọ Mi'
Uno fun yin n'imọlẹ,
A! Ohun ifẹ Jesu,
Ti nle okunkun lọ,
Awa kun fun 'banujẹ,
Ati s'ọna wa nu;
Imọlẹ y'o m'ayọ wa,
Ọrọ y'o m'orin wa.

verses.english:
'Come unto Me, ye fainting,
And I will give you life'
Oh, peaceful voice of Jesus,
Which comes to end our strife,
The foe is stern and eager,
The fight is fierce and long,
But Thou hast made us mighty,
And stronger than the strong.
verses.yoruba:
'Ẹ wa, ẹyin ti ndaku,
Un o fun yin ni iye,'
Ohun alafia Jesu
T'o f'opin s'ija wa,
Oju ọta wa koro,
Ija si le pupọ,
Sugbọn 'wọ fun wa n'ipa,
A bori ọta wa.

verses.english:
'And whosoever cometh,
I will not cast him out'
Oh, patient voice of Jesus,
Which drives away our doubt;
Which calls us, very sinners,
Unworthy though we be
Of love as free and boundless,
To come dear Lord, to Thee.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹnikẹni to ba wa,
Emi ki o ta nu
A! Ohun suru Jesu
To le 'yemeji lọ,
Ninu ifẹ iyanu,
To pe awa ẹlẹsẹ,
B'a ti lẹ jẹ alaye,
S'ọdọ Rẹ, Oluwa.

title.english: There Is A Cleansing Fountain

verses.english:
There is a cleansing fountain,
It flows from Calvary,
'Twas opened by the Saviour,
From sin each soul to free,
And now His voice is calling,
With accents, oh, so sweet,
Come to the cleansing river
Down at the Mercy-seat!
verses.yoruba:
Isun 'wẹnumọ kan mbẹ,
Lati oke Kalfari,
Oluwa si isun na,
Fun gbogbo ẹlẹsẹ,
Nisiyi ohun Rẹ npe,
Lati sọ d'ominira,
Ẹ wa fun iwẹnumọ,
Nibi itẹ-anu.

verses.english:
Though worn and heavy laden,
And burdened with your sin,
There's virtue in the river,
Oh, will you enter in?
There's healing in its waters,
There's cleansing in its stream
Then look away to Calv'ry,
Where mercy's light does beam.
verses.yoruba:
Bi ẹru ẹsẹ npa ọ,
Ti arẹ si mu ọ,
Agbara mbẹ n'isun na,
Wa wẹ n'nu isun na,
Iwosan mbe ninu rẹ,
Pẹlu iwenumọ,
Omi anu nsan titi
Lat' oke Kalfari.

verses.english:
This stream of life eternal,
For you is flowing free,
Oh, bow yourself for cleansing
And gain your liberty,
Then Christ shall be your Saviour,
And out of you shall flow,
A life of peace and heaven,
God's Paradise below.
verses.yoruba:
Orisun iye n'iṣe,
Lọfẹ l'o nsan fun wa,
Bẹrẹ, wẹ ki o si mọ,
Si gba omnira rẹ,
Gba Kristi l'Oluwa rẹ,
Y'o sọ ọ di kanga
Alafia at'ayọ,
Y'o ma san ninu rẹ.

chorus.english:
Oh! Calvary's stream is flowing,
Calvary's stream is flowing,
Flowing so free for you and for me,
Calvary's stream is flowing.
chorus.yoruba:
Isun ti nsan ni Kalfari
Isun Kalfari na nsan,
Lọfẹ lo nsan, fun gbogbo wa ni,
Isun Kalfari na nsan.

title.english: The Lord Has Treasure In Heaven

verses.english:
The Lord has treasure in heaven,
That anyone cannot know,
The One with whom He is well pleased,
Christ; Beloved of the Father
God has treasure in this world too,
Treasure that is so precious,
The Holy church of God it is
The treasure that gives Him joy.
verses.yoruba:
Ọlọrun ni 'sura lọrun,
Ti ẹnikan ko le mọ,
Ẹni ti inu Rẹ dun si,
Kristi, ayanfẹ baba,
Ọlọrun ni 'sura laye,
Isura iyebiye,
Ijọ eniyan mimọ Rẹ,
Ni 'sura ti fun layọ.

verses.english:
The Lord sends His flaming fire,
He made them useful vessels,
He put His treasure in them all,
The everlasting treasure,
The hand of God is with them all,
His glory shines from above,
And fill His church abundantly,
With the treasure of His love.
verses.yoruba:
Ọlọrun ran ina si wọn,
O so wọn d'ohun elo,
O fi 'sura Rẹ sinu wọn,
Isura titi aye,
Ọw'Ọlọrun mbẹ lara wọn,
Ogo Rẹ tan lat'oke,
O fi kun wọn lọpọlọpọ,
Isura ifẹ nla Rẹ.

verses.english:
When pass' through diverse temptation,
Still their call is eminent,
To see them holding on to Christ,
Just as the branch in the fig,
The vessels, the whole world despise
Vessels proclaim to be weak,
They are treasures of the Lord God,
That glory of the Lord shone.
verses.yoruba:
Bi wọn nkọja n'nu idanwo
Sibẹ ipe wọn daju,
Ka le ba wọn ninu Kristi,
Bi ẹka n'nu ajara,
Ohun elo t'aye kẹgan,
Ohun elo ailera,
Isura Ọlọrun ni wọn,
Ti ogo Kristi tan si.

verses.english:
Let us seek the Lord more and more,
And humble ourselves the more,
And be vessels that are holy,
That's filling with love of Christ,
We shall know His glorious vision,
We would not see ourselves,
The wonderful story we tell,
Of the One that lives in us.
verses.yoruba:
A ba le ma pongbẹ Rẹ si,
Ka rẹ 'ra wa silẹ si,
Ka jẹ ohun elo mimọ,
To kun fun Kristi nikan,
A o ri iran ogo Rẹ si,
Lai tun ri ara wa mọ,
A o so itan iyanu na,
Ti ẹni ti ngbe 'nu wa.

title.english: Sinners Turn, Why Will Ye Die

verses.english:
Sinners, turn, why will ye die?
God, your Maker, asks you why:
God, who did your being give
Made you with Himself to live,
He the fatal cause demands,
Asks the work of His own hands;
Why, ye thankless creatures, why
Will you cross His love, and die?
verses.yoruba:
Ẹlẹsẹ, ẹ yipada,
Eṣe ti ẹ o fi ku?
Ẹlẹda yin ni mbere
To fẹ ki ẹ ba On gbe;
Ọran la ni O mbi yin,
Iṣẹ ọwọ Rẹ ni yin;
A! Eyin alailọpẹ
Eṣe t'ẹ o kọ 'fẹ Rẹ?

verses.english:
Sinners, turn, why will ye die?
God, your Saviour, asks you why
God, who did your souls retrieve,
Died Himself, that you might live;
Will you let Him die in vain?
Crucify your Lord again?
Why ye ransom'd sinners, why
Will you slight His grace, and die?
verses.yoruba:
Ẹlẹsẹ ẹ yi pada,
Eṣe ti ẹ o fi ku?
Olugbala ni mbere;
Ẹni t'O gb'ẹmi yin la;
Iku Rẹ y'o j'asan bi?
Ẹ o tun kan mọ 'gi bi?
Ẹni 'rapada eṣe
Tẹ o gan or'ọfẹ Rẹ?

verses.english:
Sinners, turn; why will ye die?
God, the Spirit, asks you why
He who all your lives hath strove,
Wooed you to embrace His love
Will you not His grace receive?
Will you still refuse to live?
Why, ye long-sought sinners, why
Will you grieve your God, and die?
verses.yoruba:
Ẹlẹsẹ, ẹ yi pada,
Eṣe ti ẹ o fi ku?
Ẹmi Mimọ ni mbere
Ti nf'ọjọ gbogbo rọ yin;
Ẹ ki o ha gb'ore Rẹ?
Ẹ o kọ iye sibẹ?
Ati nwa yin pe, eṣe
Tẹ mbi Ọlọrun ninu?

verses.english:
Can you doubt if God is love,
If to all His yearnings move?
Will you not His word receive?
Will you not His oath believe?
See, your dying Lord appears!
Jesus weeps believe His tears!
Mingled with His blood they cry
Why will you resolve to die?
verses.yoruba:
Iyemeji ha nse yin
Pe ifẹ ni Ọlọrun
Ẹ ki o ha gbọrọ Rẹ?
K'ẹ gba ileri Rẹ gbọ?
W'Oluwa lọdọ yin,
Jesu sun, w'omije Rẹ;
Ẹjẹ Rẹ pẹlu nke pe,
Eṣe ti ẹ o fi ku?

title.english: Come, Oh Come

verses.english:
Come, oh come, when Christ is calling,
Linger not in paths of sin;
Sever ev'ry tie that binds you,
And the heav'nly race begin.
verses.yoruba:
Wa, nigbati Kristi npe ọ,
Wa, ma rin 'na ẹsẹ mọ,
Wa, tu gbogb' ohun t'o de ọ,
Wa, bẹrẹ 're 'je t'ọrun.

verses.english:
Come oh come, while Christ is pleading,
Oh, what love His tones convey!
Will you slight His proffer'd mercy,
Will you longer from him stray!
verses.yoruba:
Wa, nigbati Kristi mbẹbẹ,
Wa, gbọ hun ifẹ Rẹ,
'Wọ o kọ ohun ifẹ Rẹ,
Wọ o si ma sako ẹsẹ.

verses.english:
Come, oh come, delay no longer,
For th' accepted time is now,
Yield, oh yield yourself to Jesus,
And before His sceptre bow.
verses.yoruba:
Wa, mase f'akoko d'ọla,
Wa, ọjọ 'gbala ni 'yi,
Wa fi ara rẹ fun Kristi,
Wa wolẹ niwaju Rẹ.

chorus.english:
Calling now, calling now,
Hear the Saviour calling now;
Calling now, calling now,
Hear the Saviour calling now.
chorus.yoruba:
O npe ọ nisiyi,
Gbọ b'Olugbala ti npe,
O npe ọ nisiyi,
Gbọ b'Olugbala ti npe.

title.english: Come, Soul And Find Rest

verses.english:
Come, soul and find thy rest,
No longer be distress'd,
Come to thy Saviour's breast,
O don't stay away.
verses.yoruba:
Wa gba isimi rẹ,
Mase jẹ 'rora mọ,
Wa s'ọdọ Jesu rẹ,
Ma se jafara.

verses.english:
Dark is the world and cold,
Her cares cannot be told,
Come to Thy Saviour's fold,
O don't stay away.
verses.yoruba:
Okunkun l'aye yi,
Lala inu rẹ pọ,
Wa s'agb' Olugbala
Mase jafara.

verses.english:
Come with Thy load of sin,
Christ died Thy soul to win;
Now He will take Thee in,
O don't stay away.
verses.yoruba:
Gb'ẹru ẹsẹ rẹ wa,
Jesu ti ku fun ọ,
On y'o t'ẹwọ gba ọ,
Mase jafara.

verses.english:
Time here will soon be past,
Moments are flying fast,
Judgment will come at last,
O don't stay away.
verses.yoruba:
Igba ko duro pẹ,
Wawa l'akoko nlọ,
Idajọ si mbọ wa,
Mase jafara.

verses.english:
Come, O we pray thee, come,
Come, and no longer roam;
Come now and start for Home,
O don't stay away.

chorus.english:
Pray'rs are ascending now
Angels are bending low,
Both words are blending now,
O don't stay away.
chorus.yoruba:
Adura, ng'oke lọ,
Angẹl' nteri wọn ba,
Aye dapọ mọ wọn,
Mase jafara.

title.english: Come To The Saviour Make No Delay

verses.english:
Come to the Saviour make no delay,
Here in His word He has shown us the way;
Here in our midst He's standing today,
Tenderly saying, 'Come'.
verses.yoruba:
Wa s'ọdọ Jesu, mase duro;
L'ọrọ Rẹ l'o ti fọna han wa,
O duro li arin wa loni,
O nwi pẹlẹ pe, wa!

verses.english:
'Suffer the children' Oh, hear His voice!
Let ev'ry heart leap forth and rejoice,
And let us freely make Him our choice,
Do not delay, but come.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹk' ọmọde wa! Ẹ gb'ohun Rẹ;
Jẹk' ọkan gbogbo kun fun ayọ,
K'a si yan Jesu l'ayanfẹ wa,
Ẹ ma duro, ẹ wa.

verses.english:
Think once again, He's with us today
Heed now His blest command, and obey,
Hear now His accents tenderly say,
'Will you, my children, come?'.
verses.yoruba:
Ranti p'O wa pẹlu wa loni,
F'eti s'ofin Rẹ, k'o si pamọ;
Gbọ b'ohun Rẹ ti nwi pẹlẹ pe,
Ẹyin ọmọ Mi wa.

chorus.english:
Joyful, joyful, will the meeting
When from sin our hearts are pure and free;
And we shall gather, Saviour, with Thee,
In our eternal home.
chorus.yoruba:
Ipade wa yio jẹ ayọ,
Gb'ọkan wa ba bọ l'ọwọ ẹsẹ,
T'a o si wa pẹlu Rẹ, Jesu,
N'ile ayeraye!

title.english: Come Ye Weary Sinners, Come

verses.english:
Come, ye weary sinners, come
All who groan beneath your load;
Jesus calls His wand'rers home
Hasten to your pard'ning God!
Come, guilty spirits oppress'd
Answer to the Saviour's call,
Come, and I will give you rest
Come and I will save you all!
verses.yoruba:
Wa, alarẹ, ẹlẹsẹ,
Ẹyin t'ẹru ẹsẹ npa;
Jesu np'asako wa 'le,
Wa 'fiji lọd' Ọlọrun!
Ẹyin ti ẹsẹ tẹba,
Jẹ ipe Olugbala,
Wa uno fun yin ni 'simi,
Wa, uno gba gbogbo yin la.

verses.english:
Jesus, full of truth and love,
We Thy kindest word obey;
Faithful let Thy mercies prove
Take our load of guilt away;
Fain we would on Thee rely
Cast on Thee our every care,
To Thine arms of mercy fly,
Find our lasting quiet there.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu t'o kun fun otọ,
Awa gba ọrọ Rẹ gbọ,
Fi otọ anu Rẹ han,
Ko ẹru ẹsẹ wa lọ;
Awa fẹ gbọkanle Ọ,
K'a k'aniyan wa le Ọ,
K'a sa s'abẹ anu Rẹ,
K'a r'isimi l'ọdọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
Burdened with a world of grief
Burdened with our sinful load,
Burdened with this unbelief,
Burdened with the wrath of God
Lo! We come to Thee for ease,
True and gracious as Thou art,
Now our groaning souls release
Write forgiveness on our heart.
verses.yoruba:
Ibanujẹ tẹwa ba,
Ẹsẹ wa wọ wa lọrun,
Aigbaqbọ bo wa,
Pẹlu 'binu Ọlọrun;
Wo! A tọ wa fun 'rọra,
'Wọ Olotọ Olore,
Da ẹmi arẹ wa n'de,
Fi 'dariji fọkan wa.

title.english: Do You Hear The Voice Of Jesus
title.yoruba: O Gbọ Ohun Jesu t'O Nwi

verses.english:
Do you hear the voice of Jesus,
Bid you leave your life of sin?
He has offered free salvation,
If you'll turn and follow Him.
verses.yoruba:
O gbọ hun Jesu t'O nwi
Pe k'o fi ẹsẹ silẹ,
O ti mu 'gbala ọfẹ wa,
Bi iwọ ba jẹ tẹlẹ.

verses.english:
Why not give your heart to Jesus?
He who suffer'd on the tree,
He has said I freely pardon,
Take your cross and follow Me.
verses.yoruba:
Ese t'o ko f'ọkan rẹ fun
Jesu t'O ku l'ori 'gi?
O wipe, mo dariji ọ,
Gb'agbelebu, tẹle mi.

verses.english:
I will come to Thee, dear Jesus,
All my life I'll give to Thee,
I will always love and serve Thee,
O dear Lord just now take me.
verses.yoruba:
Uno wa s'ọdọ Rẹ, Jesu mi,
Un o fi aye mi fun Ọ,
Uno fẹran Rẹ, Uno sin Ọ,
Gba mi loni, Oluwa.

verses.english:
Jesus saves me, yes, He saves me,
As He promised He would do,
All the load of sin is lifted;
Come and He will save you too.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu gba mi la, O gba mi,
B'O ti leri lati se,
Gbogb' ẹni ẹsẹ li o ru,
Wa, y'O si gba o pẹlu.

chorus.english:
O, come and follow your Saviour,
Comforter gladly receive,
His voice is calling you wanderer,
Tis only to ask and believe.
chorus.yoruba:
Wa, tẹle Olugbala rẹ,
Fi ayọ gba Olutunu;
Ohun Rẹ npe ọ, asako,
Sa bere, ki o si gbagbọ.

title.english: I've A Message From The Lord

verses.english:
I've a message from the Lord,
Hallelujah!
The message unto you I'll give,
'Tis recorded in His Word,
Hallelujah!
It is only that you 'look and live'.
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa ran mi ni'se,
Aleluya!
Iwọ ni un o jẹ iṣẹ na fún;
A kọ sínú ọrọ Rẹ,
Aleluya! 
P'ẹni t'o ba wo Jesu y'o ye.

verses.english:
I've a message full of love,
Hallelujah!
A message, O my friend, for you;
Tis a message from above,
Hallelujah!
Jesus said it - and I know 'tis true!

Life is offered unto thee,
Hallelujah!
Eternal life thy soul shall have,
If you'll only look to Him,
Hallelujah!
Look to Jesus who alone can save.
verses.yoruba:
A n'ọwọ iye sí ọ,
Aleluya!
Ao fi 'ye ailopin fún ọ;
T'o ba wo Jesu nikan,
Aleluya!
Wò ó, On nìkan l'o le gbala.

chorus.english:
Look and live, 'My brother, live!
Look to Jesus now and live,'
Tis recorded in His Word,
Hallelujah!
It is only that you 'look and live!'.
chorus.yoruba:
Wo, k'o ye, Arakurin,
Wo Jesu ki o sí ye,
A kọ s'ínú ọrọ Rẹ,
Aleluya!
P'ẹni t'o ba wo Jesu y'o ye.

title.english: Return, O Wanderer, To Thy Home

verses.english:
Return, O wanderer, to thy home,
Thy Father calls for thee,
No longer now an exile roam,
In guilt and misery,
Return, return.
verses.yoruba:
Pada, asako s'ile rẹ,
Baba rẹ l'o npe ọ,
Mase alarinkiri mọ,
N'n'ẹsẹ at'osi rẹ;
Pada; pada.

verses.english:
Return O wanderer, to thy home,
'Tis Jesus calls for thee,
The Spirit and the bride say,
Come, Oh, now for refuge flee,
Return, return.
verses.yoruba:
Pada, asako s'ile rẹ,
Jesu l'O sa npe ọ,
Ẹmi pẹlu Ijọ si npe,
Yara, sa asala;
Pada, pada.

verses.english:
Return, O wanderer, to thy home,
'Tis madness to delay;
There are no pardons in the tomb,
And brief' is mercy's day,
Return, return.

title.english: Blessed Invitation From The King

verses.english:
Blessed invitation from the King of Heav'n,
Blessed invitation by the Spirit'
Falling on the weary like refreshing dew,
Whosoe'er believeth, that means you.
verses.yoruba:
Ipe t'o ni 'bukun lat'oke ọrun,
Ipe t'o ni 'bukun li emi npe wa,
O fi agbara fun ẹni ti nsare,
Eni t'o ba gbagbọ, fun ọ ni.

verses.english:
Reconciliation thro' His precious blood,
He hath wrought salvation blessed Son of God!
All the work is finished, there is naught to do,
But to claim the blessing, that means you.
verses.yoruba:
O ti l'ẹjẹ Rẹ 'yebiye se 'laja,
Ọmọ Ọlọrun ti siṣẹ igbala,
Gbogbo iṣẹ naa ti pari, o pari,
Lati gba 'bukun na, fun ọ ni.

verses.english:
Saving all who trust Him to the uttermost,
Boasting is excluded, yet in Him we boast,
Soul, receive the message, wonderful and true,
Whosoe'er believeth that means you.
verses.yoruba:
Y'o gba ẹni t'o ba gbagbọ la d'opin,
Otitọ li eyi o da wa loju,
Gba iṣẹ otitọ ati 'yanu yi,
Ẹni t'o ba gbagbọ, fun ọ ni.

verses.english:
Doubt His Word no longer, come to Him today,
Turning from your sins for evermore away;
Thro' His boundless mercy,
All shall be forgiv'n He will safely guide you home to Heav'n.
verses.yoruba:
Ma siyemeji mọ, wa 'dọ Rẹ loni
Kuro ninu ẹsẹ rẹ patapata,
'Tori anu Rẹ nla, y'o dariji ọ,
Y'o si s'amọna rẹ de ọrun.

verses.english:
There in realms of glory we will sing His praise,
With the shout of triumph thro' eternal days,
For the invitation, old yet ever new;
Glory, Hallelujah! That means you.
verses.yoruba:
Lọhun ni 'le ogo ao kọrin 'yin Rẹ,
Li hun iṣẹgun; lae ati lae,
B'ipe na tilẹ pẹ, sibẹ titun ni
Ogo, Aleluya, fun ọ ni.

chorus.yoruba:
Fun ọ ni ara fun ọ ni,
Gbẹkẹle 'leri Rẹ to daju (ara mi),
Fun ọ ni, ara, fun ọ ni,
Ẹni t'o ba gbagbo, fun o ni.

title.english: There's A Great Day Coming

verses.english:
There's a great day coming,
A great day coming,
There's a great day coming by and by;
When the saints and the sinners shall be parted right and left
Are you ready for the day to come?
verses.yoruba:
Ọjọ la kan mbọ wa,
Ọjọ la kan mbọ;
Ọjọ la kan mbọ wa, nigbose,
T'awọn eniyan mimọ at'ẹlẹsẹ y'o pinya,
Iwọ ha setan fun ọjọ na?

verses.english:
There's a bright day coming,
A bright day coming,
There's a bright day coming by and by;
But its brightness shall only come to them that love the Lord,
Are you ready for the day to come?
verses.yoruba:
Ọjọ didan kan mbọ,
Ọjọ na mbọ wa,
Ọjọ didan 'kan mbọ, nigbose,
Sugbọn didan rẹ jẹ ti awọn t'o fẹ Oluwa,
Iwọ ha se tan fun ọjọ na?

verses.english:
There's a sad day coming,
A sad day coming,
There's a sad day coming by and by
When the sinner shall hear his doom 'Depart, I know ye not',
Are you ready for that day to come?
verses.yoruba:
Ọjọ 'banujẹ mbọ,
Ọjọ na mbọ wa,
Ọjọ 'banujẹ mbo nigbose,
Ti ẹlẹsẹ y'o abo pe: 'lọ, Emi ko mọ yin ri'
Iwọ ha setan fun ọjọ na?

chorus.english:
Are you ready? Are you ready?
Are you ready for the judgment day?
Are you ready? Are you ready?
For the judgment day?
chorus.yoruba:
O ha setan? O ha se tan?
O setan fun ọjọ idajọ?
O ha setan? O ha setan?
Fun ọjọ 'dajọ.

title.english: I Was Once A Sinner, But Came

verses.english:
I was once a sinner, but I came
Pardon to receive from my Lord,
This was freely given, and I found
That He always kept His word.
verses.yoruba:
Lẹkan, mo j'ẹlẹsẹ, sugbọn
Mo ti gba 'dariji l'ọdọ Oluwa,
L'ọfẹ l'a fifun mi, mọ si ri
Pe O npa ọrọ Rẹ mọ.

verses.english:
I was humbly kneeling at the cross,
Fearing naught but God's angry frown;
When the heavens opened and I saw
That my name was written down.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fi 'rẹlẹ kunlẹ l'ẹsẹ Krist'
Mo si mbẹru 'binu Ọlọrun,
Nigbat' a si ọrun, ti mo ri
P'a kọ 'rukọ mi silẹ.

verses.english:
In the Book 'tis written, 'Saved by Grace',
O the joy that came to my soul!
Now I am forgiven, and I know
By the Blood I am made whole.
verses.yoruba:
Or'-ọfẹ nikan l'o gba mi la,
Ayọ ki l'o de si ọkan mi
A ti dariji mi mo si mọ
P'ẹjẹ Krist' mu mi pe.

chorus.english:
There's a new name written down in glory,
And it's mine O yes, it's mine!
And the white robed angels sing the story,
'A sinner has come home',
For there's new a name written down in glory,
And it's mine, O yes, it's mine!
With my sins forgiven I am bound for heaven,
Never more to roam.
chorus.yoruba:
Okọ titun t'a kọ silẹ n'n'ogo
T'emi ni totọ, t'emi,
Awọn angẹli mimọ nkọ 'rin na,
Ẹlẹsẹ kan wa le,
Tor' okọ titun kan ti a kọ n' n' ogo
T'emi ni, totọ temi,
Lẹyin 'dariji ẹsẹ, ọrun ni mo nlọ
Nko tun sako mọ.

title.english: Today The Saviour Calls

verses.yoruba:
Loni ni Jesu pe!
Asako wa,
A! Ọkan okunkun,
Ma kiri mọ.

verses.english:
Today the Saviour calls;
Oh, listen now!
Within these sacred walls
To Jesus bow.
verses.yoruba:
Loni ni Jesu pe!
Gbọ ohun Rẹ,
Ki'gba Rẹ to kọja,
Tẹriba fun.

Loni ni Jesu pe!
Sa asala,
Iji igbẹsan mbọ,
Iparun mbọ.

verses.english:
The Spirit calls today;
Yield to His power,
Oh, grieve Him not away!
Tis mercy's hour.
verses.yoruba:
Loni ni Jesu pe!
Jọwọ 'ra rẹ;
Ni'gba anu ma jẹ
K'O binu lọ.

title.english: O Do Not Let The World Depart
title.yoruba: Mase Jẹ Ki Ọrọ Na Lọ

verses.english:
O do not let the word depart,
And close thine eyes against the light,
Poor sinner, harden not thy heart,
Be saved, O tonight.
verses.yoruba:
Mase jẹ ki ọrọ na lọ,
K'osi d'oju si 'mọle yi,
Ẹlẹsẹ s'okan rẹ paya,
Gba 'gbala l'ale yi.

verses.english:
Tomorrow's sun may never rise,
To bless thy long deluded sight,
This is the time, O then be wise,
Be saved, O tonight.
verses.yoruba:
Orun ọla le saimọ,
Lati bukun okan osi rẹ,
Akoko na de, ọlọgbọn
Gba 'gbala l'alẹ yi.

verses.english:
Our Lord in pity lingers still,
And wilt thou thus His love requite?
Renounce at once thy stubborn will,
Be saved, O tonight.
verses.yoruba:
Anu Ọlọrun wa sibẹ,
'Wọ k'yo wa si'nu 'fẹ?
Kọ wa ẹsẹ rẹ silẹ,
Gba 'gbala l'alẹ yi.

verses.english:
Our blessed Lord refuses none,
Who would to Him their soul unite,
Believe, obey, the works is done
Be saved, O tonight.
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa k'yio kọ silẹ,
Bi o ba f'ọkan rẹ fun,
Gb'ọrọ na, gbọ, iṣẹ pari,
Gba 'gbala l'alẹ yi.

chorus.english:
O why not tonight,
O why not tonight
Wilt thou be saved?
Then why not tonight?
chorus.yoruba:
Ki lo se ti ko j'alẹ yi,
Ki lo se ti ko j'alẹ yi,
(Ti ko j'alẹ yi, jẹ ko j'alẹ yi,
O ha nfẹ igbala?
Jẹ ko j'alẹ yi, Jẹ ko j'alẹ yi)

title.english: My Heart Was Distressed
title.yoruba: Ọkan Mi Damu Mo Si Ri 'Banujẹ

verses.english:
My heart was distressed neath
Jehovah's dread frown,
And low in the pit where my sins drag me down,
I cried to the Lord from the deep miry clay,
Who tenderly brought me out to golden day.
verses.yoruba:
Ọkan mi damu mo si ri 'banujẹ,
Ẹru ẹsẹ mi lo mba mi ninu jẹ,
Ninu ipọnju mi mo ke p'Oluwa,
Osi yọ mi kuro ninu egbe mi.

verses.english:
He placed me upon the strong Rock by my side,
My steps were established and here
I'll abide,No danger of falling while here I remain,
But stand by His grace until the crown is won.
verses.yoruba:
O gbe mi soke, O fa mi s'ọdọ Rẹ,
O fi ẹsẹ mi mu 'lẹ bi mo ti nlọ
Ko si ohun t'o le yẹ mi l'ẹsẹ mọ,
Nipa ore ọfẹ Rẹ ni mo duro.

verses.english:
He gave me a song, 'twas a new song of praise,
By day and by night its sweet notesI will raise,
My hearts over flowing, I'm happy and free,
I'll praise my redeemer, who has rescued me.
verses.yoruba:
O ti fi orin didun si mi l'ẹnu
Orin ti mo nkọ l'ọsan ati l'oru,
Orin titun pe O sọ mi d'ominira,
Uno ma fi yin Ẹni t'ora mi pada.

verses.english:
I'll sing of His wonderful mercy to me
I'll praise Him till all men His goodness shall see,
I'll sing of salvation at home and abroad,
Till many shall hear the truth and trust in God.
verses.yoruba:
Uno ma kọrin anu to fi wa mi ri,
Titi gbogb' ẹniti'o yi mi ka yo gbọ,
Uno kede igbala yi jakejado
Titi gbogbo wọn yo wa gbẹkẹ wọn le.

chorus.english:
He brought me out of the miry clay,
He set my feet on the rock to stay,
He put a song in my soul today,
A song of praise, Hallelujah!
chorus.yoruba:
O mu mi lat'nu ira wa,
O fẹsẹ mi le krist'apata,
O f'orin kun ọkan mi loni,
Orin iyin aleluya.

title.english: We Have Heard The Joyful Sound

verses.english:
We have heard the joyful sound
Jesus saves! Jesus saves!
Spread the tidings all around
Jesus saves! Jesus saves!
Bear the news to every land
Climb the steeps and cross the waves
On ward 'tis the Lords command
Jesus saves! Jesus saves!
verses.yoruba:
Gbọ iro to gb'ọrun kan
Pe Jesu ngba nila,
Rohin na ka bi gbogbo
Pe Jesu naba nila,
Rohin na ka bi gbogbo
Loke ati pẹtẹlẹ,
Lọ ni ase oluwa
Ọlọrun gbani la.

verses.english:
Waft it on the rolling tide
Jesus Saves! Jesus Saves!
Tell to sinners far and wide
Jesus Saves! Jesus saves!
Sing yee island of the sea!
Echo back, yee ocean waves!
Earth shall keep her jubilee
Jesus saves! Jesus saves!
verses.yoruba:
Wasu na lori Okun
Pe Jesu ngba nila,
Wasu fun gbogb' ẹlẹseẹ
Pe Jesu naba nila,
Kọ ẹyin ti ngbe loke
Ati lafonifoji,
Gbe 'rọ na ka bi gbogbo
Pe Jesu nigba nila.

verses.english:
Sing above the battle strife
Jesus saves! Jesus saves!
By His death and endless life
Jesus saves! Jesus saves!
Sing it softly thru the gloom
When the hearts for mercy craves,
Sing in triumph o'er the tomb
Jesus saves! Jesus saves!
verses.yoruba:
Lọ wasu ọr'Oluwa
Pe Jesu ngbani la,
Sọ nipa 'ku Oluwa
Pe Jesu ngbani la,
Wasu ọrọ Oluwa
Jakejado agbaye,
Ọfẹ ni igbala yi
Jesu ngba ẹlẹsẹ.

verses.english:
Give the winds a mighty voice
Jesus saves! Jesus saves!
Let the nation now rejoice
Jesus saves! Jesus saves!
Shout salvation full and free
Highest hills and deepest caves
This our song of victory.
Jesus saves! Jesus saves!
verses.yoruba:
Wasu ọrọ 'luwa
Pe Jesu ngbani la,
Jẹki gbogb' aye ko yọ
Pe Jesu ngbani la,
Ọfẹ ni igbala yi
Nilẹ gbogbo agbaye,
Orin ṣẹgun wa leyi
Pe Jesu ngbani la.

title.english: A Ruler Once Came To Jesus
title.yoruba: Ijoye Kan Tọ Jesu Lọ Loru

verses.english:
A ruler once came to Jesus by night.
To ask Him the way of salvation and light;
The Master made answer in words true and plain,
'Ye must be born again'.
verses.yoruba:
Ijoye kan tọ Jesu lọ loru,
Lati bere ọna igbala oun mọlẹ,
Olukọni dahun lọna pẹlẹ pe,
'Ao le s'aitun yin bi'.

verses.english:
Ye children of men, attend to the word,
So solemnly uttered by Jesus the Lord;
And let not this message to you be in vain,
'Ye must be born again'.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹyin eniyan ẹ gbọ ọrọ yi,
Ti Jesu Kristi Oluwa wa sọ,
Mase jẹ ki ọrọ yi ko lọ lasan,
'Ao le sai tun yin bi'.

verses.english:
Oh, ye who would enter that glorious rest,
And sing with the ransomed the song of the blest;
The life everlasting if ye would obtain,
'Ye must be born again'.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹyin t'ẹfẹ wọ ibi isinmi,
Lati kọ orin t'awọn tara pada,
To ba si fẹ wọnu ilu Ọlọrun,
'Ao le sai tun yin bi'.

verses.english:
A dear one in heaven thy heart yearns to see,
At the beautiful gate may be watching for thee;
Then list to the note of this solemn refrain,
'Ye must be born again'.
verses.yoruba:
Ọkan mi npongbẹ lati ri Oluwa,
O duro lẹnu bode, O nwo mi
Tẹti ko gbọ ọrọ ti akọsilẹ
'Ao le sal tun yin be'.

chorus.english:
'Ye must be born again'
'Ye must be born again'
I verily, verily say unto thee
'Ye must be born again'.
chorus.yoruba:
'Ao le sai tun yin bi'
'Ao le sai tun yin bi'
Lotitọ ni oro na ti mo sọ pe,
'Ao le sai tun yin bi'.

title.english: The Great Physician Now Is Near

verses.english:
The Great physician now is near,
The sympathizing Jesus;
He speaks the drooping heart to cheer,
Oh, hear the voice of Jesus!
verses.yoruba:
Oniṣẹgun nla wa nihin,
Jesu abanidaro;
Ọrọ Rẹ mu ni l'ara da,
A gbọ ohùn ti Jésù.

verses.english:
Your many sins are all forgiven,
Oh, hear the voice of Jesus!
Go on your way in peace to heaven,
And wear a crown with Jesus.
verses.yoruba:
A fi gbogbo'ẹsẹ rẹ ji Ọ,
A gbọ ohùn ti Jésù,
Rin lọ s'ọrun l'alafia,
Si ba Jesu dé adé.

verses.english:
All glory to the risen Lamb!,
I now believe in Jesus;
I love the blessed Saviour's name,
I love the name Jesus.
verses.yoruba:
Gbogb'ogo fun Krist' t'O jinde,
Mo gbagbọ nisisiyi;
Mo f'Orukọ Olugbala,
Mo fẹ Orukọ Jesu.

verses.english:
His name dispels my guilt and fear,
No other name but Jesus;
Oh, how my soul delights to hear,
The precious name of Jesus.
verses.yoruba:
Orukọ Rẹ l'ẹru mi lọ,
Kò sí orúkọ míràn,
 B'ọkan mi ti nfẹ láti gbọ,
Orúkọ Rẹ 'yebiye.

verses.english:
Come, brethren, help me sing His praise,
Oh, praise the name of Jesus!
Come, sisters, all your voices raise,
Oh, bless the name of Jesus.
verses.yoruba:
Arakunrin ẹba mi yin,
Ẹ yin orukọ Jesu;
Arabinrin, gb'ohun soke,
Ẹ yin orukọ Jesu.

verses.english:
The children too, both great and small,
Who love the name of Jesus,
May now accept the gracious call,
To work and live for Jesus.
verses.yoruba:
Ọmọdé at'agbalagba,
T'o fẹ orukọ Jesu,
Le gba pe 'fẹ nisisiyi,
Lati ṣiṣẹ fún Jesu.

verses.english:
And when to the bright world above,
We rise to see our Jesus;
We'll sing around the throne of love,
His name, the name of Jesus.
verses.yoruba:
Nigba t'a ba si dé ọrùn,
Ti a ba sì rí Jésù;
A o kọ'rin yi 'tẹ ifẹ ka,
Orin orukọ Jesu.

chorus.english:
Sweetest note in Seraph song,
Sweetest name on mortal tongue,
Sweetest carol ever sung:
Jesus! Blessed Jesus!

title.english: Hear The Footsteps Of Jesus
title.yoruba: Gbọ Iro Ẹsẹ Jesu, O Nkọja Lọ Bayi

verses.english:
Hear the footsteps of Jesus, He is now passing by,
Bearing balm for the wounded, healing all who apply;
As He spake to the suff'rer who lay at the pool,
He is saying this moment 'wilt thou be made whole?'
verses.yoruba:
Gbo iro ese Jesu, O nkoja lo bayi
O ni 'tura f'agbọgbẹ, O ns'awotan arun;
Bo ti so f'alaisan ni leti adagun,
O nwi bẹ nisisiyi,
'O nfẹ 'wosan bi?'.

verses.english:
'Tis the voice of that Saviour whose merciful call,
Free offers salvation to one and to all.
He is now beckoning to Him, each sin tainted soul,
And lovingly asking 'wilt thou be made whole?'
verses.yoruba:
Ohun Olugbala ni, ipe anu Rẹ,
Mu igbala ọfẹ wa fun gbogbo eniyan
O npe gbogbo ọkan ti ẹru ẹsẹ npa,
O nfi ifẹ bere pe:
'O nfẹ 'wosan bi?'

verses.english:
Are you halting and struggling, o'erpowered by your sin,
While the waters are troubled, can you not enter in?
Lo, the Saviour stands waiting to strengthen your soul,
He is earnestly pleading, 'Wilt thou be made whole?'
verses.yoruba:
Ara nni ọ, ẹru ẹsẹ rẹ nwọ ọ l'ọrun,
O ko ha le wọnu omi ni bi o ti nru?
Wo Oluwa nduro lati fun ọ l'okun,
O si nfi 'fẹ bere pe:
'O nfẹ 'wosan bi?'

verses.english:
Blessed Saviour, assist us, to rest on Thy word,
Let the soul healing power, on us now be outpoured;
Wash away every sin spot, take perfect control,
Say to each trusting spirit, 'Wilt thou be made whole?'
verses.yoruba:
Ran wa lọwọ Jesu ka gbẹkẹle ọrọ Rẹ
Jẹ ki ẹmi iwosan ba le wa loni yi,
Wẹ abawọn ẹsẹ nu, si s'akoso wa,
Sọ f'ọkan to nwa ọ pe:
'O nfẹ 'wosan bi?'.

chorus.english:
Wilt thou be made whole,
Wilt thou be made whole,
Oh, come weary sufferer,
Oh, come, sin-sick soul;
See the life-steam is flowing,
See the cleansing waves roll;
Step into the current and thou shalt be whole.
chorus.yoruba:
O nfẹ 'wosan bi?
O nfẹ 'wosan bi?
Wa, alailera, wa;
Wa, ẹlẹsẹ wa;
Wo omi iye ti nsan,
Omi iwẹnumọ,
Wọ inu rẹ, iwọ yo si 'wosan.

title.english: Are You Weary, Are You Heavy
title.yoruba: Arẹ Mu ọ, ọkan Rẹ Poruru

verses.english:
Are you weary, are you heavy hearted?
Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus;
Are you grieving over joys departed?
Tell it to Jesus alone.
verses.yoruba:
Arẹ mu ọ, ọkan rẹ poruru,
Sọ fun Jesu, sọ fun Jesu;
Ibanujẹ dipo ayọ fun ọ?
Sọ fun Jesu nikan.

verses.english:
Do the tears flow down your cheeks unbidden?
Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus;
Have you sins that to men's eyes are hidden?
Tell it to Jesus alone.
verses.yoruba:
Asun-dẹkun omije lo nsun bi?
Sọ fun Jesu, sọ fun Jesu,
Iwọ l'ẹsẹ ti ẹnikan ko mọ?
Sọ fun Jesu nikan.

verses.english:
Do you fear the gathering clouds of sorrow?
Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus;
Are you anxious what shall be tomorrow?
Tell it to Jesus alone.
verses.yoruba:
Iwọ nfoya 'banujẹ mbẹ bi?
Sọ fun Jesu, sọ fun Jesu,
Iwọ saniyan ọjọ ọla bi?
Sọ fun Jesu nikan.

verses.english:
Are you troubled at the thought of dying?
Tell it to Jesus, tell it to Jesus;
For Christ's coming kingdom are you singing?
Tell it to Jesus alone.
verses.yoruba:
Ironu iku nda ọ lamu bi?
Sọ fun Jesu, sọ fun Jesu,
O nsafẹri ijọba Jesu bi?
Sọ fun Jesu nikan.

chorus.english:
Tell it to Jesus, tell it to
Jesus,He is a friend that's well known;
You have no other such a friend or brother,
Tell it to Jesus alone.
chorus.yoruba:
Sọ fun Jesu, sọ fun Jesu,
On l'ọrẹ ti o mọ;
Ko si ọrẹ tabi 'yekan bi Rẹ,
Sọ fun Jesu nikan.

title.english: Be Known To Us In Breaking Bread

verses.english:
Be known to us in breaking bread,
But do not then depart;
Saviour, abide with us, and spread,
Thy table in our heart.
verses.yoruba:
F'ara han wa n'ibi onjẹ,
Ma si se lọ nihin;
Olugbala ba wa joko,
Ko si ba wa jẹun.

verses.english:
There sup with us in love divine;
Thy body and Thy blood,
That living bread, that heav'nly wine
Be our immortal food.
verses.yoruba:
Fi ifẹ mimọ ba wa jẹun;
K'ara on ẹjẹ Rẹ,
Onjẹ iye, waini t'ọrun,
Ma bọ wa titi lae.

title.english: What Can Wash Away My Sins
title.yoruba: Ki L'o Le w'ẹsẹ Mi Nu

verses.english:
What can wash away my sin?
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
What can make me whole again?
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
verses.yoruba:
Ki l'o le w'ẹsẹ mi nu?
Kò sí lẹhin ẹjẹ Jesu;
Ki l'o tun le wo mi sàn?
Kò sí lẹhin ẹjẹ Jesu.

verses.english:
For my cleansing this I see,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
For my cleansing this my plea,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
verses.yoruba:
Fún wẹnumọ mi, nko ri
'Kan mi, lẹhin ẹjẹ Jesu;
Ohun tí mo gbẹkẹle
Fún 'dariji, l'ẹjẹ Jésù.

verses.english:
Nothing can for sin atone,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
Nought of good that I have done,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
verses.yoruba:
Etutu f'ẹsẹ ko si,
Ko si lẹhin ẹjẹ Jesu,
Iṣẹ rere kan ko si,
Kò sí lẹhin ẹjẹ Jesu.

verses.english:
This is all my hope and peace:
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
This is all my righteousness,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
verses.yoruba:
Gbogbo igbẹkẹle mi,
Ireti mi l'ẹjẹ Jesu;
Gbogbo ododo mi ni
Ẹjẹ, kiki ẹjẹ Jesu.

chorus.english:
Oh precious is the flow
That makes me white as snow!
No other fount I know;
Nothing but the blood of Jesus!
chorus.yoruba:
A! Ẹjẹ 'yebiye,
To mu mi fún bi nso,
Kò s'isun miran mọ,
Kò sí lẹhin ẹjẹ Jésù.

title.english: Have You Been To Jesus
title.yoruba: O Ti Tọ Jesu Lo Fun 'Wẹnu Mọ Bi

verses.english:
Have you been to Jesus for the cleansing power?
Are you wash'd in the blood of the Lamb?
Are you fully trusting in His grace this hour?
Are you wash'd in the blood of the Lamb?
verses.yoruba:
O ti tọ Jesu lo fun 'wẹnu mọ bi?
A wẹ ọ nin'ẹjẹ Ọd'aguntan?
Iwọ ha gbẹkẹle ore-ọfẹ Rẹ?
A wẹ ọ nin'ẹjẹ Ọd'aguntan?

verses.english:
Are you walking daily by the Saviour's side?
Are you wash'd in the blood of the Lamb?
Do you rest each moment in the Crucified?
Are you wash'd in the blood of the Lamb?
verses.yoruba:
O mba Olugbala rin l'ojojumo?
A wẹ o nin'ẹjẹ Ọd'aguntan?
O ha gbẹkẹlẹ Ẹni t'a kan mọ 'gi?
A wẹ ọ ninu ẹjẹ Ọd'aguntan?

verses.english:
When the Bridegroom cometh will your robes be white?
Pure and white in the blood of the Lamb?
Will your soul be ready for the mansions bright?
And be washed in the blood of the Lamb?
verses.yoruba:
Aṣọ  rẹ ha mọ lati pade Jesu?
A fọ mọ la nin'ẹjẹ Ọd'aguntan?
Ọkàn rẹ ha mura fún 'le didan ni?
Ka wẹ ọ ninu ẹjẹ Ọd'aguntan?

verses.english:
Lay aside the garments that are stained with sin,
And be washed in the blood of the Lamb,
There's a fountain flowing for the soul unclean,
Oh, be washed in the blood of the Lamb!
verses.yoruba:
Bọ ẹwù ẹri-ẹsẹ sí apakan,
K'a wẹ ọ nin'ẹjẹ Ọd'aguntan?
Isun kan sàn fún gbogbo Ọkàn aimọ,
Jọ, lọ wẹ nínú ẹjẹ Ọd'agutan.

chorus.english:
Are you wash'd in the blood,
In the soul-cleansing blood of the Lamb?
Are your garments spotless?
Are they white as snow?
Are you wash'd in the blood of the Lamb?
chorus.yoruba:
A wẹ ọ, nin'ẹjẹ,
Ninu ẹjẹ ti wẹ ọkàn mọ?
Aṣọ rẹ ha fúnfún, o sí mọ laulau?
A wẹ ọ nin'ẹjẹ Ọd'aguntan?

title.english: Till He Come-Oh, Let The Words
title.yoruba: K'On T'o De, Jẹ k'Ọrọ Yi

verses.english:
When the weary ones we love
Enter on their rest above,
Seems the earth so poor and vast,
All our life-joy overcast?
Hush! Be every murmur dumb:
It is only till He come.
verses.yoruba:
Gba t'awọn ti a fẹran
Bọ si sinmi wọn loke,
T'o jẹ pe aye wa pin,
Ti adun rẹ si koro;
Ẹ dakun, ẹ ma b'ohun
Kiki k'On to de sa ni.

verses.english:
Clouds and conflicts round us press:
Would we have one sorrow less?
All the sharpness of the Cross,
All that tells the world is loss,
Death, and darkness, and the tomb,
Only whisper 'Till He come'.
verses.yoruba:
Ibanujẹ yi wa ka,
A ha fẹ k'o dinku bi?
Gbogbo ẹru ipọnju
Gbogbo ofo aye yi,
Iku, ọfọ on 'boji
Nso jẹjẹ pe, 'K'On t'o de.

verses.english:
See, the Feast of Love is spread,
Drink the Wine, and break the Bread
Sweet memorials- till the Lord
Call us round His Heav'nly Bread;
Some from earth, from glory some,
Severed only, till He come.
verses.yoruba:
Wo tabil' ifẹ t'a tẹ,
Mu waini, si j'akara;
'Ranti didun, k'Oluwa
To pe wa s'onjẹ ọrun,
Ni lat' aye 'mi l'ọrun,
Wọn pinya tit' On fi de.

title.english: I Hunger And I Thirst

verses.yoruba:
Mo nkebi on ongbẹ,
Jesu, se onjẹ mi;
Tu jade om iye,
Lat' inu apata.

verses.english:
Thou bruised and broken Bread,
My life-long wants supply;
As living souls are fed,
O feed me, or I die.
verses.yoruba:
'Wọ akara t'a bu
Tẹ ọkan mi l'ọrun,
B'ati b'ọkan iye,
Bọ mi, ma jẹ ki nku.

verses.english:
Thou true life-giving Vine,
Let me Thy sweetness prove;
Renew my life with Thine,
Refresh my soul with love.
verses.yoruba:
'Wọ Ajara iye,
Jẹ ki nmọ adun Rẹ;
Jọ, tun ọkan mi se,
Fi ifẹ s'aya mi.

verses.english:
Rough paths my feet have trod,
Since first their course began;
Feed me, Thou Bread of God
Help me, Thou Son of Man.
verses.yoruba:
Ọna aikuna pọ,
Ti mo ti rin kọja,
Bọ mi Onjẹ Ọrun,
Gba mi, Ọm'Ọlọrun.

verses.english:
For still the desert lies,
My thirsting soul before;
O living waters rise,
Within me evermore.
verses.yoruba:
Aginju wa sibẹ,
Ti y'o m' ongbẹ gbe mi;
Ẹyin omi iye,
Ẹ ma sun ninu mi.

title.english: I Know There Is Power In Jesus'

verses.english:
I know there is pow'r in Jesus' blood
For He wash'd my sins away;
And I know there is joy in serving
Him,For He turned my night to day.
verses.yoruba:
Agbara mbe n'nu ẹjẹ Jesu,
'Tori o w'ẹsẹ mi nu;
Mo si mọ pe isin Rẹ li ayọ,
O s'ọkun mi di 'mọlẹ.

verses.english:
I know there is pow'r in Jesus' blood
From my guilt He set me free;
When I came unto Him with all my sins,
And His blood availed for me.
verses.yoruba:
Agbara mbẹ n'nu ẹjẹ Jesu,
O aba mi lọwọ ẹbi,
'Gbati mo k'eru ẹsẹ mi to wa,
Ẹjẹ Rẹ si wẹ mi mọ.

verses.english:
I know there is pow'r in Jesus' blood
For all things have been made new;
Since His own precious blood has been applied,
And has cleansed me through and through.
verses.yoruba:
Emi mọ ire t'ẹjẹ na nse,
O ti sọ wa di titun,
Nipa ẹjẹ Rẹ iyebiye na,
Mo di mimọ titi lae.

chorus.english:
There is power, power, wonder working power,
There is power, power, purifying power,
There is pow'r in Jesus blood.
chorus.yoruba:
Agbara mbẹ, agbara t'o ṣiṣẹ 'yanu,
Agbara mbẹ, agbara ti o nwẹ wa mọ,
Mbẹ ninu ẹjẹ Jesu.

title.english: The Holy Communion

verses.english:
The Holy Communion
The grace of God it is,
To eat the bread and drink the wine,
In remembrance of Thee.
verses.yoruba:
Isin 'dapọ mimọ
Ore-ọfẹ l'o jẹ,
K'a jẹ akara, k'a mu wain'
N'iranti Rẹ, Jesu.

verses.english:
The blood that flowed for sin,
We see, in this, the type,
It is a witness in our heart,
That Thou really loves us.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹjẹ ti nsan f'ẹsẹ,
L'a r'apẹrẹ rẹ yi;
Eri si ni li ọkan wa,
Pe Iwọ fẹran wa.

verses.english:
This little type of feast,
If it is here so sweet,
How sweeter still in heav'n above,
When we shall see Thy face.
verses.yoruba:
A! Eri diẹ yi,
Bi o ba dun bayi,
Y'o ti dun to loke ọrun,
N'gba t'a ba r'oju Rẹ.

verses.english:
Then we shall surely know,
That we are your symbol,
All Thy wonderful goodness ways,
Proclaim for evermore.
verses.yoruba:
Gbana ao mọ daju
P'aworan Rẹ ni wa;
Gbogb' ọna ore 'yanu Rẹ
Nkede titi aye.

chorus.english:
In remembrance of that feast
We are ga-thered today,
To show the Lord's atoning death
Until He will come back again,
Until my.......... (Until my Father's kingdom on high),
Before I.......(Before I drink with you once again),
This is our type of Passover feast.....
Time of deliverance is When,
I by faith, cling to that shed blood
I shall freedom receive
Sickness and need shall flee,
Satan's army may rise
We shall conquer them all
Thro' the blood of the Lamb,
Holy Lamb.
chorus.yoruba:
Fun rant' ẹbọ mimọ na,
Mimọ na, mimọ na,
L'awa pejọ pọ fun l'oni
Lati f'iku Oluwa han
Titi Oun y'o fide;
(O d'inu ijọba Baba mi)
Kinto tun ba yin mu;
(N'iru 'dapọ bi eyi)
Ase irekọja wa l'eyi,
Igba 'dasilẹ ni
Gba mba nf'igbagbọ rọ m'ẹjẹ na,
Ao ri idande gba
Aini, aisan yo tan
Ogun esu le nde,
A o ṣẹgun gbogbo wọn,
Nipa ẹjẹ Jesu, Ọdagutan na.

title.english: There's One Above All Earthly Friends

verses.english:
There's one above all earthly friends
Whos' love all earthly love transcends,
It is my Lord and Christ divine,
My Lord because, I know He's mine.
verses.yoruba:
Kristi mimọ, Oluwa mi,
Ifẹ Rẹ ju t'araye lọ;
Ọrẹ otitọ li O jẹ,
Mo mọ pe Oluwa mi ni.

verses.english:
He's mine because He die for me,
He saved my soul, He set me free,
With joy I worship at His shrine,
And cry, 'Praise God', I know He's mine
verses.yoruba:
T'emi ni, O sa ku fun mi,
O gba mi, O si da mi n'de,
Pẹlu ayọ ni mo nkepe,
Ogo ni fun Ọlọrun mi.

verses.english:
He's mine because He's in my heart
And never, never will we part,
Just as the branch is to the vine,
I'm joined to Christ, I know He's mine.
verses.yoruba:
T'emi ni, O ngbe ọkan mi,
A ki y'o pinya tit' aye,
Bi ẹka l'ara ajara,
Bẹni mo jẹ l'ara Kristi.

verses.english:
Some day upon the street of gold,
Mine eyes His glory shall behold,
Then while His arms around met wine,
I'll cry for joy, 'I know He's mine'.
verses.yoruba:
Lọjọ kan ni 'lu didan ni,
Oju mi y'o ri ogo Rẹ;
Nigbana uno rọ mọ l'ọrun,
Uno fo f'ayọ p'On jẹ t'emi.

chorus.english:
I know He's mine, this friend so dear,
He lives with me He's ever near,
Ten thousand charms, around Him shine,
And, best of all, I know He's mine.
chorus.yoruba:
Oun jẹ t'emi, Ọrẹ mi ọwọn,
O mba mi gbe nigbagbogbo;
Ogo didan wa yi I ka,
Ju gbogbo rẹ, Oun jẹ t'emi.

title.english: My Life, My Love, I Give To Thee

verses.english:
My life, my love, I give to Thee,
Thou Lamb of God, who died for me
Oh, may I ever faithful be,
My Saviour and my God!
verses.yoruba:
Mo f'aye at'ifẹ mi fun,
Ọd'agutan to ku fun mi;
Jẹ ki nle jẹ olotitọ,
Jesu Olọrun mi.

verses.english:
I now believe Thou dost receive
For Thou hast died that I might live;
And now henceforth I'll trust in Thee,
My Saviour and my God!
verses.yoruba:
Mo gbagbọ pe Iwọ ngba ni,
'Tori 'Wọ ku, k'emi le la;
Emi y'o si gbekele Ọ,
Jesu Ọlọrun mi.

verses.english:
O Thou who died on Calvary,
To save my soul and make me free,
I'll consecrate my life to Thee,
My Saviour and my God!
verses.yoruba:
Iwọ t'O ku ni Kalfari,
Lati sọ mi d'ominira;
Mo yara mi s'otọ fun Ọ,
Jesu Ọlọrun mi.

chorus.english:
I'll live for Him who died for me
How happy then my life shall be
I'll live for Him who died for me
My Saviour and my God!
chorus.yoruba:
Uno wa f'Ẹni t'O ku fun mi,
Aye mi yo si dun pupọ,
Uno wa f'Ẹni t'O ku fun mi;
Jesu Ọlọrun mi.

title.english: According To Thy Gracious Word

verses.english:
According to thy gracious word,
In meek humility,
This will I do, my dying Lord,
I will remember thee.
verses.yoruba:
Gẹgẹ bi ọrọ ore Rẹ,
Ninu irẹlẹ nla;
Emi o se yi Oluwa,
Emi o ranti Rẹ.

verses.english:
Thy body; broken for my sake,
My bread from heaven shall be;
Thy testamental cup I take,
And thus remember thee.
verses.yoruba:
Ara Rẹ ti a bu fun mi,
Yi o jẹ ounjẹ mi;
Uno gba ago ibukun Rẹ,
Lati se ranti Rẹ.

verses.english:
Gethsemane can I forget?
Or there thy conflict see,
Thine agony and bloody sweat,
And not remember thee?
verses.yoruba:
Mo le gbagbọ Gethsemane?
Ti mo r'ijamu Rẹ,
Iya on ogun ẹjẹ Rẹ,
Ki nma si ranti Rẹ?

verses.english:
When to the cross I turn mine eyes
And rest on Calvary,
O Lamb of God, my sacrifice,
I must remember thee.
verses.yoruba:
Gba mo ba nwo agbelebu,
Ni oke Kalfari;
'Wọ Ọd'agutan Ọlọrun,
Dandan, uno ranti Rẹ.

verses.english:
Remember thee, and all thy pains,
And all thy love to me;
Yea, while a breath, a pulse remains
Will I remember thee.
verses.yoruba:
Uno ranti gbogbo 'rora Rẹ,
At' ifẹ Rẹ si mi,
Bi o ku emi kan fun mi,
Emi o ranti Rẹ.

verses.english:
And when these failing lips grow dumb,
And mind and mem'ry flee,
When thou shalt in thy Kingdom come,
Jesus, remember me.
verses.yoruba:
Gbati ẹnu mi ba pamọ,
Ti iye mi ba ra;
Ti o ba de n'ijọba Rẹ,
Jesu jọ ranti mi.

title.english: Jesus, Thou Joy Of Loving Hearts

verses.english:
Jesus, Thou Joy of loving hearts,
Thou Fount of life, Thou Light of men
From the best bliss that earth imparts,
We turn unfilled to Thee again.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu, ayọ ọkan gbogbo,
Orisun 'ye, imọlẹ wa,
Nin'ọpọ bukun aye yi,
Laini 'telọrun, at' Ọ wa.

Otitọ Rẹ duro laelae,
Wọn gb'awọn to kepe Ọ la;
Awọn ti o wa Ọ ri Ọ,
Bi gbogbo nin'ohun gbogbo.

verses.english:
We taste Thee, O Thou living Bread,
And long to feast upon Thee still;
We drink of Thee, the fountain-head,
And thirst our souls from Thee to fill.
verses.yoruba:
A tọ Ọ wo Onjẹ Iye,
A fẹ jẹ l'ara Rẹ titi;
A mu ninu Rẹ, Orisun,
Lati pa ongbẹ ọkan wa.

verses.english:
Our restless spirits yearn for Thee,
Where'er our changeful lot is cast;
Glad when Thy gracious smile we see,
Blest when our faith can hold Thee fast.
verses.yoruba:
Ongbẹ Rẹ sa ngbẹ ọkan wa,
Nibikibi to wu k'a wa;
'Gbat'a ba ri Ọ awa yọ,
Ayọ nigbat' a gba Ọ gbọ.

Jesu wa ba wa gbe titi,
Se akoko wa ni rere;
Le okunkun ẹsẹ kuro,
Tan 'mọlẹ Rẹ mimọ s'aye.

title.english: Come Ye Yourselves Apart

verses.english:
Come ye yourselves apart, and rest awhile,
Weary, I know it, of the press and throng;
Wipe from your brow the sweat and dust of toil,
And in my quiet strength again be strong.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ wa sapakan, k'ẹ simi diẹ,
Mo mọ arẹ ati wahala yin;
Ẹ nu ogun oju yin nu kuro,
K'ẹ si gb'agbara n'nu agbara mi.

verses.english:
Come ye aside from all the world holds dear,
For converse which the world has never known;
Alone with Me, and with My Father here,
With Me, and with My Father not alone.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ takete s'ohun adun aye,
Ẹ wa fun idapọ t'aye ko mọ,
Ẹnikan wa l'ọdọ Mi on Baba,
L'ọdọ Mi on Baba, ẹgbẹ yin kun.

verses.english:
Come, tell Me all that ye have said and done,
Your victories and failures, hopes and fears;
I know how hardly soul are wooed and won,
My choicest wreaths are always wet with tears.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ wa so gbogb' ohun t'ẹ se fun mi,
So t'iṣẹgun ati t'isubu yin;
Mo mo b'iṣẹ ẹmi ti soro to,
Ade t'o dara t'on t'omije ni.

verses.english:
Come ye, and rest, the journey is too great,
And ye will faint beside the way and sink;
The bread of life is here for you to eat,
And here for you the wine of love to drink.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ wa simi; ajo na jin pupọ,
Arẹ o mu yin, ẹ o ku lọna;
Onjẹ iye wa nihin, ẹ wa jẹ,
Nihin l'omi iye wa, ẹ wa mu.

title.english: Rescue The Perishing, Care For

verses.english:
Rescue the perishing, care for the dying,
Snatch them in pity from sin and the grave
Weep o'er the erring one, Lift up the fallen,
Tell them of Jesus the Mighty to save.
verses.yoruba:
Yọ awọn ti nṣegbe, sajo ẹni nku,
F'anu ja wọn kuro ninu ẹsẹ;
Ke f'awọn ti nsina gb'ẹni subu ro,
Sọ fun wọn pe, Jesu le gba won la.

verses.english:
Though they are slighting Him still He is waiting,
Waiting the penitent child to receive
Plead with them earnestly, plead with them gently,
He will forgive if they only believe.
verses.yoruba:
Bi wọn tilẹ gan, sibẹ O nduro,
Lati qb'ọmọ to ronupiwada,
Sa f'itara rọ wọn, si rọ wọn jẹjẹ,
On o dariji bi wọn jẹ gbagbọ.

verses.english:
Down in the human heart, crush'd by the tempter,
Feelings lie buried that grace can restore;
Touch'd by a loving hand, waken'd by kindness,
Chords that were broken will vibrate once more.
verses.yoruba:
Ero ọkan ẹda ti esu te pa,
Ni ore-ọfẹ le tun mu pada;
Ọkan ti o gb'ọgbe, t'a fọwọ ifẹ,
At'inu rere soji, y'o kọrin.

Yọ awọn ti nṣegbe-iṣẹ tirẹ ni,
Oluwa yio f'agbara fun ọ;
Fi suru rọ wọn pada s'ọna toro,
Sọ f'asako p'Olugbala ti ku.

chorus.english:
Rescue the perishing,
Care for the dying;
Jesus is merciful,
Jesus will save.
chorus.yoruba:
Yọ awọn ti nsegbe,
Sajo ẹni nku,
Alanu ni Jesu, yio gbala.

title.english: Sow In The Morn Thy Seed

verses.english:
Sow in the morn thy seed,
At eve hold not thine hand;
To doubt and fear give thou no heed
Broadcast it o'er the land.
verses.yoruba:
Fun 'rugbin l'owurọ,
Ma simi tit' alẹ;
F'ẹru on 'yemeji silẹ,
Ma fun s'ibi gbogbo.

verses.english:
Thou knowest not which may thrive,
The late or early sown;
Grace keeps the chosen germ alive,
When and wherever strown.
verses.yoruba:
'Wọ ko mọ 'yi ti nhu,
T'ọrọ tabi t'alẹ,
Ore-ọfẹ yoo pamọ,
'Bi t'o wu ko bọ si.

verses.english:
And duly shall appear,
In verdure, beauty, strength
The tender blade, the stalk, the ear,
And the full corn at length.
verses.yoruba:
Yoo si hu jade,
L'ẹwa tutu yọyọ;
Bẹni y'o si dagba s'oke,
Y'o s'eso nikẹyin.

verses.english:
Thou canst not toil in vain;
Cold, heat, and moist, and dry,
Shall foster and mature the grain
For garners in the sky.
verses.yoruba:
'Wo k'y'o ṣiṣẹ lasan!
Ojo, iri, ọrun,
Yoo jumọ si iṣẹ pọ
Fun ikore ọrun.

verses.english:
Thence, when the glorious end,
The day of God is come,
The angel reapers shall descend,
And heav'n cry: Harvest home!
verses.yoruba:
Njẹ nikẹhin ọjọ,
Nigbat' opin ba de,
Awọn angẹl y'o si wa ko
Ikore lọ sile.

title.english: Workman Of God! O Loose Not Heart

verses.english:
Workman of God! O lose not heart,
But I learn What God is like,
And, in the darkest battle-field
Thou shalt know where to strike.
verses.yoruba:
Oniṣẹ Ọlọrun, dide!
Mo riri Ọlọrun
B'o ti wu k'ogun gbona to
'Wọ o ja b'akọni.

verses.english:
Thrice blest is he to whom is giv'n
The instinct that can tell
That God is on the field when he
Is most invisible.
verses.yoruba:
Ilọpo ibukun ni fun
Ọkan ẹni t'o sọ
Pe Ọlọrun mbẹ l'oju 'ja,
'Gba t'oju wa ko ri.

verses.english:
Ah! God is other than we think;
His ways are far above,
Far beyond reason's height, and reach'd
Only by childlike love.
verses.yoruba:
Ọlọrun ju b'a ti ro lọ,
Giga si l'ọna Rẹ;
Ẹni n'ifẹ ewe l'ọkan,
L'o le ri ọna na.

verses.english:
Then learn to scorn the praise of men,
And learn to lose with God;
For Jesus won the world through shame,
And beckons thee his road.
verses.yoruba:
Mase ka iyin ẹda si,
Padanu f'Ọlọrun,
Jesu jẹ r'aye nipa ẹgan,
O npe o s'ọna Rẹ.

verses.english:
For right is right, since God is God
And right the day must win;
To doubt would be disloyalty,
To falter would be sin.
verses.yoruba:
Otọ ni y'o leke dandan,
Niwọn t'Ọlọrun mbẹ,
Isọtẹ ni iyemeji;
Ẹsẹ n'ifasẹhin.

title.english: Ye Servants Of The Lord

verses.english:
Ye servants of the Lord,
Each in his office wait,
Observant of His heav'nly word,
And watchful at His gate.
verses.yoruba:
Iranṣẹ Oluwa!
Ẹ duro nid'isẹ,
Ẹ tọju ọrọ mimọ Rẹ,
Ẹ ma sọna Rẹ sa.

verses.english:
Let all your lamps be bright,
And trim the golden flame:
Gird up your loins, as in His sight,
For awful is His name.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹ k'imọlẹ yin, tan,
Ẹ tun fitila se!
Ẹ damure girigiri,
Orukọ Rẹ l'ẹru.

verses.english:
Watch; 'tis your Lord's command,
And while we speak, He's near;
Mark the first signal of His hand
And ready all appear.

Oh, happy servant he,
In such a posture found!
He shall his Lord with rapture see,
And be with honour crown'd.
verses.yoruba:
Iranṣẹ 'rẹ l'ẹni
Ti a ba nipo yi;
Ayọ l'on o fi r'Oluwa
Yo f'ọla de l'ade.

verses.english:
Christ shall the banquet spread,
With His own royal hand,
And raise that faithful servant's head,
Amid the angelic band.
verses.yoruba:
Kristi tikalarẹ,
Y'o tẹ tabili fun;
Yo gb'ori iranṣẹ na ga
Larin ẹgbẹ angẹli.

title.english: Let All Zion's Watchmen Arise

verses.english:
Let all Zion's watchmen arise,
And answer their own calls,
Let them, their own commission take,
Themselves from the Lord's mouth.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹ k'alore Sion dide,
Gba ipe fun 'ra wọn;
Jẹki wọn gba aṣẹ wuwo
Lat' ẹnu Oluwa.

verses.english:
It's a very great work indeed
For which we need watchmen
It's a burden on angel's heart
And it fills the Lord's hands.
verses.yoruba:
Ki 'se isẹ kekere ni
A nfẹ olusọ si;
O to kun angẹli l'ọkan,
O kun Jesu lọwọ.

verses.english:
They watch over one soul, for whom
The Lord left His glory
A soul who will have to be in
Eternal joy or loss.
verses.yoruba:
Wọn nsọ ọkan ti Oluwa
F'ogo ọrun 'lẹ fun
Ọkan ti yio wa titi lae
N'nu ayọ tab' egbe.

verses.english:
So, they also may see Jesus
As their Lord and Saviour
In watching their footsteps daily
Their hearts are kept for Him.
verses.yoruba:
K'awon ba le ri Jesu na
Bi Olugbala wọn;
Si s'ọkan wọn l'ojojumọ
Ki wọn le sọ fun Ọ.

title.english: Lord, Speak To Me, That I May Speak

verses.english:
Lord, speak to me, that I may speak
In living echoes to Thy tone;
As Thou has sought, so let me seek
Thy erring children lost and lone.
verses.yoruba:
Kọ mi Oluwa, bi a ti
Jẹ gbohungbohun ọrọ Rẹ;
B'o ti wa mi, jẹ k'emi wa
Awọn ọmọ Rẹ t'o ti nu.

verses.english:
Oh, lead me, Lord, that I may lead
The wand'ring and the wav'ring feet
O, feed me, Lord, that I may feed
Thy hung'ring ones with manna sweet.
verses.yoruba:
To mi, Oluwa, ki nle tọ
Awọn asako si ọna;
Bo mi Oluwa, ki nle fi
Manna Rẹ b'awọn t'ebi npa.

verses.english:
Oh, strengthen me, that while I stand,
Firm on the Rock, and strong in Thee,
I may stretch out a loving hand
To wrestlers with the troubl'd sea.
verses.yoruba:
Fun mi l'agbara: fi ẹsẹ
Mi mulẹ lori apata;
Ki nle na ọwọ igbala
S'awọn t'o nri sinu ẹsẹ.

verses.english:
Oh, teach me, Lord, that I may teach,
The precious things Thou dost impart,
And wing my words that they may reach,
The hidden depths of many hearts.
verses.yoruba:
Kọ mi Oluwa, ki nle fi
Ẹkọ rere Rẹ k'ẹ lo mi;
F'iyẹ f'ọrọ mi, k'o le fo
De ikọkọ gbogbo ọkan.

verses.english:
Oh, give Thine own sweet rest to me,
That I may speak with soothing pow'r,
A word in season, as from Thee,
To weary ones in needful hour.
verses.yoruba:
F'isimi didun Rẹ fun mi
Ki nle mọ, bo ti yẹ lati
Fi pẹlẹpẹlẹ s'ọrọ Rẹ
Fun awọn ti arẹ ti mu.

verses.english:
Oh, fill me with Thy fullness, Lord,
Until my very heart o'erflow
In kindling thought, and glowing word,
Thy love to tell, Thy praise to show.
verses.yoruba:
Fi ẹkun ore Rẹ fun mi,
Titi ọkan mi y'o fi kun
Fun tara l'ero at'ọrọ
Lati kede 'fẹ oun 'yin Rẹ.

verses.english:
Oh, use me, Lord, use even me
Just as Thou wilt, and how, and where;
Until Thy blessed face I see,
Thy rest, Thy joy, Thy glory share.
verses.yoruba:
Ko mi, Oluwa, a n'emi
Bi o ti fẹ, nigbakugba,
Titi em'o fi r'oju Rẹ,
Ti uno pin ninu ogo Rẹ.

title.english: Ye Little Ones Keep Close To God

verses.english:
Ye little ones keep close to God
In trembling and humility,
Let all knees bow down before Him,
Our Lord and Saviour and our friend.
verses.yoruba:
Ọmọde, ẹ sunm' Ọlọrun,
Pẹlu irẹlẹ at'ẹru;
Ki ekun gbogbo wolẹ fun
Olugbala at'Ọrẹ wa.

verses.english:
O Saviour, let Thy great mercy
Fill us with gratitude to Thee
And in our pilgrimage on earth
May we receive more of Thy grace.
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa, jẹ k'anu Rẹ nla,
Mu wa kun fun ọpẹ si Ọ;
Ati b'a ti nrin lọ l'aye,
K'a ma ri ọpọ anu gba.

verses.english:
O Saviour, may all evil thoughts
Be far away flung from our hearts,
And each day, give us Thy wisdom
To choose to walk the narrow way.
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa! M'ero buburu,
Jinna rere si ọkan wa;
L'ojojumọ fun wa l'ọgbọn,
Lati yan ọna toro ni.

verses.english:
In times of sickness and good health
In times of plenty or in need,
And when the hour of death shall come,
Deliver us with Thy great pow'r.
verses.yoruba:
Igba aisan, at'ilera
Igba aini tabi ọrọ;
Ati l'akoko iku wa,
Fi agbara Tirẹ gba wa.

title.english: I Want To Be Like Jesus

verses.english:
I want to be like Jesus,
So lowly and so meek,
For no one marked an angry word
That ever heard Him speak.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fẹ ki ndabi Jesu
Ninu iwa pẹlẹ;
Ko s'ẹni t'o gb'ọrọ 'binu
L'ẹnu Rẹ lẹkan ri.

verses.english:
I want to be like Jesus,
So frequently in prayer;
Alone upon the mountain-top,
He met His Father there.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fẹ ki ndabi Jesu
L'adura 'gba gbogbo;
Lori oke ni On nikan,
Lo pade Baba Rẹ.

verses.english:
I want to be like Jesus,
I never, never find
That He, though persecuted, was
To any one unkind.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fẹ ki ndabi Jesu
Emi ko ri ka pe;
Bi nwọn ti korira Rẹ to
O s'ẹnikan ni'bi.

verses.english:
I want to be like Jesus,
Engaged in doing good,
So that of me it may be said,
'She hath done what she could'.

I want to be like Jesus,
Who sweetly said to all,
'Let little children come to Me'
I would obey the call.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fẹ ki ndabi Jesu
T'o f'iyọnu wipe,
'Jẹ k'ọmọde wa s'ọdọ mi'
Mo fẹ jẹ ipe Rẹ.

verses.english:
But oh, I'm not like Jesus,
As any one may see;
Then, gentle Saviour, send Thy Grace,
And make me like to Thee.
verses.yoruba:
Sugbọn nko dabi Jesu,
O si han gbangba bẹ;
Jesu fun mi l'ore-ọfẹ,
Se mi, ki ndabi Rẹ.

title.english: One There Is Above All Others

verses.english:
One there is above all others,
Oh, how He loves!
His is love beyond a brother's
Oh, how He loves!
Earthly friends may fail or leave us,
One day soothe, the next day grieve us,
But this Friend will ne'er deceive us,
Oh, how He loves!
verses.yoruba:
Ẹnikan mbẹ t'O fẹràn wa,
A! O fẹ wa!
Ìfẹ Rẹ ju ti 'yekan lọ,
A! O fẹ wa!
Ọrẹ aiye nkọ wa sile,
B'oni dun, ọla le koro;
Ṣugbọn ọrẹ yi ko ntan ni,
A! O fẹ wa!

verses.english:
'Tis eternal life to know Him,
Oh, how He loves!
Think, O think how much we owe Him,
Oh, how He loves!
With His precious Blood He bought us,
In the wilderness He sought us,
To His fold He safely brought us,
Oh, how He loves!
verses.yoruba:
Iye ni fún wa bí a bá mọ,
A! O fẹ wa!
Ro b'a ti jẹ ni 'gbese to,
A! O fẹ wa!
Ẹjẹ Rẹ l'O si fi ra wa,
Nin' aginju l'O wa wa ri;
O sí mu wa wa s'agbo Rẹ;
A! O fẹ wa!

verses.english:
We have found a friend in Jesus,
Oh, how He loves!
'Tis His great delight to bless us,
Oh, how He loves!
How our hearts delight to hear Him;
Bid us dwell in safety near Him;
Why should we distrust or fear Him,
Oh, how He loves!
verses.yoruba:
Ọrẹ ododo ni Jesu,
A! O fẹ wa!
O fẹ lati ma bukun wa,
A! O fẹ wa!
Ọkan wa fẹ gbọ Ohùn Rẹ,
Ọkan wa fẹ lati sunmọ;
On na ko sí ni tan wa jẹ,
A! O fẹ wa!

verses.english:
Through His Name we are forgiven,
Oh, how He loves!
Backward shall our foes be driven,
Oh, how He loves!
Best of blessings He'll provide us,
Nought but good shall e'er betide us,
Safe to glory He will guide us,
Oh, how He loves!
verses.yoruba:
L'okọ Rẹ l'a nri 'dariji
A! O fẹ wa!
On o le ọta wa s'ẹhin,
A! O fẹ wa!
On o pese 'bukun fun wa;
Ire l'a o ma ri titi,
On o fi mú wa lọ s'ogo,
A! O fẹ wa!

title.english: Be Present At Our Table

verses.english:
Be present at our table, Lord,
Be here and everywhere adore;
Bless these Thy gifts and grant that we,
May feast in Paradise with Thee.
verses.yoruba:
Wa, ba wa jẹun Oluwa,
Jẹ k'a ma yin orukọ Rẹ;
Wa bu si onjẹ wa, si jẹ
K'a le ba O jẹun l'ọrun.

title.english: Blessed Jesus, Here We Stand

verses.english:
Blessed Jesus, here we stand,
Met to do as Thou has spoken;
And this child, at Thy command,
Now we bring to Thee in token
That to Christ it here is given,
For of such shall be His heaven.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu nihin l'a duro,
Lati se bi Iwọ ti wi,
Ọmọ yi, ni aṣẹ Rẹ,
L'a fi bun Ọ nisistyi;
Kristi li a fun l'ọmọ na,
Iru wọn n'ijọba ọrun.

Fun eyi a tọ Ọ wa,
Gba ọmọ yi ti a mu wa
Jẹ k'a r'ogo Rẹ nihin,
Ni anu se ni ọmọ Rẹ;
Ma si se fi silẹ laelae
L'aye ati l'ọrun pelu.

L'aye Rẹ l'ọmọ yi wa,
Isura ọwọn f'ọkan wa,
Jẹ k'adura wa goke,
Ya ibukun Rẹ l'ainiwọn,
Si kọ orukọ ti a fun
Ọmọ yi sinu 'we iye.

title.english: Do No Sinful Action

verses.english:
Do no sinful action,
Speak no angry word;
Ye belong to Jesus,
Children of the Lord.
verses.yoruba:
Mase huwa ẹsẹ,
Ma sọrọ 'binu;
Ọmọ Jesu l'ẹ se,
Ọmọ Oluwa.

verses.english:
Christ is kind and gentle,
Christ is pure and true;
And His little children
Must be holy too.
verses.yoruba:
Krist' je Oninure,
At' Ẹni Mimọ;
Bẹ l'awọn ọmọ Rẹ
Yẹ k'o jẹ mimọ.

verses.english:
There's a wicked spirit
Watching round you still,
And he tries to tempt you
To all harm and ill.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹmi ibi kan wa
To nsọ irin rẹ;
O si nfẹ dan ọ wo
Lati se ibi.

verses.english:
But ye must not hear him,
Though 'tis hard for you
To resist the evil,
And the good to do.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ ma se gbọ tirẹ,
B'o tilẹ soro
Lati ba esu ja
Lati se rere.

verses.english:
For ye promised truly,
In your infant days
To renounce him wholly,
And forsake his ways.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹyin ti se leri
Ni ọmọ ọwọ;
Lati k'esu silẹ
Ati ọna rẹ.

verses.english:
Ye are Christian soldiers,
Ye must learn to fight
With the bad within you,
And to do the right.
verses.yoruba:
Ọm' ogun Krist' niyin,
Ẹ kọ lati ba
Ẹsẹ inu yin ja,
Ẹ ma se rere.

verses.english:
Christ is your own Master
He is good and true,
And His little children
Must be holy too.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu l'Oluwa yin,
O se Ẹni re;
Ki ẹyin ọmọ Rẹ
Si ma se rere.

title.english: Faithful Shepherd, Feed Me

verses.english:
Faithful Shepherd, feed me
In the pastures green;
Faithful Shepherd, lead me
Where Thy steps are seen.
verses.yoruba:
Olusagutan mi,
Ma bọ mi titi;
Olusagutan mi,
Ma tọ ẹsẹ mi.

verses.english:
Hold me fast and guide me
In the narrow way,
So, with Thee beside me,
I shall never stray.
verses.yoruba:
Di mi mu, si tọ mi,
Ni ọna hiha,
B'O ba wa lọdọ mi,
Emi ko sina.

verses.english:
Daily bring me nearer
To the Heav'nly shore;
May Thy love grow dearer,
May I love Thee more.
verses.yoruba:
Sin mi s'ọna ọrun,
Ni ojojumọ,
Ma busi 'gbagbọ mi,
Si mu mi fẹ Ọ.

verses.english:
Give me joy or sadness,
This be all my care,
That Eternal gladness
I with Thee may share.
verses.yoruba:
K'ayọ tabi ẹkun,
Ti ọdọ Rẹ wa;
K'iye ainipẹkun,
Le jẹ ayọ mi.

verses.english:
Day by day prepare me,
As Thou seest best,
Then let Angels bear me
To Thy promised rest.
verses.yoruba:
Ma pese ọkan mi,
Ni ojojumọ;
Si jẹ K' Angẹli Rẹ,
Sin mi lọ ile.

title.english: Gentle Jesus, Meek And Mild

verses.english:
Gentle Jesus, meek and mild,
Look upon a little child,
Pity my simplicity,
Suffer me to come to Thee.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu, 'Wọ onirẹlẹ,
Wo mi, emi ọmọde;
Jọ sanu aimọkan mi
Jẹk' emi wa sọdọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
Fain I would to Thee be brought,
Blessed Lord, forbid it not
In the Kingdom of Thy grace,
Give a little child a place.
verses.yoruba:
Mo fẹ k'a mu mi t'Ọ wa:
Oluwa, mase ko mi;
F'emi ọmọde l'aye
N'ijọba or'-ọfẹ Rẹ.

verses.english:
Fain I would be as Thou art,
Give me Thy obedient heart,
Thou art pitiful and kind,
Let me have Thy loving mind.

Above all O Jesus Christ,
Let me do my Father's will,
Not to frustrate the spirit,
And Thy glory to be shown.
verses.yoruba:
Leke gbogbo rẹ, Jesu,
Jẹ nma se 'fẹ Baba mi,
Ki nma b'Emi Rẹ ninu
Ki nwa f'ogo Rẹ nikan.

verses.english:
Lamb of God, I look to Thee
Thou shalt my example be,
Thou art gentle, meek, and mild,
Thou wast once a little child.
verses.yoruba:
Odagutan Ọlọrun
'Wọ ni k'o j'apẹrẹ mi,
Iwọ tutu, 'Wọ tẹnu;
O si ti s'ọmọde ri.

verses.english:
Loving Jesus, gentle Lamb
In Thy gracious hand I am,
Make me Saviour what Thou art,
Live Thyself within my heart.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu, Ore ọmọde,
Ni ọwọ Rẹ ni mo wa;
Se mi gẹgẹ b'O ti ri,
Si ma gbe 'nu mi titi.

verses.english:
Thy praise, O Lord will I show,
I will serve Thee all my days,
The world shall see Jesus Christ
Father's holy Son in Me.
verses.yoruba:
Emi y'o fi yin Rẹ han
Uno fi aye mi sin Ọ,
Aye y'o si ri Kristi,
Ọmọ mimọ ninu mi.

title.english: Hear Thou Our Prayer O Lord

verses.english:
Hear Thou our prayer O Lord,
For the children giv'n to us,
Allot them in Thy blessing,
And joy of heav'n give to them.
verses.yoruba:
Gb'adura wa Oluwa,
F'awọn ọmọ t'O fun wa,
Pin wọn ninu 'bukun Rẹ
Si fun wọn l'ayọ l'ọrun.

verses.english:
Let their souls draw nigh to Thee,
When they are little children,
Let Thy glory be made known,
At their youthful time O Lord.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹ k'ọkan wọn sunmọ Ọ,
Nigba wọn wa l'ọmọde
Jẹ ki wọn f'ogo Rẹ han,
L'akoko 'gba ewe wọn.

verses.english:
With the blood of the Saviour,
Wash their souls and make them clean,
Regenerated to be
That they may be Thine alone.
verses.yoruba:
Fi ẹjẹ Olugbala,
Wẹ ọkan wọn mọ toto;
Jẹ k'a tun gbogbo wọn bi,
Ki wọn si le jẹ Tirẹ.

verses.english:
Now we plead for Thy mercy,
O Lord answer our request,
Our souls now rest upon Thee,
In mercy hear our requests.
verses.yoruba:
Anu yi l'a mbẹbẹ fun,
K'O si gbọ adura wa;
Iwọ l'a gb'ọkan wa le,
Ni anu gb'adura wa.

title.english: Hosanna! Raise The Pealing Hymn

verses.english:
Hosanna! Raise the pealing hymn
To David's Son and Lord;
With Cherubim and Seraphim
Exalt the incarnate Word.
verses.yoruba:
Hosana! Ẹ kọrin s'oke
S'ọmọ la Dafidi
Pẹlu Kerub' ati Seraf,
K'a yin Ọm' Ọlọrun.

verses.english:
Hosanna! Lord, our feeble tongue
No lofty strains can raise;
But Thou wilt not despise the young
Who meekly chant Thy praise.
verses.yoruba:
Hosana! Eyi na nikan
L'ahọn wa le ma kọ;
Iwọ ki o kẹgan ewe
Ti nkọrin iyin Rẹ.

verses.english:
Hosanna! Sovereign, Prophet, Priest
How vast Thy gifts, how free!
Thy blood, our life; Thy word, our feast;
Thy name our only plea.
verses.yoruba:
Hosana! Alufa, Ọba,
Ẹbun Rẹ ti pọ to!
Ẹjẹ Rẹ l'o jẹ iye wa,
Ọrọ Rẹ ni onje.

verses.english:
Hosanna! Master, lo, we bring
Our offerings to Thy throne;
Not gold, nor myrrh, nor mortal thing,
But hearts to be Thine own.
verses.yoruba:
Hosana! Baba awa mu
Ọrẹ wa wa fun Ọ;
Ki 'se wura tab' ojia
Bikose ọkan wa.

verses.english:
Hosanna! Once Thy gracious ear
Approved a lisping throng;
Be gracious still, and design to hear
Our poor but grateful song.
verses.yoruba:
Hosana! Jesu lẹkan ri
O yin awọn ewe;
