Sanu fun wa, si f'eti si
Orin awa ewe.

verses.english:
O Saviour, if, redeemed by Thee,
Thy temple we behold,
Hosannas through eternity
We'll sing to harps of gold.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu b'O ba ra wa pada,
T'a si wo 'jọba Rẹ;
A o fi fere wura kọ
Hosana titi lae.

title.english: Little Drops Of Water

verses.english:
Little drops of water,
Little grains of sand,
Make the mighty ocean,
And the bounteous land.
verses.yoruba:
Ọpọ ikan omi,
'Yanrin kekere,
'Wọnyi l'o d'okun nla
At'ilẹ aye.

verses.english:
And the little moments,
Humble though they be,
Make they mighty ages
Of eternity.
verses.yoruba:
Isẹju wa kọkan
Ti a ko ka si
L'o nd'ọdun aimọye
Ti ainipẹkun.

verses.english:
Little deeds of kindness,
Little words of love,
Make our earth an Eden
Like the heav'n above.
verses.yoruba:
Iwa ore diẹ,
Ọrọ 'fẹ diẹ,
L'o ns'aye di Edẹn
Bi oke ọrun.

verses.english:
So our little errors
Lead the soul astray
From the paths of virtue
Into sin to stray.
verses.yoruba:
Aṣiṣẹ kekeke
L'o nm'ọkan sina,
Kuro l'ọna rere
Si ipa ẹsẹ.

verses.english:
Little seeds of mercy
Sown by youthful hands
Grow to bless the nations
Far in heathen lands.
verses.yoruba:
Isẹ anu diẹ
Ta se l'ọmọde
Di 'bukun f'orilẹ
T'o jinna rere.

verses.english:
Little ones in glory
Swell the angels' song;
Make us meet, dear Saviour,
For their holy throng.
verses.yoruba:
Awọn ewe l'ogo
Ngbẹrin angẹli;
Se wa yẹ, Oluwa
F'ẹgbẹ mimọ wọn.

title.english: Jesus Called Little Ones

verses.english:
Jesus call'd little ones,
Laid them on His bosom,
And He embraced them in His arms,
And gave them His blessings.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu pe ọmọde,
O gbe wọn s'aya Rẹ;
O f'ọwọ Rẹ gba wọn mọra,
O si sure fun wọn.

verses.english:
Jesus receive this child
That we bring in Thy house,
Make him Thine own, and let him grow,
For Thy glory O Lord.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu gb'ọmọde yi,
T'a gbe wa s'ilẹ Rẹ,
Tikara Rẹ se ni Tirẹ,
K'o dagba f'ogo Rẹ.

verses.english:
O Lord, when our children
And before Thee appear,
Give children to all the barrens,
And bless us ere we go.
verses.yoruba:
Gb'awọn ọmọde wa,
Ti wọn nwa waju Re,
Si pese f'awọn ti ko ni
Sure fun gbogbo wa.

title.english: Jesus Is Our Shepherd Wiping Every

verses.english:
Jesus is our Shepherd, wiping every tear;
Folded in His bosom, what have we to fear?
Only let us follow whither He doth lead,
To the thirsty desert, or the dewy mead.
verses.yoruba:
Olusọ-agutan l'Olugbala wa,
B'a ba wa l'aya Rẹ ki l'a o bẹru,
Sa jẹ k'a lọ s'ibiti O ntọ wa si,
Iba jẹ asalẹ tab' oko tutu.

Olusọ-agutan awa m'ohun Rẹ,
Wo b'ọrọ kẹlẹ Rẹ ti nm'ọkan wa dun
B'o tile mba wa wi jẹjẹ l'ohun Rẹ,
Laisi Rẹ l'ẹhin wa awa o segbe.

Olusọ-agutan ku f'agutan Rẹ,
O f'ẹjẹ Rẹ wọn awọn agutan Rẹ,
O si fi ami Rẹ s'ara wọn, o ni;
'Awọn t'O l'Ẹmi Mi, awọn ni t'Emi'.

verses.english:
Jesus is our Shepherds; Guarded by His arm,
Though the wolves may rave in, none can do us harm;
When we tread death's valley, dark with fearful gloom,
We will fear no evil victors o'er the tomb.
verses.yoruba:
Olusọ-agutan, l'abẹ isọ Rẹ,
Bi koriko ba wa, ki y'o le se nkan;
Bi awa tilẹ nrin l'ojiji iku,
Awa ki y'o bẹru, awa o ṣẹgun.

title.english: Jesus Loves Me, This I Know
title.yoruba: Jesu Fẹ Mi, Mo Mọ Bẹ

verses.english:
Jesus loves me, this I know,
For the Bible tells me so;
Little ones to Him belong,
They are weak, but He is strong.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu fẹ mi, mo mọ bẹ,
Bibẹli l'o sọ fun mi;
Tirẹ l'awọn ọmọde,
Wọn ko l'agbara On ni.

verses.english:
Jesus loves me, He Who died
Heaven's gate to open wide;
He will wash away my sin,
Let His little child come in.

Jesus loves me, loves me still,
Though I'm very weak and ill;
From His shining throne on high
He will watch me where I lie.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu fẹ mi sibẹ si,
Bi emi tilẹ s'aisan;
L'or' akete aisan mi
Y'o t'itẹ Rẹ wa sọ mi.

verses.english:
Jesus loves me, He will stay
Close beside me all the way,
Then His little child will take
Up to Heav'n, for His dear sake.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu fẹ mi, y'o duro
Ti mi ni gbogb' ọna mi;
'Gba mba f'aye yi silẹ,
Y'o mu mi rele ọrun.

chorus.english:
Yes, Je-sus loves me!
Yes, Je-sus loves me!
Yes, Je-sus loves me!
The Bi-ble tells me so!
chorus.yoruba:
Ha Jesu fe mi,
Ha Jesu fẹ mi,
Ha Jesu fẹ mi,
Bibẹli sọ fun mi.

title.english: Jesus, Meek And Gentle

verses.english:
Jesus, meek and gentle,
Son of God most High,
Pitying, loving Saviour,
Hear Thy children's cry.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu Onirẹlẹ,
Ọmọ Ọlọrun,
Alanu, Olufẹ,
Gbo 'gbe Ọmọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
Pardon our offences,
Loose our captive chains,
Break down every idol
Which our soul detains.
verses.yoruba:
Fi ẹsẹ wa ji wa,
Si da wa n'ide,
Fọ gbogbo orisa,
Ti mbẹ l'ọkan wa.

verses.english:
Give us holy freedom
Fill our hearts with love;
Draw us, holy Jesus,
To the realms above.
verses.yoruba:
Fun wa ni om'nira,
F'ifẹ s'ọkan wa;
Fa wa, Jesu mimọ
S'ibugbe l'oke.

verses.english:
Lead us on our journey,
Be Thyself the way
Through terrestrial darkness
To celestial day.
verses.yoruba:
Tọ wa l'ọna ajo,
Si jẹ ọna wa
La okun aye ja
S'imọlẹ ọrun.

title.english: Jesus, Thou That Feedeth Thy Flock

verses.english:
Jesus, Thou that feedeth Thy flock
Like the kind and good shepherd,
Who gives to them Thy tender care
And embraces the young ones.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu, 'Wọ ti mbọ agbo Rẹ,
B'olus'agutan rere,
Ti 'sikẹ awọn to dẹra,
Ti 'ab'awọn ọdọ mọra.

verses.english:
Receive these children, we pray Thee,
Draw them to Thy dear embrace,
We have the blest assurance that
No evil can harm them there.
verses.yoruba:
Jọwọ! Gba ọmọde wonyi,
F'anu gba wọn mọ aya;
Gbangba l'o daniloju pe,
Ewu ki y'o wu won n'bẹ.

verses.english:
There, they will never go astray,
The lion will not hunt them,
And let Thy compassionate love
Be their portion all their life.
verses.yoruba:
Nibẹ, wọn ko ni sako mọ,
Ẹkun ki y'o le pa wọn;
Jẹ ki 'ronu ifẹ nla Rẹ,
Dabo wọn lọna aye.

verses.english:
In Thy green pastures up on high
Let them find a place of rest;
Let them eat the green, tender grass
And drink waters of Thy love.
verses.yoruba:
N'nu papa Rẹ oke ọrun,
Jẹ ki wọn ri 'bi 'simi,
Ki wọn j'oko tutu yọyọ,
Ki wọn m'omi ifẹ Rẹ.

title.english: Jesus Our King, Our Lesson
title.yoruba: Jesu Ọba, A Pari Ẹkọ Wa

verses.english:
Jesus our king, our lesson now is o'er,
Do not allow the devil pick it up.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu Ọba, a pari ẹkọ wa,
Ma jẹki esu sa jẹ l'ọkan wa.

verses.english:
Jesus our King, we give our thanks to Thee,
As Thou has given us the bread of life.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu Ọba, a s'ope l'ọwọ Rẹ,
T'O ti fun wa li onjẹ ọrun jẹ.

verses.english:
Jesus our King, no teaching is like Thine,
Thy testimonies are so sweet to us.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu Ọba, ko s'ẹkọ bi Tirẹ,
Ihin Rẹ dun pupọ li eti wa.

verses.english:
Jesus our King, unto Thee we shall look,
Thus Thou has taught us to do in Thy word.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu Ọba, Iwọ li ao ma wo,
O ti ko wa bẹ ninu ọrọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
Jesus our King, as we depart for home,
We pray, keep us safely under Thy wings.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu Ọba, n'ijade wa lọ yi,
A bẹ Ọ, k'O dabobo gbogbo wa.

verses.english:
Jesus our King, keep us throughout the week,
And bring us back again the coming week.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu Ọba, ninu gbogb' ọsẹ yi,
Sọ wa, si mu wa ri ọsẹ ti mbọ.

title.english: When He Cometh, When He Cometh
title.yoruba: 'Gba t'O Ba De, 'Gba t'O Ba De

verses.english:
When He cometh, when He cometh,
To make up His jewels,
All His jewels, precious jewels,
His loved and His own.
verses.yoruba:
'Gba t'O ba de, 'gba t'O ba de,
Lati si ọsọ Rẹ;
Gbogbo ọsọ Rẹ iyebiye,
Awon ti O fẹ.

verses.english:
He will gather, He will gather,
The gems for His Kingdom,
All the pure ones all the bright ones,
His loved and His own.
verses.yoruba:
Yio kojọ, yio kojọ,
Ọsọ ijọba Rẹ;
Awọn mimọ, awọn didan,
Awọn ti O fẹ.

verses.english:
Little children, little children,
Who love their Redeemer,
Are the jewels, precious jewels,
His loved and His own.
verses.yoruba:
Awọn ewe, awọn ewe,
To fẹ Olugbala;
Ni ọsọ Rẹ iyebiye,
Awọn ti O fẹ.

chorus.english:
Like the stars of the morning,
His bright Crown adorning,
They shall shine in their beauty,
Bright gems for His Crown.
chorus.yoruba:
Bi irawọ owurọ,
Wọn ns'ade Rẹ lọsọ,
Ẹwa wọn o yọ pupọ,
Ẹwa fade Rẹ.

title.english: When Mothers Of Salem

verses.english:
When mothers of Salem
Their children brought to Jesus,
The stern disciples drove them back
And bade them depart;
But Jesus saw them ere they fled,
And sweetly smiled and kindly said,
'Suffer little children to come unto Me'.
verses.yoruba:
'Gba 'wọn iya Salem
Gb'ọmọ wọn tọ Jesu wa;
Awọn ọm'ẹhin Rẹ le wọn
Wipe ki wọn ma lọ,
Sugbọn ki wọn to ma salọ
Krist ri wọn, O f'ayọ wipe;
Jẹ ki awọn ọmọ wẹwẹ tọ Mi wa.

verses.english:
'For I will receive them,
And fold them in My bosom;
I'll be a Shepherd to those lambs,
Oh, drive them not away!
For if their hearts to Me they give,
They shall with Me in glory live'.
'Suffer little children to come unto Me'.
verses.yoruba:
Em'o tẹwọgba wọn,
Uno gbe wọn mọra pẹlu;
Emi y'o jẹ Olusọ wọn,
Ẹ mase le wọn lọ;
Bi wọn, ba f'ọkan wọn fun mi,
Wọn y'o ba mi gbe 'nu ogo,
Jẹ ki awọn ọmọ-wẹwẹ tọ Mi wa.

verses.english:
How kind was our Saviour
To bid those children welcome!
But there are many thousands
Who have never heard His name;
The Bible they have never read;
They know not that the Saviour said
'Suffer little children to come unto Me'.

Oh! soon may the heathen
Of every tribe and nation
Fulfil Thy blessed word,
And cast their idols all away;
Oh! shine upon them from above,
And show Thyself a God of love,
Teach the little children to come unto Thee.
verses.yoruba:
Laipẹ, ki keferi
Ti mbẹ ni gbogbo aye
M'ọrọ Rẹ sẹ, ki wọn si ko
Orisa wọn danu,
Jọ tan imọlẹ Rẹ si wọn,
Farahan b'Ọlọrun ifẹ,
Kọ awọn 'mọ wẹwẹ lati tọ Ọ wa.

title.english: Now The Day Is Over

verses.english:
Now the day is over,
Night is drawing nigh,
Shadows of the evening,
Steal across the sky.
verses.yoruba:
Ọjọ oni lọ tan,
Orun sunmọle;
Okunkun ti de na,
Ilẹ si ti su.

verses.english:
Now the darkness gathers,
Stars their watches keep,
Birds and beasts, and flowers
Soon will be asleep.
verses.yoruba:
Okunkun bo ilẹ,
Awọn 'rawọ yọ;
Ẹranko at'ẹyẹ
Lọ si 'busun wọn.

verses.english:
Jesus, give the weary
Calm and sweet repose;
With Thy tend'rest blessing
May mine eyelids close.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu f'orun didun,
F'ẹni alarẹ;
Jẹ ki ibukun Rẹ
Pa oju mi de.

verses.english:
Grant to little children
Visions bright of Thee
Guard the sailors tossing
On the deep blue sea.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹ k'ọmọ kekere
La ala ri Ọ;
S'ọlọkọ t'ewu nwu
Ni oju omi.

verses.english:
Comfort every sufferer,
Watching late in pain;
Those who plan some evil
From their sin restrain.
verses.yoruba:
Ma tọju alaisan
Ti ko r'orun sun;
Awọn ti nro ibi
Jọ, da wọn l'ẹkun.

verses.english:
Through the long night watches,
May Thine angels spread,
Their white wings above me,
Watching round my bed.
verses.yoruba:
N'nu gbogb' ewu oru,
Jẹ k'angẹli Rẹ
Ma se olusọ mi
Lori 'busun mi.

verses.english:
When the morning wakens,
Then may I arise
Pure and fresh, and sinless
In Thy holy eyes.
verses.yoruba:
'Gba' ile ba si mọ
Jẹ k'emi dide
B'ọmọ ti ko l'ẹsẹ
Ni iwaju Rẹ.

verses.english:
Glory to the Father,
Glory to the Son,
And to Thee, blest
Spirit Whilst all ages run.
verses.yoruba:
Ogo ni fun Baba,
Ati fun Ọmọ,
Ati f'Ẹmi Mimọ,
Lae ati laelae.

title.english: There's A Path That Leads To God

verses.english:
There is a path that leads to God,
All others go astray;
Narrow but pleasant is the road,
And Christians love the way.
verses.yoruba:
Ọna kan lo ntọka s'ọrun,
Isina ni 'yoku,
Hiha si l'oju ọna na,
Awọn Kristian lo fẹ.

verses.english:
It leads straight through this world of sin,
And dangers must be pass'd;
But those who boldly walk therein,
Will get to heav'n at last.
verses.yoruba:
Lat'aye o lọ tarata,
O si la ewu lọ;
Awọn ti nfi 'gboya rin in,
Yo d'ọrun nikẹhin.

verses.english:
How shall an infant pilgrim dare
This dangerous path to tread?
For on the way's many a snare
For youthful travellers spread.
verses.yoruba:
Awọn ewe yo ha ti se
Le la ewu yi ja;
'Tori idẹkun pọ l'ọna
F'awọn ọdọmọde.

verses.english:
While the broad road, where thousands go,
Lies near and opens fair;
And many turn aside,
I know, To walk with sinners there.
verses.yoruba:
Gbigboro l'ọna t'ọpọ nrin
O si tẹju pẹlu,
Mo si mọ pe lati d'ẹsẹ
Ni wọn se nrin nibẹ.

verses.english:
But lest my feeble steps should slide,
Or wander from Thy way,
Lord,condescend to be my guide,
And I shall never stray.
verses.yoruba:
Sugbọn kẹsẹ mi ma ba yẹ,
Ki nma si sako lọ;
Oluwa jọ s'olutọ mi,
Emi ki o sina.

verses.english:
Then I may go without alarm
And trust His word of old
'The lambs, He'll gather with His arm,
And lead them to the fold'.
verses.yoruba:
Nje mo le lọ laisi 'foya,
Ki nabẹkẹl' ọrọ Rẹ,
Apa Rẹ y'o s'agutan Rẹ,
Y'O si ko wọn dele.

verses.english:
Thus I may safely venture through
Beneath my Shepherd's care;
And keep the gate of heav'n in view,
Till I shall enter there.
verses.yoruba:
Bẹni uno la ewu yi ja
Nipa itọju Rẹ;
Uno tẹjumọ 'bode ọrun
Titi uno fi wọle.

title.english: There's A Friend For Little Children

verses.english:
There's a friend for little children
Above the bright blue sky;
A friend who never changes
Whose love can never die
Unlike our friends by nature,
Who change with changing years,
This friend is always worthy
The precious name he bears.

There's a rest for little children
Above the bright blue sky
For those who love the Saviour,
And Abba father cry
A rest from every trouble
From sin and danger free,
Where every little pilgrim
Shall rest eternally.
verses.yoruba:
Isimi kan mbẹ f'ọmọde,
Loke ọrun lọhun;
F'awọn to f'Olugbala
Ti nke 'Aba Baba'
'Simi lọwọ iyọnu,
Lọw' ẹsẹ at'ewu;
Nibi awọn ọmọde
Yo simi titi lae

verses.english:
There's a home for little children
Above the bright blue sky
Where Jesus reigns in glory;
A home on peace and joy,
No home on earth is like it
Nor can with it compare
For every one is happy
Nor can be happier there.

There's a crown for little children
Above the bright blue sky,
And all who look to Jesus
Shall wear it by and by
A crown of brightest glory
Which he will then bestow
On those who found his favour,
And loved him here below.
verses.yoruba:
Ade kan mbẹ fun ọmọde
Loke ọrun lohun;
Eni t'o ba nwo Jesu,
Y'o ri ade na de;
Ade to l'ogo julo
Ti y o fi fun gbogbo
Awọn t'o wa oju Rẹ
Ti wọn si fe nihin.

verses.english:
There's a song for little children
Above the bright blue sky
A song that will not weary
Though sung continually;
A song which even angels
Can never, never sing,
They know not Christ as Saviour
But worship him as king.
verses.yoruba:
Orin kan mbẹ fun ọmọde
Loke ọrun lọhun;
Orin ti ko le su ni,
B'o ti wu k'a kọ to!
Orin t'awọn angẹli
Ko ni le ri ko titi;
Krist' ki s'Olugbala wọn
Ọba l'o jẹ fun wọn.

verses.english:
There's a robe for little children
Above the bright blue sky,
A harp of sweetest music,
A palm of victory
All, all above is treasured,
And found in Christ alone
Oh, come, dear little children
That all may be your own.

title.english: Jesus Do Manifest Thyself

verses.english:
Jesus do manifest Thyself
At this matrimony,
We beseech Thee to come,
O Lord Reveal Thyself to us.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu Farahan nitotọ
Nibi ase yawo
Oluwa, awa bẹ Ọ, wa
F'ara Rẹ han nihin.

verses.english:
Pour Thy blessings upon these ones
Whose hands are joined in one,
Look down in favour of their match,
And bless this their union.
verses.yoruba:
Fi ibukun Rẹ fun awọn
Ti o da 'wọpọ yi;
F'oju rere wo 'dapọ wọn,
Si bukun ẹgbẹ wọn.

verses.english:
Fill both their bosoms with Thy love
Give to them contentment,
Give them Thy peace O Lord, we pray,
And supply all their needs.
verses.yoruba:
F'ẹbun ifẹ kun aya wọn,
Fun wọn ni 'tẹlọrun;
Fi alafia Rẹ fun wọn,
Si busi ini wọn.

verses.english:
Through Thy perfect love, make them one,
That they, may by Christ's love,
Make domestic cares become light
By helping each other.
verses.yoruba:
F'ifẹ mimọ sọ wọn d'ọkan
Ki wọn f'ifẹ Kristi
Mu aniyan ile fere;
Nipa ajumọse.

verses.english:
Let them be help to each other
In matters of their faith,
And bless thou them with good children,
Who will establish their home.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹ ki wọn ran 'ra wọn lọwọ
Ninu igbagbọ wọn;
Ki wọn si ni ọmọ rere,
Ti y'o gbe le wọn ro.

title.english: For In Cana Of Galilee

verses.english:
For in Cana of Galilee,
At that blest marriage feast,
Jesus was present in that place,
And His disciples too.
verses.yoruba:
N'ilu Kana ti Galili,
Nib' ase'gbeyawo,
Jesu f'ara Rẹ han nibẹ,
Pẹl' awọn 'mọ-ẹhin.

verses.english:
Jesus, reveal Thyself we pray,
At this holy wedding,
And bestow all of Thy blessing,
Upon husband and wife.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu ma sai f'ara Rẹ han
Nibi 'gbeyawo yi,
K'o si fi ibukun Rẹ fun
Ọkọ ati aya.

verses.english:
Let them both be in fellowship
All the days of their life,
Let Thy divine love be the tie
That the world cannot break.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹki wọn le wa n'irẹpọ,
Ni ọjọ aye wọn;
K'ifẹ at'ọrun wa sọ wọn,
K'aye ma le ja wọn.

verses.english:
That they may one another help
By working together,
Grant them Thy peace, O Lord, we pray,
And true satisfaction.
verses.yoruba:
Ki wọn ma ran 'ra wọn lọwọ
Nipa ajumọse;
Fi alafia Rẹ kun wọn,
Fun wọn n'itẹlọrun.

verses.english:
Like the first blessings
Thou gave in The garden of Eden,
That they may go and multiply
Until their lives shall end.
verses.yoruba:
Gẹgẹ b'ire ọjọ kini,
Ni ọgba Ẹdẹni
Ki wọn ma bi, ki wọn ma rẹ,
Tit' opin ẹmi wọn.

title.english: O Perfect Love

verses.english:
O perfect Love, all human thought transcending,
Lowly we kneel in pray'r before Thy throne,
That theirs may be the love which knows no ending,
Whom Thou for evermore dost join in one.
verses.yoruba:
Ifẹ pipe, t'o tayọ ero ẹda,
Niwaju Rẹ l'a wolẹ l'adura
Pe, ki ifẹ ailopin le jẹ t'awọn
Ti Iwọ so d'ọkan titi aye.

verses.english:
O perfect Life, be Thou their full assurance,
Of tender charity and steadfast faith,
Of patient hope, and quiet brave endurance,
With childlike trust that fears nor pain nor death.
verses.yoruba:
Iye pipe, ma jẹ igbẹkẹlẹ wọn
Fun ifẹ on igbagbọ ododo;
Fun ireti on ẹmi ifarada,
Pẹlu 'fọkantan lai bẹru iku.

verses.english:
Grant them the joy which brightens earthly sorrow,
Grant them the peace which calms all earthly strife,
And to life's day the glorious unknown morrow,
That dawns upon eternal love and life.
verses.yoruba:
Fun wọn l'ayọ ti bori ibanujẹ,
Fun wọn l'alafia ti nm'aye dun,
Titi owurọ ologo y'o fi mọ;
Ọjọ ifẹ on iye allopin.

title.english: Rest In The Lord-From Harps Above

verses.english:
Rest in the Lord-from harps above,
The music seems to thrill
Rest in His everlasting love
Rest and be still.

Rest thou, who claimest for thine own,
Thy chosen bride today,
Affianced in His faith alone
Thy bride for aye.
verses.yoruba:
Simi, Iwọ ọkọ t'o gbe
Iyawo rẹ loni;
Ninu Jesu, yawo rẹ ni
Titi aye.

verses.english:
And thou, whose trustful hand is given,
Avouching here thy spouse,
Rest, for a Father seals in heaven
His children's vows.
verses.yoruba:
At' iwọ ta fa ọwọ rẹ
F'ọkọ n'nu ile yi;
Simi, Baba f'edidi Rẹ
Si ẹjẹ yin.

verses.english:
Rest ye, who cluster round them both,
To mingle praise and prayers;
Your God affirms the plighted troth,
Your God and theirs.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ simi ẹyin ọrẹ wọn,
T'ẹ wa ba wọn pejọ;
Ọlọrun wọn ati ti yin
Gba ohun wọn.

verses.english:
Rest for the Heav'nly Bridegroom here
Is standing by your side,
And in this union draws more near
His mystic bride.
verses.yoruba:
Simi; Jesu ọkọ Ijọ
Duro ti yin nihin;
Ninu idapọ yin, O nfa
Ijọ mọra.

verses.english:
Rest in the Lord-thrice Holy Dove,
In us Thy word fulfil,
Rest in His everlasting love,
Rest and be still.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹ simi Adaba mimọ,
M'ọrọ Rẹ se n'nu wa,
Simi le 'fẹ Rẹ ailopin;
Si duro Jẹ.

title.english: O Father, All-Creating

verses.english:
O Father, all-creating,
Whose wisdom and Whose pow'r
First bound two lives together
In Eden's primal hour;
Today to these Thy children
Thine earliest gift renew;
A home by Thee made blessed,
A love by Thee kept true.

O Saviour, Guest most bounteous
Of old in Galilee,
Vouchsafe to-day Thy presence,
With these who wait on Thee;
Their store of earthly gladness
Transform to heav'nly wine,
And teach them, in the tasting,
To know the gift is Thine.
verses.yoruba:
N'igbeyawo Galili,
Iwọ ba wọn pejọ
Jọ, sọkalẹ s'arin wa,
Bukun ọkọ, aya;
Sọ ikoro di adun,
Sọ ẹkun di ẹrin;
Kọ wọn lati mọ Ọ ni
Oniṣẹ iyanu.

verses.english:
O Spirit of the Father,
Breathe on them from above,
So searching in Thy pureness,
So tender in Thy love;
That guarded by Thy presence,
From sin and strife kept free,
Their lives may own Thy guidance
Their hearts be ruled by Thee.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹmi Ọrun alaye,
Mi si wọn lat'oke;
Fun wọn ni iwa-mimọ,
Fun wọn n'ifẹ pipe,
Jọ, ma se amọna wọn,
Ki wọn le sa f'ẹsẹ
Se akoso aye wọn,
Ki wọn le dabi Rẹ.

verses.english:
Except Thou build it, Father,
The house is built in vain;
Except Thou, Lord, sustain it,
The joy will turn to pain:
But nought can break the union
Of hearts in Thee made one,
And love which Thou hast hallowed,
Is endless love begun.

title.english: The Voice That Breathed O'er Eden

verses.english:
The voice that breathed o' er Eden
That earliest wedding-day,
The primal marriage blessing,
It hath not passed away.
verses.yoruba:
Ire t'a su ni Eden
N'igbeyawo 'kini;
Ibukun t'a bukun wọn
O wa sibẹ-sibẹ.

verses.english:
Still in the pure espousal
Of Christian man and maid
The Holy Three are with us,
The threefold grace is said.
verses.yoruba:
Sibẹ titi di oni
N'igbeyawo Kristiani:
Ọlọrun wa l'arin wa,
Lati sure fun wa.

verses.english:
For dower of blessed children,
For love and faith's sweet sake,
For high mysterious union
Which nought on earth may break.
verses.yoruba:
Ire ki wọn le ma bi
Ki wọn ko si ma rẹ;
Ki wọn ni 'dapọ mimọ
T'ẹnikan k'yo le tu.

verses.english:
Be present, heav'nly Father,
To give away this bride,
As Eve Thou gav'st to Adam
Out of his own pierced side.
verses.yoruba:
Ba wa pe, Baba ọrun,
F'obirin yi f'ọkọ;
Bi O ti fi Efa fun
Adam l'ọjọ kini.

verses.english:
Be present, gracious Saviour,
To join their loving hands,
As Thou didst bind two natures
In Thine eternal bands.

Be present, Holy Spirit,
To bless them as they kneel,
As Thou for Christ the Bridegroom
The heav'nly spouse dost seal.

O spread Thy pure wings o'er them!
Let no ill pow'r find place,
When onward through life's journey
The hallow'd path they trace.
verses.yoruba:
Fi wọn s'abẹ abo Rẹ
K'ibi kan ma ba wọn;
'Gba wọn para ile Rẹ
Ma tọju ọkan wọn.

verses.english:
To cast their crowns before Thee,
In perfect sacrifice,
Till to the home of gladness
With Christ's own bride they rise.
verses.yoruba:
Pẹlu wọn lọj'aye wọn
At'ọkọ at'aya;
Titi wọn o d'ọdọ Rẹ
N'ile ayọ l'ọrun.

title.english: O Lord Put Thy Seal Upon

verses.english:
O Lord, put Thy seal upon
This wedlock that we witness
In Thy honour, meet with us
Bless their promises of love
Make this fellowship holy
For them and also with Thee.

Thou wert present in Cana
In a marriage, just as this
Meet with us while we are here
Thou, the fountain of blessings
Adorn this marriage with joy
Such as the world cannot give.
verses.yoruba:
'Wọ farahan ni Kana
N'igbeyawo bi eyi;
Ba wa pade nihinyi,
'Wọ orisun ibukun!
Fi ayọ t'aye ko ni
Se 'gbeyawo yi l'ọsọ.

verses.english:
Not for miracle we ask
Such as water be made wine
But all of our heart desire
Is that we taste of Thy love
May Thy pow'r divine, we pray
Make holy our natural love.

O Lord, from today onward
Husband and wife let us be
How ever long it may be
To the very end with Thee
In the land of rest above
In Thy home high up in heav'n.
verses.yoruba:
Lat' oni lọ, Oluwa,
Jẹk' ajo t'ọkọ t'aya,
B'o tile wu k'o gun to,
De opin li ọdọ Rẹ;
Ni ile isimi ni,
Ni ile Rẹ li ọrun.

title.english: God Give Us Christian Homes

verses.english:
God give us Christian homes!
Homes where the Bible is loved and taught,
Homes where the master's will is sought,
Homes crowned with beauty Thy love hath wrought,
God give us Christian homes,
God give us Christian homes.
verses.yoruba:
Fun wa ni'le Kristian,
Ile ti nwọn nkẹkọ Bibeli,
Ile ti wọn nse 'fẹ Oluwa,
Ile ti ẹwa Oluwa ngbe,
Fun wa ni'le Kristian,
Fun wa ni'le Kristian.

verses.english:
God give us Christian homes!
Homes where the father is true and strong,
Homes that are free from the blight of wrong,
Homes that are joyous with love and song,
God give us Christian homes,
God give us Christian homes.
verses.yoruba:
Fun wa ni'le Kristian,
Ile ti 'fẹ Ọlọrun njọba
Ile ti ko si aisedede,
Ile ti ayọ ko lafiwe
Fun wa ni'le Kristian,
Fun wa ni'le Kristian.

verses.english:
God give us Christian homes!
Homes where the mother in queenly quest,
Strives to show others thy way is best,
Homes where the Lord is an honoured guest,
God give us Christian homes,
God give us Christian homes.
verses.yoruba:
Fun wa ni'le Kristian,
Ile ti'ya nteriba f'ọkọ,
Ile ti ntọka Jesu f'aye,
Ile ti Kristi ti jẹ Ori,
Fun wa ni'le Kristian,
Fun wa ni'le Kristian.

verses.english:
God give us Christian homes!
Homes where the children are led to know,
Christ in His beauty who loves them so,
Homes where the alter fire burn and glow,
God give us Christian homes,
God give us Christian homes.
verses.yoruba:
Fun wa ni'le Kristian,
Ile ti ifẹ Kristi leke,
Ile ti ẹwa Ọlọrun ngbe,
Ile ti ina adura njo,
Fun wa ni'le Kristian,
Fun wa ni'le Kristian.

title.english: Tenderly Guide Us O Shepherd
title.yoruba: Jesu Wa f'Ifẹ Rẹ Samọna Wa

verses.english:
Tenderly guide us O shepherd of love,
To the green pastures and waters above,
Guarding us ever by night and by day,
Never from Thee would we stray.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu wa f'ifẹ Rẹ samọna wa
Si ipa omi iye lat'oke,
Ma sọ wa nigba ọsan at'alẹ,
A k 'yo kuro lọdọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
What tho' the heavens with clouds be o'ercast,
Fearful the tempest and bitter the blast,
Still with the light of Thy Word on the way,
Never from Thee would we stray.
verses.yoruba:
Bi 'sudẹdẹ tilẹ b'oju ọrun
Ti ẹru iji si gb'ọkan wa kan,
Pẹlu mọlẹ lati 'nu ọrọ Rẹ,
A k'yo kuro lọdọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
Over our weakness Thy strength has been cast,
Keep us in meekness Thine own till the last,
Then, safely folded with joy we shall say,
Never from Thee would we stray.
verses.yoruba:
Agbara Rẹ bori ailera wa,
Jẹ ka wa n'irẹlẹ titi dopin,
Gba taba si dele ayọ loke
A k'yo kuro lọdọ Rẹ.

chorus.english:
Never! Never!
Never! Oh never for Tho art the way
Never! Never!
Never! From thee would we stray.
chorus.yoruba:
A k'yo! Sako
Tirẹ titi lawa o jẹ Baba,
A k'yo! Sako
A k'yo kuro lọdọ Rẹ.

title.english: Come, Ye Thankful People, Come

verses.english:
Come, ye thankful people come,
Raise the song of harvest home:
All is safely gathered in,
Ere the winter storms begin;
God our Maker doth provide
For our wants to be supplied:
Come to God's own temple, come,
Raise the song of harvest home!
verses.yoruba:
Wa, ẹyin ọlọpẹ wa,
Gbe orin ikore ga,
Ire gbogbo ti wọle
K'otutu ọyẹ to de;
Ọlọrun Ẹlẹda wa,
L'o ti pese f'aini wa;
Wa k'a rele Ọlọrun
Gbe orin ikore ga.

Oko Ọlọrun l'a jẹ
Lati s'eso yin Rẹ
Alikama at epo,
Ndagba faro tab'ayọ
Ehu yọ, ipẹ tẹle
Siri ọka si kẹhin;
Oluwa kore mu wa
Jẹ eso rere fun Ọ.

verses.english:
Then, thou church triumphant, come
Raise the song of harvest home:
All are safely gathered in,
Free from sorrow, free from sin;
There for ever purified
In God's garner to abide;
Come, ten thousand angels, come,
Raise the glorious harvest home!
verses.yoruba:
Bẹni, maa bọ, Oluwa
Si ikore, ikeyin
Ko awọn eeyan Rẹ jọ
Kuro l'ẹsẹ at'aro;
Sọ wọn di mimọ laelae
Ki wọn le ma ba Ọ gbe
Wa t'Iwọ t'angẹli Rẹ
Gbe orin ikore ga.

title.english: Glory, Praise And Honour

verses.english:
Glory, praise and honour
Unto Jesus our Lord
For keeping us alive
And to witness this day
Our hearts are fill'd with joy
For His great privilege
And to labour for Thee
In Thy vineyard on earth.
verses.yoruba:
Ogo, yin, ọla,
Fun Olugbala wa
T'o da ẹmi wa si
Titi d'ọjọ oni
Ayọ kun ọkan wa
Fun anfani nia yi
Lati siṣẹ fun Ọ
N'nu ọgba Rẹ laye.

verses.english:
We thank Thee for guidance
And the pow'r of Spirit
And the gift of great love
That binds us together
O Jesus, our Shepherd
Accept our praises now
For Thy Compassion sake
Unite us for ever.
verses.yoruba:
A dupẹ fun toni
On agbara t'ẹmi
At' ẹbun ifẹ nla
Ti o fi so wa pọ,
Olusagutan wa,
Tẹwọ gba iyin wa;
Nitori anu Rẹ
Sẹ wa l'ọkan laelae.

verses.english:
Bless us heav'nly Father
On this our harvest day
Send Thy sign unto us
To have joy in Thy praise
Let us be successful
Lord in our daily task
Let's put our trust in Thee
For ever and ever.
verses.yoruba:
Bukun wa, Oluwa,
Loni ajọdun wa,
Ran ami Rẹ si wa
K'a layọ n'nu 'sin Rẹ
Ka si s'aseyori
N'nu iṣẹ isin wa
K'a si fi Jesu se
Igbẹkẹle wa lae.

verses.english:
O Lord our Creator Fountain of Salvation,
Make us worthy O Lord
In Thy heavenly home
At the end of our lives
In this world of misery
That we may have a place
In Thy Kingdom, O Lord.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹlẹda, Oluwa,
Orisun 'gbala wa,
Se wa yẹ f'ajọdun
Ti ibugbe loke;
N'ipari ajo wa
N'nu aye osi yi,
K'a le ni ibugbe
Lọdọ Rẹ Oluwa.

title.english: Lord Of Harvest, Thee We Hail

verses.english:
But chiefly, when Thy liberal hand
Scatters new plenty o'er the land
When sounds of music fill the air,
As homeward all their treasures bear,
We too will raise our hymn of praise
For we Thy common bounties share.
verses.yoruba:
Ju gbogbo rẹ lọ, nigbati
Ọwọ rẹ fun ọpọ kalẹ
'Gbati ohun ayọ gb'ile
B'ẹda ti nko ire wọn jọ;
Awa pẹlu y'o ma yin Ọ
Oore Rẹ ni gbogbo wa npin

title.english: O Lord Of Heaven And Earth

verses.english:
O Lord of heav'n and earth and sea,
To Thee all praise and glory be;
How shall we show our love to Thee
Giver of all!
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa ọrun oun aye,
'Wọ n'iyin at'ọpẹ ye fun fun;
Bawo la ba ti fẹ Ọ to!
Onibu ọrẹ.

verses.english:
The golden sunshine, vernal air,
Sweet flow's and fruits,
Thy love declare Where harvests ripen,
Thou art there, Giver of all!
verses.yoruba:
Orun ti ran, at'afẹfẹ,
Gbogbo eweko nsọ 'fẹ Rẹ;
'Wọ l'O nmu irugbin dara,
Onibu ọrẹ.

verses.english:
For peaceful homes and healthful days,
For all the blessings earth displays,
We owe Thee thankfulness and praise,
Giver of all!
verses.yoruba:
Fun ara lile wa gbogbo,
Fun gbogbo ibukun aye
Awa yin Ọ a si dupe;
Onibu ọrẹ.

verses.english:
Thou didst not spare Thine only Son,
But gav'st Him for a world undone,
And freely with that Blessed One,
Thou givest all!
verses.yoruba:
O ko du wa li Ọmọ Rẹ,
O fi fun aye ese yi,
Pẹlu Rẹ l'ọfe l'o nun wa
L'ohun gbogbo.

verses.english:
Thou giv'st the Holy Spirit's pow'r
Spirit of life, and love, and pow'r,
And dost His sev'nfold graces show'r
Upon us all.
verses.yoruba:
O fun wa l'Ẹmi Mimọ Rẹ
Ẹmi iye at' agbara,
O rọ'jo ẹkun 'bukun Rẹ
Le wa l'ori.

verses.english:
For souls redeemed, for sins forgiv'n
For means of grace, and hopes of Heav'n,
Father, what can to Thee be giv'n,
Who givest all?
verses.yoruba:
Fun idarji ese wa,
Ati fun ireti ọrun,
Kil' ohun t'a ba fifun Ọ?
Onibu ọrẹ.

verses.english:
We lose what on ourselves we spend,
We have as treasure without end,
Whatever, Lord, to Thee we lend,
Who givest all!
verses.yoruba:
Owo ti a nna ofo ni,
Sugbọn eyi t'a fi fun Ọ,
O jẹ isura tit' aye.
Onibu ọrẹ.

title.english: To Thee O Lord, Our Heart We Raise

verses.english:
To Thee, O Lord, our hearts we raise,
In hymns of adoration,
To Thee bring sacrifice of praise
With shouts of exultation;
Bright robes of gold the fields adorn
The hills with joy are ringing,
The valleys stand so thick with corn
That even they are singing.
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa, a gbe ọkan wa
Si Ọ n'nu orin iyin;
A m'ọrẹ ọpẹ wa fun Ọ
Pẹlu iho ayọ nla;
Gbogbo papa f'ẹwa bora
Awọn oke nho f'ayọ
Ọka po l'afonifoji
Tobẹ ti wọn fi nkọrin.

verses.english:
And now, on this our festal day.
Thy bounteous hand confessing,
Before Thee thankfully we lay
The first-fruits of Thy blessing
By Thee the souls of men are fed
With gifts of grace supernal;
Thou who dost give us earthly bread,
Give us the bread eternal.
verses.yoruba:
Loni, ọjọ ikore wa,
Awa jẹwọ ore Rẹ,
Awa f'ọpẹ mu bun wa,
Akoso ibukun Rẹ
'Wọ l'o nfi ore-ọfẹ bọ
Ọkan awa ẹda Rẹ,
'Wọ ti npese onjẹ ajọ,
Fi onjẹ ọrun bọ wa.

verses.english:
We bear the burden of the day,
And often toil seem dreary;
But labour ends with sunset ray,
And rest comes for the weary;
May we, the angel-reaping o'er,
Stand at the last accepted,
Christ's golden sheaves for evermore
To garners bright elected.
verses.yoruba:
A nfarada oru ọjọ,
Laalaa a si ma su-ni;
Sugbọn nigbati oorun wọ
'Simi de fun alarẹ;
Se wa l'eni itẹwọgba,
'Gbat' angẹli ba nkore,
K'a jẹ alikama Kristi
Ti On y'o to si aba.

verses.english:
O blessed is that land of God
Where saints abide for ever,
Where golden fields spread far and broad,
Where flows the crystal river,
The strains of all its holy throng
With ours today are blending;
Twice blessed is that harvest song
Which never hath an ending.
verses.yoruba:
Ibukun n'ilẹ Ọlọrun
'Bi t'awọn mimọ wa lae
Papa wura tẹju nibẹ
Odo rẹ dan bi Kristal,
Orin ẹgbẹ mimọ t'ọhun
Dapọ mọ tiwa loni;
'Bukun orin 'kore na pọ
Ti a o maa kọ titi.

title.english: We Plough The Fields And Scatter

verses.english:
We plough the fields, and scatter
The good seed on the land,
But it is fed and watered
By God's almighty hand;
He sends the snow in winter,
The warmth to swell the grain,
The breezes, and the sunshine,
And soft refreshing rain.
verses.yoruba:
Aroko, a funrugbin
Sinu oko gbogbo,
Sugbọn ọwọ Ọlọrun
L'o mu 'rugbin dagba;
O ran otu at'oru
Lati mu eso pọn,
Efufu ati orun,
At'ojo to nrinlẹ.

verses.english:
We thank Thee then, O Father,
For all things bright and good,
The seed-time and the harvest,
Our life, our health, our food;
Accept the gifts we offer
For all Thy love imparts,
And, what Thou most desirest,
Our humble, thankful hearts.
verses.yoruba:
Baba, a sọpẹ fun Ọ,
F'ohun rere gbogbo,
Fun gba 'rugbin on 'kore
F'ẹmi 'lera, onjẹ;
Gba ẹbun ti a mu wa
Fun 'seun-ifẹ Rẹ,
Si gba ọkan ọpẹ wa,
'Wọ sa fẹ eyi ju

chorus.english:
All good gifts around us
Are sent from heaven above;
Then thank the Lord,
O thank the Lord,
For all His love.
chorus.yoruba:
Ẹbun rere gbogbo
Lati ọrun wa ni;
Sọpẹ f'Oluwa, ẹ sọpẹ
Fun gbogbo ifẹ Rẹ.

title.english: Christ Is Our Cornerstone

verses.yoruba:
Kristi n'ipilẹ wa,
Lori Rẹ lao kole,
Awọn mimọ nikan
L'o ngb' agbala ọrun,
Ireti wa t'ore aye,
T'ayọ ti mbọ wa n'nu 'fẹ Rẹ.

Agbala mimọ yi
Yo ho f'orin iyin;
Ao kọrin yin s'Ọ,
Mẹtalọkan mimọ,
Bẹ lao f'orin ayọ kede
Orukọ Rẹ titi aye.

verses.english:
Here, gracious God, do Thou
For evermore draw nigh;
Accept each faithful vow,
And mark each suppliant sigh
In copious shower, on all who pray
Each holy day Thy blessing pour.
verses.yoruba:
Ọlọrun Olore,
Fiyesimi nihin,
Gba ẹjẹ t'a mu wa
At'ẹbẹ wa gbogbo;
K'O si f'ọpọ 'bukun dahun
Adura a nigbagbogbo.

verses.english:
Here may we gain from Heaven
The grace which we implore,
And may that grace, once given,
Be with us evermore;
Until that day when all the blest
To endless rest are call'd away.
verses.yoruba:
Nihin jẹ k'ore Rẹ
Ta ntọrọ lat'ọrun
Bọ s'ori wa lẹkan
Ko ma si tun lọ mọ,
Tit' ọjọ na t'ao s'akojọ
Awọn mimọ sib' isimi.

title.english: Great Is The Lord Our God

verses.english:
Great is the Lord our God,
And let His praise be great;
He makes His churches His abode,
His most delightful seat.
verses.yoruba:
Ọlọrun wa tobi,
Ẹjẹ k'iyin Rẹ pọ,
O f'ile sin Rẹ se bugbe
At' ibujoko Rẹ.

verses.english:
These temples of His grace,
How beautiful they stand!
The honours of our native place,
And bulwarks of our land.
verses.yoruba:
Tẹmpili or'ọfẹ,
A! Wọn ti dara to!
Awọn li ọla ilu wa
At'odi ile wa.

verses.english:
In Zion God is known,
A refuge in distress;
How bright has His salvation shone
Through all her palaces!
verses.yoruba:
Ni Sion, Ọlọrun
L'abo n'igba 'pọnju
Igbala Rẹ ti logo to
N'nu awọn afin Rẹ!

verses.english:
In every new distress
We'll to His house repair;
We'll think upon His wondrous grace
And seek deliverance there.
verses.yoruba:
Bi ipọnju ba de,
A o lọ si'le Rẹ;
Ao ranti ore-ọfẹ Rẹ,
Ao wa 'gbala nibẹ.

title.english: Christ Is The Foundation

verses.english:
Here the vow be seal'd by Thy spirit Lord,
Here the sick be healed and the lost restored,
Here the broken hearted Thy forgiveness prove,
Here the friends long parted be restored to love.

verses.yoruba:
Jẹki a ri ẹri pe, O mbẹ nihin;
K'awọn t'a de l'ẹwọn d'ominira nihin
K'imọlẹ tan nihin si awọn Tirẹ,
Lati bẹ wa soke si ohun t'ọrun.

verses.english:
Here may God the Father, Christ the Saviour-Son,
With the Holy Spirit, be adored as One;
Till the whole creation at Thy footstool fall,
And in adoration own Thee Lord of all.
verses.yoruba:
Nihin ni k'a juba Ọlọrun Baba,
Ati Kristi Ọmọ pẹl' Ẹmi mimọ;
Titi gbogbo ẹda y'o wolẹ fun Ọ,
Ti wọn o ma yin Ọ; Oluwa aye.

title.english: Revive Thy Work, O Lord

verses.english:
Revive Thy work, O Lord,
Thy mighty arm make bare;
Speak with the voice that wakes the dead,
And make Thy people hear.
verses.yoruba:
Ji 'ṣẹ Rẹ nde, Jesu
Fi agbara Rẹ han,
Fọ'hun to le j'oku dide,
Mu k'eniyan Rẹ gbọ.

verses.english:
Revive Thy work, O Lord,
Create soul-thirst for Thee,
And hung' ring for the Bread of Life,
O may our spirits be.
verses.yoruba:
Ji 'ṣẹ Rẹ nde, Jesu,
Mu k'ongbẹ Rẹ gbẹ wa,
Si mu k'ebi pa ọkan wa;
Fun onjẹ ye na.

verses.english:
Revive Thy work, O Lord,
Exalt Thy precious name;
And, by the Holy Ghost, our love
For Thee and Thine inflame.
verses.yoruba:
Ji 'ṣẹ Rẹ nde, Jesu,
Gbe orukọ Rẹ ga,
Mu k'ifẹ Rẹ kun ọkan wa,
Nipa Ẹmi Mimọ.

verses.english:
Revive Thy work, O Lord,
Give pow' unto Thy word;
Grant that Thy blessed Gospel may
In living faith be heard.
verses.yoruba:
Ji 'ṣẹ Rẹ nde, Jesu,
F'agbara f'oro Rẹ,
Ka gbọ 'hinrere 'bukun Rẹ.
Ni igbagbọ aye.

verses.english:
Revive Thy work, O Lord,
And give refreshing showers,
The glory shall be all Thine own,
The blessing, Lord, be ours.
verses.yoruba:
Ji 'ṣẹ Rẹ nde, Jesu,
Rọ 'jo itura Rẹ,
Ogo yo jẹ Tirẹ nikan,
K'ibukun jẹ tiwa.

chorus.english:
Revive Thy people hear,
While here to Thee we bow;
Descend, O gracious Lord,descend!
O come and bless us now.
chorus.yoruba:
Ji 'ṣẹ Rẹ nde Jesu
'Gba ta nsin Ọ, nihin,
Sọkalẹ wa, Olore wa,
Si bukun wa nihin.

title.english: Almighty Father Hear Our Cry

verses.english:
Almighty Father, hear our cry,
As o'er the trackless deep we roam
Be Thou our haven always nigh,
On homeless waters Thou our home.
verses.yoruba:
Baba, jọwọ gb'adura wa,
Bi a ti nlọ l'oju omi;
Iwọ ma jẹ ebute wa,
At' ile wa l'oju omi.

verses.english:
O Jesus, Saviour, at whose voice
The tempest sank to perfect rest,
Bid Thou the mourner's heart rejoice
And cleanse and calm the troubl'd breast.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu Olugbala, 'Wọ ti
O ti mu 'ji dakẹ rọrọ,
Ma jẹ ayọ fun asọfọ,
F'isimi f'ọkan aibalẹ.

verses.english:
O Holy Ghost, beneath whose pow'r
The ocean woke to life and light,
Command Thy blessing in this hour,
Thy fost'ring warmth, Thy quick'ning might.
verses.yoruba:
'Wọ Ẹmi Mimọ, Ẹni ti,
O ra baba l'oju omi,
Pasẹ 'bukun l'akoko yi,
Fi ipa Rẹ mu wa sọji.

verses.english:
Great God, Triune Jehovah,
Thee We love, we worship, we adore;
Our Refuge on time's changeful sea
Our Joy on Heav'n Eternal shore.
verses.yoruba:
'Wọ Ọlọrun Mẹtalokan,
Ti awa nsin, ti awa mbọ,
Ma se abọ wa laye yi
Ati ayọ wa li ọrun.

title.english: And Let Our Bodies Part

verses.english:
And let our bodies part,
To different climes repair;
Inseparably joined in heart
The friends of Jesus are.
verses.yoruba:
A o pinya l'ara lọ
S'onirury ilu,
Sugbọn awọn ọrẹ Jesu
Wa n'isọkan Ẹmi.

verses.english:
Jesus, the corner-stone,
Did first our hearts unite,
And still He keeps our spirits one
Who walk with Him in white.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu, Olori wa,
L'O da ọkan ya pọ,
Awa t'a mba rin ni mimọ
L'O sọ d'ọkan l'ẹmi.

verses.english:
O let us still proceed
In Jesus work below;
And, following our triumphant Head
To further conquest go.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹk'a tẹsiwaju
Ninu Iṣẹ Jesu;
K'a ma tẹle Oluṣẹgun,
K'a ba le ṣẹgun si!

verses.english:
The vineyard of their Lord
Before His laboured lies;
And, lo! We see the vast reward
Which waits us in the skies.
verses.yoruba:
Ọgba Oluwa mbẹ
Niwaju On 'ṣẹ Rẹ;
Áwa si nwo ere nla na,
Ti a nlọ ba loke.

verses.english:
O let our heart and mind
Continually ascend,
That haven of repose to find
Where all our labours end.
verses.yoruba:
K'ifẹ at'ere wa
Goke nigbagbogbo,
Lati d'ebute 'simi ni
Nibiti 'ṣẹ wa pin.

verses.english:
Where all our toils are o'er,
Our suff'ring and our pain;
Who meet on that eternal shore,
Shall never part again.
verses.yoruba:
Nibẹ n'iṣẹ wa tan,
Iya oun 'rora wa!
L'ebute ayeraye ni;
A ki yoo pinya mọ.

verses.english:
O happy, happy place,
Where saints and angels meet,
There we shall see each other's face
And all our brethren greet.
verses.yoruba:
Ilu alafia,
T'awọn mimọ pade!
Nibẹ l'ao r'oju ara wa,
Tao yo mọ ara wa.

verses.english:
The Church of the first-born;
We shall with them be blest
And, crown'd with endless joy return
To our eternal rest.
verses.yoruba:
T'awa-t'ijọ 'saju
L'ao jumọ gba 'bukun,
Ninu ayọ l'ao tun wọ
Isimi ailopin.

title.english: God Be With You Till We Meet Again
title.yoruba: K'Ọlọrun Sọ Ọ K'a Tun Pade

verses.english:
God be with you till we meet again,
By His counsels guide, uphold you,
With His sheep securely fold you,
God be with you till we meet again.

God be with you till we meet again,
'Neath His wings protecting hide you,
Daily manna still provide you,
God be with you till we meet again.
verses.yoruba:
K'Ọlọrun sọ ọ k'a tun pade!
K'o f'iyẹ Rẹ dabobo ọ,
K'o maa pese fun aini rẹ,
K'Ọlọrun sọ ọ k'a tun pade!

verses.english:
God be with you till we meet again,
When life's perils thick confound you
Put His arms unfailing round you,
God be with you till we meet again.
verses.yoruba:
K'Ọlọrun sọ ọ k'a tun pade!
Nigba t'ewu ba yi ọ ka,
K'o f'ọwọ 'fẹ Rẹ gba ọ mu,
K'Ọlọrun sọ ọ k'a tun pade.

verses.english:
God be with you till we meet again,
Keep love's banner floating o'er you,
Smite death's threat'ning wave before you,
God be with you till we meet again.
verses.yoruba:
K'Ọlọrun sọ ọ k'a tun pade,
K'o fi ifẹ raga bo ọ,
K'o pa oro iku fun ọ,
K'Ọlọrun sọ ọ k'a tun pade!

chorus.english:
Till we meet, till we meet,
Till we meet at Jesus' feet,
Till we meet, till we meet,
God be with you till we meet again.
chorus.yoruba:
K'a pade ...... K'a pade,
K'a pade...... l'ẹsẹ Jesu;
K'a pade..... K'a pade!
K'Ọlọrun sọ ọ k'a tun pade!

title.english: Jesus Will Be With You

verses.english:
Jesus will be with you wheresoe'er you stray,
Jesus will be with you and will guide your way,
Through the lonely deserts, over mountain bare,
Jesus wii be with you, brother ev'rywhere.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu y'o pẹlu rẹ l'ọna rẹ gbogbo,
Jesu y'o pẹlu rẹ, y'o si maa tọ ọ,
Larin asalẹ ati l'ori oke,
Jesu y'o wa pẹlu rẹ nigbagbogbo.

verses.english:
Jesus will be with you wheresoe'er you stray,
Jesus will be with you and will be your stay;
Through the dark some valley with its griefs and care,
Jesus will be with you, brother don't despair.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu y'o pẹlu rẹ l'ọna rẹ gbogbo,
Jesu y'o pẹlu rẹ, y'o si di ọ mu,
Larin afonifoji ibanujẹ,
Jesu y'o pẹlu rẹ, ma so 'reti nu.

verses.english:
Jesus will be with you wheresoe'er you stray,
Jesus will be with you all along life's way;
Through the chilly waters to the land so fair,
Jesus will be with you, brother trust His care.
Through the chilly waters to the land so fair,
Jesus will be with you, brother trust His care.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu y'o pẹlu rẹ l'ọna rẹ gbogbo,
Jesu y'o pẹlu rẹ, l'ọna ajo rẹ,
Lari isan 'danwo s'ọna ilu ni,
Jesu y'o pẹlu rẹ, sa gbẹkẹ rẹ l'e.

chorus.english:
Jesus will be with you,
Jesus will be with you,
He will be with your friend to comfort and defend,nJesus will be with you,
Jesus will be with you,nJesus will be with you to the end.

title.english: With The Sweet Word Of Peace

verses.english:
With the sweet word of peace,
We bid our brethren go;,
Peace, as a river, to increase,
And ceaseless flow.
verses.yoruba:
Ọrọ alafia
L'a fi sin yin, ara,
K'alafia bi odo nla
Ma ba yin lọ.

verses.english:
With the calm word of pray'r,
We earnestly commend
Our brethren to Thy watchful care
Eternal Friend!
verses.yoruba:
N'nu ọrọ adura,
A f'awọn ara wa
Le isọ Oluwa lọwọ;
Ọre tootọ.

verses.english:
With the dear word of love,
We give our brief farewell;
Our love below, and Thine above,
With them shall dwell.
verses.yoruba:
Ọrọ ifẹ didun
L'a fi p'odigbose,
Ifẹ wa ati t'Ọlọrun
Y'o ba wọn gbe.

verses.english:
With the strong word of faith,
We stay ourselves on Thee;
That Thou, O Lord, in life and death
Their help shall be.
verses.yoruba:
Ọrọ 'gbagbọ lile,
Ni igbẹkẹle wa
Pe, Oluwa y'o se 'ranwọ
Nigbagbogbo.

verses.english:
Then the bright word of hope
Shall on our parting gleam,
And tell of joys beyond the scope
Of earth-born dream.
verses.yoruba:
Ọrọ 'reti didun
Y'o mu 'pinya wa dun,
Y'o sọ ayọ t'o le dun ju
Ayọ t'aye.

verses.english:
Farewell; in hope, and love,
In faith, and peace, and prayer,
Till He whose home is ours above
Unite us there.
verses.yoruba:
O digbose ara;
N'ifẹ ati 'gbagbọ
Tit' ao fi tun pade l'oke
N'ile l'ọrun.

title.english: In The Hour We Have To Part

verses.english:
In the hour we have to part,
Let us all command ourselves,
To the watchful eye and heart,
Of our dearest and close Friend.
verses.yoruba:
Ni akoko ipinya
Jẹki a fi ara wa,
S'abẹ oju at'ọkan,
Ọrẹ korikosun wa.

verses.english:
Jesus Christ, hear Thou our pray'rs,
Thou the guardian of Thy sheep,
May Thy mercy and Thy care,
All our hearts in safety keep.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu gbọ adura wa,
'Wọ ti nsọ agutan Rẹ,
K'anu ati tọju Rẹ,
Pa gbogbo ọkan wa mọ.

verses.english:
Grant that we have strength through Thee,
Add pleasure to every pain,
Spare our lives we pray, dear Lord,
Until we shall meet again.
verses.yoruba:
K'a l'agbara n'ipa Rẹ,
F'adun s'irora gbogbo,
K'o si da ẹmi wa si,
Titi ao fi tun pade.

title.english: There Is A Home Eternal

verses.yoruba:
Ile ailopin kan wa,
To ndan, t'o dara;
Nib' ayọ pipe wa,
Ko si oru nibẹ,
Awọn Angẹli si nkọrin
Nigbagbogbo yi'tẹ ka;
Nigbawo ni uno ri ọ,
Ile didan, didan yi?

verses.english:
There is a home eternal,
Beautiful and bright,
Where sweet joys supernal
Never are dimm'd by night;
White-rob'd angels are singing
Ever around the bright throne;
When, oh, when shall I see thee,
Beautiful, beautiful Home?

Soon shall I join the ransomed,
For beyond the sky;
Christ is my salvation,
Why should I fear to die?
Soon my eyes shall behold Him
Seated upon the bright throne;
Then, oh, then shall I see thee,
Beautiful Home! Beautiful Home!
verses.yoruba:
Laipẹ uno dapọ mọ wọn
Ni oke ọrun;
Kristi ni 'gbala mi
Ese ti uno bẹru?
Laipẹ oju mi y'o ri
B'o ti joko lor' itẹ;
'Gbana emi o ri Ọ
Ile didan, didan yi

chorus.english:
Home! Beautiful Home!
Bright, beautiful Home!
Bright, Home of our Saviour,
Bright, beautiful Home!
chorus.yoruba:
Ile didan yi,
Ile mimọ yi,
Ile igbala wa,
Ibugbe ogo!

title.english: Blessed Are They In Jesus

verses.english:
Blessed are they in Jesus,
Those that are children of God
Redeemed are they by His blood
They passed from death into life.
verses.yoruba:
Alabukun n'nu Jesu,
Ni awọn om' Ọlọrun
Ti a fi ẹjẹ Rẹ ra
Lat' inu iku s'iye.

verses.english:
Ere the world was created,
Father loves them in His Son,
And by faith in Jesus Christ
There this seal was giv'n to them.
verses.yoruba:
K'a to d'aye ni Baba
Fẹ wọn ninu Ọmọ Rẹ;
Nipa 'gbagbọ n'nu Jesu
Ni wọn gba edidi yi.

verses.english:
Those who have been justified
By His good, abundant grace,
Their sins are all washed away,
They shall be free from judgment.
verses.yoruba:
Awọn ti a da l'are
Nipa ore ọfẹ Rẹ,
A wẹ abogbo ẹsẹ wọn,
Wọn o bọ l'ọjọ 'dajọ.

verses.english:
They bear fruits of the Spirit
In good works of righteousness,
The work of sin they abhor,
The word of God dwell in them.
verses.yoruba:
Wọn ns'eso ore-ọfẹ
Ninu ise ododo,
Irira l'ẹsẹ si wọn,
Ọr' Ọlọrun ngbe 'nu wọn.

verses.english:
Thro' precious blood of the Lamb
They become co-heirs with God,
Through the Saviour's majesty,
They wear robes of righteousness.
verses.yoruba:
Nipa ẹj'Ọdagutan,
Wọn mba Ọlọrun K'ẹgbẹ
Pẹlu ọlanla Jesu
A wọ wọn l'asọ ogo.

chorus.english:
Thank God, I'm counted worthy,
In this world and in the next.
chorus.yoruba:
Ọpẹ, a ka wa mọ wọn,
L'aye yi, ati l'ọrun.

title.english: Come, Let Us Join Our Friends Above
title.yoruba: Wa, K'a Da m'Awọn Ọrẹ Wa

verses.english:
Come, let us join our friends above
That have obtained the prize,
And on the eagle wings of love
To joys celestial rise.
verses.yoruba:
Wa, k'a da m'awọn ọrẹ wa
Ti wọn ti jere na;
N'ifẹ k'a f'ọkan ba wọn lọ
S'ode ọrun l'ọhun.

verses.english:
Let all the saints terrestrial sing,
With those to glory gone;
For all the servants of our King,
In earth and heav'n, are one.
verses.yoruba:
K'awọn t'aye, d'orin wọn mọ
T'awọn to lo s'ogo,
Awa l'aye, awọn l'ọrun
Ọkan ni gbogbo wa.

verses.english:
One family we dwell in Him,
One church, above, beneath,
Though now divided by the stream,
The narrow stream of death.
verses.yoruba:
Idile kan n'nu Krist', ni wa,
Ijọ kan l'a si jẹ;
Isan omi kan l'o ya wa!
Isan omi iku.

verses.english:
One army of the living God,
To His command we bow;
Part of His host have cross'd the flood,
And part are crossing now.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹgbẹ ogun kan t'Ọlọrun,
Aṣẹ Rẹ l'a si nṣe;
Apakan ti wọ 'do na ja,
Apakan nwọ lọwọ!

verses.english:
Our spirits too shall quickly join,
Like theirs with glory crowned,
And shout to see our Captain's sign
To hear His trumpet sound.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹmi wa fẹrẹ dapọ na,
Y'o gb'ade bi ti wọn;
Ao yọ s'ami Balogun wa
Lati gbọ ipe Rẹ.

verses.english:
O Jesus be our guard and guide,
O that the word were given!
Come, Lord of hosts, the waves divide,
And land us all in heaven.
verses.yoruba:
Jesu, sọ wa, s'amọna wa
'Gba t'onikọ ba de
Oluwa pin omi meji,
Mu wa gunlẹ l'ayọ.

title.english: For All The Saints Who
title.yoruba: F'awọn Eniyan Rẹ To Lọ Simi

verses.english:
For all the saints who from their labours rest,
Who Thee by faith before the world confessed,
Thy name, O Jesus, be forever blessed,
Alleluia!
verses.yoruba:
F'awọn eniyan Re t'o lọ simi;
Awọn ti o fi 'gbagbọ jẹwọ Rẹ,
K'a yin orukọ Rẹ; Olugbala,
Aleluya!

verses.english:
Thou wast their Rock their fortress, and their Might,
Thou, Lord, their Captain in well the fought fight;
Thou in the darkness drear their one true Light,
Alleluia!
verses.yoruba:
Iwọ l'apata wọn at'odi wọn,
Iwọ ni Balogun wọn l'oju 'ja,
Iwọ ni imọlẹ okunkun wọn,
Aleluya!

verses.english:
O may Thy soldiers, faithful, true, and bold,
Fight as the saints who nobly fought of old,
And win, with them, the victor's crown of gold!
Alleluia!
verses.yoruba:
Jẹ ki awọn ọm' ogun Rẹ l'aye
Jagun nitotọ b'awọn ti 'gbani;
Ki wọn le gba ade ogo bi wọn,
Aleluya!

verses.english:
O blest communion, fellowship divine!
We feebly struggle; they in glory shine!
Yet all are one in Thee, for all are Thine,
Alleluia!
verses.yoruba:
Idapọ ibukun wo lo to yi,
Awa nja n'ihin, awọn nyọ l'ọhun,
Bẹ tirẹ kanna l'awa at'awọn,
Aleluya!

verses.english:
And when the strife is fierce, the warfare long,
Steals on the ear the distant triumph song,
And hearts are brave again, and arms are strong,
Alleluia!
verses.yoruba:
'Gba t'ija ba ngbona, ti ogun nle,
A dabi ẹni nab'orin ayọ wọn;
Igboya a si de, at'agbara,
Aleluya!

Ọjọ nlọ, orun wa fere wọ na,
Awọn ajagun toto y'o simi,
Didun ni isimi paradise,
Aleluya!

Leyin eyi, ọjọ ayọ kan mbọ,
Awọn mimọ y'o dide n'nu ogo;
Ọba ogo yio wa larin wọn,
Aleluya!

verses.english:
From earth's wide bounds, from ocean's farthest coast,
Through gates of pearl streams in the countless host,
Singing to Father, Son, and Holy Ghost,
Alleluia!
verses.yoruba:
Lat' opin ilẹ, lat' opin okun,
Ogunlọgọ nrọ wọ 'bode Pearli;
Wọn nyin Baba, Ọmọ ati Ẹmi
Aleluya!

title.english: Hush! Blessed Are The Dead

verses.english:
Hush! Blessed are the dead
In Jesus' arms who rest,
And lean their weary head
For ever on His breast.
verses.yoruba:
Ibukun ni f'oku
T'o simi le Jesu
Awọn to gb'ori wọn
Le okan aya Rẹ.

verses.english:
Oh beatific sight!
No darkling veil between,
They see the Light of light,
Whom here they loved unseen.
verses.yoruba:
Iran 'bukun l'eyi
Ko si b'oju l'arin,
Wọn ri Ẹni 'mọlẹ
Ti wọn ti fe l'airi.

verses.english:
For them the wild is past,
With all its toil and care;
Its with'ring midnight blast,
Its fiery noonday glare.
verses.yoruba:
Wọn bọ lọwọ aye
Pẹlu aniyan rẹ;
Wọn bọ lọwọ ewu
To rin l'ọsan, l'oru.

verses.english:
Them the Good shepherd leads,
Where storms are never rife,
In tranquil dewy meads
Beside the Fount of Life.
verses.yoruba:
Olusọ-Agutan
Nibi t'iji ki ja,
Mu wọn lo si papa
L'ẹba omi iye.

verses.english:
Ours only are the tears,
Who weep around their tomb
The light of begone years
And shadowing years to come.
verses.yoruba:
Lor' iboji wọn
L'awa nsọkun loni
Wọn j'ẹni 'ire fun wa
Ta ki y'o gbagbe lae.

verses.english:
Their voice, their touch, their smile,
Those love-springs flowing o'er,
Earth for its little while
Shall never know them more.
verses.yoruba:
A k'y'o gb'ohun wọn mọ;
Ohun ifẹ didun
Lat' oni lọ, aye
Ki o tun mọ wọn mọ.

verses.english:
O tender hearts and true,
Our long last vigil kept,
We weep and mourn for you
Nor blame us: Jesus wept.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹyin oninure,
Ẹ fi wa silẹ lọ
Ao sọkun yin titi
Jesu pa sọkun ri.

verses.english:
But soon at break of day
His calm Almighty voice,
Stronger than death, shall say,
Awake, arise, rejoice.
verses.yoruba:
Sugbọn a fẹ gb'ohun
Olodumare na;
Y'o kọ, y'o si wipe,
'Ẹ jinde, ẹ si yọ'.

title.english: Hark! Hark, My Soul
title.yoruba: Gbọ, Ọkan Mi Bi Angẹli Ti Nkọrin

verses.english:
Hark! Hark, my soul; angelic songs are swelling,
O'er earth's green fields and ocean's wave-beat shore,
How sweet the truth those blessed strains are telling,
Of that new life when sin shall be no more!
verses.yoruba:
Gbọ, ọkan mi, bi angẹli ti nkọrin
Yika ọrun ati yika aye;
Ẹ gbọ bi ọrọ orin wọn ti dun to!
Ti nsọ 'gbati ẹsẹ ki o si mọ.

verses.english:
Onward we go; for still we hear them singing,
Come, weary souls, for Jesus bids you come!
And through the dark its echoes sweetly ringing,
The music of the gospel leads us home.
verses.yoruba:
B'a si ti nlọ, be l'a si ngbọ orin wọn,
Wa, alare, Jesu l'o ni k'e wa,
L'okunkun ni a ngbọ orin didun wọn,
Ohun orin wọn ni f'ọna han wa.

verses.english:
Far, far away, like bells at evening pealing,
The voice of Jesus sounds o' er land and sea,
And laden souls, by thousands meekly stealing,
Kind Shepherd, turn their weary steps to thee.
verses.yoruba:
Ohun Jesu ni a ngbọ l'ọna rere,
Ohun na ndun b'agogo y'aye ka;
Ẹgbẹgbẹrun awọn to gbọ ni si mbọ,
Mu wọn w'ọdọ Re, Olugbala wa.

verses.english:
Rest comes at length; though life be long and dreary,
The day must dawn and dark some night be past;
Faith's journey ends in welcome to the weary,
And heav'n, the heart's true home, will come at last.
verses.yoruba:
Isimi de, bi wahala tilẹ pọ,
Ilẹ y'o mọ, l'ẹyin okun aye;
Irin ajo pari f'awọn alarẹ,
Wọn o d'ọrun 'bi 'simi nikẹyin.

verses.english:
Angels, sing on, your faithful watches keeping,
Sing us sweet fragments of the songs above,
Till morning's joy shall end the night of weeping,
And life's long shadows break in cloudless love.
verses.yoruba:
Ma kọrin nsọ, ẹyin angẹli rere,
Ẹ ma kọrin didun k'a ba ma gbọ,
Tit' ao fi nu omije oju wa nu,
Ti a o si ma yọ titi laelae.

chorus.english:
Angels of Jesus, angels of light,
Singing to welcome the pilgrims of the night!
chorus.yoruba:
Angẹli Jesu, angẹl' 'mọlẹ,
Wọn nkọrin ayọ pade ero l'ọna.

title.english: How Sweet The Hour Of Closing Day

verses.english:
How sweet the hour of closing day,
When all its peaceful and serene,
And the broad sun's retiring ray
Sheds a mild luster o'er the scene!
verses.yoruba:
Igba asalẹ ti dun to,
Ti ara tu ohun gbogbo,
'Gbati itansan orun alẹ
Ba ntan mọlẹ s'ohun gbogbo!

verses.english:
Such is the Christian's parting hour
So peacefully he sinks to rest;
And faith, rekindling all its pow'r,
Lights up the languor of his breast.
verses.yoruba:
Bẹni 'kẹyin onigbagbọ,
On a simi l'alafia;
Igbagbọ t'o gbona janjan,
A mọlẹ ninu ọkan rẹ.

verses.english:
There is a radiance in his eye,
A smile upon his wasted cheek,
That seems to tell of glory nigh,
In language that no tongue can speak.
verses.yoruba:
Imọlẹ kan mọ l'oju Rẹ,
Ẹrin si bẹ ni ẹnu rẹ;
O nf'ede t'ahọn wa ko mọ,
Sọrọ ogo t'o sunmọ 'le.

verses.english:
A beam from heav'n is sent to cheer
The pilgrim on his gloomy road;
And angels are attending near,
To bear him to their bright abode.
verses.yoruba:
Itansan 'mọlẹ t'ọrun wa
Lati gba ni 'yanju l'ọna
Awọn angẹl duro yi ka
Lati bẹ lọ s'ibugbe wọn.

verses.english:
O Lord, that we may thus depart,
Thy joys to share, Thy face to see,
Impress Thine image on our heart,
And teach us now to walk Thee.
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa, jẹ k'a lọ bayi,
K'a ba Ọ yọ, k'a r'oju Rẹ;
Tẹ aworan Re s'ọkan wa,
Si kọ wa b'a ti ba Ọ rin.

title.english: Those Eternal Bowers Man Hath
title.yoruba: Ile Ẹwa Wọnni, B'o Ti Dara To

verses.english:
Those eternal bowers man hath never trod,
Those unfading flowers round the Throne of God,
Who may hope to gain them after weary fight?
Who at length attain them, clad in robes of white?
verses.yoruba:
Ile ẹwa wọnni, b'o ti dara to!
Ibugbe Ọlọrun, t'oju ko ti ri;
Tal'o fẹ de ibẹ, lẹyin aye yi?
Tal'o fẹ k'a wọ on ni asọ funfun?

verses.english:
He who wakes from slumber at the spirit's voice,
Daring here to number things unseen his choice;
He who casts his burden down at Jesus' cross,
Christ's reproach his guerdon,all beside but loss.
verses.yoruba:
Awọn wọnni t'o ji ninu orun wọn,
Awọn t'o ni 'gbagbọ si nkan t'a ko ri
Awọn to k'aniyan wọn l'Olugbala,
Awọn ti ko tiju agbelebu Kristi.

verses.english:
He who gladly barters all on earthly ground;
He who, like the Martyrs, says 'I will be crowned'
He whose one oblation is a life of love,
Knit in God's salvation to the blest above.
verses.yoruba:
Awọn ti ko nani gbogbo nkan aye,
Awọn t'o le sotọ de oju iku,
Awọn t'o nrubọ ifẹ l'ojojumọ,
Awọn t'a f'igbala Jesu rapada.

verses.english:
Shame upon you legions of the Heavenly King,
Citizens of regions past imagining?
What, with pipe and tabor dream away the light,
When He calls to labour and faith's arduous fight?
verses.yoruba:
Itiju ni fun yin, Ọm'ogun Jesu,
Ẹyin ara ilu ibugbe ọrun,
Kinla! Ẹ nfi fere at'ilu sire,
'Gba t'o ni k'ẹ ṣiṣẹ, t'o si pe, 'Ẹ ja!'

verses.english:
Jesus, Lord of Glory, as we breast the tide,
Whisper Thou the story of the other side;
Where, the saints are casting crowns before Thy feet,
For everlasting, in Thyself complete.
verses.yoruba:
B'igbi omi aye si ti nkọlu wa,
Jesu, Ọba Ogo, sọ si wa l'eti;
Adun t'o wa l'ọrun ilu mimọ ni,
Nibi t'isimi wa, lae ati laelae.

title.english: Jerusalem, My Happy Home

verses.english:
Jerusalem, my happy home,
Name ever dear to me!
When shall my labours have an end,
In joy, and peace, and thee?
verses.yoruba:
Jerusalem, ibi ayọ,
To se ọwọn fun mi,
'Gbawo n'isẹ mi o pari
L'ayọ l'alafia?

verses.english:
When shall these eyes thy heav'n built walls
And pearly gates behold,
Thy bulwarks with salvation strong,
And streets of shining gold?
verses.yoruba:
Gbawo ni oju mi y'o ri
Ẹnu 'bode pearli rẹ?
Odi Rẹ t'o le fun 'gbala,
Ita wura didan.

verses.english:
There happier bowers than Eden's bloom,
Nor sin nor sorrow know;
Blest seats, through rude and stormy scenes,
I onward press to you.
verses.yoruba:
Ọgba ti o ju Edẹn lọ,
Ibi ko si nibẹ;
Ilu ayọ, mo nlepa rẹ
Larin iji aye.

verses.english:
Why should I shrink at pain and woe
Or feel at death dismay?
I've Canaan's goodly land in view,
And realms of endless day.
verses.yoruba:
Ese t'emi o kọ iya,
Iku ati ipọnju?
Mo nwo ile rere Kenan'
Ilẹ mọlẹ titi.

verses.english:
Apostles, martyrs, prophets there,
Around my Saviour stands,
And soon my friends in Christ below,
Will join the glorious band.
verses.yoruba:
Aposteli, martyr, woli
Wọn y'Olugbala ka;
Awa tikarawa fẹrẹ
Dapọ mọ ogun na.

verses.english:
Jerusalem, my happy home,
My soul still pants for thee!
Then shall my labours have an end,
When I thy joys shall see.
verses.yoruba:
Jerusalem, ilu ayọ
Ọkan mi nfa si ọ;
'Gbati mo ba ri ayọ rẹ,
Ise mi y'o pari.

title.english: The Saints Of God!

verses.yoruba:
Awọn mimọ, lala pari
Wọn ti ja, wọn si ti ṣẹgun
Wọn ko fẹ ohun ija mọ
Wọn da wọn le l'ẹsẹ Jesu
A! Ẹyin ẹni ibukun
Isimi yin ti daju to!

verses.english:
The saints of God! Their wanderings done,
No more their weary course they run,
No more they faint, no more they fall,
No foes oppress, no fears appeal;
O happy saints! For ever blest,
In that dear home, how sweet their rest!
verses.yoruba:
Awọn mimọ, irin pari
Wọn ko tun sure ije mọ,
Arẹ at'isubu d'opin
Ọta on ẹru ko ri mọ,
A! Ẹyin ẹni ibukun
Isimi yin ha ti dun to!

verses.english:
The saints of God! life's voyage o'er,
Safe landed on that blissful shore,
No stormy tempests now they dread
No roaring billows lift their head;
O happy saints! For ever blest,
In that calm haven of their rest.
verses.yoruba:
Awọn mimọ, ajo pari,
Wọn ti gun silẹ ibukun
Iji ko d'eru ba wọn mọ,
Igbi omi ko nipa
A! Ẹyin ẹni ibukun
Ẹ nsimi n'ibi Alafia.

Awọn mimọ, Oku wọn sun,
Ninu ile, awon nsọna
Titi wọn yoo fi jinde
Lati fi ayọ goke lọ!
A! Ẹni 'bukun, ẹ kọrin
Oluwa at'Ọba yin mbọ.

verses.english:
O God of saints, to Thee we cry,
O savior, plead for us on high;
O holy Ghost, our Guide and Friend
Grant us Thy grace till life shall end:
That with all saints our rest may be
In that bright paradise with Thee.
verses.yoruba:
Ọlọrun wọn, 'Wọ l'a nke pe,
Jesu, bẹbẹ fun wa l'oke,
Ẹmi Mimọ, Olutọ wa,
F'ore-ọfẹ fun wa d'opin,
K'a le b'awọn mimọ simi
Ni paradise Rẹ.

title.english: When The Trumpet Of The Lord Shall

verses.english:
When the trumpet of the Lord shall sound and time shall be no more,
And the morning breaks, eternal bright and fair,
When the saved of earth shall gather over on the other shore,
And the roll is called up yonder, I'll be there.
verses.yoruba:
Gbati ipe oluwa ba dun, t'aye yo si folọ,
Ti imọlẹ ọjọ titun y'o si de;
Nigbati awọn ọmọ igbala ba pejọ l'oke,
T'a ba si p'orukọ l'ọhun, uno wa n'bẹ.

verses.english:
On that bright and cloudless morning when the dead in Christ shall rise,
And the glory of His resurrection share;
When His chosen ones shall gather to their home beyond the skies,
And the roll is called up yonder, I'll be there.
verses.yoruba:
L'orọ ọjọ na t'awọn oku n'nu
Kristi 'o jinde,
Ti wọn y'o si pin n'nu ogo ajinde;
'Gbati awọn ayanfẹ y'o pejọ si ode ọrun,
T'a ba si p'orukọ l'ọhun, uno wa n'bẹ.

verses.english:
Let us labour for the master from the dawn till setting sun,
Let us talk of all His wondrous love and care;
Then when all of life is over, and our work on earth is done,
And the roll is called up yonder, I'll be there.
verses.yoruba:
Jẹki a fi gbogbo akoko wa ṣiṣẹ f'Oluwa,
Jẹki a royin ifẹ iyanu Rẹ,
Nigbati a ba si pari ire ije wa l'aye,
T'a ba si p'orukọ l'ọhun, uno wa n'bẹ.

chorus.english:
When the roll is called up yonder
When the roll is called up yonder
When the roll is called up yonder
When the roll is called up yonder
I'll be there.
chorus.yoruba:
Gbat'a ba p'orukọ l'ọhun,
Gbat'a ba p'orukọ l'ọhun,
Gbat'a ba p'orukọ l'ọhun,
Nipa ore-ọfẹ nikan uno wa n'bẹ.

title.english: We Shall Meet Beyond The River

verses.english:
We shall meet beyond the river,
By and by, by and by;
And the darkness shall be over,
By and by, by and by;
With the toilsome journey done,
And the glorious battle won,
We shall shine forth as the sun,
By and by, by and by.
verses.yoruba:
A o pade l'oke odo,
Nigbose, nigbose,
Okunkun yo si rekọja,
Nigbose, nigbose,
'Gbati ajo ba pari,
Ta si ṣẹgun t'o logo,
A o si ma ran bi orun
Nigbose, nigbose.

verses.english:
We shall strike the harps of glory,
By and by, by and by;
We shall sing redemption's story,
By and by, by and by;
And the strains, for evermore
Shall resound in sweetness o'er
Yonder everlasting shore
By and by, by and by.
verses.yoruba:
A o ma lu harpu ogo
Nigbose, nigbose,
A o ma kọrin irapada,
Nigbose, nigbose,
Titi lae li orin na
Y'o ma f'adun ro yi ka
Ebute ayeraye,
Nigbose, nigbose.

verses.english:
We shall see and be like Jesus,
By and by, by and by;
Who a crown of life will give us,
By and by, by and by;
And the angels who fulfil
All the mandates of His will.
Shall attend and love us still,
By and by, by and by.
verses.yoruba:
Awa y'o si dabi Jesu,
Nigbose, nigbose,
Ti yo fun wa l'ade iye,
Nigbose, nigbose,
Awọn angẹli pẹlu
Ti nmu gbogbo 'fẹ Rẹ se
Wọn y'o ma se ikẹ wa
Nigbose, nigbose.

verses.english:
There our tears shall all cease flowing,
By and by, by and by;
And with sweetest rapture knowing,
By and by, by and by;
And all the blest ones, who have gone
To the land of life and song,
We with shouting shall rejoin,
By and by, by and by.
verses.yoruba:
Omije oju wa y'o gbẹ,
Nigbose, nigbose,
Pẹlu ayọ nla l'ao si mọ,
Nigbose nigbose,
Awọn mimọ t'o saju
Lọ si ile ayọ na,
Pel' ayọ lao tun dapọ
Nigbose, nigbose.

title.english: There Is Singing In Heaven

verses.english:
There is singing in heav'n such as we have never known,
Where the angels sing the praises of the lamb upon the throne,
Their sweet harps are ever tuneful and their voices always clear,
O that we might be more like them while we serve the Master here!
verses.yoruba:
Orin mbẹ li ọrun, iru eyiti awa ko mọ,
Nibiti awọn angẹli nkorin 'yin s'Ọdagutan,
Harpu wọn ni ohun didun, ohun wọn si dun pẹlu,
A! Ki awa le se 'bi ti wọn lati sin Oluwa.

verses.english:
But I hear another anthem blending voices clear and strong,
Unto Him that hath redeem'd us and hath bought us, is the song;
We have come thro' tribulations to this land so fair and bright,
In the fountain, freely flowing He hath made our garments white.
verses.yoruba:
Sugbọn mo gbọ orin miran ti a kọ l'ohun oke,
Si ẹni t'O ra wa pada t'O si gba wa, l'orin na;
Awa ti la ipọnju wa ja si ile didan yi,
Nibi orisun 'ye ti nsan l'O ti fo asọ wa mọ.

verses.english:
Then the angels stand and listen, for they cannot join that song,
Like the sound of many waters by that happy, blood-wash'd throng;
For they sing about great trials,battles fought and vict'ries won,
And they praise their great redeemer who hath said to them, well done!
verses.yoruba:
Awọn angẹli dake, 'tori wọn ko le kọrin na,
Bi iro omi pupọ l'ẹnu awọn t'a f'ẹjẹ ra!
N'tori wọn nsọ ti iṣẹgun lori 'danwo at'ija,
Wọn si nyin Olurapada ti O ti wipe, 'O seun'.

verses.english:
So, although I'm not an angel, yet I know that over there,
I will join a blessed chorus that the angel cannot share;
I will sing about my Saviour who upon dark Calvary,
Freely pardon'd my transgressions died to set a sinner free.
verses.yoruba:
Bi emi ko tile nse angeli, mo mọ pe l'ohun oke,
Uno b'awọn mimọ kọrin t'awọn angẹli ko ni kọ,
Uno kọrin ti Olugbala ti O ku ni Kalfari,
Lati dari ẹsẹ mi ji mi, lati da mi silẹ.

chorus.english:
Holy, holy, is what the angels sing,
And I expect to help them make the courts of heav'n ring;
But when I sing redemption's story they will fold their wings,
For angels never felt the joys that our salvation brings.
chorus.yoruba:
Mimọ, Mimọ l'awọn angẹli nkọ,
Mo si ni 'reti lati ba wọn kọrin li ọrun,
Sugbọn wọn ko leba mi kọrin ti irapada,
N'tori angẹli ko mọ ayọ ti 'gbala mu wa.

title.english: There's Land Of Peace And Plenty

verses.yoruba:
Ilẹ alafia kan wa, ti 'lẹkun rẹ si silẹ,
Ẹni ti ọkan rẹ funfun, ti o si mọ, y'o gbe 'bẹ;
K'iṣẹ ẹnu ọna ogo nikan l'a ni ba wọle,
Sugbọn eni ti y'o wọ 'bẹ yo k'ẹsẹ silẹ na.

verses.english:
There is bread of heaven growing, in its fair and fertile fields,
And the wine of love its vineyard to the thirsting mortal yields;
There are mountain heights of glory that await the trav'lers rod,
And blest retreats where empty souls draw nearer unto God.
verses.yoruba:
Irugbin orun nhu nibẹ, ni'lẹ rẹ ti o l'ọra,
O si nhu igi ajara ti o ntu ọkan lara;
Oke giga, didan wa 'bẹ t'o jẹ ibi itura,
Abo 'o daju ni o jẹ f'okan to sunmọ Ọ.

verses.english:
Who would stay without its borders in the desert dark and drear,
When the luscious grapes of Eschol are so very, very near?
Enter in then with rejoicing, for the Lord is on your side,
And in His glorious presence ever more you shall abide.
verses.yoruba:
Tani ko fẹ lọ s'lle na t'o fẹ joko s'asalẹ,
'Gbati eso ilẹ na pọn, ti 'bẹ si wa nitosi?
Njẹ fi ayọ wọ ile, n'tori Oluwa mbẹ fun ọ,
Niwaju 'tẹ ogo Rẹ, ni 'wọ o ma gbe titi.

chorus.english:
Come over, come over, to the land of corn and wine,
There is nothing can compare with the many holy pleasures there,
Come over, come over, leave the desert plain below,
And come away, away come over.
chorus.yoruba:
Wa nihin, wa nihin silẹ ẹlẹtu loju
Ko s'ohun t'a le fi we adun mimọ ti o wa nibẹ,
Wa nihin, wa nihin, fi asalẹ yi silẹ;
Si jade wa, jade wa.

title.english: In The Land Of Fadeless Day

verses.english:
In the land of fadeless day
Lies the 'city four-square',
It shall never pass away,
And there is 'no night there'.
verses.yoruba:
Ni'lẹ ti ọjọ ki nsu,
N'ilu Ọlọrun wa;
Ilu na y'o wa titi,
Ko si s'oru nibẹ.

verses.english:
All the gates of pearl are made
In that'city four-square',
All the streets with gold are laid,
And there is 'no night there'.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹnu ọna rẹ jẹ Pearl,
N'ilu Ọlọrun wa;
Ita rẹ si jẹ wura,
Ko s'oru nibẹ.

verses.english:
An the gates shall never close
To the 'city four-square',
There life's crystal river flows,
And there is 'no night there'.
verses.yoruba:
A ki nti ẹnu ọna
T'ilu Ọlọrun wa;
Omi iye nan nibẹ,
Ko si s'oru nibẹ.

verses.english:
There they need no sunshine bright,
In that 'city four-square',
For the lamb is all the light,
And there is 'no night there'.
verses.yoruba:
Wọn ko fẹ 'tansan orun,
N'ilu Ọlọrun wa;
N'tori krist' n'imọlẹ rẹ,
Ko si s'oru nibẹ.

chorus.english:
God shall wipe away all tears
There's no death, no pain, nor fears;
And they count not time by years
For there is no 'night there'.
chorus.yoruba:
Baba y'o n'omije nu,
Ko s'iku, 'rora ẹru,
Ko si kika akoko
'Tori ko s'oru n'bẹ.

title.english: We Speak Of The Realms Of The Blest

verses.english:
We speak of the realms of the blest,
Of that country so bright and so fair,
And oft are its glories confess'd;
But what must it be to be to be there?
verses.yoruba:
A nsọrọ ilẹ 'bukun ni,
Ilẹ didan at' ilẹ ẹwa;
'Gbagbogbo l'a nsọ t'ogo rẹ,
Y'o ti dun to lati de 'bẹ!

verses.english:
We speak of its pathways of gold,
Of its walls deck'd with Jewels most rare,
Its wonders and pleasures untold,
But what must it be to be there?

We speak of its freedom from sin,
From sorrow, temptation, and care,
From trials without and within?
But what must it be to be there?
verses.yoruba:
A nsọ p'ẹsẹ ko si nibẹ!
Ko s'aniyan at'ibanujẹ,
Pẹlu 'danwo l'ode, ninu;
Y'o ti dun to lati de 'bẹ!

verses.english:
We speak of its anthems of praise,
With which we can never compare,
The sweetest on earth we can raise;
But what must it be to be there?
verses.yoruba:
A nsọrọ orin iyin rẹ,
Ti a kole f'orin aye we,
B'o ti wu k'orin wa dun to,
Y'o ti dun to lati de 'bẹ!

verses.english:
We speak of its service of love,
Of the robes which the glorified wear,
The Church of the First-born above;
But what must it be to be there?
verses.yoruba:
A nsọrọ isin ifẹ rẹ,
Ti agbada t'awọn mimọ nwọ,
Ijọ akọbi ti oke;
Y'o ti dun to lati de bẹ!

verses.english:
Do Thou, Lord, 'midst pleasure of woe,
Still for Heav'n our spirits prepare,
And shortly we also shall know,
And feel what it is to be there.
verses.yoruba:
Jọ Oluwa l'ọnakọna,
Sa se ẹmi wa yẹ fun ọrun,
Laipẹ awa na yio mọ,
B'o ti dun to lati de 'bẹ!

title.english: When Ends Earth's Long

verses.english:
When ends earth's long and evil day
This world of mis'ry and of woes
There is a place so bright
No change or decay there to find
No night, but all eternal day
Tell me, will you be there?
verses.yoruba:
Lẹyin aye buburu yi,
Aye ẹkun on osi yi,
Ibi rere kan wa;
Ayipada ko si nibẹ,
Ko s'oru, a f'ọsan titi
Wi mi, 'wọ o wa nibẹ?

verses.english:
Its pearly gates are clos'd to sin
No unclean thing shall enter in
To spoil the place so bright,
That happy, shining golden shore,
No curse will ever there be found,
Tell me, will you be there?
verses.yoruba:
'Lekun ogo rẹ ti m'ese,
Ohun eri ko le wọ 'bẹ,
Lati b'ẹwa rẹ jẹ;
L'ebute daradara ni,
A ko ni gburo egun mọ,
Wi mi, 'wọ o wa nibẹ?

verses.english:
Who will be there? the lowly heart
Who served the Lord in godly fear,
Who count the world but loss,
Those led by the Holy Spirit,
Those who walk in the narrow way,
They are those to be there.
verses.yoruba:
Tan' y'o de 'bẹ? Onirẹlẹ,
To f'ibẹru sin Oluwa,
T'wọn ko naani aye,
Awọn t'a f'Ẹmi mimọ tọ,
Awọn t'o nrin l'ọna tooro,
Awọn ni o wa nibẹ.

title.english: Shall We Gather At The River

verses.english:
Shall we gather at the river
Where bright angel feet have trod;
With its crystal tide for ever,
Flowing by the throne of God!
verses.yoruba:
A o pade l'eti odo
T'ẹsẹ angẹli ti tẹ;
T'o mọ gara bi kristali,
L'ẹba itẹ Ọlọrun.

verses.english:
On the margin of the river,
Guided by our Shepherd King
We will walk and worship ever,
His dear footsteps following.
verses.yoruba:
L'eti bebe odo na yi,
Pẹl' Olus'agutan wa,
A o ma rin a o sin,
B'a ti ntẹle 'pasẹ Rẹ.

verses.english:
There beside the tranquil river,
Mirror of the Saviour's face,
Happy hearts, no more to sew
Sing of glory and of grace.
verses.yoruba:
Njẹ l'ẹba odo tutu na,
Ao r'oju Olugbala;
Ẹmi wa ki o pinya mọ,
Yio kọrin ogo Rẹ.

verses.english:
But before we gain the river,
Lay we every burden down;
Jesus, here from sin deliver
Those whom there Thy grace will crown.
verses.yoruba:
K'a to de odo didan na,
A o s'ẹrú wa kalẹ;
Jesu y'o gba ẹrú ẹsẹ
Awọn ti O de l'ade.

A fẹ de odo didan na,
'Rin-ajo wa fẹrẹ pin;
Ọkan wa fẹrẹ kun f'orin
Ayọ at'Alafia.

chorus.english:
Yes, we'll gather at the river,
The beautiful, beautiful river,
Gather with the saints at the river,
That flows by the throne of God.
chorus.yoruba:
A o pade l'eti odo,
Odo didan, odo didan na,
Pẹl' awọn mimọ l'ẹba odo,
T'o nsan l'ẹba itẹ ni.

title.english: Sleep On, Beloved

verses.yoruba:
Ma sun, olufẹ; ko si ma simi,
Gb'ori rẹ le aya Olugbala,
A fẹ ọ sugbọn Jesu fẹ ọ ju,
Sun 're, sun 're, sun 're.

Orun rẹ dun bi orun ọmọde,
Iwọ ki yo si ji si ẹkun mọ,
Isimi to daju n'isimi rẹ,
Sun 're, sun're, sun're.

verses.english:
Until the shadows from this earth are cast,
Until He gathers in His sheaves at last;
Until the twilight gloom is over-past,
Goodnight! Good-night! Good-night!
verses.yoruba:
Tit' a o ka okunkun aye kuro,
Titi ao fi ko ikore 'wọle,
Titi oyẹ aye yio fi la,
Sun 're, sun 're, sun 're.

verses.english:
Until the Easter glory lights the skies;
Until the dead in Jesus shall arise,
And He shall come, but not in lowly guise,
Goodnight! Good-night! Good-night!
verses.yoruba:
Titi orun ajinde y'o fi yọ,
T'awọn oku n'nu Jesu y'o dide,
On y'o si wa ninu ọlanla Rẹ,
Sun 're, sun 're, sun 're.

verses.english:
Until made beautiful by Love Divine,
Thou in the likeness of thy Lord shalt shine,
And He shall bring that golden crown of thine,
Goodnight! Good-night! Good-night!
verses.yoruba:
Titi ẹwa orun 'yo jẹ tirẹ,
Ti iwọ o ma ran ninu ogo,
Oluwa y'o de ọ l'ade wura,
Sun 're, sun 're, sun 're.

verses.english:
Only 'good-night', beloved-not 'farewell!'
A little while, and all His saints shall dwell,
In hallowed union, indivisible,
Goodnight! Good-night! Good-night!
verses.yoruba:
O d'owurọ sa ni, olufẹ mi,
A tun fẹrẹ ri 'ra na: nibiti,
Ipinya ati Ituka ko si,
Sun 're, sun 're, sun 're.

verses.english:
Until we meet again before His throne,
Clothed in the spotless robe He gives His own,
Until we know even as we are known,
Goodnight! Good-night! Good-night!
verses.yoruba:
Tit' ao fi pade niwaju 'tẹ Rẹ,
Nin' asọ igunwa awọn Tirẹ,
Tit' ao mọ gẹgẹ bi a ti mọ wa,
Sun 're, sun 're, sun 're.

title.english: Servants Of God, Well Done

verses.english:
'Servant of God, well done',
From all your labours, rest;
Thou has fought and Thou has triumphed,
'Enter Thy Master's joy'
The call came in the night,
He rais'd himself to hear,
The arrow of death enter'd in,
He fell, but did not fear.

The midnight cry went forth,
'Arise to meet Thy God'
He woke, and saw his commander,
Through prayer and in faith,
His soul rose up at once,
Left this body of clay;
When morn broke, this body of clay,
Was found lying down dead.
verses.yoruba:
Igbe ta loganjọ,
'Pade Ọlọrun rẹ',
O ji, o ri Balogun rẹ;
N'n' adura on 'gbagbọ,
Ọkan rẹ nde wiri,
O bọ amọ silẹ,
Gbat' ilẹ mọ, agọ ara
Si sun silẹ l'oku.

verses.english:
The pangs of death is past,
Cares and distress are o'er,
The days of fighting are all gone,
His heart has found real peace;
Soldier of Christ, 'well done'
Keep singing songs of joy;
Take thy rest in Thy Saviour's breast
And rest eternally.
verses.yoruba:
'Rora iku kọja,
Lala at' isẹ tan;
Ọjọ ogun jija pari,
Ọkan rẹ r'alafia
Ọmọ-gun Krist', o seun
Ma kọrin ayọ sa!
Simi lọdọ Olugbala,
Simi titi aye.

title.english: There's No Further Dwelling Place Here

verses.english:
There's no further dwelling place here,
Therefore, let us not be trifle,
E'en tho' thou built a sky scrapper,
Thou hast six feet as bed for rest.
verses.yoruba:
A ko ni 'bugbe kan nihin,
Onile ẹ rọra yanran;
B'o fi gbogb' aye kọ Garẹt,
Ẹsẹ mẹfa ni busun wa.

verses.english:
There's no further dwelling place here,
Torch and leave is treasure of earth,
We came to the world nakedly,
And nakedly we shall return.
verses.yoruba:
A ko ni 'bugbe kan nihin,
Ọr' aye fọwọba fi lẹ,
Ni ihooho la sa w'aye
Ni ihooho lao pada lọ.

verses.english:
There's no further dwelling place here,
We are only sojourners here,
Go to the grave and see the hades,
They had now reached their resting place.
verses.yoruba:
A ko ni 'bugbe kan nihin,
O ko gbagbọ p'ajọ l'o wa!
Lọ wo 'boji w'awọn to sun,
Awọn ni wọn de 'bi simi

title.english: They Have Reached The Golden Shore

verses.english:
They have reach'd the golden shore
Up in heav'n; up in heav'n;
They shall hunger there no more,
They are ever free from pain,
Up in heav'n; up in heav'n.
verses.yoruba:
A! Won ti gun s'ebute,
Loke ọrun; loke ọrun;
Ebi ko ni pa wọn mọ,
Wọn bọ lọwọ irora
Loke ọrun; loke ọrun.

verses.english:
They need no light of lamp,
Up in heav'n; up in heav'n;
There they have perpetual light,
Jesus is their shinning light,
Up in heav'n; up in heav'n.
verses.yoruba:
A! Wọn ko wa fitila,
Loke ọrun; loke ọrun;
'Mọlẹ ni l'ọjọ gbogbo,
Jesu si n'Imọlẹ wọn,
Loke ọrun; loke ọrun.

verses.english:
Ah, the streets are made of gold,
Up in heav'n; up in heav'n
There the glory never fades,
For the flock of Christ they are,
Up in heav'n; up in heav'n.
verses.yoruba:
A! Wura n'ita wọn jẹ,
Loke ọrun; loke ọrun;
Ogo 'bẹ si pọ pupọ,
Agbo Jesu ni wọn jẹ,
Loke ọrun; loke ọrun.

verses.english:
It is never chilly there,
Up in heav'n; up in heav'n,
For their winter is all past,
Every day is ever bright,
Up in heav'n; up in heav'n.

They have all ceased from their fight,
Up in heav'n; up in heav'n;
Jesus Christ has saved their souls,
They with Him walk hand in hand,
Up in heav'n; up in heav'n.
verses.yoruba:
A! Wọn dẹkun ija 'ja,
p Loke ọrun; loke ọrun;
Jesu l'o ti gba wọn la,
T'awọn Tirẹ l'o si nrin,
Loke ọrun; loke ọrun.

verses.english:
They shall no more cry nor weep,
Up in heav'n; up in heav'n;
Jesus is always with them,
With Him is abundant joy,
Up in heav'n; up in heav'n.
verses.yoruba:
A! Wọn ko ni sọkun mọ,
Loke ọrun; loke ọrun;
Jesu sa wa lọdọ wọn,
Lọdọ Rẹ ni ayọ wa,
Loke ọrun; loke ọrun.

verses.english:
Ah we shall soon join the throng,
Up in heav'n, up in heav'n,
We expect our time to come,
When our Lord shall call us home,
Up in heav'n, up in heav'n.
verses.yoruba:
A! A o dapọ mọ wọn,
Loke ọrun; loke ọrun;
A nreti akoko wa,
'Gba Oluwa ba pe ni
S'oke ọrun; s'oke ọrun.

title.english: Ten Thousand Times

verses.english:
Ten thousand times ten thousand,
In sparkling raiment bright,
The armies of the ran somed saints
Throng up the steeps of light;
'Tis finished, all is finished
Their fight with death and sin;
Fling open wide the golden gates,
And let the victors in.

What rush of hallelujahs
Fills all the earth and sky!
What ringing of a thousand harps
Be speaks the triumph nigh!
O day for which creation
And all its tribes were made!
O joy, for all its former woes
A thousandfold repaid!
verses.yoruba:
Iro Aleluya wọn
Lo gb'aye, ọrun kan;
Iro ẹgbẹgbẹrun harpu
Ndun pe ṣẹgun de tan;
Ọjọ t'a s'ẹda aye,
T'a da oril' ede,
Ayọ la pa 'banujẹ rẹ
Ti a fun ni kikun.

verses.english:
