O then what raptured greetings
On Canaan's happy shore,
What knitting severed friendships up,
Where partings are no more!
Then eyes with joy shall sparkle
That brimmed with tears of late;
Orphans no longer fatherless,
Nor widows desolate.
verses.yoruba:
A! Ayọ t'a ko le sọ
Leti bebe Kenan'
Idapọ nla wo lo to yi,
Ibi t'a ki npinya;
Oju to kun fẹkun ri
Y'o tan 'mọlẹ ayọ;
Ki y'o si alaini baba,
Opo ki y'o si mọ.

Mu 'gbala nla Rẹ fun wa,
Ọd'agutan t'apa
Ko 'rukọ awọn ayanfẹ,
Mu 'pa Rẹ k'o jọba;
Wa ifẹ orilẹ ede,
Da onde Rẹ silẹ;
Wa fi ami 'leri Rẹ han
Wa, Olugbala wa.

title.english: Lord Who Made The Seven Planets

verses.english:
Lord who made the seven planets,
And the seven earth below,
This world make it to be fifteen,
Praise and praises by thy name.
verses.yoruba:
Baba to da ọrun meje,
Ati 'lẹ meje pẹlu,
Aiye lo se ẹkẹdogun,
Iyin ni f'orukọ Rẹ.

verses.english:
The bright sun, the Moon and the Stars,
Are the light of the world,
Jesus Christ the Rock of Ages,
Are the light of the night.
verses.yoruba:
Orun, Osupa, Irawọ,
Awọn ni 'mọlẹ aiye,
Okuta Oniyebiye,
Awọn ni mọlẹ salẹ.

verses.english:
Thy protection our Father,
Let it ever be upon us,
Let no evil here and yonder,
Have effect on our members.
verses.yoruba:
Abo Oluwa Onikẹ,
Lawa ẹgbẹ bora mọ;
Ko s'ohun 'bi to le se wa,
Lagbara mẹtalọkan.

verses.english:
Safe delivery for our pregnant,
All our barrens to be fruitful,
All our children to be saved,
Let death have no right on us.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹni loyun a bimọ la,
Agan a tọwọ b'osun,
Ọlomọ, ko ni padanu,
Iku ko ri wa gbe se.

verses.english:
Not the secret of the ocean,
Nor the secret of the seas,
Could mankind reveal in the world,
Nor in heavenly home above.
verses.yoruba:
Ko s'ẹniti nri di okun,
A ki nri di ọlọsa,
Baba ọrun on aiye,
Ma jẹ k'aiye r'idi mi.

chorus.english:
Wonderful are thy works,
And incomprehensible,
Wonderful are thy works,
And incomprehensible.
chorus.yoruba:
Ijinlẹ lọrọ na,
Awamaridi si ni,
Ijinlẹ lọrọ na,
Awamaridi si ni.

title.english: What Are These Arrayed In White

verses.english:
What are these arrayed in white,
Brighter than the noonday sun?
Foremost of the sons of light,
Nearest the eternal throne?
These are they that bore the cross,
Nobly for their Master stood;
Sufferers in His righteous cause,
Followers of the dying God.
verses.yoruba:
Ta l'awọn yi t'asọ wọn
Ndan ju orun ọsan lọ?
Asaju ọmọ 'mọlẹ
T'o sunmọ 'tẹ Ọlọrun?
Awọn yi l'o ti jiya
Nitori Oluwa wọn,
Ati ninu isin Rẹ;
'Wọn l'o to Kristi lẹyin.

verses.english:
Out of great distress they came,
Washed their robes by faith below
In the blood of yonder Lamb,
Blood that washes white as snow;
Therefore are they next the throne,
Serve their Maker day and night;
God resides among His own,
God doth in His saints delight.
verses.yoruba:
Wọn f'ẹjẹ Ọd'agutan,
Fọ'sọ wọn, nipa 'gbagbọ
Ẹjẹ na ti wẹ ni mọ;
Nitorina wọn njọsin
Lẹba itẹ Ẹlẹda;
Ọlọrun si mba wọn gbe,
Inu Rẹ si yo si wọn.

verses.english:
More than conquerors at last,
Here they find their trials o'er;
They have all their sufferings pass'd
Hunger now and thirst no more;
No excessive heat they feel
From the sun's directer ray
In a milder clime they dwell,
Region of eternal day.
verses.yoruba:
Wọn ta 'wọn aṣẹgun yọ,
Idanwo wọn ti pari;
Gbogbo iṣẹ wọn kọja
Ebi, ongbẹ, ko si mọ;
Oru ko mu wọn, n'tori
Ọwọ orun ko de 'bẹ
Ilu 'tura ni wọn ngbe,
Ibi 'mọlẹ ailopin.

verses.english:
He that on the throne doth reign,
Them the Lamb shall always feed,
With the tree of life sustain,
To the living fountains lead;
He shall all their sorrows chase,
All their wants at once remove,
Wipe the tears from every face,
Fill up every soul with love.
verses.yoruba:
Ọd'agutan, l'ori 'tẹ,
Y'o ma bọ wọn n'gbagbogbo,
Y'o f'onjẹ iye bo wọn
Y'o f'omi 'ye fun wọn mu;
Y'o pa 'banujẹ wọn rẹ,
Gbogbo aini wọn y'o tan,
Y'o nu omije wọn nu,
Y'o f'ifẹ kun ọkan wọn.

title.english: Some Day, But When I Cannot Tell
title.yoruba: L'ọjọ Kan Sa, Ti Nko Le Sọ

verses.english:
Some day, but when I cannot tell,
To toil and tears I'll bid 'farewell,
For I shall with the angels dwell,
Some day, some blessed day.
verses.yoruba:
L'ọjọ kan sa, ti nko le sọ,
Uno dagbere fun 'banujẹ,
Uno ba awọn angẹli gbe,
Ọjọ, ojọ ayọ.

verses.english:
Some day within the gates so fair,
A golden harp my hands shall bear,
And glistening robes of white I'll wear
Some day some blessed day.
verses.yoruba:
L'ọjo kan 'nu 'bode didan,
Emi y'o gbe harpu wura;
Uno wọ asọ funfun laulau,
Ọjọ, ọjọ ayọ.

verses.english:
Some day I'll see my Saviour's face,
And welcomed to His blest embrace
Shall with His people find a place,
Some day some blessed day.
verses.yoruba:
L'ọjọ kan uno r'Olugbala,
Oun yio si gba mi mọra,
Y'o si ka mi kun ayanfẹ,
Ọjọ, ọjọ ayọ.

verses.english:
Some day, some blessed day
I know, I'll find the love of long ago,
And learn how much to Christ I owe
Some day some blessed day.
verses.yoruba:
L'ọjọ kan sa emi mọ pe
Uno ri awọn t'o ti kọja;
Uno mọ bi 'gbese mi ti to
Ọjọ, ọjọ ayọ.

chorus.english:
Some day... some day,
I'll be at home with Christ to stay,
Some day, some blessed day.
chorus.yoruba:
Ọjọ ayọ, ọjọ ayọ,
T'emi y'o ma ba Jesu gbe,
Ọjọ, ọjọ ayọ.

title.english: The Flow'rs That Beautified The Field

verses.english:
The flow'rs that beautified the field,
That looked tender and fresh,
When touched by sickle, it will die,
It falls and withers off.
verses.yoruba:
Itana t'o bo 'gbẹ l'asọ
To tutu yọyọ bẹ;
Gba doje ba kan, a si ku,
A subu, a si rọ.

verses.english:
This example is fit for us,
According to God's word;
Let young and old take heed and know,
That they are but like grass.
verses.yoruba:
Apẹrẹ yi jẹ f'ara wa,
B'ọr'Ọlọrun ti wi,
K'ọmọde at agbalagba,
Mọ, 'ra wọn l'eweko.

verses.english:
Put not your trust on fleeting breath,
Call not your times your own,
Around, we see sickle of death,
Cut down thousands of souls.
verses.yoruba:
A! Ma gbẹkẹle ẹmi rẹ,
Ma pe gba rẹ ni tirẹ,
Yika l'a nri doje iku,
O mbẹ 'gbẹrun lulẹ.

verses.english:
Those who are spread until this day,
Soon, life will also end;
Prepare, be wise before the time,
The death angel will come.
verses.yoruba:
Ẹyin t'adasi di oni,
Laipẹ, ẹmi y'o pin,
Mura k'ẹ si gbọn l'akoko,
K'ikọ iku to de.

verses.english:
The grass, when dead, will wake no more,
Die, thou, that thou may live,
What, if death were the door that leads,
To everlasting pain.
verses.yoruba:
Koriko, b'o ku, ki ji mọ,
Ẹ ku lati tun ye,
A! B'iku lọ jẹ 'lẹkun nkọ,
S'irora ailopin!

verses.english:
O Lord, help us answer Thy call,
Let us depart from sin,
And when we fall down like the grass,
Let our souls come to Thee.
verses.yoruba:
Oluwa, jẹ k'a jẹpẹ Rẹ,
K'a kuro n'nu ẹsẹ,
Gbat'a lulẹ bi koriko,
K'ọkan wa yọ si Ọ.

title.english: When You Count The Ones Who Love

verses.english:
When you count the ones who love the Lord,
Count me, count me,
When you count up those who trust His word,
Count me, count me.
verses.yoruba:
Gbat'o ba nk'awọn to f'Oluwa,
Ka mi mọ wọn,
'Gbat'o ba nk'awọn to f'ọrọ Rẹ,
Ka mi mọ wọn.

verses.english:
When you count up those who're saved by grace,
Count me, count me;
Who have found in Christ a hiding place,
Count me, count me.
verses.yoruba:
Gbat'o ba nk'awọn ti a gbala,
Ka mi mọ wọn,
Awọn to fi Kristi se abo,
Ka mi mọ wọn.

verses.english:
When you count up those who do the right,
Count me, count me;
Who are walking in the gospel light,
Count me, count me.
verses.yoruba:
'Gbat'o ba nka awọn oloto,
Ka mi mọ wọn,
To nrin n'nu mọlẹ Ihinrere,
Ka mi mọ wọn.

chorus.yoruba:
Ka mi mọ awọn ọmọ Ọba ọrun,
Ka mi m'awọn ti yo mase 'ranṣẹ fun,
Ka mi m'awọn ti o ma kọ'rin 'rapada,
Ka mi .... mọ wọn.

title.english: Father, Before Thy Throne

verses.english:
Father, before Thy throne of light
The guardian angels bends,
And ever in Thy presence bright
Their psalms adoring blend;
And casting down each golden crown
Beside the crystal sea,
With voice and lyre, in happy choir,
Hymn glory, Lord, to Thee.

And as the rainbow luster falls
Athwart their glowing wings,
While seraph unto seraph calls,
And each Thy goodness sings;
Oh may we feel, as low we kneel
To pray Thee for Thy grace,
That Thou art here for all who fear,
The brightness of Thy face.
verses.yoruba:
Didan osumare si ntan
Si ara iyẹ wọn;
Serafu nke si Serafu
Ti wọn nkọrin 'yin Rẹ;
Bi a ti kunlẹ nihinyi
Ran ore Rẹ si wa,
K'a mọ pe 'wọ wa nitosi
Lati da wa lohun.

verses.english:
Here where the angels see us come
To worship day by day,
Teach us to seek our heav'nly home
And serve Thee 'en as they;
With them to raise our notes of praise
With them Thy Love to own
Till life's first flow'r and fullest pow'r
Be Thine and Thine alone.
verses.yoruba:
Nihin, nibit' awọn angẹl'
Nwo wa b'a ti nsin Ọ
Kọ wa, k'a wa ile ọrun,
K'a sin Ọ bi ti wọn;
K'a ba wọn kọ orin iyin
K'a ba wọn mọ 'fẹ Rẹ
Titi agbara y'o fi di
Tirẹ, Tirẹ nikan.

title.english: Our Hearts Are Full With Joy Today

verses.english:
Our hearts are full of joy today,
We have found the golden way,
Its light is shinning on our way,
We have found the golden way,
It's long our hearts have craved for it,
In all the changing scenes of life,
We have almost entire failed,
In finding the golden way.
verses.yoruba:
Ọkan wa kun f'ayọ loni,
A ti r'ọna wura na,
Imọlẹ rẹ tan l'ọna wa,
A ti r'ọna wura na,
O ti pẹ t'ayun Rẹ nyun wa,
Larin ayidayid' aye,
Diẹ lo ku fun wa ko bọ,
K'a to r'ọna wura na.

verses.english:
We were called from this sinful world,
We have found the golden way,
Our friends and neighbours are still there,
We have found the golden way,
We have answered the call divine,
May we ne'er miss that heavenly place,
With Jesus, we are going home,
We have found the golden way.
verses.yoruba:
A pe wa kuro l'aye yi,
A ti r'ọna wura na,
Ọrẹ wa gbogbo wa nibẹ,
A ti r'ọna wura na,
Awa jẹ ipe didun na,
K'a ma tase ijọba ọrun,
Pẹlu Jesu a nlọ 'le wa,
A ti r'ọna wura na.

verses.english:
Our light afflictions are all past,
We have found the golden way,
The joy of home makes us forget,
We have found the golden way,
The storm and mist will soon be past,
Our storm tossed hearts will take their rest,
We set sails, our boat comes to shore,
We have found the golden way.
verses.yoruba:
Kin ni 'danwo wa t'o kọja,
A ti r'ọna wura na,
Ayọ ile mu k'a gbagbe,
A ti r'ọna wura na,
Ikuku ko ni pẹ kuro,
Ifayabalẹ yoo si de,
A ta 'gbokun, ọkọ gunlẹ,
A ti r'ọna wura na.

verses.english:
With hearts of gratitude to God,
We have found the golden way,
Sometime, before, we have lost it,
We have found the golden way,
We will soon be with the Saviour,
Jesus will gladly receive us,
But only by His grace alone,
We have found the golden way.
verses.yoruba:
Pẹl' ọkan 'pẹ s'Ọlọrun wa,
A ti r'ọna wura na,
Lẹkan ri ti a ti sọnu,
A ti r'ọna wura na,
A fẹ d'ọdọ Olugbala,
Jesu yio f'ayọ gba wa,
O jẹ nipa or'ọfẹ nikan,
A ti r'ọna wura na.

verses.english:
We give thanks to our God on high,
That we found the golden way,
Give glory, praise, thanks and honour
To the Father and the Son,
And also to the Holy Ghost,
To the eternal Trinity,
We shall praise Him world without end,
That we found the golden way.
verses.yoruba:
A dupẹ lọw' Ọlọrun wa,
Pe a r'ọna wura na,
Iyin, ogo ọpẹ, ọla,
Fun Baba ati Ọmọ,
Ati pẹlu Ẹmi Mimọ,
Mẹtalọkan ayeraye,
Titi aye lao ma yin,
Pe a r'ọna wura na.

chorus.english:
Then sing, ah, sing a song of joy
Sing from a joyful heart and shout,
The light has come and we are home,
We have found the golden way.
chorus.yoruba:
Njẹ kọrin, kọrin ayọ,
F'ọkan ayọ kọrin soke,
Imọlẹ de, a de'le wa,
Ati r'ọna wura na.

chorus2.english:
Thanks be to Thee Thou Elshadai,
Praise be to Jehovah Rovai,
Halleluyah sing songs of praise,
To the blessed Three in one.
chorus2.yoruba:
Ọpẹ ni fun Ọ Elshadai,
Jehofa Rofai ni k'ayin,
Aleluya orin iyin,
Fun Mẹtalọkan soso.

title.english: As I Journey Thro' The Land

verses.english:
As I journey thro' the land singing as I go,
Pointing souls to calvary-to the crimson flow,
Many arrows pierce my soul from without, within;
But my Lord leads me on, through Him I must win.
verses.yoruba:
Ninu irin ajo mi bẹni mo nkọrin,
Mo ntọka si Kalfari s'ibi ẹjẹ na,
Idanwo lode ninu l'ọta gbe dide,
Jesu l'O ntọ mi lọ iṣẹgun daju.

verses.english:
When in service for my Lord, dark may be the night,
But I'll cling more close to Him,
He will give me light,
Satan's snares may vex my soul, turn my thought aside;
But my Lord goes ahead, leads what'er betide.
verses.yoruba:
Ninu iṣẹ isin mi, b'okunkun ba su,
Uno tubọ sunmọ Jesu y'O tan imọlẹ
Esu le gb'ogun ti mi ki nle sa pada,
Jesu l'o ntọ mi lọ, ko s'ewu fun mi.

verses.english:
When in valleys low I look towards the mountain height,
And behold my Saviour there,leading in the fight,
With a tender hand outreached towards the valley low,
Guiding me, I can see, as I onward go.
verses.yoruba:
Bi mo tilẹ bọ sinu afonifoju
Imọlẹ itoni Rẹ y'o mọlẹ si mi
Y'o na ọwọ Rẹ si mi, y'O gbe mi soke
Uno ma tẹsiwaju b'O ti ntọ mi lọ.

verses.english:
When before me billows rise from the mighty deep,
Then my Lord directs my barque,
He doth safely keep,
And He leads me gently on through this world below,
He's a real Friend to me, oh, I love Him so.
verses.yoruba:
Nigbati jgbi aye vi ba nyi lu mi,
Mo ni abo l'o daju labẹ apa Rẹ,
Y'O ma f'ọwọ Rẹ tọ mi titi de opin,
Ọrẹ ododo ni, A! Mo ti f'Ẹ to.

chorus.english:
Oh, I want to see Him, look upon His face,
There to sing for ever of His saving grace,
On the streets of glory let me lift my voice;
Cares all past, home at last, ever to rejoice.
chorus.yoruba:
A! Mo nfẹ ri Jesu,
Ki nma w'oju Rẹ,
Ki nma kọrin titi, nipa ore Rẹ,
Ni ilu ogo ni ki gbohun soke,
Pe mo bọ, ija tan, mo de ile mi.

title.english: Jerusalem On High

verses.english:
Jerusalem on high
My song and city is,
My home whene'er I die,
The center of my bliss.
verses.yoruba:
Jerusalem' t'ọrun 
L'orin mi, ilu mi!
Ile mi bi mbá ku;
Ẹkùn ibukun mi.

verses.english:
There dwells my Lord, my King,
Judged here unfit to live;
There Angels to Him sing,
And lowly homage give.
verses.yoruba:
Níbẹ l'Ọba mi wa,
T'a da l'ẹbi l'aye;
Angẹli nkọrin fún,
Wọn sì ntẹriba fún.

verses.english:
The Patriarchs of old
There from their travels cease;
The Prophets there behold
Their longed-for Prince of Peace.
verses.yoruba:
Patriark igbani,
Par'ayọ wọn níbẹ,
Awọn woli, wọn nwọ,
Ọmọ Aládé wọn!

verses.english:
The Lamb's Apostles there
I might with joy behold;
The harpers I might hear
Harping on harps of gold.
verses.yoruba:
Níbẹ ni mo le ri
Awọn Àpọsteli;
At'awọn akọrin
Ti nlu harpu wura.

verses.english:
The bleeding Martyrs, they
Within those courts are found;
All cloth'd in pure array,
Their scars with glory crown'd.
verses.yoruba:
Ni àgbàlá wọnni,
Ni awọn Martir wa;
Wọn wọ asọ ala,
Ogo bo ọgbẹ wọn.

verses.english:
Ah me! Ah me! that I
In Kedar's tents here stay,
No place like this on high;
Thither, Lord, guide my way.
verses.yoruba:
T'emi yi sa su mi,
Ti mo ngb'ago kedar;
Kò sí 'ru yi loke,
Níbẹ ni mo fẹ lọ.

chorus.english:
O happy place! When shall I be,
My GOD, with Thee, to see Thy Face?
chorus.yoruba:
Ibi ayọ! Nigbawo ni
Un o r'oju Rẹ, Ọlọrun mi?
